Job Description:
Who We Are:

Macnica Americas, Inc., a North American subsidiary of Macnica Group – a $5B technology development and distribution company based out of Japan is in search of the right person to serve as Marketing Specialist at our Dallas Office. The successful candidate has a minimum of 3 years of experience working in tech as well as a bachelor's degree or higher in a major relevant to the position.
The Marketing Specialist will work in close collaboration with our GM of Marketing on defining and deploying communications that increase brand awareness, enhances marketing campaigns, and exemplifies corporate communication strategy.

The Role:
Supporting the development, coordination, publication and maintenance of all company-wide communications for a variety of mediums, i.e., social media, internet, intranet, print and verbal
Designing and developing of internal/external materials and graphics to better communicate our brand and products with the audience
Utilizing social media to exchange information and brand messages about Macnica and its businesses directly with key audiences and influencers
Creating and refreshing marketing communications to support the company strategies
Assisting with the content and brand cohesion for Macnica marketing materials, trade shows,

and newsletter
Editing and proof-reading all presentations and marketing materials
Supporting the executive team on all internal and external presentations
Creating branded content for web and print distribution
Collaborating and assisting in website projects (optimization, functionality, content)
Traveling to trade shows, up to 10%
Other duties as assigned
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Business, Marketing, Communications, or a related discipline
3-5 years of experience in marketing, preferably for technology/ electronics industry
Familiarity with B2B advertising campaigns
Experience with graphic design programs such as Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator
Proficiency using various software, applications, and programs including Microsoft Office Suite
Must possess good time management skills, be highly organized and be technologically savvy.
Ability to be adaptive to changing company needs with superior problem-solving skills is highly desirable
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment, both, in the office and remotely with team members across the country
The Perks:
15 days of vacation, national holidays, and paid sick time off
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401 (k) with company matching
Interacting with suppliers from all over the world
A chance to visit industry trade shows around the country, Europe, and Asia
Being a part of an amazing team in a friendly work environment

Job Type:
• Full-time

Job Description*
About Us: * Founded in 2008, ZLINE Kitchen and Bath began designing and offering one-of-a-kind kitchen range hoods. From the beginning, we have always been industry-leaders when it comes to design and quality. Over the years, we have evolved and now manufacture a ‘range’ of luxury kitchen appliances and bath fixtures such as professional ranges, faucets, sinks, and much more – providing Attainable Luxury to homeowners looking to increase the value of their spaces that mean the most to them. While our product line expansion is growing quickly, we are also scaling all facets of our operations to accommodate increasing demand. Essentially, we are the industry-leading e-commerce appliance brand, with the pace and culture of a top marketing agency.
Who we’re looking for: * We are seeking an entry to mid-level candidate looking to excel in a fast-paced, competitive environment focused on e-commerce marketing. Our team fosters an amazing culture, and we are looking for an absolute rockstar with a desire to contribute to the achievement of our goals positively. We promote from within, so the ideal candidate will have a broad set of skills and experiences and will be open to having their role grow and develop with the company.
Key Roles*As a Marketing Specialist, you will learn ZLINE’s brand “story” and utilize every and all marketing tool to tell the story in the most effective way – ideal candidates will engage in the following:
Undergo product training to better understand value propositions, audience segments, and nuances with our product line. This involves minor Customer Service experience as part of onboarding.
Assist marketing team in ads creation, with use of graphic design, copywriting, and other necessary skills required for creating marketing assets.
Develop, execute, and analyze the effectiveness of advertising campaigns with heightened focus towards video ads through Google Marketing Suite and other platforms.
Conduct comprehensive research on competitors, identify opportunities, and present reports on findings.
Evaluate SEO and identify areas for improvement, and implement ideas across Magento and Squarespace platforms.
Research and vet various tools to help improve efficiency of marketing team including new software, applications, methods, etc.
Take responsibility for contributions to team and company - holding yourself accountable for the amount of work you put in, organization/workflow, time-management of managing various project simultaneously.
Requirements and Qualifications: *
Proficiency required on the following: Microsoft Office, MacOS, Social Media
Proficiency highly preferred with the following: SEMRush, Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Merchant Center, YouTube Marketing, Facebook Business Manager (Certifications make you stand out from the rest.)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially for copywriting.
Strong organizational and time management skills, and a keen attention to detail.
Motivation to push yourself and go above and beyond what is asked of you.
Professional appearance and presentation skills.
Experience with HubSpot Marketing a plus
Experience with Salesforce a plus
Starting Salary: $37,000 DOE - compensation is negotiable DOE.Must be able to pass a background check and provide 2 professional references.
In lieu of a cover letter, please provide answers to these 3 questions: *
What do you feel is your most relevant experience for this position?
What jumped out at you about this job ad?
Tell us something unique, interesting, or surprising about you. Feel free to be creative - we want to get to know you!

EBM Corporations is a growing ag contractor in Northeast Nebraska and surrounding region. We offer services for new construction, remodels and repairs to grain storage and handling facilities, commercial feed mills, seed cleaning and bagging as well as other material handling facilities.
We are currently seeking an individual to be responsible for the development and implementation of marketing promotions, materials, campaigns to promote interest and increase visibility in our construction, manufacturing and crane service entities.
Key responsibilities include planning and preparing marketing/promotional materials, marketing plans, update and maintain websites, employ search marketing techniques and research data to measure ongoing optimization.
EBM Corporations offers competitive wages and benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, Life, 401k, and Vacation/Holidays.

• Marketing techniques to improve awareness of brand, products, and services
• Website management, including updates, SEO practices and Google Analytics.
• Social media presence: Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube
• Traditional and digital advertising production and management
• Copywriting and editing
• Tradeshow logistics – planning, budgeting, and shipping

• Exceptional communication skills.
• Excellent customer service skills and professionalism.
• Ability to work independently and contribute in a team environment.
• Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and Office 365

Apply online at www.ebmconstruction.net and attach resume, or apply in person at EBM Corporations, 1014 Sherwood Road, Norfolk, NE 68701.

Company Snapshot: *
At Tulsa Community WorkAdvance (TCW), we empower people to achieve meaningful, sustainable life change by providing NO COST access to high-quality education and training, working with individuals to identify their career goals, and then supporting them to make those goals a reality.

Since 2012, TCW has provided underserved residents in the Tulsa area with training and personalized support services so they can thrive in high demand careers. TCW is in a phase of tremendous growth and opportunity. We are looking for candidates who think fast, embrace change, and are excited to help us transform our organization to better support the success of the residents and businesses in our community.

Position Overview*:

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Training and Marketing Specialist in our Tulsa, OK office. The right candidate will be comfortable wearing many different hats and exceptionally organized to deliver the various roles effectively.
The Primary Responsibilities of the Training and Marketing Specialist Include*:
Social Media
Help maintain social media and online presence including website, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter
Respond to social media engagements in a timely and professional manner
Capitalize on social media opportunities and raise the awareness of the organization to do the same. This can include:
Taking customer photos (training, on the job, etc)
Writing customer success stories
Recruit and inform customers and potential customers of the wide array of educational opportunities and career advancement services available
Submit regular reports on recruitment and community engagement
Communications
Build and execute the strategy of community partner communications
Create and schedule mass text and email messaging to inform customers about opportunities
Assist in the creation and revision of recruitment advertisements
Thought leader for setting the voice and tone of the organization in regard to customer communications
Training
Teach existing class and workshop curriculum on topics related to job readiness and career advancement
Educate customers on how to properly fill out job applications, write professional resumes and navigate job interviews
Conduct orientation sessions to provide program applicants with knowledge about the TCW program and application steps
Networking
Attend outreach events including job fairs, education events and community activities in order to market opportunities to potential applicants
Maintain relationships with local community- and faith-based organizations, educational institutions, and other partners
Submit regular reports on recruitment and community engagement
Qualifications*:
BA or BS degree required
3-5 years experience in a similar role
Experience working with underserved populations preferred
Experience and comfortability speaking to small and large groups
Experience with social media platforms and engaging audiences on them
Desire to work as part of a team of individuals dedicated to achieving excellent results while maintaining an evolving, fun and energetic workplace
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment
Must have proficient computer skills and experienced knowledge of Microsoft Office, Gmail and Google Drive, with the ability to adapt to new equipment and technology
Working knowledge of software such as Adobe Creative cloud, InDesign, Photoshop, Etc
Working knowledge of WordPress a plus
Working knowledge of Salesforce a plus
Occasional evening and weekend work required

Direct marketing in local areas of the San Joaquin County and its surrounding areas.

Bachelor's Degree in Marketing or related allied health field required. Master's Degree Preferred.

BLS Certified

Requires organizational skills that enable the individual to react and perform under stress and emergency situations and to manage two to three activities at one time on an on-going basis.

Knowledge of JCAHO, state and federal regulations as it pertains to departmental activities. Knowledge of QC and QA related to the department.

Normal outpatient environment with standard heating and air conditioning.
Minimal exposure to radiation, darkroom chemicals, radiation related disease and body fluids.

Marketing Operations Specialist
Job Overview
As the Marketing Operations Specialist at Marchex, you will keep our systems running smoothly and efficiently. You will be responsible for maintaining and improving the health of our database, from new lead acquisition to email deliverability, as well as our lead management process. You will support the demand generation team in building new campaigns, testing performance, and automating repeatable processes. Additionally, you will be our go-to analytics expert, helping the team report on successes and uncover new opportunities, with a constant pulse on marketing’s impact on business revenue.
Job Impact
This role is a critical revenue driver for the company! The Marketing Operations Specialist ensures the continued success of Marchex by keeping our marketing and sales funnel running smoothly and efficiently, reporting on performance, and delivering a healthy pipeline of qualified leads to our sales team
Team
The Demand Generation Team owns and executes marketing programs, as well as lead generation, timely lead follow-up, and pipeline.
Outline of Duties and Responsibilities
Support sales revenue goals by maintaining our lead management process, including lead lifecycle, lead scoring, and sales alerts.
Work with our demand generation team to ensure we achieve significant year-over-year increases in qualified leads and pipeline by building and testing emails, campaigns, and web forms.
Communicate regularly with our sales operations, sales, and customer teams to analyze who is responding to our marketing campaigns, and how we can better engage those who are not.
Partner with our customer teams to create a maintain a unified view of Marchex customers across our systems.
Work closely with sales operations to ensure data is syncing seamlessly in Salesforce and Marketo for accurate and up-to-date attribution, lead management, and reporting.
Automate repeatable processes for the demand generation team and yourself.
Build repeatable and self-serve reporting for the marketing team to analyze performance across pipeline, content, channels, and campaigns, and help us uncover the story within the data.
Dig into data to understand what messages and campaigns are resonating with our customers and which ones are not.
Support the vision and values of the company through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors.
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested.
Experience, Skills and Qualifications
BA/BS degree in related field or equivalent experience.
3-5 years of marketing automation experience.
Experience working in marketing operations software such as Marketo, Eloqua, or Pardot, and are familiar with how they work. Marketo admin experience preferred.
Experience with Salesforce CRM, Salesforce campaigns, and reporting, and comfortable building reports and dashboards.
Strong analytical skills, using those skills to solve problems, uncover business opportunities, and tell a story with our data about what is and is not working.
Bias toward simplification, without over-engineering our processes and campaign flow.
Creative thinking and problem solving; help us uncover a better way of doing things and a better way of reaching our audience.
Familiarity with HTML a plus
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with an ability to work effectively cross-functionally and with all levels within the organization.
Successfully worked in ambiguous environments. Needs can and will change frequently and you’ll need to continually roll with the tide.
Working Conditions
The job conditions for this position are in a standard office setting. Employees in this position use PC and phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Limited corporate travel may be required to remote offices or other business meetings and events.

Ecumen North Branch seeks an Admissions Manager to join its team. Ecumen North Branch consists of 51 assisted living rental apartment homes, as well as 67 nursing home beds, and 20 additional residences for seniors requiring memory care. Ecumen creates home for older adults wherever they choose to live. Our employees are dedicated to empowering our customers to lead richer, fuller lives and have consistently recognized Ecumen as a “Best Place to Work,” an award by the Minneapolis-St. Paul Business Journal.

The Admissions Manager is directly responsible for relationship building with community referral and admission sources, and marketing of the campus within the community.
Position Highlights:
Full Time
Days
Benefit Eligible
Beautiful Campus
Competitive Wages
Great Team Environment
Essential job responsibilities include:
Establishes personal contacts within the community and builds relationships with referral sources (e.g. discharge planners, hospital/facility case workers, and others in the community). Tracks all referrals and leads.

Communicates information regarding prospective admissions to appropriate facility team members, including need for pre-admissions authorizations, payer sources, anticipated time of arrival, special needs of the resident for services and supplies, etc.

Conducts personal marketing visits with identified key referral sources and speaks to groups to enhance awareness of all campus services available. Represents campus at community marketing events and programs geared towards our potential customers and referral sources.

Job Description:
As a content marketer at etrailer.com (the leading online retailer of trailer, towing and RV accessories in the US) you’ll be responsible for creating the most helpful content in the world for the trailer, towing, and RV communities. At etrailer our goal is to become the definitive source of information for all the products we carry by creating the best articles, shopping guides, videos, photos, and descriptions out there.

In this role you’ll examine our customers’ research & purchasing habits, assess the existing catalog of information on the web around our products, and combine that knowledge to create content that’s more unique and more helpful than anything out there currently. And unlike at a traditional e-commerce operation, you’ll have access to use and test the products you’ll write about and partner with our in-house product experts, videographers, designers, and marketing team to develop and deploy our world-class content.


Responsibilities
Research, design and write content/content series that helps our customers solve problems, answer common questions and compare products
Communicate effectively with customers through a neighborly, knowledgeable voice
Develop a fact- or experience-based opinion on the topics you are writing about and clearly communicate how you developed your opinion
Monitor, report on, and analyze the performance of new and existing content, adjusting and revising as needed
Collaborate with marketing team to coordinate multi-touch marketing funnels
Manage several content production projects simultaneously
Update existing content to ensure accuracy, relevancy, mobile-friendliness and UX
Use in-house content management tools to build, design and manage content

About You

You really love helping people solve problems. You’re not afraid to dive head first into a topic or problem that is new to you. You find deep satisfaction in organizing and consolidating a tangled mess of information into clear, concise and logically consumable pieces of content. You have a knack for designing and presenting content on a webpage. You love to write and your writing has some personality. You don’t just want to write, you want to measure the effectiveness of your writing and the impact it has on the people who read it . You love trying to understand why someone would click a title, read an article or navigate to a certain page. You like holding yourself accountable for great performance, monitoring and tracking success and failures through data. You enjoy nerding out on data and what it really communicates about human behavior.


Skills
Strong creative and technical writing experience (1-3yrs experience)
Editing experience (1-3yrs experience)
Basic SEO knowledge & keyword research experience (1-3yrs experience)
Experience with Google Analytics or similar tool (1-3yrs experience)
Exceptional research skills
Ability to empathize with readers’ perspective and experiences
Strong analytical skills
Strong time management skills
Bonus Skills
An eye for web design
HTML experience

Why etrailer.com?

etrailer.com is the US’s leading online retailer of trailer, towing, and RV accessories. We’re not an ordinary ecommerce retailer. We’re more than a few developers and marketers sitting in a small office just trying to convince you to buy at the cheapest price. At etrailer.com, you’ll find an entire company dedicated to helping customers find the best possible solutions for their needs. Our team of 300+ people creatively works together to ensure that each person who visits our website has the most personalized shopping experience on the web. As a part of this team, you’ll dig deep to understand the problems our customers are trying to solve and how etrailer can connect them to solutions via content marketing initiatives.

As Email Marketing, you will be responsible for building our email marketing campaigns from the ground up. You will be responsible for planning, developing, implementing, and maintaining the company’s first email marketing strategy.
We’ll rely on your experience working with a variety of email automation platforms to select a platform that meets our needs. You’ll guide our graphic design team to create beautiful email templates that engage and delight our consumers. Your deep, working knowledge of financial products and services helps you empathize with consumers as they navigate getting out of debt to repairing their credit.
From running email marketing campaigns from end-to-end to managing email databases, and tracking and reporting KPI’s, this will be the first time we engage with our over 2 million monthly site visitors and your efforts will set the foundation for our email customer engagement strategy moving forward.
Our company is a fun, creative, and transparent organization, where everyone has access to our executive team, learning important business skills, taking part in major decisions, and experiencing life at a rapidly growing startup. We offer generous benefits including health care, dental, retirement matching and even catered lunches! We work hard but like to have fun too.
Responsibilities:
Manage, write, design and implement an extensive email marketing campaign to ensure business goals are met and emails have a high open rate and CTR
Create organic email databases for lead generation. Carry out segmentation of databases to implement remarketing strategies
Manage trigger email campaigns throughout the customer lifecycle to maximize engagement
Excellent understanding of email marketing concepts and metrics such as sender score, deliverability and sender reputation.
Track and report on KPI and sales revenue generated from email marketing efforts
Must be able to know what resonates with certain audiences to grow email list subscriptions & segmentation of lists
Design and implement desktop and mobile-friendly HTML email templates
Ensure prompt and accurate communication with great timing and frequency with clients to minimize unsubscribers
Understanding best practices and industry-related compliance laws - CAN-SPAM compliant
Purge non-deliverable email addresses and opt-outs
Coordinate and monitor the maintenance, integrity, and security of several databases
Requirements:
5+ years of experience managing email marketing campaigns
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or relevant field
Experience growing, engaging with, and analyzing performance of a large (50,000+) email marketing database
Experience building an email marketing campaign from scratch
Excellent written communication skills
Proficient in setting up and leveraging email marketing automation platforms (eg. Klavio, Manychat, Marketo etc.)
Proficient in Google Analytics, HTML/CSS, A/B Testing, and other content management systems
Proficient in data analytics to determine what worked and what didn’t by looking at the data and suggesting improvements
Some personal or professional experience with one or more of our finance product categories (eg. personal finance, mortgages, insurance, etc.)
Knowledge of SEO/SEM
Strong project management skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Able to work under tight deadlines
At least one sample of an effective document delivered in the past that yielded results

Respicardia® is a leader in innovative technologies that address the unmet needs in respiratory and cardiovascular disease with safe and effective therapies. Founded in 2006 and headquartered near Minneapolis, Minnesota, Respicardia is dedicated to improving patient outcomes, quality of life and overall cardiovascular health via novel transvenous neurostimulation therapies.

The *rem*edē System is a safe and effective treatment for moderate to severe central sleep apnea that offers improved patient satisfaction and an overall better quality of life.
JOB SUMMARY: *
The Therapy Access Specialist is responsible for the development and adoption of the *rem*edē System in assigned markets. This individual will develop and execute a therapy awareness plan that is in alignment with the strategic priorities of Respicardia.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES**: *
The Therapy Access Specialist will:

· Collaborate with Territory Managers and clinical support teams to deliver procedural growthby assisting with the achievement of business goals.

· Identify key accounts, health care professionals, and business issues that have the greatest effect on use of company products by meeting with existing and potential customers.

· Classify clinical needs, goals, and constraints related to patient care. Determine where our therapies can be part of a comprehensive healthcare solution.

· Work to build strong relationships and collaborate with healthcare providers within multiple disciplines to plan therapy awareness efforts in order to identify potential *rem*edē patients.

· Develop strategic patient pathways in assigned markets to support therapy adoption.

· Work with existing and potential *rem*edē Program Champions to identify workflow needs, goals, and constraints related to the patient pathway. Nurture new sites in the start-up process.

· Expand the remedē patient pool by developing workflow to identify potential candidates.

· Identify key referral networks for the remedē System.

· Develop and enhance referral relationships through therapy awareness activities, routine customer visits, product demonstrations, educational programs, trade show participation and problem resolution.

· Work with the marketing department to modify best practices and winning strategies into tools and approaches that can rolled out to others (both TMs and other TAS’s) – taking the best solutions locally and making them available nationally

· Stay informed on market dynamics and developments relative to sleep apnea therapy.
Job Requirements & Qualifications: *
· 2+ years of successful sales and market awareness experience in medical device or pharmaceutical industry, with a preference for cardiovascular and/or sleep medicine

· Bachelors Degree

· Strong medical device or pharmaceutical industry experience in supporting business planning, forecasting, and sales process

· Able to build and maintain strong, action-oriented customer relationships

· Results-oriented team player

· Demonstrated ability to create therapy awareness strategies to improve patient access in the medical device or pharmaceutical industry

· Willingness to travel (locally, regionally, nationally) - approximately 70%

· Demonstrated knowledge of U.S. and global healthcare systems including expertise in health care finance, reimbursement policies related to the device industry, and new technology assessment processes

· Successful organizational, project management and presentation skills

· Outstanding communications and interpersonal skills including developing relationships at all levels in an organization and directly influencing business objectives

· Demonstrated ability to make effective decisions independently and to accomplish tasks in a fast-paced environment

· Comfortable in a small, dynamic company environment. Must be energetic, enthusiastic, determined and goal oriented

WHO IS LIV? *
LIV Development is a Birmingham-based real estate investment and development firm with regional offices in Dallas, TX and Tampa, FL. LIV focuses on multi-family and senior-living housing; delivering properties on time, under budget, with strategic branding and marketing, and skilled asset management.
WE ARE PASSIONATE: * We LIV and breathe it. Built on past successes; our passion is pursuing excellence, accepting challenges, and embracing opportunities to improve efficiencies and produce the highest quality product possible.
WE ARE DRIVEN: * At LIV, we’re on the fast track to success with over $1+ Billion in projects that span the Southeast U.S. region with broad expertise across market cycles, geographic and asset classes.

Creation of Strategic Marketing Plans for each property, which includes budgeting, planning, and creative; and work collaboratively with LIV and property management team members for proper execution to achieve optimum leasing and financial performance
Assist with creation of “vision” and “thesis” for each property marketing

Guide design and implementation of signage, collateral materials, and promotional items at each property
Use analytics to identify and improve conversion rates using key metrics such as cost per lead, cost per lease, and lead to lease conversion ratio
To advise and schedule on-location video and photography production
Work with on-site teams and management company staff to generate and improve resident experience and promotional events
Manage special projects as assigned
Birmingham based in-office role, but does require occasional light travel

Previous experience with some of the following technologies is preferred but not required: Yardi (including Rent-Café & Yardi CRM), Google My Business, Google Analytics, Google Drive/Sheets, Facebook Ads & Marketplace, Instagram, Apartments.com and other third-party ILS sites, and WordPress

Intimate understanding of residents and prospects, how they interact and communicate; and the ability to generate marketing campaigns to attract new leasing prospects

Experience with Adobe Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator preferred)
Some knowledge in graphic design and web design, preferred

Ability to communicate & interact with senior leaders and project teams with knowledge and confidence
Ability to demonstrate analytical understanding of marketing objectives & branding goals

About NetSearch:
NetSearch Digital Marketing is an independent, full-service digital marketing agency based out of Richmond, Virginia. NetSearch started 14 years ago with a small team of web experts who wanted to create an agency that really excelled at both customer service and our core services.
We’ve grown since then but we’re still a small team, and we see it as having the best of both worlds – we have the knowledge and capabilities of larger companies, but we’re still small enough to provide individual attention and care to every client.
Each account is assigned a dedicated client service person and a digital specialist who’s always available to talk through the project and make sure they’re getting what they need. Now, we have over 300 clients, and we’ve been included on the INC 5000 Fastest Growing Businesses list for the past four years.
We offer a diverse set of digital marketing solutions combined with a web design team that helps our clients achieve their dreams. With PPC, SEO, and Remarketing; Facebook and LinkedIn advertising; Reputation Management applications, Live Chat services, and more, we can help our clients with whatever digital challenges they might face.
Our central goal is to help our clients grow by simplifying digital marketing and delivering leads. We always pride ourselves on our one-on-one customer service and commitment to transparency. Our core values are baked into everything we do – reliability, honesty, professionalism, and going above and beyond for our clients.
At the end of the day, what sets us apart from a lot of agencies is that we really care about helping our clients succeed.
About the position:
As a Digital Marketing Specialist you will drive revenue growth through Search by aligning both Organic & Paid Search strategies and maximize Search Engine coverage and efficiency. You will work with client websites optimizing content for Search engines. You will operate on both a strategic and tactical level, covering all aspects of digital advertising including campaign management, optimization, creative testing, and metrics.
No Remote Positions Available. Must work in our Richmond office.
The core responsibilities of this position would include:
Daily SEM management of 15-20 clients
Boost organic visibility of client web properties through on-page and off-page SEO optimizations
Writing, Editing, and Uploading content to client’s web properties and landing pages
Modify HTML and CSS elements of client’s web properties
Handle daily execution of Google Ad accounts. This includes Search, Display, Video, and Shopping campaigns
Utilize diagnostic tools to identify issues and opportunities of SEM Services
Collect and analyze SEM metrics, synthesize results and identify optimizations.
Monitor industry news, trends, and shifts to align with evolving SEM strategies.
Collaborate and communicate issues and opportunities to internal stakeholders
Forecasting and reporting of Search Engine Marketing services
A candidate must have:
3+ years of Search Engine Optimization experience
3+ years of Google Ads and Bing Ads account management
The ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:
BS/BA degree preferred (Business, Economics, Marketing, Mathematics, or Computer Science)
Google Ads Certified, Google Analytics Certified, and/or achieved Google Ads Nano-Degree
Strong proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Ads, Google Tag Manager, and Google Search Console
Strong proficiency in HTML and CSS. Proficiency in JavaScript.
Proficient in Facebook Ads and LinkedIn Ads
The ability to switch between individual and team tasks
Goal oriented personality with a passion for Digital Marketing
Compensation:
Based on experience level. $40,000 - $60,000 and quarterly bonus structure

Job description:

Under the direction of the Digital Services Manager, the Digital Marketing Associate will live by the company’s core values and follow standard operating procedures to manage Local PPC and SEO campaigns

We are looking for a motivated individual who goes above and beyond to achieve success for our clients. The ideal candidate has a passion for digital marketing and wants to grow his or her career in the online marketing industry.

Responsibilities:

Key responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Work in our Richmond office.
Optimize Local PPC campaigns from insights obtained through automated bidding platform. Optimizations include keyword targeting, writing ad copy, set up tracking scripts, designing and optimizing landing pages. Maintain performance and hit cost per lead objectives for each campaign.
Optimize Local SEO campaigns to increase online visibility in Google and Bing search engine result pages. You will use various SEO tools to help create a custom optimization plan that details the onsite and offsite SEO tasks to increase visibility.
Work with our Client Service Coordinator department to provide insights and reporting to our customers.
Monitor client performance and ensure campaigns meet client cost per lead objectives
Follow standard operating procedures in logging time, completing internal tickets, and updating daily, weekly, and monthly reports.
Preferred Experience:
1-2 years of Google Ads account management.
1-2 years optimizing websites for improved visibility on Google and Bing.
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university.
Employee benefits:
Medical Insurance: NetSearch Digital Marketing provides medical plans for employees. NetSearch plans are through UnitedHealth Group. Employees can sign up for Medical insurance on the first day of employment. NetSearch will pay 50% of the age-rated HAS plan amount toward the cost of the employees desired sponsored health insurance plan. This plan includes vision. Spouse and dependents can also participate in medical coverage plans but NetSearch does not contribute towards their plans.
Dental Insurance: NetSearch Digital Marketing provides dental plans for employees. Dental plans are provided through HealthKeepers Group. Employees can sign up for a dental plan on the first day of employment. NetSearch will pay 50% of your individual premium each month. Spouse and dependents can also participate in dental coverage plans but NetSearch does not contribute toward their plans.
Life, AD & D and Long-Term Disability Insurance: Provided at no cost to the employee.
401(k): Employees are eligible for the company 401(k) plan after one year of employment. NetSearch will match up to 5% of the employees’ monthly contributions into the 401(k) plan.
Paid Time Off (PTO): Year one employees receive 17 days of PTO. Year Two to Four, 22 Days of PTO. Year five+, 27 days PTO. PTO can be used for vacation days, personal days, or sick time. PTO is in addition to 7 holidays observed by the company.
Work From Home: We provide 12 work from home days for each employee. Employees are eligible to work from home after the first 6 months of employment.
Parental Leave: We provide 12 weeks of paid parental leave.
Employee perks:
Bring your dog to work day - on the second Thursday of each month employees are encouraged to bring their dogs into work with them.
First Friday Luncheons – on the first Friday of every month NetSearch has a company luncheon where we update the company on achievements, opportunities, and franchise news.
Early work dismissal on Fridays – We provide two work schedules for employees (Option 1) 7:30-5:00 M-T and 8:00-3:00 on Fridays (Option 2) 8:00-5:30 M-T, and 8:00 to 3:00 on Fridays
NetSearch Outings – Every quarter management coordinates an event or outing for employees. Events like Summer Olympics, Cornhole Tournaments, Chili Cook-off, and Kicker’s Games more.
Department Fun Budget – NetSearch provides each of its department managers a quarterly fun budget to use for its department.
Sporting Events – NetSearch will also pay for NetSearch employees to participate in social sports leagues and play sports like kickball, dodge ball, and softball.
Snack Station – NetSearch provides a large variety of snacks and beverages for employees to enjoy while at work

Manages the email marketing calendar, including: recommending and developing creative and content, executing tests, compiling targeted member lists, scheduling, and deployment.

Red Sky Lighting, LLC is seeking an Entry Level Inside Sales and Marketing specialist. This position will be based at our Downtown Racine, WI office and will be someone who is dynamic on many levels. This person will be willing to make themselves invaluable to the company and as the company grows, so too will they in their knowledge and experience of the business world. This is a full time position with excellent salary to commensurate with education and job experience.

Company Overview
Red Sky Lighting (RSL) manufactures and sells premier, rough service, durable LED lights designed for the harshest and most hazardous conditions. From food processing plants to petrochemical plants, our fixtures are made of ruggedized construction that require low maintenance and emit high lumen output. Based in Racine, Wisconsin, our fixtures instill a sense of tradition and passion for selling an amazing product that will not disappoint. At Red Sky Lighting, we make Seriously Safe Lights.
Employee Overview
Our products and the employees who design and build them are part of making a difference in the world every day. If you are ready to do something that matters, to do it well, and to be encouraged and rewarded for doing it, then RSL is the place for you. The Inside Sales and Marketing Specialist will work with outside sales representatives, management, and customers to deliver exceptional support and satisfaction while also engaging in marketing

Support sales regions and outside sales representatives to meet monthly/quarterly/annual sales goals established by the business.
 Demonstrate the ability to professionally manage customer telephone calls and emails while performing other required tasks.
 Establish and maintain the highest possible professionalism with customers with regards to their business and organization; and with regards to the knowledge of RSL’s products, strategic plan and selling policy.
 Coordinate with marketing and sales to provide visually pleasing documentation for customers to view product information, including but not limited to: Website updates, social media postings and composing speculation sheets.
 Provide and establish accurate lead times for shipments as well as alternatives to meet shipment needs.

Follow-up on quotations/orders and provide information and updates to customers and sales representatives. Pro-actively contact customers following quotes/sales to ensure ongoing customer satisfaction and resolve any issues or objections
 Utilize available resources to provide technical information and to facilitate timely solutions to customer issues.
 Train peers and customers as appropriate. Serve as a mentor, and support for internal teams and departments.
 Lead project teams and serve as team member for special projects to drive continuous improvement and the team’s performance.
 Demonstrate proficiency in multiple department support software.

Qualifications

 1 or more years of work experience in product support, customer service, or inside sales.
 Legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship.
 Prior experience working with technical or electrical products or in a customer support role for technical or electrical products.
 Has demonstrated experience working with MS Office software package as well as knowledge of Adobe InDesign and/or Photoshop.
 The ability to travel  Analytical skills, including mathematics; detail-orientation, including proofreading and fact checking; communication skills, including sounding professional over the phone and in written text.

WebStrategies, voted one of the Best Places to Work in VA and one of the Fastest Growing Companies in RVA in 2018, is adding to its talented team of digital marketers, and we want you to be a part of it.

About the Job


We're looking for a passionate digital marketer who loves working in the online space. You’ll join one of the top digital agencies in Virginia where you can expand your skill set, learn from those with years of experience, and develop best in class skills in the fastest growing area of marketing.

What you'll do
Become an expert at today's most effective search and advertising strategies
Execute SEO, PPC, and conversion rate optimization (CRO) campaigns for our clients
Work directly with WebStrategies Account Managers
Collaborate with the WebStrategies team to solve digital marketing challenges for our clients
Learn and grow. We'll determine a development plan specifically for you and your skill set.
Who You Are
Someone who wants to grow their craft as a digital practitioner
Someone who is fascinated with how Google and Facebook work, and want to leverage that knowledge to help clients get more business.
Results oriented: you can separate the tactics from the big picture.
Detail oriented: you can follow and execute detailed, proven processes
Someone located in central VA. If you do not live locally and don't plan to relocate, please do not apply.
What We Offer
A digital-obsessed culture. We flat-out love working in the digital space, so be ready to get your geek on.
A culture focused on individual development. Your continued growth and development is one of our core values.
A place to make an impact. A company of our size gives you the opportunity to make an immediate and direct impact on team members and our clients.
Flexible work from home policy. Our office is in Midlothian, but we allow employees to choose between working in the office or at home (most employees split their time between the two).
Qualifications
1-3 years experience in search marketing, display advertising or content marketing
Experience with web design, usability or conversion optimization a huge plus
Creative, forward-thinking self-starter with an attention to detail and drive to produce consistent and quality work
Superior written and verbal communications skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Highly organized with excellent time management skills
How to stand out


Remember what we said about being digitally obsessed? We're not kidding. We once hired someone based on their YouTube channel. We'd love to see any side projects that prove you enjoy the work. If you submit your application and don't include examples or acknowledge a lack of them, we'll just assume you didn't read this far into the job description. Don't have anything to share? We'd still like to hear from you.

Compensation


We are proud to offer a very competitive compensation and benefits package, which we'll share with you during the interview process.

A little more about us...


We were voted one of the Top Places to Work in Virginia and one of the Fastest Growing Companies in Richmond in 2018. And while those are nice, we believe our best days are still ahead of us, and we want you to be a part of that journey. We will invest in you, challenge you, and develop you.

Like what you're reading?

Email Chris Leone your resume and a message on why you think you’re a match.

We can't wait to hear from you.

Description

Brooks is seeking a talented marketing professional to support our growing Services Product Line. This is a high-growth position is a critical member of the Service Product Management team, supporting product lines within the business. Responsibilities include pricing, configuration management, forecasting, assisting with competitive analysis, establishing parts in Oracle and spares management. Individuals will work closely with many functional groups to gather information or to communicate plans and progress.

The Product Marketing Specialist will support the product lines with a focus on Quality, Delivery, Customer Satisfaction, responsiveness and Productivity.

The Product Marketing Specialist will assist in defining product specifications with function, price, cost and reliability objectives for product development projects and with preparation of on-going competitive analysis and regularly communicates relevant information throughout the organization.

The Product Marketing Specialist will work with team members provide critical product marketing support and with marketing communications to create product materials supporting new product introductions and lifecycle management of existing products. Will serve as the internal focal point across multiple product lines within a business ensuring responsive execution of pricing implementation, configuration, part number management, forecast roll up and knowledge driven business reporting.

Works cross-functionally with product managers, engineering, operations, service and sales to ensure proper commercial transaction management is in place for existing and new platforms.

The ideal candidate would have experience to identify process efficiency opportunities with a proven track record of being able to lead a team for process improvement.

Summary of Areas of responsibility:
Pricing, configuration management, forecasting, assisting with competitive analysis, establishing parts in Oracle and spares management
Focus on quality, delivery, customer focus and overall responsiveness
Provides critical product marketing support; works with Marcom to create product materials supporting new product introductions and lifecycle management of existing products
Accountable for:
Quotes: Oracle pricing, parts FRUs
Tactical forecast
Customer engagement
Required Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree and 3+ years of relevant experience
Has the ability to work effectively as part of a matrix team; strong cross-functional collaboration
Strong understanding of order fulfillment processes and policy, as well as expertise in Oracle
Has demonstrated experience in managing order transaction from customer request thru factory fulfillment.
Proficiency working with Microsoft Office products (Excel & PowerPoint).
Strong oral and written communication skills.

The Preserve, a private living community featuring over 2,000+ acres of pristine Texas nature, located in Liberty County, Texas, just an hour from Beaumont and Houston, is currently offering an excellent job opportunity for Bilingual Land Sales Representatives who want to build a career with a well-established Real Estate Investment Company.

Our expansive landscape is filled with properties available for sale including: RV park properties, lots, new homes, tiny homes, mobile homes, and also rental cabins. At the Preserve we offer a combination of a natural environment and carefully planned amenities, ideal for those seeking a retreat and/or a place to call home. Property owners at the Preserve enjoy a scenic environment which includes fishing lakes, miles of white sand beaches, swimming pools, outdoor pavilions, BBQ stations and picnic areas, walking and hiking and biking trails, and an Equestrian center with 20+ miles of riding trails.

If you are self-motivated, and have a high level of enthusiasm and integrity, we have a place for you. The ideal candidate for this role will have:

· Bilingual skills in English/Spanish

· Excellent people skills and ability to build rapport and uncover customer needs

· Previous sales, retail, call center, telemarketing or customer service experience

· Strong verbal communication skills and ability to achieve sales goals while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction

· Great negotiation, proactive follow up and great listening skills

· Knowledge of Word, Outlook Email, and a minimum typing speed of 35 wpm

· Availability to work 40+ hours per week, including extended hours and weekends

· Reliable transportation and auto liability insurance

There is no license or real estate experience required. Our Land Sales Specialists are primarily in the office providing information/customer service over the phone to prospective buyers, but they also meet with customers in person and conduct property showings. Additional duties include but are not limited to:

· Guiding customers through the purchase process

· Participating in Marketing and Networking events to enhance sales

· Following up on sales leads/prospective customers

· Completing administrative tasks for loan/sales files

We offer:

· Quarterly performance bonuses and other add-on bonuses

· 100% Employer-paid Health/Dental/Life and Long Term Disability Insurance coverage

About Us


Cascade Management, Inc. and its principals began providing property and asset management services in 1974. We continue to manage the majority of properties from our original portfolio, which has grown substantially over time. Through our growth, the commitment to our properties, owners and employees remains fundamental to our values.

Locations:

Everett Pod - Compass Health3315 Lombard AvenueEverett, Washington 98201

North Pod - Compass Health209 Milwaukie Park StreetMt. Vernon, Washington 98273 South Pod - Compass Health8520 5th Avenue WestEverett, Washington 98204

Cascade Management’s Service Model is the foundation of everything we do and is expected to be upheld every day you come to work. Our Service Model represents the most important behaviors and actions to ensure a stakeholder interaction is positive every time. As an integral part of the Cascade team, all members are expected to carry out our Service Model of Friendly, Helpful, Knowledgeable, Respectful, and Responsive.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities


SUMMARY

The Portfolio Management Specialist Intern works under the Senior Regional Portfolio Manager for assistance with oversight of properties and support of field staff through reports, notices, tenant and vendor relations, tracking receivables, vacancies, and day-to-day management of site staff.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Formulate and manage the operational and capital budget for the portfolio of communities overseen; track and report on the financial performance of the communities; and implement strategies for enhancing the value of the assets with guidance from Senior Regional Portfolio Manager.

Assist with the review and approval processes for invoices for properties within portfolio in a timely manner, provide plan for outstanding late invoice payment.

Track and reconcile properties’ Accounts Receivables with support from Senior Regional Portfolio Manager to ensure timely collection and notify Accounting of any anomalies.

In partnership and guidance of the Senior Regional Portfolio Manager, attend regular meetings with property owners to discuss the property performance and critical areas that need addressing, utilizing a structured meeting with agenda.*

Assist with implementation of strategies for achieving high operational performance in the areas of expense management, rent growth, resident retention and service, income generation, and collections.*

Aid in the process to recruit, hire, train, and manage the performance of staff under your and your manager’s supervision and take appropriate actions to ensure achievement of performance goals.*

Make regular visits to each property site and ensure that the interior and exterior of the community meet Cascade Management safety and appearance standards.*

Approve all repairs and operating and maintenance contracts, within delegated contracting and signing authority; manage supplier and vendor performance with Senior Regional Portfolio Manager as final authority.

Address maintenance emergencies promptly, responding to after-hours calls.*

Ensure quality maintenance of each property through tracked regular preventative maintenance inspections and timely completion of work orders.

Ensure Property Management teams adhere to Cascade Management’s policies, processes, procedures and tools, and make recommendations to management if improvements are needed.

Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal laws pertaining to the industry, employment, fair housing, and resident/tenant relations.*

Review property net occupancy regularly; review and approve invoices for the properties; provide plan for outstanding late invoice payments.*

Review and approve site staff timecards.

Educate, train, and develop community managers and other site staff within the assigned portfolio on appropriate Cascade Management, Inc. policies and procedures, including, but not limited to reporting requirements, safety procedures, compliance, and owner requests.

Work with the marketing department, at the direction of the Portfolio Manager or Senior Portfolio Manager, to develop appropriate plans and marketing strategy in fulfilling vacant units.

Communicate with owners, partners, and constituents of the properties under assigned portfolio, under the direction of the PM.

Regular and reliable attendance during scheduled hours*

Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Physical Demands


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Valid Driver's License and Insurance required.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree (B.A./B.S.) from four-year college or university; or 3 years of related experience in property management function (management of 200+ units); or equivalent combination of education and experience.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to sit. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with hands and arms, and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.

Digital Marketing Specialist

The Lewis Group of Companies is seeking an experienced Marketing professional to join the team as our Digital Marketing Specialist for the Lewis Apartment Communities team in Southern and Northern California and Nevada.

IT'S ABOUT TEAMWORK: Working under the Sr. Director of Marketing and interacting with a variety of Lewis departments, you will build and design email campaigns, landing pages with A/B testing, and manage paid social campaigns. You’ll report on email automation campaigns, you will write, edit and promote content, and manage website enhancements and testing campaigns.

At its core, your good work will promote and market Lewis residential communities to the public, helping families learn even more about beautiful Lewis apartment homes in California and Nevada.

To be successful, your experience should include:
At least 2+ years of digital media, social media campaigns and optimization experience
Working knowledge of marketing automation and other software like Marketo, Constant Contact, HubSpot, and Pardot
Working within PhotoShop to create, edit and update images, graphics & content
Marketo experience is preferred but not required
Google Analytics certification is preferred but not required
Your key responsibilities will be:
Playing an integral role in executing and optimizing digital marketing projects as it pertains to project strategy, recommendations, needs, and performance.
Launch and optimize various web/email/social campaigns and oversee accounts on a variety of platforms
You will provide insights in campaign performance through Google Analytics and Marketo email insights.
Assist with special projects and promotions as needed
You will maintain and collaborate with multiple partner relationships including those focused-on website design and maintenance, strategy, paid search, advertising listings, reputation management and social media.
This is a great opportunity for you to join a stable, recognized, and successful leader with a strong history in real estate development.

Join the Lewis Group of Companies and you will be an important part of a winning team with a long history of successful real estate development and property management. Our dedication to these industries is your key to a successful and rewarding future. This culture of both excellence and camaraderie is what makes Lewis a wonderful place to grow your career.

In addition to a competitive hourly salary and bonus potential, Lewis offers a variety of medical and dental benefits, 401k plan with company match, extensive career training, free access to LinkedIn Learning catalog, annual reviews, unlimited PTO accrual, and much more.

Please visit www.lewisgroupofcompanies.com and www.lewiscareers.com for more company information and apply today!

Academy of Art University is hiring for a detail-oriented, entry level Marketing Automation Specialist. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills by supporting with e-mail and SMS marketing communications to prospective and current students. This is an excellent opportunity to take your career to the next level and learn a ton along the way. Additional responsibilities include:
Manage the day-to-day operations, production and execution of trigger-based nurturing program through our marketing automation platform (Pardot). Facilitate designing trigger-based nurturing programs for all stages of prospective student development from inquiries and cold prospects, to engagement, to closed opportunities and retention.
Engage in the everyday operation, production and execution of marketing automation campaigns, workflows and triggers using multiple platforms (Pardot, Sendy, Salesforce, Twilio, Meera) to achieve key conversion points in the marketing funnel.
Help to maintain the email "campaign calendar" and facilitate proper approvals on all email/SMS/chatbot campaigns.
Assist with the campaign development for other departments within the University including, but not limited to, Financial Aid and Student Services. Ensure timeliness and quality of all deliverables.
Facilitate content production, coordination with stakeholders and execution of SMS (Twilio) and chatbot (Meera) campaigns.
Help build, test, launch and analyze automated campaigns based on prospective and active student stages in the life cycle.
Engage in the day-to-day maintenance and coordination, with external departments, regarding the compilation, aggregation and list distribution for campaigns from Salesforce to respective platforms (Pardot, Sendy, Twilio, and Meera).
Assist in the maintenance of our CRM (Salesforce) integration, especially in the passage and usage of user data to create segmented users within email/SMS/chatbot campaigns.
Document daily operational workflow and marketing automation best practices to ensure proper list management, data quality, list hygiene and campaign optimization.
Increase campaign performance by optimizing subject lines, call-to-action (CTA), open rates, click–through rates and conversion rates.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree, with a major in Communications, Marketing or related field, or related professional experience.
1-2 years of hands-on experience in email marketing and operations.
Knowledge of email and marketing automation processes (preferred).
Familiarity with HTML/CSS3 (preferred).
Must be flexible—willing to change direction if needed—even multiple times.
Excels at project management and multi-tasking.
Self-starter with the ability to find solutions for unstructured problems.
Collaborative, well-organized and efficient.
Excellent analytical skills and has an interest in reporting and data analysis.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Attention to detail and flawless execution.
Ability to work independently with minimal direction while also functioning and contributing as part of a team.

Academy of Art University offers full-time employees health insurance, 401k options, paid vacation based on years of service (15 days' accrual at start), paid holidays, paid sick leave and a commuter benefit program. The Academy also offers full-time employees an opportunity to take one undergraduate course tuition free each semester. Once we’ve returned onsite, employees will also regain access to our multi-lane swimming pool, two fitness centers and our many recreational programs, including our NCAA Division II events.

About Us:

Avast is a global leader in digital security products. With over 400 million users online, we offer products under the Avast and AVG brands that protect people from threats on the internet and the evolving IoT threat landscape. Our threat detection network is among the most advanced in the world, using machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies to detect and stop threats in real time. We offer digital security products for Mobile, PC and Mac, which are top-ranked and certified by VB100, AV-Comparatives, AV-Test, SE Labs and others.

The position is based in Charlotte, NC.

About You:
We are looking for a Marketing Operations Specialist to join the global Avast Business Marketing team to help to improve our B2B demand generation and lead management operations. Youll partner across the team and contribute by using data to create and support innovative programs to improve the lifecycle experience for our prospects and customers.

This is a fast-paced role responsible for supporting demand generation activities by producing, optimizing and scaling email campaigns and customer journeys that deliver targeted, relevant, and timely information. You will be responsible for tracking the lead cycle and creating dashboards in Salesforce to help provide insights into the overall performance. The ideal candidate is a marketing operations professional who enjoys working with data and reporting on campaign activity, always optimizing. You have hands-on skills & expertise in Salesforce and Pardot, with modern features like journey builders, personalization tools and customer segmentation. You understand business requirements and solutions to effectively bring campaigns to life.

Responsibilities:
Manage and support the marketing technology stack with an emphasis on Pardot, serving as the primary Pardot administrator: overseeing the development, implementation and ongoing management of marketing automation processes including the buyers journey and lead processes
Own email and campaign lists and ensure data integrity across leads, campaigns and opportunities
Develop, manage and publish reporting dashboards in Salesforce for marketing and sales
Data analytics:
Review data, evaluate trends, compare with similar data sets, report recommend actions
KPI volume and pacing to targets track and report on marketing activity against target
Lead development reporting:
Establish cadence for reviewing MQLs resulting from marketing activity
Track, monitor and analyze responses and leads from activities
Collaborate with demand generation team to correlate results from actions
Collaborate with BI & Analytics team to compare metrics
Manage creative briefs and cross-functional aspects of planning, building, launching, and optimizing campaigns, including targeting, design, and analysis. Youll work cross-functionally with Marketing Managers, Creative, Copy & Translation teams and Sales Ops to fully execute campaigns.
Pre-deployment QA
Set up A/B tests, interpret results and recommend next steps for campaigns
Develop and implement lead scoring/grading to improve the funnel for Sales
Requirements:
Bachelors Degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field
Expertise in working with Salesforce
5+ years experience with executing email campaigns in a marketing automation platform (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, Marketo, Eloqua)
HTML knowledge; the ability to troubleshoot simple email HTML errors preferred
SQL knowledge; ability to troubleshoot queries
Experience with implementing lead scoring
Extreme attention to detail and thorough project management skills
Ability to accurately QA emails and troubleshoot rendering issues, existing automation, data issues
Outstanding communication skills
Strong analytical skills and business acumen
Ability to learn quickly, manage time effectively, and apply new tools and creative techniques to challenges
Small business marketing experience is a plus

Founded in 1970, CGB Enterprises, Inc. is known as an innovative and progressive leader in the grain, transportation, and risk management industries. Today, CGB operates a global enterprise with nearly 100 locations and over 2,500 US employees overseeing a diverse family of businesses that provide an array of services for producers and logistics services for an international base of customers. The combination of our assets provides a growing organization that is celebrating over 45 years of strength and stability!

Do you have an outgoing personality, thrive on hitting goals, and enjoy developing relationships with farmers that positions you as their market expert for them to sell their grain to, maximize their yield & get the most out of their market plan?

In a Marketing Specialist role, you will be primarily responsible for originating and servicing a group of medium to large farming operations and high margin accounts within regional draw territories. Job responsibilities are quantitatively measured and evaluated.

In this job, you will:
Originate and service a group of medium to large farming operations and high margin accounts within company's regional draw territories.
Establish, maintain and grow customer relationships by developing knowledge of customer's business, including the functionality of operations, provide customers knowledge of the market and bring value to the customer by determining the best fit of company products and services into their market plan.
Identify accounts that are underperforming and develop, document, and implement a marketing strategy to correct.
Support daily customer service needs and coordinate with staff and other departments to understand products and how they can support customer needs.
Assist Merchant staff on program contracts, farm programs, and crop insurance.
Assist in product development and feedback to fit the needs of the marketplace in conjunction with support network.
Gather and contribute commodity market analysis and information in support of location/regional position.
Complete bi annual review of customers and supplies report to management.
Other duties as assigned.
Here’s what you’ll need to be considered:

Education

Required - Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience and training.

Experience

Required - 4 years' experience in grain merchandising.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Professional knowledge of farm economics, grain marketing and risk management tools (futures, options, crop insurance).
Strong computer skills, including working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
Effective interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of people within and outside the organization.
Strong decision making, negotiation, and conflict management skills.
Strong coaching and teaching skills.
Strong time management and prioritization skills, with ability to remain flexible to changing priorities.
Ability to quickly learn and promote company products and services; includes how to implement products and services sold with customer.
Ability to work effectively both autonomously and within a team environment.
Ability to develop new skills, learn new techniques and software while ensuring assigned customer base receives excellent service.
Are you ready to make a meaningful career move & an impact at CGB? Apply today!

RESEARCH SERVICES DEPARTMENT
GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
The position requires an analytical disposition; someone who is comfortable with data as well as trend analysis and statistics and the manipulation of that data via statistics into a compelling, insightful and concisely presented interpretation of commercial real estate market conditions. It also requires strong leadership and the ability to motivate others in the department as well as co-workers in other departments to work towards providing the best data possible to the agents.
This position is responsible for leveraging available resources to innovatively and proactively solve issues ranging from staffing of the department to the timely generation of reports as well as the construction of new databases and the expansion or existing databases. Also responsible for responding to agent requests in a timely and professional manner, provided those requests are submitted through appropriate channels. Strong presentation and communication skills, both one on one and in group settings are required.
The person filling this position must also have strong process management and follow-through skills to ensure that the database information is kept current and that the updating is done in an efficient and timely manner.
Working experience in data interpretation (e.g. real estate appraisal or trend forecasting) may overcome this preferred.
Compensation: salary + benefits
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Attend division specialty meetings within the Salt Lake office (Industrial, Office, Retail and Investment) to interface with agents regarding their research and information requirements.
Generate semi-annual market study reports in conjunction with the graphics and marketing departments.
Construct quarterly reviews and studies of the market based on compiled and updated data.
Coordinate the maintenance or construction of office, retail, industrial, land and multi-family databases for Utah, Salt Lake and Weber/Davis counties as well as for any new markets we may enter with the goal of achieving complete data accuracy. This will require the monitoring of inventory, classification and ownership, lease/sale properties, lease/sale comparables, tenant information, proposals and related information (e.g., taxes, tax ID numbers).
Gain facility and understanding of all company research-related database programs and then effectively communicate the capabilities and limitations of those systems to the agents.

Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members in six health plans, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.
Job Summary

The Marketing Specialist is responsible for planning, building and implementing marketing programs and campaigns, This includes responsibility for writing, editing and creative development; vendor interaction, coordinating feedback, translations, and approvals; working with graphic design team for layout; and coordinating production/fulfillment; ensuring consistency of message and branding, accuracy and effectiveness throughout all marketing vehicles. Specialist to approach marketing solutions holistically and with the member/prospective member in mind. Effectively manages systems, processes, relationships and platforms is necessary in order to product outcomes that are aligned with business objectives.

Duties

Marketing Focus Area - Brand and Product Growth

Programs and Initiatives
The Marketing Specialist will be responsible for the development and launch of key marketing programs and initiatives. This involves the development of strategy, tactics, cross functional collaboration and program management. Specialist will develop internal and external relationships in order to build and launch tactics that meet the busines needs of key organizational stakeholders.

Stakeholder and Business Unit Collaboration
Specialist will need to work with the various key groups within marketing to be able to deliver outcomes that are both effective and cross functional. This includes working closely with designers, production managers for printing and accessibility team. In addition Specialist will need to work with management and leadership to incorporate feedback into project deliverables. Acting as the front line of service to key business units is a critical role for a Specialist, interfacing as a connector to core marketing resources and tools in order to achieve successful outcomes.

Project Management and Regulatory Approvals
In order to effectively manage workload, Specialist will need to manage various key systems and platforms to be able to drive progress of tasks and deliverables. This will require constant communication within these platforms and the updating of statuses and key updates. Being able to communicate regularly and find solutions to challenges and create new opportunities to outcomes is a key component to sucessful project management. Working closely with Compliance is also critical in order to retain critical regulatory approvals for projects and tactics.

Metrics and Strategy Development
Specialist is expected to work closely with Sales and Marketing business units to manage and track data associated with Marketing programs.In addition specialists will be asked to develop trend analysis and strategic marketing recommendations from resposne data in order to leverage insights and data sets to drive outcomes as needed.

Perform other duties as assigned.

SUMMARY: The Customer Success andMarketing Automation Specialist executes inbound marketing initiatives leveraging technology platforms to communicate with the M Community, centers of influence, and prospective customers. Supports the Aperture program, including communication, workflow management, scheduling, and interfacing with Member Firms and external third parties

Analyze data obtained from multiple sources in Excel in order to identify opportunities for performance improvement and opportunities to act on insights.
