Digital Marketing Specialist

IT BEGAN WITH A FLIP-FLOP. But not just any flip-flop. A sandal that revolutionized the industry, bringing biomechanical support to a quintessential summer staple. From these humble beginnings in Australia to the bustling San Francisco Bay Area, Vionic has grown from a fledgling business to a global footwear brand. We’re bringing together style and science and reimagining the look of supportive footwear.

Vionic has been named a 2018 Gallup Great Workplace Award Winner, and is the only company recognized in the fashion and retail sector. Vionic is one of just 39 companies globally to receive the prestigious award, which celebrates companies that achieve exceptional performance by creating a culture of high-reaching employee engagement. Gallup has rated Vionic among the top 2% of all companies based on "Employee Engagement” exceeding the national average by 65 percentage points. We are also officially certified and recognized as a Marin/Bay Area/California Green Business.

In a Nutshell

We are looking for Digital Marking Specialist to join our exciting and growing team focused on digital and eCommerce excellence. We are looking for someone who is passionate about all things digital marketing, who stays at the forefront of new technologies and is enthusiastic about delivering results. Reporting to Sr. Digital Marketing Manager, Growth & Acquisition, the Digital Marketing Specialist will work closely to manage and measure Vionicshoes.com full-funnel digital marketing strategy.

What You’ll Do:
Support the management day-to-day digital marketing channels including but not limited to: Paid Search, Paid Social, Display Media, Web Retargeting, and Affiliates.
Keep a tight pulse on paid channel performance through a keen understanding of Google Analytics reporting and Digital Ad Management reporting.
Manage and optimize eCommerce product feed for paid programs such as Google shopping, Facebook DPAs, Pinterest Shopping, and retargeting programs.
Manage Google Tag Manager to gather paid program insights, making recommendations, and ensuring effective ROI measurement.
Identify opportunities for ROAS improvement, program scalability, and testing as necessary.
Maintain the paid media creative calendar ensuring best performing and seasonally relevant creative is available & trafficked on time.
Work closely with the Creative team from brief, establish timelines, and acquire final approval on paid ads ensuring ads meet best practices and are delivered with correct specs.
Collaborate with external partners and agencies on launching new campaigns, creative testing, implementing/QA'ing tagging and tracking, and monitoring performance to continue growth and success of existing and new acquisition programs
Partner with Digital Channel Managers (email, social, brand marketing manager, and e-commerce website) to influence digital strategy and tactics with data-driven analysis.
Analyze digital campaign landing page performance, design testing initiatives to ensure traffic is being driven to the highest performing page on mobile and desktop.
Develop, launch, and scale email lead generation efforts to achieve monthly email subscriber goals and ROI.
What You’ll Bring to the Team:
Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university in a relevant subject (Math, Finance, Economics, Digital/marketing Analytics or related field);
2-3 years of managing and executing of performance marketing channels -previous digital marketing agency experience are highly regarded
Familiar managing self-service platforms like Facebook Ads, Google AdWords, Pinterest, Criteo
Proficiency in Google Analytics, GTM, designing custom reports, consumer funnels is a plus
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills; must be very comfortable with data analysis and enjoy working with data to understand performance, optimize campaigns, drive decisions, and measure results
Excellent time management, organizational skills; must possess a self-starter attitude with an eagerness to learn
Strong written and verbal communication skills; must be able to present ideas in a clear, concise, understandable, and organized manner
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Excellent Excel skills (e.g. you can do pivot tables in your sleep, know vlookups or index match, string parsing, etc) - SQL experience is a plus.
Highly curious, motivated, proactive, and adaptable to a fluid environment
How We Take Care of our People:

We offer a fun and dynamic workplace with a robust benefits package. You will have access to medical, dental, vision, 401K retirement plan with employer match, Long Term Disability, Life, and a generous amount of PTO. Fresh organic fruit and juices, wellness challenges, and celebrations abound, including Australia Day! You receive free shoes each season, and receive a seriously deep discount on our products because you will want more!

In this role you will:
Actively manage and execute content calendar for blogs, videos and collateral for the company
Implement SEO best practices to generate blog, video and website traffic
Develop and edit various content types, including blog articles, infographics, and collateral and video descriptions
Ensure that blog content follows corporate style guide and terminology conventions
Coordinate interviews with product management and engineering for blog and video topics
Brainstorm and develop ideas for creative marketing campaigns
Assist in analyzing marketing data (campaign results, conversion rates, traffic, etc.) to help shape future marketing strategies
Liaise with internal and external teams to guarantee adequate planning, execution and monitoring of marketing activities
Maintain awareness of best practice marketing techniques/tools to achieve successful campaigns and promotions
The ideal Venafi Warrior will be armed with:
Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in digital marketing required; some experience in web design and marketing automation is a plus
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and/or JavaScript preferred
Experience with web hosting platforms preferred
Strong knowledge of various marketing and analytics tools including as Marketo, Google Analytics, CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce), and content management systems
What sets you apart?
Detail oriented with excellent time management skills
Excellent analytical and data analysis skills
Strong prioritization, organization, and project management skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment managing multiple priorities and deliverables
Outstanding writing, editing, communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
While you are busy protecting the world, we've got you covered!

In addition to fostering a work environment with a strong work from anywhere ethic, Venafi offers a benefit package that is in the top 1%. We provide 100% employer paid premiums for both team members and their families. That includes health, dental, and vision insurance. YES, REALLY! We offer four weeks of PTO (Paid Time Off), eleven holidays, and a "pick your own community service day." We also offer 401(k) and company matching, company HSA contribution, 2x salary employer paid life insurance and parental leave. We even offer pet insurance!

More About Venafi:

Venafi is the undisputed heavy weight champion in Machine Identity Protection. Why? Because we created the category and are light years ahead of anyone that would consider competing! Gartner has recognized Venafi as number one in our space and as it turns out, one is NOT the loneliest number!

Venafi is the inventor of the technology that secures and protects keys and certificates. Venafi protects machine identity types by orchestrating cryptographic keys and digital certificates for SSL/TLS, IoT, mobile and SSH. Many of the largest organizations in the world use Venafi.

Billions of dollars have been spent protecting usernames and passwords and almost nothing protecting keys and certificates—organizations are just now realizing that protecting keys and certificates is as important as protecting usernames and passwords. The bad guys know this and are using stolen or forged keys and certificates to attack networks and steal data. In fact, Gartner says 50% of network attacks will use certificates.

Come help us protect the world!

Position:

Responsible for providing treasury product marketing, product sales demonstration, technical and financial analysis to customers, prospects and internal relationship managers (Bankers) by performing the following duties:

We are looking for a dynamic and talented *E-commerce Content / SEO Specialist, to work in our Oxnard, CA. office. *
_Job Summary: _* BOSS Audio Systems is seeking a passionate Senior Digital content manager to join our marketing team in sunny California. From expressing our brand vision and messages in all digital and traditional format to educating our enthusiastic consumers about car audio, our content specialist is the core role within marketing team to make difference of our consumer experience. This role is responsible in weaving together content with social, ecommerce, PR, keeping our product content up to date, be the storyteller of the multiple brands. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in managing multiple large volume content creation processes, copy editing with a sprinkle of SEO. If you are passionate about content that speaks to the customer and thrive in fast-paced commerce world, the growth opportunity is here!
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: *_List the essential duties and responsibilities of the position, in order of importance and/or amount of time spent._
Creative Storytelling/Social Content:

· Assist VP of Marketing in crafting brand messages and product massaging strategy.

· Artfully tell stories that communicate our unique position and the products we offer to create connection with consumers.

· Work with social media and digital marketing team to produce compelling and vibrant marketing campaign messages relevant to our consumers and implement throughout marketing funnels: ads, emails, landing pages, website banners, social posts.

Content Marketing and SEO:

· Manage the entire content production process from concept to publishing, and data reporting on results.

· Overseeing the execution of an SEO strategy that continuously improves keywords rankings and captures new ranking opportunities with new content.

· Develop and create content that aligns against evergreen, brand campaigns and integrated marketing initiatives: blogs, emails, How-to guides.

· Use product management system Salsify to assist sales team in populating product load sheets.

· Managing freelance editors and contractors

Product Content:

· Collaboration with product & customer support team to create targeted and varied content, include but not limited to user manual, quick start guide, packaging.

· Work closely with catalog manager in creating and maintaining online PDPs for both brand websites & E-commerce marketplaces such as Amazon, eBay, Walmart, able to analyze and constantly optimize for better conversion rates.

· Work with the creative team, including graphic designers, videographers, and photographers to create and execute innovative and compelling copies for product images or videos.

· Provide guidance and editorial expertise for all outgoing content: sell sheets, presentation, flyers.

Public Relation:

· Responsible for all press release and manage industry media relationship for ongoing product mentions, reviews.

· Manage and maintain affiliates network to increase backlinks and overall brand internet coverage.

· Securing thought leadership and guest-posting opportunities on other top-publisher sites
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES: *_List other important function that are secondary duties but may be time consuming._
· Develops standards, systems, and best practices for content creation, distribution, maintenance, content retrieval and content repurposing including the real-time implementation of content strategies across our global marketing team;

· Collaborates with Ecommerce team to amplify content through various channels including the website, blog, SEO, YouTube, and social media;

· Stays current on digital marketing best practices and techniques for creating effective and engaging web content;

· Translate consumer insights and learning into innovative and creative content ideas such as brand partnerships, experience activations, product demos;

· Performs other related duties as assigned by supervisor.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES: *_What does a person in this position need to be able to do?_
· Strong in both short & long format writing.

· Excellent grammar, writing, copy-editing and communication skills, including the ability to adapt writing style to appeal to different audiences and adhere to established brand voices;

· Strong understanding of SEO and keyword placement;

· Agile in adapting to E-commerce, SEO & SEM requirement and write effective copies to improve both ranking & conversions;

· Extensive experience with copy for: blogs, ads, packaging, websites, press releases, social media and more.

· Strong strategic thinker and results oriented executor; and

· Consumer electronics and car audio industry experience a plus.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: *_What is the usual educational and background and work experience of an individual qualified to perform this job?_
· Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Journalism, Communications, English, Public Relations or related required;

· Mandatory: 3 - 4 years content management experience for a consumer brand on relevant digital channels;

· Previous experience in writing for the website using CMS such as Wordpress/Shopify.

· Past experience managing creative resources, freelancers, and production needs for campaigns and content projects;

· Versatile research skills and enthusiasm for learning about new topics;

· Strong strategic thinker and results oriented executor;

· Extremely organized with attention to detail; proven project manager that can work across functions to accomplish goals;

· Creative thinker with track record of being able to translate insights into strong consumer facing communication pieces;

· 1+ year of SEO experience with an understanding of how search engine crawlers and websites work;

· Extensive experience working with and managing a large catalog of online products;

· Strong attention to detail with the ability to focus on task completion for a variety of competing priorities;

· An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset – a “make it happen” way of thinking;

· Data-driven with proven track record of turning insights into action

· Excellent organizational and time management skills; ability to manage multiple priorities; and

· Proactive: able to note things that need to be done without being prompted.

Skilljar is seeking a Demand Generation expert to drive our digital marketing efforts. We are looking for a creative, customer-centric marketer with a successful track record in B2B demand generation for software technology products. This is a fantastic opportunity to get in early at a rapidly growing startup that is working to create a new category of software solutions.

In this role, you'll be working closely with our content creators and product marketers to plan and execute digital marketing campaigns. In addition to top-notch marketing skills and experience managing paid marketing budgets, we are looking for someone who is comfortable wearing multiple hats in a fast-changing environment. This role reports to the Director of Demand.

We're looking for a motivated, self-starter who is comfortable wearing multiple hats and thrives in a dynamic environment. You must be nimble, highly-collaborative, and able to think on your feet. This is a great opportunity to join a rapidly accelerating startup that has dozens of Fortune 1000 and mid-market clients on its roster.

Responsibilities
Develop and execute programs to generate pipeline through lead-generation initiatives including SEM, SEO, retargeting, content syndication, nurture programs, social media, email campaigns, and webinars.
Oversee digital spend, including monthly reporting on forecast vs. actual, cost per lead, account penetration, and pipeline return.
Design and execute the multivariate testing program for emails and landing pages. Recommend and implement improvements to increase conversions.
Track, measure, and report campaign performance against agreed-upon metrics, including MQL, SQL, and pipeline. Consistently assess and optimize program performance vs. spend to meet campaign goals and KPIs.
Provide data-driven analytics and reporting to leadership teams, that define where we are against goals and how we will adjust to reach them.
Collaborate with sales and business development to ensure close alignment and understand lead quality; optimize marketing campaigns accordingly to deliver the strongest quality lead flow.
Manage technical aspects of key marketing systems (marketing automation, CRM) used to generate, distribute, and report on leads.
Maintain Lead Scoring methodology based on analysis of highest converting leads; work with the sales team to roll out and optimize.
Stay up-to-date with digital marketing trends and potential new channels and strategies to keep us ahead, including updates to social media marketing, attribution, and programmatic media buying.
Requirements
2-5 years of experience in digital marketing, ideally aligned to B2B products and verticals.
At least 2-years of experience using digital campaign tools like AdWords and Google Analytics. And at least 1-year experience using Hubspot.
Experience working with marketing automation tools such as Google Analytics, AdWords, WordPress, and Salesforce.
Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders in Sales and Account Development.
US work authorization and criminal background check are required.
The Company

Backed by prominent financial institutions, including Mayfield, Shasta Ventures, and Trilogy Equity Partners, Skilljar is the leading enterprise customer training platform, transforming the way organizations onboard, engage, and retain their customers. Trusted by leading global companies like Zillow, Slack, Tableau, Liberty Mutual, Cisco, Verizon, and U-Haul, Skilljar provides the essential tools and foundation for successful customer and partner engagement and enablement.

We are a team of bright, dedicated Skillets with startup drive and a passion for education. Headquartered in Seattle, WA, Skilljar is currently operating remotely, with employees based in Washington, Oregon, California, and Colorado.

Position Description:

The primary focus of this role is to manage, develop strategy, and execute 1:1 digital marketing tactics that drive corporate and business unit goals and objectives through omni-channel approaches using Marketing Automation and Email Marketing technology.
This position requires strong technical competency and familiarity with email marketing and marketing automation tools and techniques.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Email Marketing. Coordinates with marketing managers, designers, and content writers. Monitors and manages email deliverability, monitors the uptime and reliability of our email service provider. Improves click-through-rates, open-rates, and metrics in regards to email as a channel through A/B testing, subject line optimization, consulting and recommendations to marketing colleagues and more. Maintaining a schedule for email delivery and implementing one-off-blasts, statement emails, newsletters, email series and more. Responsible for anything and everything email.
Develop and implement Marketing Automation. Working with vendors to establish best practices and set up marketing automation for omni-channel campaigns through direct mail, email, paid advertising, on-site ads and content, and various other channels. Management of a Marketing Automation Customer Data Platform and coordination between business units and marketing managers to determine next-best-action offers available. Document and establish policies procedures for execution.
Strategic development and guidance for Marketing Managers. Works with marketing managers to develop campaigns with marketing automation in mind, using advanced next-best-action techniques through omni-channel, AI decisioning, and automation. Works to educate the marketing team on advanced techniques available and how to use the marketing automation tools themselves.
Serves as main point of contact for any Marketing Automation or CDP vendor, platform, or tool suite. Develop timelines, schedules, and manage deliverables with vendors.
Seek continuing education in Marketing Automation, AI modeling, Customer Data Platform, and best practices in regards to 1:1 marketing for financial institutions.
Other duties as required
Minimum formal education required for this position:

Knowledge consistent with a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, or similar field of study.

Each year of relevant work experience may be exchanged for a year in a relevant degree program or vice versa. For example, a requirement of“Knowledge Consistent with a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting and 2+ years’ of accounting experience” could be substituted for a High School Diploma and 6 years of relevant accounting work experience or a Master’s Degree in Accounting and 0 years of work experience.

Minimum work experience:

3+ years’ of experience in Digital marketing or a relevant field.

Technical or specialized knowledge/skills:
Strong written, oral and interpersonal skills for effective communication.
Experience in email marketing: managing delivery calendars, implementing emails, launching campaigns, and optimizing results through A/B testing, subject line optimization and click-through optimization.
Experience with one or more Marketing Automation and/or Customer Data Platforms such as Pega Systems, Marketo, Eloqua, Hubspot, Adobe Target, Active Campaign or others.
Experience developing automated marketing campaigns in a marketing automation platform utilizing two or more channels and techniques including: email, web content customization, text messaging, direct mail, paid advertising, and more.
Experience managing digital marketing vendors.
Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite of products (Word/Excel/Outlook).
(Preferred) HTML and CSS knowledge and experience.
(Preferred) Experience using predictive AI modeling to determine next-best-action through the channel a member is most likely to respond in.
(Preferred) Experience with marketing strategy and campaign execution.
(Preferred) Email deliverability and performance optimization through ESP’s and/or email intelligence platforms such as: Mailgun, SendGrid, Amazon SES, eDatasource etc.
Certifications required:
None
Environmental, physical and psychological requirements:
Must be able to sit or stand for prolonged periods of time in a climate controlled environment. Must be able to use fingers, hands, wrists for repetitive tasks such as typing, using a mouse, handling paper, currency, or coin, and operating a telephone. Demands for visual and auditory acuity are typical of an office environment. Must be able to interact via email, telephone, or in person with diplomacy, tact, and courtesy with all members under varying circumstances. Must be able to lift up to 40 lbs.

WHAT WE DO MATTERS:

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 15 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, The Bash, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life's milestones. From the proposal to creating a home, and starting a family together, we're there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:

The Knot Worldwide is looking for an Email Marketing Specialist with 4-6 years of experience to join the existing email marketing team of seven and support consumer engagement and advertising programs for The Knot, WeddingWire and The Bump brands. The Email Marketing Specialist will partner with the Creative Team, Local and National Sales Teams, Commerce Team and other stakeholders to create and execute email programs.

Day-to-day, this person will be building email campaigns in Salesforce Marketing Cloud's Content Builder, segmenting data using SQL queries, working with stakeholders on approvals, scheduling email sends, reporting performance of campaigns, and providing recommendations to improve processes and performance. The Email Marketing Specialist must be able to react quickly to support business needs, determine daily activities and priorities while delivering projects to tight deadlines. The right candidate will have experience collaborating with various teams and developing large-scale campaigns.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage the National email advertising program for all brands (WeddingWire, The Knot and The Bump), working closely with the Account Managers. Balance advertiser needs with brand and consumer interests.
Manage the Local email advertising program by working closely with the email Ops team and provide strategic guidance including list segmentation and campaign optimization to our largest clients.
Build and execute email campaigns to support the Commerce team and drive revenue. Make recommendations to improve performance.
Manage the daily set-up of one-time and automated email campaigns, content and message optimization, mobile-responsive email template creation & editing (HTML), list segmentation, deployment, and reporting in Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
Track email metrics and deliverability; report performance of email campaigns to stakeholders including open rates, click rates, and conversion.
Optimize performance of existing campaigns and programs by performing ongoing testing including audience segmentation, subject lines, email copy, layouts and CTAs that improve conversion.
Ensure cross-browser/email client compatibility through testing tools such as Litmus.
As needed, support other team members with execution of email campaigns.
SUCCESSFUL EMAIL MARKETING SPECIALIST CANDIDATES HAVE:

The ideal candidate will have a strong attention to detail and the ability to project manage multiple deliverables and brands. Key requirements for this role include:
Bachelor's degree in marketing or related field. Background in editorial, e-commerce or consumer products a plus.
4-6 years experience in email marketing and execution.
Strong understanding and experience working with an enterprise-level ESP. Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud a big plus!
Intermediate knowledge of HTML specifically for email channel.
Basic SQL skills.
Basic experience with Google Analytics.
Ability to troubleshoot technical issues, following a logical sequence to identify problems.
Experience with A/B and multivariate testing using complex segmentation.
Experience compiling and analyzing large amounts of data and communicating results in an organized and concise way. High comfort level with pivot tables.
Strong interest in current email best practices, strategies, and industry standards recommending new methods, innovative ideas, and/or technologies to grow the business.
Ability to think strategically and work independently.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to coordinate workflows with multiple stakeholders (national/local advertising, editorial, marketing, commerce, product, design and creative).
Deadline driven, highly flexible, multi-tasking master with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
At The Knot Worldwide, we believe you are more than a resume and invite you to go for it, take the leap of faith, and apply for this job if it sparks your passion to join TKWW and make a difference!

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:
You Dream Big. You iterate and experiment to drive innovation.
You Love Our Users. You keep our global community at the center of everything you do.
You Respect All Voices. Inclusion strengthens us and powers your decisions.
You Hustle Every Day. You favor urgency and own your outcomes.
You Win Together. People are at the heart of our success and you play as a team.
WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:

The Knot Worldwide offers a unique employee experience and we are deeply proud of our award-winning culture. From flexible vacation and generous parental leave benefits to promoting wellness and giving back to our community, we believe in happiness above all else—in and out of the office.

Founded by a small group of educators, Michigan Schools & Government Credit Union (MSGCU) has been providing quality financial services to the community for more than 65 years. Following our mission of being a caring organization dedicated to promoting financial success for our members, we have grown to be the 6th largest Credit Union in Michigan. With 15 offices in Macomb, Oakland and Wayne Counties, MSGCU has 350 team members, 135,000 members, over $2 billion in assets, and has earned a 97% member satisfaction rating for the past ten years. We have also been honored as a Top Workplace by The Detroit Free Press seven years in a row.

If you have a passion for helping people and providing exceptional and dependable service, we want you on our team!

Overview of Responsibilities: Supports MSGCUs growth initiatives by generating engagement with relevant, effective, and efficient messaging delivered via automated and digital tools. Deepens relationships with members and prospective members by keeping them informed of new and existing products and services that help promote their financial success. Supports high quality data-driven decision making, strengthening our competitive position and contributing to future marketing enhancements.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Develops and executes MSGCUs email marketing program, including segmentation, testing, and deployment. Continually evaluates for improvements and applies to subsequent email initiatives. Uses email to support marketing campaigns and promotions. Researches and implements email automation enhancements as suited for departmental and organizational needs.
Responsible for MSGCUs relationship with email vendor; managing Matrix onboarding program consisting of monthly direct mail. Develops and implements product messaging and digital enhancements to the program on an ongoing basis. Tracks and reports results with recommended optimizations.
Manages member online advertising tool to ensure the right message gets to the right member at the right time. Personalizes where possible. Responsible for data feed, targeting, and messaging cadence. Converts engagement into warm leads for retail staff. Partners with Virtual Services team in managing vendor relationship.
Researches, implements, and manages the marketing automation platform and fully leverages its capabilities. Marketing team lead for support of Marketing Automation integration with core system and assists in the integration of additional platforms into the marketing automation software.
Responsible for supporting future marketing automation efforts and processes, proactively researching and recommending best practices, tactics, and monitoring industry standards. Efforts may include but not limited to member referral tool, CRM, blog/enewsletter, and other lead generation efforts.
Manages paid search program through partner agency. Cross-references data and learnings with internal programs for optimal performance. Shares learnings with the marketing team.
Works with Marketing Data & Research Analyst, Marketing Manager, and other marketing team members to define KPIs, create reporting, and analyze campaign/program performance. Creates recommendations to improve results continuously.
Plans and performs A/B and other forms of testing to define and execute enhancements to productivity, conversion rates, ROI, and sales growth.
Builds and supports the appropriate calendars to facilitate the delivery of relevant, timely news and product information that supports MSGCUs strategic targets. Ensures effective and appropriate use of branding at all times.
Partners with Marketing Data & Research Analyst to ensure ideal targeting, mine results for insightful and actionable understanding, and develop future optimizations.
Supports high quality decision making by seeking answers to marketing problems with relentless curiosity about what intel lies within member behavioral and transactional data available, as well as industry sources.
Essential Preparation and Experience:
Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Advertising, or other related field; and
3 years of experience in an email marketing or related role including:
B2C marketing experience, and
Experience with Salesforce.com or similar platform resulting in expert working knowledge.
Preferred experience:
Financial marketing industry experience.
Direct marketing experience.
Paid search experience.
Intermediate experience using Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat, etc.).
Essential Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Member Focus: Builds meaningful and productive internal/external working relationships with key stakeholders in order to plan, produce, and deploy effective communications. Skilled at influencing, collaborating, and working as part of a team in order to deliver effective, member-focused marketing campaigns and promotions.
Action Oriented: Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency and enthusiasm. Strong project management, organizational and time management skills. Operates well under pressure and meets tight deadlines. Flexibility to meet deadlines and address unplanned communication needs that may arise.
Communicates Effectively: Strong written and verbal communication skills with a demonstrated ability to distill, organize, and convey complex information in a logical, user-friendly manner. Ability to present an opinion or recommendation based on data and facts in a convincing way.
Instills Trust: Builds relationships and gains the confidence of others by modeling honesty, integrity, authenticity, and behaviors that align with organizational values. Exemplifies courage by stepping up to address difficult issues. Meticulous attention to detail and high quality standards. Conducts oneself with utmost discretion and professionalism to protect sensitive information.
Self-Development: Actively seeks new ways to grow and be challenged using formal and informal development channels.
Expert working knowledge of database management concepts and best practices. Working knowledge of marketing analytics concepts.
Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point required.
Working Conditions:
Office and branch location environment with little discomfort from noise, extreme temperature, dust, or other factors.
Required to travel throughout MSGCU's service area as business needs require.
Exposed to potentially hazardous conditions, such as robbery. Receives detailed instructions and security procedures on an annual basis to minimize risk.
This work involves sitting most of the time with brief periods of walking or standing and may occasionally require lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds.

About John Burns Real Estate Consulting


John Burns Real Estate Consulting, LLC provides independent subscription research and customized consulting services related to the US housing industry. John Burns founded the company in 2001 because he saw a need for better housing market analysis. The company has grown to a highly passionate team of research analysts and consultants in offices across the country, who work together to provide the most trusted source of US housing analysis and consulting services. Three principles guide us:
Purpose: To enable the profitable development of the best places to live in the world through great research.
Vision: To be the most trusted and respected US housing market analysts and consultants.
Mission: To help executives make informed housing industry investment decisions.
John Burns Real Estate Consulting offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k) with employer contributions, paid vacation, holiday leave, etc. Compensation will be based on a candidate’s market value and their ability to contribute to our business.

Job Description:
1. Position Summary for Mental Crisis Specialist:
The Mental Health Crisis Specialist is responsible for providing on/off site crisis intervention and stabilization, assessments and short term case management to adults, children, and adolescents in crisis or emergency mental health situations 24 hours per day, 7 days a week, 365 days per year. The primary goals of the Crisis Team are hospital or jail diversion, in home stabilization, member safety, and suicide prevention, and other tasks relating to this goal as required.
Primary Duties/Responsibilities:
Provide short-term crisis intervention services in the community or the ‘ROC” Center for adults, children, and adolescents, which include intake, outreach visits, telephone lethality monitoring, linkage, and follow-up services where applicable.
Provide mental health evaluations and assist in the assessment for the need for involuntary transport by Law Enforcement to the local Title 36 Contracted Agency.
Provide short term case management to include crisis planning, behavior modification, and the coordination of individualized services specific to family needs.
Collaborate and work effectively with partner agencies to develop appropriate service provisions for identified families.
Provide assessment to determine suicide lethality or dangerousness to others, mental status, and other behavioral, cognitive and/or affective indicators as required.
Complete all required charting, casework, documentation, and other computer entry, on a timely basis.
Maintain a working knowledge of the mental health, developmentally disabled, social service and wrap system in assigned County in order to provide appropriate referral and linkage for members served.
Attend and participate in all required clinical supervisions, training, staff meetings, and case conferences, as indicated by the Director.
Assist in providing coverage in other agency programs in emergency situations or staff shortage situations as required by agency managers.
Engage in agency or community projects or work groups that contribute to the agency and/or program mission.
Maintain and increase skills in the field through trainings in the agency and/or the community.
Provide marketing and/or educational presentations to the community, or training to other agency staff, as assigned by the Director.
Assist in the training of new staff and students, as assigned by a supervisor.
Assume on call and back-up responsibilities, consistent with program needs.
Maintain a valid Arizona Driver’s License and have access to a usable vehicle.
Work as a team member to provide safe/positive work environment for members, staff and the public.
Secure and maintain all necessary certification and professional licensing as directed by profession.
Participate in weekly Crisis Provider Meetings and Quality Circles.
Special assignments, projects, and other duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications Required To Perform Job:
High school Diploma or GED required. Bachelor’s Degree in behavioral health field or four years related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience in behavioral health care to qualify as a behavioral health technician. Requires excellent communication skills, including ability to respond to callers/members with patience, objectivity and a nonjudgmental attitude. Demonstrated ability to problem-solve. Knowledge of or ability to learn about community resources and agency services. Ability to work well in a team, good interpersonal skills, and positive attitude. Ability to follow clinical and office protocols and procedures. Ability to multi-task and computer literate. Customer service, clinic or center, or social service experience preferred. Reliable transportation, clean driving record, Arizona driver’s license, and current personal automobile insurance required.

Marketing Coordinator – Reporting & Planning
Who we are:
Here at Allstar, we create opportunities and maximize potential – plain and simple – this is our Company Mission. We are a Mission First, People ALWAYS organization, and operate without borders or boundaries. One Team, One Mission is our Value System, and we live it each and every day, both internally and outside our walls with our vendors, agencies and business partners.
Purpose and Scope:
This position is new to our performance-based advertising (PBA) function, and a critical part of our company’s future. We are looking for an experienced, data-driven, digital media guru who lives and breathes performance-based marketing. The right candidate will understand how to guide digital advertising agencies to create, execute, monitor, control, and maximize our digital media campaigns across all digital channels.
Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities
Provide detailed analytical support to all levels and teams of the Allstar organization and assist as needed with cross functional and ad hoc reporting requests.
Summary
Provide Strategic and operational analyses, reporting and insights to all levels of the Allstar organization
Leverage strong data & analytical skills to manage product life cycles, and deliver relevant reporting, metrics & insights for timely decision-making
Maintain/Update weekly Marketing P&Ls by campaign (including for marketing tests)
Responsibilities
Provide Strategic and Operational Analyses
The right candidate will have a track-record of providing strategic analysis to management and executive level decision makers
Gather and articulate, clearly and concisely, omni-channel attribution to maximize advertising spend and return on advertising spend (ROAS)
Collaborate with other functional teams, (e.g., Sales, Finance, Merchandising, Product, Product Dev) to understand the impact of analysis across multiple areas of the business
Collaborate with our tv and digital advertising agencies to ensure adherence with PBA campaign budgets and targets
Assist in developing inventory needs analysis for direct to consumer sales
Maintain/Update weekly Marketing P&Ls
Responsible for managing weekly margin dashboard reports, Profit and Loss statements and other reports relating to DR Marketing by providing weekly quantitative and qualitative analysis of profitability by product
Create weekly P&L for new tests (TV and Digital)
P&L / Margin Dashboards – to be updated and sent to staff weekly
Maintain cost assumptions for active products and new products
Update Media spend files to maintain historical data for analysis
Requirements
· Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) required in Finance, Mathematics, Economics, Business, Computer Science or related analytical field
· Minimum 1-2 year relevant data analysis experience
· Forecasting, media reporting and financial modeling experience a plus
· Direct Response experience a plus
· Ability to gather, manipulate, and analyze large sets of data
· Ability to transform data to create a story with actionable insights
· Online advertising platforms such as Google Analytics, Facebook, and DoubleClick a plus
· SQL experience a plus
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
· Must be a self-starter with strong attention to detail, required.
· Strong written and verbal communication and analytical skills and strong proficiency with MS Word, Excel, PP
· Demonstrated success in performing well under time constraints, excellent time and project management skills
· Adept at dealing with ambiguity and a frequently changing industry with the ability to work extra hours as needed
· Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook is required. Web research and internet savvy a plus.
· Must have the ability to work occasional overtime as needed.
Salary Range: $45-55k

Job Description: Genetic Purity Grow-out Specialist *
Company Information*
VoloAgri® is a Non-GMO vegetable seed technology and breeding company dedicated to Cultivating Global Health. We take pride in passionately serving every customer with customized vegetable seed and technical service solutions they can count on. Our innovative seeds produce plants with increased yields, improved disease resistance, and post-harvest processing advantages while still achieving exceptional taste! This reduces the environmental farming footprint while increasing the healthy consumption of delicious vegetables.

Our diverse team of industry experts are stationed around the world. Our Global Corporate Headquarters is based in Woodland, CA and satellite offices in Holland and Mexico City; and research stations in California (Woodland), Mexico (Culiacan), and Spain (Almeria). Our prized collection of seeds has been developed under several brands including US Agriseeds and Axia.
Location: Woodland, CA*
Position: Genetic Purity Grow-out Specialist*
Reporting to: QA Manager *
Job Description Summary: *
Manage the genetic purity grow-out (PGO) program to ensure that all pre-commercial and commercial seed lots are grown out and field evaluated for purity. This process includes tracking all inbound receiving lots, preparing and scheduling samples for timely placement in designated grow-out locations, and managing the evaluations process. This position will be located at our Woodland R&D site and expected travel up to 25%.
Primary Duties: *
Subject Matter Expertise
*
Work with the marketing and sales teams to learn all variety characteristics within VoloAgri’s vegetable portfolio.
Work with breeders and the Production Manager to learn the characteristics of all parent lines.
Work with VoloAgri Plant Pathologist and the Pest Control Advisor (PCA) to learn proper field inspection protocols and how to identify plant disease symptoms.
PGO Planning
*
Establish or maintain global PGO trial locations internally and externally. While primary trialing stations are in Woodland CA and Culiacan MX and alternative locations may also be utilized. Establish contracts, pricing and agronomic practices that are suited for each crop.
Track all inbound material and develop planting schedules based on estimated arrival dates in advance of receiving.
Coordinate with Production Analyst and Inventory Management to finalize planting lists.
Manage the actual sample preparation and delivery to designated location.
Create field maps for all varieties to be planted in coordination with relevant colleagues.
Oversee the sowing and transplanting process of PGO trials
Work with field labor to mark and stake the fields in preparation for planting.
Work with farm managers to identify ideal agronomic practices per crop including: ground selection, planting, watering, fertility, pest and weed control to achieve optimal varietal performance.
PGO Execution
*
Manage field labor in the planting and maintenance of all crops. Activities include staking, tying, pruning, weeding, irrigating, harvesting, and others as needed.
Work with the field owner and PCA to create a weekly plan for pest control management, fertilization, and irrigation for the fields.
Inspect the fields weekly for any change in plant habit, growth, maturity and presence of plant diseases and pests. Communicate any observed changes to relevant stakeholders.
Evaluate the PGO trial taking detailed notes and photos of each variety/lot present in the PGO trial.
Data Evaluation and Entry
*
Perform or coordinate timely PGO evaluations (multiple readings) to obtain optimal expression of seed lot impurities (off-type plants).
Conduct timely reporting of impure seed lots to the Inventory Management and Production Analyst to determine quality and disposition.
Ensure PGO results are entered into the quality system (ABS) immediately after evaluation readings are performed.
Work with the financial team and develop an annual PGO budget. Manage expenses within the budget parameters.
Provide summary reports with trend analysis to the QA and Sales & Marketing teams
Provide detail analysis any customer complaints related to genetic purity.
Become the product expert of each variety and learn/teach specific plant characteristics that are unique to a given variety.
QC Data Entry
Assist as needed with data analysis and entry of all QC test results including:
Genetic Purity by DNA markers
Germination
Seed Health
Physical Purity
Safety and Compliance
*
Adheres to all Human Resource Policies and Procedures
Adheres to all Health, Safety and Environmental Policies and Procedures
Adheres to all Process Quality Policies and Procedure
Qualifications & Experience: *
*
A minimum of 3 years’ experience in seed production or crop trialing activities.
The ideal candidate will have a background working with agronomy with a focus of vegetable seed production or trialing.
The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with standard vegetable phenotypic traits and physiology.
The ideal candidate will have analytical and plot design skills.
Extensive knowledge and highly proficient in the use of manufacturing databases (SAP, Oracle, etc.) and Microsoft Office products.
Skills and Personal Traits*
Demonstrated success when faced with changing priorities or circumstances.
Excellent communication skills (verbal & written) for effective vendor & internal staff communication.
Attention to detail, drives tasks to closure efficiently with error‐free end result.
Excellent leadership and organizational skills.
Strong analytical and computer skills.
Strong team player, self‐starter, positive attitude and high integrity.
Education
BS in Agriculture is required
VoloAgri Compensation & Benefits: *
Competitive compensation package for Woodland region
Medical & dental insurance
Section 125 Dependent Care plans, 401(k) Plan
Vacation, sick and holiday time off

The Clinical Outreach Specialist utilizes clinical expertise to contribute to the development of the agency marketing and growth plan. Job Title: Digital Marketing Director (5 Years Experience Required)
Job Description:
Summary of Requirements for Digital Marketing Director

To save you time as a young professional looking to grow in the marketing industry, we have a list of a few preferred qualities for you to review. We have a full list of perks for you below, so we look forward to seeing if you fit all or most of the requirements below!
5 Years Experience at a Digital Marketing Agency
Lead and direct accounts team to engage with clients to support financing and growth opportunities associated with RMP clientele
5 Years Experience Advanced Search Ads Experience, with examples of results
(Google, Bing, Display)
5 Years Experience Advanced Facebook Ads Experience, with examples of results
(Lead Gen, Targeting, Remarketing)
Experience using a CRM, organizing info, calendar appointments, etc
(Asana, Trello, Basecamp, Salesforce, etc)
Experience using analytics software
(Google Analytics, SEMrush, Hootsuite, Sprout Social)
Experience using landing page software
(Unbounce, Clickfunnels, Wordpress)
Fluent Typer
(typing test, can you type 50 wpm or more?)

If for any reason, you don’t meet some of these requirements but believe you are a “Pro” in the making, reach out with how you can bring value to our team. We review all applications
What is Roofing Marketing Pros?*
If you’re ready to work for an exciting Digital Marketing Agency with rapid growth and a “googley” culture, we have an opportunity to share with you.

At Roofing Marketing Pros, we develop a super effective, unique, and proprietary systems that will consistently provide new commercial and/or residential roofing leads looking for a trusted Roofing Pro near them.

RMP is laser-focused on delivering PROVEN marketing systems that consistently provide 5-10 X ROI. These are the numbers that we currently hit, so that performance will also be a part of your responsibility as a Digital Marketing Pro.

Unlike most marketing agency “generalists ”that focus on taking in as many random industry/vertical clients as possible, we specialize in a specific type of marketing that puts roofing contractors and brands in front of property owners looking to get their roofs replaced, repaired, upgraded & more.
Perks for our Pros*
Work alongside the Pros - Sit next to industry-leading digital ads experts that have worked 10+ years in Paid Search and Social Media Marketing
Marketing Assets Library - We’ve spent over $50k on guides, coaching and training from the biggest names in marketing. You’ll have access to 100%.
Free Barista Bar - Get your Cafecito fix on all day every day with 24/7 access to amenities like amazing coffee, craft cold brew coffee, espresso drinks, Kambucha and more!
Hottest Building on Miami Beach - Work alongside dozens of other Startups and Accelerators at the We Work by Lincoln. Lounges, private rooms, open areas and plenty of freedom. You will find it very motivational being surrounded by young, driven, smart professionals.
“Google” Company Culture - Just like our clients, we work hard and play hard. Every team member has an opportunity to work on projects they love, and suggest our next “outing” with the team. Developing your skill sets and expanding your abilities is a top priority for us as a team. If you join our team, you will absolutely become a Pro in several digital marketing disciplines.
Free Lunch Fridays - Everyone’s favorite part of the week! Working on South Beach means trying every top-rated restaurant we can find. You don’t have to love food to work here, but it’s recommended.
Dog-Friendly Office - Dogs make everyone’s day better. Feel free to bring your pooch in from time to time, as long chew on the MacBook charger cables.
Bonuses & Promotions - We believe salaries are just a “start” to a Pro’s ability to earn. Every team member to be rewarded with recognition and financial bonuses for great work. We will set your goals for bonuses, and do everything we can to help you hit those goals.
Constantly Adding Perks - 2 Years, we’ve earned a national reputation as THE digital ads agency for general contractors. Growth is currently exploding. Our top priority before that growth is making sure our agency is the best for our team. We want you to look forward to Monday!
Your Experience: What makes you a Pro?
Strong interest in a career in digital advertising and marketing
Positive “can-do” and “will-do” attitude
Strong and timely communication with interpersonal skills
Ability to optimize campaigns to maximize performance
Easy to get along with and enjoys being social
Expert at communicating performance, and digging for information from clients in order to create unique campaigns
Knowledge of split testing, targeting testing, and creative testing in order to compare results across campaigns.
Ability to customize performance reports for various purposes
Able to handle fast learning curves on new software, new updates, etc.
Independent and able to discover solutions on tasks delegated to you
Your Role: Digital Marketing Director
Launch and maintain Google Ads, Bing Ads, Facebook Lead Generation Campaigns for dozens of Roofing Companies across the US.
Build marketing department for our own agency and utlize different online channels to generate leads for our company. The channels include Facebook, PPC, YouTube, TradeShows, Direct Mail, Email Marketing.
Lead and train accounts team to keep, grow, and client accounts
Plan, develop, and implement comprehensive paid media strategies to increase visibility, brand recognition, and drive user acquisition and leads across SEM and Paid Social channels (i.e. AdWords, Facebook, Instagram,etc.)
Craft each campaign to the client’s company, brand, values, in order to set them apart from each business surrounding them.
Conducting competitive research to stay informed on fluctuations and changes in the macro-environment that could impact the overall performance.
Expert in ad targeting/analytics, as well as the creative skill sets to produce better and faster results. We never stop optimizing.
Identifying and selecting the best channel or medium for an advertising campaign based on an in-depth market analysis (i.e. audience demographics, media usage, ratings, type of content in a given vehicle, etc.)
Grow client relationships by building your bond between the performance of your campaign with reporting
Compiling daily, weekly, monthly, and lifetime report to quantify results and communicate them to the client.
Understand that our clients are hard-working, blue color business people. They are busy, not very tech-savvy, and care primarily about 1) Performance and 2) Trust, to keep them active. Communication etiquette and intuition is a crucial part of this role.
Able to manage direct feedback, nurture relationships, and create a bond between you and your clients.

PURPOSE:

As a data-driven, email marketing specialist, you'll be responsible for executing the company's email marketing strategy to engage, nurture, and drive customer loyalty. The specialist will manage and execute email marketing campaigns, from setup, targeting, and testing to deployment and campaign optimization. You'll be working cross-functionally with various business partners to strategize, set up and execute email marketing campaigns, and be looked at to advise and inform partners on email marketing best practices. The role requires the coworker is efficient in and strives to become an expert with Salesforce Marketing Cloud, continually seeking out ways to improve the effectiveness of the email channel.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Collaborate with marketing and field partners to conceptualize, build, and maintain email programs that fulfill customer needs, consultant needs, and business objectives.
Develop and deploy emails for both our consumers and our consultants. This includes recommending and reviewing creative, executing tests, running data filters, scheduling, and deployment.
Advise on testing optimization including A/B and multivariate testing.
Partner on reporting and analysis of email marketing programs, and work with cross-functional teams on recommendations for campaign improvements.
Partner with teams across the organization to effectively craft messaging, offers, and creative to better engage customers and consultants.
Use data and campaign metrics to make recommendations for continuous improvement of ongoing email campaigns.
Regularly review the competitive landscape to look for opportunities and creative inspiration to help build and grow the email marketing program for Pampered Chef.
COMPETENCIES FOR SUCCESS:
Customer Focus
Communicates Effectively
Tech Savvy
Manages Complexity
MEASURES OF SUCCESS:
Revenue Per Active Customer
Complete Projects Within Defined Deadlines
Grow Active Customer and Consultant Base
REQUIREMENTS
Academic background in marketing, communications, business, technology or related field. Undergraduate college degree minimum.
2+ years of email marketing experience. Knowledge of Salesforce Marketing Cloud required.
2+ years of experience in marketing campaign execution; retail or direct selling industry experience a plus.
Experience establishing effective measurement and reporting that deliver insights to business partners so they can make informed decisions that increase program effectiveness.
Exceptional written and oral communications skills. Strong interpersonal skills, well-developed organizational skills.
Team spirit and a collaborative attitude to work well within a small, high-performing team, as well as across departments.
Proven ability to work cross-functionally to prioritize what's best for the company.
Basic HTML experience and competency a plus.

When a benefits problem needs solving or a question needs answering, our insurance solutions specialists jump right in. Our specialists work as Nextep’s benefits agency to find the best benefit solutions for each client. Nextep is a certified Professional Employer Organization (PEO), we work hand-in-hand with small and mid-sized companies to provide HR services including payroll, benefits, human resources, risk & compliance, and more. Nextep has been recognized as a Best Place to Work in Oklahoma and we were recognized for excellence in corporate ethics by the Oklahoma Ethics Consortium.

At Nextep, our employees work every day to elevate the employment experience and enrich people’s lives. We take that endeavor seriously and extend that spirit of enrichment to business owners, their employees, and each other.

Nextep is seeking an Insurance Solutions Specialist for our Norman office. This position is responsible for an assigned book of business. The Insurance Solution Specialist works with Nextep’s benefit team, performing and supporting various account management activities, including but not limited to solving complex employee benefit issues, the development and coordination of insurance marketing and the RFP process, and managing annual policy renewals for assigned accounts.

Job Responsibilities:
Using expertise in benefit plans, analyze and market employee benefit programs, including management and coordination of the RFP process, work closely with client to develop long-term benefit strategy, review carrier proposals and make recommendations.
Review contracts, amendments and SPDs for accuracy and coverage, identify errors and coordinate corrections with carriers, vendors and affiliated partners.
Provide claims, eligibility, billing and plan administration support.
Ensure client satisfaction and deliver an exceptional level of customer service in a professional and timely manner.
Build and maintain effective working relationships with employee benefit carriers, vendors and affiliated partners.
Coordinate and conduct client presentations including open enrollment meetings, benefit fairs, benefit strategy & planning, and renewal presentations.
Maintain a broad knowledge of benefit products, services and carrier underwriting requirements to aid in consulting and advisement in the planning and meeting of business objectives.
Maintain a working knowledge of current industry legislative and compliance issues, including but not limited to ACA, AHCA, COBRA, HIPAA, ERISA, FMLA, etc.
Requirements
Minimum of 3 years in the insurance industry required.
Employee benefits experience preferred.
Strong time management skills, analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks, and superior organizational skills.
Ability to work in a team environment with a client services focus, while working in a fast paced and deadline driven work environment.
Must be able to travel based on client and business needs.
Life & health and property & casualty insurance licenses required.
Benefits

Nextep is committed to the success, development, and long-term engagement of our employees. In addition to our unique corporate culture, we offer an attractive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401(k), HSA, tuition reimbursement and much more. You can learn more about Nextep at GlassDoor.

If you would like to be a part of our growing team, please apply today! Nextep is an equal opportunity employer.

Why Beztak

Beztak Properties, a national Real Estate Development and Property Management company wants you to join our family of talented individuals who work together to provide an excellent living experience for our residents. Our portfolio includes over 35,000 apartments across the nation including multi-family and senior living, as well as over 2,000,000 SF of retail and office space.

We are seeking to hire bright, dynamic individuals who have a passion for service and commitment to excellence. Our culture is one that is built upon the three Es: Excellent, Ethical and Effective. We strongly believe in promotion from within. As a team member, you will have the opportunity to experience limitless career growth potential and advancement. While certain positions require past work experience in a specific role, you dont have to have any experience in property management to join the Beztak team, we will teach you everything you need to know about what we do!

We also offer a generous, competitive compensation and benefits package. Check us out at www.beztak.com to learn more about who we are.

The Opportunity

We are looking to hire a Digital Marketing Director to join our Marketing Team lead by our VP of Marketing. This position is responsible for creating high quality, brand breakthrough digital experiences that blend content with commerce. The right person will have excellent writing and editing skills, to develop quality messages that interpret the Beztak vision and brand. The Director must be a hands-on individual who will be responsible for working directly with the operations team as well as outside marketing consultants, web designers, internal and external associates, and clients. The right person will have an expertise of knowledge with design and digital advertising. Your experience executing projects from conception to production is critical. Projects will include web copy and design, marketing campaigns, portfolio transitions, digital analytics and reporting, and SEO strategy.

Key Functions
Oversee a myriad of projects adhering to the brand, timelines, and budgets
Manage and execute implementation of SEO/SEM strategy keeping pace with industry trends
Provide analysis and recommendations in coordination with elements and structure of websites and web pages
Direct creative development of marketing content online and in print
Aiding in the overall creation of property websites and all marketing materials with outside design companies
Copywriting for brochures, and websites
Support sales and lead generation efforts
Aid in third party property portfolio transition tasks
Building brand awareness and positioning
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Bachelors degree in marketing, advertising or related area required
A minimum of 5 years digital analytics, website design, and copywriting expertise
Excellent writing and communication skills
A minimum of 7 years of experience in marketing, advertising, or branding
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels such as Search, Display, and Retargeting
Experience with GoDaddy and domain management
Equal comfort and expertise with both the creative aspect (campaign creation) and the analytical aspect (metric analysis) of marketing.
Proficient in Adobes Creative Cloud, primarily Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign a plus
Experience in branding, creative layout and/or graphic design, a plus
Ability to multi-task and juggle numerous projects and clients at once

WebStrategies, voted one of the Best Places to Work in VA and one of the Fastest Growing Companies in RVA in 2018, is adding to its talented team of digital marketers, and we want you to be a part of it.

About the Job


We're looking for a passionate digital marketer who loves working in the online space. You’ll join one of the top digital agencies in Virginia where you can expand your skill set, learn from those with years of experience, and develop best in class skills in the fastest growing area of marketing.

What you'll do
Become an expert at today's most effective search and advertising strategies
Execute SEO, PPC, and conversion rate optimization (CRO) campaigns for our clients
Work directly with WebStrategies Account Managers
Collaborate with the WebStrategies team to solve digital marketing challenges for our clients
Learn and grow. We'll determine a development plan specifically for you and your skill set.
Who You Are
Someone who wants to grow their craft as a digital practitioner
Someone who is fascinated with how Google and Facebook work, and want to leverage that knowledge to help clients get more business.
Results oriented: you can separate the tactics from the big picture.
Detail oriented: you can follow and execute detailed, proven processes
Someone located in central VA. If you do not live locally and don't plan to relocate, please do not apply.
What We Offer
A digital-obsessed culture. We flat-out love working in the digital space, so be ready to get your geek on.
A culture focused on individual development. Your continued growth and development is one of our core values.
A place to make an impact. A company of our size gives you the opportunity to make an immediate and direct impact on team members and our clients.
Flexible work from home policy. Our office is in Midlothian, but we allow employees to choose between working in the office or at home (most employees split their time between the two).
Qualifications
1-3 years experience in search marketing, display advertising or content marketing
Experience with web design, usability or conversion optimization a huge plus
Creative, forward-thinking self-starter with an attention to detail and drive to produce consistent and quality work
Superior written and verbal communications skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Highly organized with excellent time management skills
How to stand out

If you submit your application and don't include examples or acknowledge a lack of them, we'll just assume you didn't read this far into the job description. Don't have anything to share? We'd still like to hear from you.

Compensation


We are proud to offer a very competitive compensation and benefits package, which we'll share with you during the interview process.

A little more about us...


We were voted one of the Top Places to Work in Virginia and one of the Fastest Growing Companies in Richmond in 2018. And while those are nice, we believe our best days are still ahead of us, and we want you to be a part of that journey. We will invest in you, challenge you, and develop you.

Elysium Health’s mission is to solve the biggest challenges in health with science, to help people live healthier for longer. Elysium works directly with top scientists, clinicians and health professionals around the world to translate advances in science and technology into innovative health products that work. Our product development pipeline begins with research and development, continues with preclinical studies, and culminates with human clinical trials to demonstrate the safety and efficacy of products. Throughout this process, Elysium’s focus is to develop compounds found in nature that allow people to support their health proactively.

Elysium is guided by a Scientific Advisory Board, which includes multiple winners of the Nobel Prize, as well as researchers and doctors who are experts in chemistry, physiology, neuroscience, complex chemical systems, biochemistry, and many other fields of study.

Basis, Elysium Health’s first product, is a proprietary formulation of two ingredients designed to support long-term health at the cellular level. Basis is clinically proven to increase NAD+ levels, which decline with age. NAD+ is required for energy creation, regulating circadian rhythms, maintaining healthy DNA, and hundreds of other biological functions.

Marketing Associate

Who we are

At Marketsmith, Inc., outcomes are everything. For our clients, ourselves and the community around us. So much so, in fact, that we refer to ourselves as The Outcomes Agency. We are a woman-owned, data driven omnichannel marketing agency that delivers real business impact for direct-to-consumer and challenger brands in any category through the applied use of technology. Our mission is to make challenger brands champions. It’s not just about data science, however, or the application of analytics. Our focus on outcomes means we begin by thoroughly understanding our client’s business and a willingness to commit shared accountability for success.

We are a diverse company focused on giving back and encouraging our employees to do great work so they can do good things. Our unique culture puts our employees first – from new graduates to seasoned professionals and offers tremendous opportunities for learning and advancement as well as competitive salaries. We operate under the vision of a highly-respected CEO and leadership team who inspire team work, innovation and the ability to make a difference. Our employees enjoy all the benefits of working for a Manhattan agency without the commute.

Who we need

The MSI Marketing Associate is a fully participating team member, responsible for providing impeccable support on a day-to-day basis to the Account team. The Marketing Associate fosters strong client relationships while collaborating with the team to deliver great work of the highest quality This requires someone who is a highly organized self-starter.

Responsibilities
Support the Client Performance team by providing prompt, thorough response to all client requests
Coordinate with the client and account teams daily to monitor account status, job development, on-going budget reports, and track status of all assigned account work in status reports
Monitor accounts to alert Account Directors of issues early on and ensure the sharing of relevant information
Work with Account Directors to formulate POVs on business and brand issues and opportunities
Establish trust and respect with the client to maintain and grow existing relationships
Coordinate client meetings as needed
Learn and put into practice all client service processes including: Creative, Production, Media, Accounting, and Analytics
Work closely with internal/external media and creative teams to ensure deliverables are on schedule and within budget. This may include developing media and creative briefs
Work with Accounting Department to ensure timely and accurate billing of all client projects including; responsible for opening and closing all job numbers, tracking budgets, reconciliation of all projects, and client invoicing, attendance at weekly and monthly financial meetings, etc.
Communicate with Production/Traffic on project timelines, job numbers, estimates, setting up meetings, issuing instructions and trafficking deliverables/materials
Work closely with account team, talent, and business management to understand, anticipate, and manage budgetary issues
Administrative Ssupport as needed (covering reception desk)
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications and Education Requirements

·Bachelor’s degree and one year of experience in an agency or related environment.

·An action-oriented entrepreneurial spirit and a laser focus on the outcome, not just on the process

·A “your problem is my problem” attitude and an eagerness to explore all available resources to think differently about problems and solutions

·A thirst for knowledge to dig deep into the business to understand where the pain points are and the ability to link our work directly back to the business as much as possible

·A resilient positive demeanor to foster a highly collaborative environment

·Confidence to present your own and other’s work persuasively, whether written or verbal

·Financial savvy – the willingness and capability to work with numbers

·Curiosity to learn further about the advertising business and account management from emerging media and technology, trade publications, industry blogs and industry collateral

What we offer

With free drinks and healthy snacks, a game room where you can blow off some steam, a walking club, free gym membership, and weight loss programs; paid time off, work from home time and Summer Fridays; a robust benefits package including health, dental, accident, life, and critical care insurance, health and dependent flexible spending accounts; a 401K; guest speakers, access to classes to earn certifications and master technology and marketing tools, an easy commute from NJ, NYC metro, or NE PA, and opportunities to volunteer for causes to help families and animals in need, Marketsmith could be your new professional home.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. To level the field, we’ll ask you to take a personality assessment test and agree to a background check.
