Job Summary:

The Technical Label Application Specialist provides expertise and guidance, specific to quality and customer satisfaction, to all of Inland’s internal and external customers. As a company technical expert, this position will be responsible for overseeing new product qualifications, new equipment startups, quality reviews, and training at the customer sites via in person or through the use of technology. While partnering with Sales, Marketing, Engineering, Quality, Supply Chain and Operations, the Technical Label Application Specialist will assist customers in resolving packaging and label quality related issues and improving production and efficiency problems that exist. This position is responsible for providing customers with excellent technical customer service while ensuring complete satisfaction. While interacting both internally and externally, this position must ensure that Inland’s principles are maintained, and product integrity is preserved.

Essential Duties& Responsibilities:

To perform this job successfully, and individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.This list of essential functions is not exhaustive and may be supplemented as necessary.
Collaborates with external customers, suppliers and Inland’s internal departments on quality related projects and serves as a technical resource to formulate problem resolutions.
Functions as Inland’s label application technical expert and listens closely to the needs of internal and external customers to resolve quality and/or label performance related issues.
Investigates customer complaints while collaborating with members of internal departments to troubleshoot and develop new product and process designs.
Documents and communicates customer feedback to Operations, Engineering, QA, Marketing, and Sales in an effort to continuously improve internal processes and products that will enhance our Customer’s experiences.
Assists in achieving quality assurance operational objectives by contributing information and analysis to strategic plans and reviews; implements production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; identifies and resolves problems; completes audits; determines system improvements; and implements change.
Supports new products and new customers through the qualification processes while ensuring products meet and/or exceed customer expectations.
Maintains and improves product quality by completing product, process, company, system and compliance, audits.
Prepares quality documentation, including detailed reports after customer visits, by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends including failed processes, stability studies, recalls and corrective actions.
Documents technical and customer information to facilitate and maintain effective business relationships.
Continuously works to build skill sets to become and maintain a solution expert in the label and packaging industry.
Gathers market intelligence and documents collected information in provided tools and/or databases to assist in company growth. Identifies potential product/service sales opportunities at customer sites and provides information to the internal teams.
Works closely with internal and external customers on functional and design aspects to achieve optimal performance on both machinery and containers.
Working with Quality and Operational Leadership, to help design and communicate training and development opportunities for quality assurance and operation’s personnel.
Core Competencies:
Building Partnerships
Developing and leveraging relationships within and across work groups, as well as outside the organization, to achieve results
Earning Trust
Gaining others’ confidence by acting with integrity and following through on commitments while disclosing own positions; treating others and their ideas with respect and supporting them in the face of challenges.
Driving for Results (Self)
Setting high goals for personal accomplishment that align with organizational projects and expected outcomes; tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals while deriving satisfaction for that achievement and continuous improvement.
Essential skills and experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Manufacturing, Chemical, or Materials) and/or STEM-related field
3 years’ experience in label application or related packaging application field and/or a combination of work experience and education
Bi-lingual in Spanish and English
Strong understanding of mechanical, pneumatic, and controls systems on a wide variety of label application equipment
General understanding of materials, application, and troubleshooting techniques utilized for shrink, pressure sensitive, IML and glue-applied labels
Availability and willingness to travel up to 50% of work schedule, including travel to multiple locations within a select region of the US and Canada
Strong continuous improvement and problem-solving skills
Understanding of analytical testing methodology
Ability to analyze a variety of data and develop conclusions/action plans
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Strong proficiency working with Microsoft Office tools as well as project management tools (ex. Gantt timelines)
Attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to maintain confidentiality
Nonessential skills and experience:
Advanced degree in a STEM-related field of study
Six Sigma Green Belt Certification, Kaizen (Lean Manufacturing)
PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification
Knowledge of the food packaging industry
Work Environment:

Operates in a demanding, fast-paced, people-oriented manufacturing environment with frequent changes and interruptions, and multiple project assignments. Works with a variety of people including vendors, customers, employees, managers and executives.

Required Work Schedule:
Serving as the Technical Label Application Specialist, your weekly work schedule may depend on your travel arrangements and customer schedules. Must have the availability and willingness to travel up to 50% of work week and flexible to accommodate customer visit requests. This position requires travel to multiple locations within the US and Canada.
Typically works standard business hours, Monday through Friday. On some occasions, may be required to travel on a weekend to be at a customer location on a Monday morning or late on a Friday evening.
Physical Requirements:
Generally sedentary
20/40 corrected vision
No unusual physical requirements are necessary

Gusto is looking for a contract Communications Specialist to help craft and implement communications activities that support our overall strategic priorities and drive awareness of our business, brand and culture with journalists, thought leaders, influencers, customers, and our employees.

You're a savvy communicator, strong collaborator, and possess excellent organizational skills and the ability to juggle many projects at once. You will work closely with and support our Communications team, maintaining and implementing communications strategies across various channels. You enjoy writing and editing, are able to function well in a fast-paced environment and work well with cross-functional partners. You share our passion to raise awareness for the importance of small business in America and empowering entrepreneurs.

Here's What You'll Do Day-to-day
Manage and optimize workflows around media coverage; analyzing coverage and reporting for internal teams
Assist in the development of messaging, content, and programs that frame and amplify our business, brand, and culture
Collaborate with cross-functional teams on blog posts, media pitches, and launch materials

Generate and edit media lists, influencer databases, award submissions, press releases, fact sheets, backgrounders, biographies, tour reports, briefing books, speaking opportunity abstracts, pitches, Q&As, media scans and analysis, metric reporting, industry and competitive news monitoring,

Bachelor's degree in Communications, Writing, Journalism or related field
1+ years experience working at a PR agency or in marketing communications
Strong organizational, project management, and analytical skills
Exceptional listening, problem-solving, and verbal and written communications skills
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and adapting quickly

Forward combines world-class doctors with the most advanced medical technology to deliver preventive healthcare to its members. Founded in 2016 by former executives from Google and Uber, our goal is to deliver higher quality, lower cost health care to everyone.

You can read our story here and some recent press from USA Today, Forbes and TechCrunch. Our investors include Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital as well as angel investors Eric Schmidt, Marc Benioff, Neil Blumenthal, Ashton Kutcher, among others.

Many industries have successfully cut out the middleman by selling directly to consumers. However, no one has ever accomplished this in healthcare—arguably the most important and personal industry to consumers—until now. We know that at the heart of our success is our team. Become a part of the growth team that is focused on bringing better health, happiness and peace of mind to consumers everywhere.
YOU WILL:
Own the strategy and execution of some of our key customer-facing channels including email and SMS, with a focus on driving user acquisition, activation, and engagement.
Own and maintain organization and management/connection systems of customer databasesPlan and manage the execution of campaigns targeting both leads and customers.
Collaborate closely with the brand marketing team to develop rich content that resonates with customers at each stage of their lifecycle
Partner with Growth engineering to identify and implement technology to amplify the impact of our marketing channels.
Track, analyze, and interpret key performance metrics to maximize response, scale and efficiency.
Learn what it takes to build a world-changing startup, both by osmosis and through constant interaction with the Growth team.
YOU ARE:
Customer-Obsessed. You are deeply empathetic, constantly putting yourself in the shoes of our potential members.
Creative. You’re curious. You’re always learning. You don’t need to be asked to think outside of the box.
Hyper-Organized. Quite simply, you get things done. You achieve results on time and on deadline while communicating progress along the way.
Entrepreneurial. You’re a self-starter who loves to own things end-to-end. You don’t ask for permission; you’re too busy making things happen. Solutions-Oriented. You dive into the details to uncover the optimal solution.
Collaborative. You bring great ideas to the table and seek out how to include others to make your ideas even better. People value your opinions and love that you respect theirs. Impactful. You’re deeply mission-driven. You think there’s more to life than software that enables puppy ears to be superimposed in photos (we concede those are cute).
YOUR EXPERIENCE:
3-5 years experience in growth marketing, engagement marketing, CLC management, email marketing, CRM, or customer acquisition.
Experience in development and execution of customer relationship management campaigns
In-depth understanding of customer acquisition, including channels and trends
Understanding of customer lifecycle development and proper messaging surfaces
Experience with marketing automation + email/CRM tools a strong plus (ie. Marketo)
Experience working with and negotiating with vendors/salespeople
Background with copywriting, design and/or front end coding (HTML, etc) a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical skills
Startup experience a plus

We are an insurtech company where smart people can see the impact of their work as we tackle meaningful problems together. We think it’s fun to disrupt an industry that has been slow to change. But we aren’t shaking things up for the sake of change, we’re here to solve big problems using technology and an innovative approach to improve how small business owners access insurance. Like our small business clients, we are a diverse team of builders, dreamers, and entrepreneurs, so at the heart of every decision we make is the idea that if it doesn’t serve our clients, it doesn’t serve us. We hire passionate people who like to work hard, yet we also know that life exists outside the office. Small businesses are the backbone of the economy; talented team members are the backbone of Pie. We are pie-oneering a whole new approach to insurance.

How You’ll Do It

You will work directly with the Senior Marketing Manager to expand our partner marketing channel. You will implement our strategy, positioning, and tactics to reach this critical audience of insurance wholesalers, retail agents, and payroll companies. In this highly cross-functional role, you’ll collaborate within marketing and across Pie, particularly with our business development team, and use multiple marketing channels to help achieve our dual goals of acquiring new partners and growing existing partner relationships.

The Day-to-Day
Help tell the Pie story effectively to the distribution partner audience through a wide variety of marketing channels, including paid and earned opportunities.
Serve as a partner marketing expert, collaborating with members of our marketing, business development, underwriting, product, and customer care teams on highly cross-functional projects.
Own the day-to-day execution for a range of partner marketing channels, including creative, budget, targeting, testing, and reporting.
Support the business development team’s efforts to acquire new partners and grow partner agent volume through both proactive campaigns and responsive projects (i.e., you’ll drive some efforts and also respond to some incoming requests).
Stay up-to-date on emerging marketing channels and innovate ambitiously on existing approaches rather than simply imitating competitors’ tactics.
Exercise outstanding judgment in your strategic, tactical, and creative recommendations and decisions about campaigns and activities.
Analyze and optimize partner marketing performance on an ongoing basis.
The Right Stuff
3-5 years of experience successfully implementing marketing tactics, preferably in partner marketing but will consider equivalent experience.
Expertise in three or more marketing channels: email, branding, product marketing, content, events, video, partner marketing, B2B (e.g., demand generation, lead nurture, sales/business development collateral, trade shows), direct mail, referral, or social media.
Strong perspective on the partner marketing channel balanced with a desire to collaborate effectively with stakeholders with differing viewpoints.
Experience with Marketo or other marketing automation platform preferred.
Outstanding speaking and presenting abilities.
Exceptional writing, spelling, grammar, and proofreading skills.
Experience measuring results and optimizing efforts quickly.
Ownership mindset with a willingness to roll up your sleeves and a strong belief that the buck stops with you.
Demonstrated ability to get up to speed fast, manage projects, influence decision makers, and ruthlessly prioritize high impact activities.
Bachelor’s degree.
Pie Perks

• Competitive salary
• A piece of the Pie (in the form of stock grants)
• Comprehensive health plans
• Generous vacation
• Paid sick leave
• Commuting Allowance
• Future focused 401k match
• Modern office space with onsite gym
• Our core values are more than just a poster on the wall; they’re tangibly reflected in our work and
recognized with our monthly culture award.
• Generous parental leave

Our Achievements
Pie Insurance Named a Top Colorado Company 2020
Pie is rated Excellent by our customers on Trustpilot
Checkout our employee reviews on Glassdoor
Pie raises an additional $127M in funding

Are you looking for a challenging role as an Account Manager Commercial (Technology Sales)? InterVision Systems is a strategic service provider committed to unlocking value by delivering innovative technology through a consultative approach. We believe we will transform businesses through the evolutionary power of technology. Our people are the best in their field!

So, if you are looking for a career changing opportunity, we want to meet you!

InterVision Sales Professionals are responsible for selling technical solutions cloud/hosted, on premise, managed services and professional service engagements. Additionally, an understanding of IP voice-video-collaboration, storage and virtualization add to the desired skills and experience sought for this position. Using your consultative selling experience, you will sell InterVision technology solutions to mid-to-large size business enterprises. Accountable for meeting and exceeding sales goals. InterVision offers a competitive compensation plan including base salary, commissions, an expense allowance, and great benefits. InterVision supports your success as an account manager by providing sales training and an excellent support structure to ensure your success.

This position reports to the AVP, Sales - Central.

Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience.
At least three (3) to five (5) years of sales experience, preferably within a high technology environment

Exceptional customer facing/listening skills.
Strong personal sales ability including exceptional closing skills

Customer-focused with a strong sense of urgency and the ability to multi-task, problem-solve and manage client relationships in a fast-paced environment
Excellent interpersonal skills including strong motivation, focus and passion for selling services of value
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as strong presentation skills
Experience preparing and presenting winning proposals
Computer literate with a high level of proficiency in all Microsoft applications
Experience with managing longer sales cycles and balancing and driving multiple simultaneous opportunities to closure
A demonstrated ability to become a trusted advisor to customers
What GREAT things will you be doing?
Consistently meet or exceed sales invoicing quotas (Margin and MRR) by identifying, developing and closing new sales opportunities
Consistently complete agreed upon sales activities (calls, contacts, registrations, activities, quotes, statement of discovery, needs analysis, etc.)
Effectively utilize company tools and methodologies to manage accounts
Maintain expertise on InterVisions products, services and solutions to effectively position technology options and close profitable sales to Commercial Business customers.
Apply consultative sales approach to grow the customer base and drive higher revenues, customer growth and customer retention
Coordinate efforts with other internal teams and groups to ensure effectiveness and efficiency
Stay current on competitive information and offerings.
Proactively assess, clarify and validate customer needs; compare and contrast existing infrastructure to InterVision solutions including invisible, transparent and visible solutions.
Ability to effectively profile target accounts
Utilize professional networking to build relationships with executive and decision making managers at targeted clients.
Work collaboratively with inside sales and marketing to coordinate various sales activities (targeted mailings, telemarketing, order processing, marketing events, etc).
Proven track record of hunting, developing new opportunities and establishing new customer relationships
Ability to understand client business issues and needs and formulate recommended solutions that drive value for the customer and InterVision.
Performs other duties as assigned and required. Duties and responsibilities may change from time to time without notice and include but are not limited to the duties described above.
Performs effective account planning with an extended team, calling at all levels with customers organization, and managing partner relationships
Ability to understand client business issues and needs and formulate recommended solutions that drive value for the customer and InterVision.
Performs other duties as assigned and required. Duties and responsibilities may change from time to time without notice and include but are not limited to the duties described above.
Performs effective account planning with an extended team, calling at all levels with customers organization, and managing partner relationships
How Do We Back Our Strong Reputation?

GREAT PLACE TO WORK: If you thrive in an environment of growth and individual impact, InterVision is the place for you!

CUSTOMER SUCCESS: InterVision has worked with more than 5,000 clients across industry sectors to solve their biggest business challenges. We take a neutral approach to determine which IT consumption model best fits each client organization. Recommendations are custom designed around specific client requirements, integrating best-in-class solutions from our vendor partners. SBM Magazine recognized our unparalleled approach to customer service by awarding InterVision with their Best Customer Service Award.

BROAD CAPABILITIES: InterVision offers a wide range of services and solutions that organizations need to thrive in todays dynamic IT market, including on-premises solutions, managed services, cloud services, hosting/colocation services, automation, and professional services. This broad Hybrid IT portfolio uniquely and competitively positions InterVision in an industry largely made up of small, specialized consultancies or very large commodity resellers.

WORLD-CLASS FACILITIES: InterVision has headquarters in Santa Clara, Calif. and St. Louis, Mo., and offices and data centers in Missouri, Colorado, California and Washington. We operate multiple Tier 3 and Tier 4 level data centers, which are SOC II Type 2 compliant specific and certified in Confidentiality and Security. Our Integration Center is a restricted-access facility with power, cooling, and space to handle a high volume of IT equipment.

INDUSTRY ACCOLADES: InterVision has received some of the technology industrys most prestigious awards. This includes multiple wins for CRN Technology Elite 250, CRNs Solution Provider 500; CRN MSP 500, and Inc. Magazines 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies. InterVision President and CEO Aaron Stone received accolades as one of the Top 100 St. Louisans to Know How to Succeed in Business. InterVisions Disaster Recovery-as-a-Service has been positioned in Gartner and Forrester analyst reports multiple years in a row.

TOP VENDOR CERTIFICATIONS: InterVision holds the highest certifications and partner levels with leading technology vendors, and we have teams of trained engineers supporting their solutions. Here are just a few of the certifications from our list of 80+ vendors: Cisco Gold Certification, Cisco Cloud and Managed Services Master, Juniper Elite Partner, Microsoft Gold Partner, NetApp Star Partner, Palo Alto Networks Diamond Partner, and VMware Premier Partner.

About us:

We want to help small business win. That’s why we’re here.

We connect small business owners to investors – to create jobs, help families and power economies – because we believe that people are made for more. And we want to help them.

So, we created the leading online marketplace for small business loans. We’ve helped small businesses get $11.7 billion in 116,000 loans to 81,000 small business owners. In a single year, we unlocked 115,000 jobs and contributed $8 billion to the global economy. There’s never been a better time to join!

Be part of the team that changes everything. Let’s build the place where small businesses can get the funding they need to win and leave a legacy behind, forever.

This role sits within “Business Services”. The engine of Funding Circle - we keep FC running. Whatever the subject area, we turn dreams into reality and help small business win. Funding Circle Marketing drives growth, but not just Funding Circle’s. We connect small businesses with the funds they need to grow to help small businesses continue to play a vital role in the U.S. economy. We are ambitious and passionate about helping more small businesses.

About the role:

Marketing Operations is the backbone of any successful marketing team and Marketing Analytics is the source of tangible value. We are seeking an analyst to assist with both, with the overarching goal of enabling Marketing team members to drive value. You have the ability to improve not only the pipes behind the scenes but determine how the team tests into new initiatives and surface insights to drive better outcomes. As such, you will focus on keeping the lights on today, improving processes for tomorrow, and supporting innovative acquisition efforts to drive growth well into the future.

Digital Marketing: you will be responsible for the pipelines between marketing platforms (such as Facebook, Google Ads), our website, and management/measurement/visualization platforms such as Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics and Tableau.

Offline Marketing: you will be responsible for the process to get campaigns out the door and create measurement frameworks to monitor success and weave together a comprehensive (offline and online) view of success.

This role requires someone who's analytical, detail oriented and has baseline knowledge of the digital marketing landscape and marketing attribution. You enjoy diving into data to analyze performance just as much as you enjoy designing a framework to enable that analysis. You believe done is better than perfect but recognize you can’t scale on a flimsy foundation. You thrive in a fast-paced environment but can stay engaged with routine tasks.

As the Marketing Operations Analyst you will be responsible for…

Marketing Infrastructure:

Tactical:
You will own Google Tag Manager and the process by which our website communicates with external management/measurement tools and platforms
You will own existing and develop new ETL processes to ensure internal access to marketing platform data and accurate data sources for internal reporting. This includes liaising with the Data Team to identify, fix, and improve our data pipelines.
You will oversee day-to-day data execution and define and document business practices
Strategic:
Work with manager and campaign managers to determine pixel set-up that reflects platform limitations and measurement framework.
Marketing Reporting:

Tactical:
You will own Tableau based reports to ensure key stakeholders have access to accurate and timely information at varying levels of granularity
You will oversee reporting tools to ensure items are entered correctly by team members and reflected correctly in end-user reports
You will provide overviews of Marketing’s performance to key stakeholders and, with the help of your manager, craft the narrative.
Strategic:
You will continuously question processes and refine, rebuild, and create reports to serve existing and future needs with a focus on surfacing insights.
Marketing Analytics
Tactical:
Thrive in a data-driven, test-and-learn culture with your passion for telling stories with data - not only surfacing marketing (online and offline) and social media insights, but also presenting these insights and recommendations to the wider organization, including executives, to influence change.
Apply sophisticated computational, statistical, and modeling techniques in support of campaign optimization; techniques include A/B and multivariate testing, predictive analysis, data mining, marketing mix modeling, attribution modeling
You will assist channel managers in tying platform’s source of truth to internal metrics with a goal of improving efficiency and conversion through underwritten funnel.
You will conduct ad-hoc analysis to dig into performance and answer marketing related questions for key stakeholders including Risk
Strategic:
You will constantly innovate on measurement framework to assist with spend allocation decisions, campaign execution, and internal storytelling
About you:
3+ years in Marketing data analytics. An understanding of the digital and offline marketing landscape and management/measurement tools. Advanced proficiency with Excel and data evaluation skills.
Hands-on experience applying statistical approaches/concepts, including A/B tests, credibility, statistical significance, and multivariate testing
Experience running existing and writing new SQL based queries
Attention to detail and the ability to understand the nuances of marketing programs and digital tracking
Bias towards action. Some questions just need answers while others should fuel further investigation. Proactively probing data, asking questions, and seeking clarity.
Demonstrated willingness to learn and a curious nature. We have a great team but sometimes you will become the SME on a tool you have never used before. Be open, flexible, and eager to expand your skill set.
Extremely detail and process-oriented with a drive to improve whatever you touch. A view that the current way does not mean it is right, based on a philosophy that done is better than perfect but scale isn’t possible on a flimsy foundation.
Bonus:
Familiarity with business intelligence tools (Tableau, etc)
Experience with tag management tools (Google Tag Manager, etc) and exposure to engineering component
It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.

At Funding Circle, we celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe that diversity makes us better.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Want to Build the Incredible? We’d love to hear from you.

You will focus on creating, implementing, tracking and optimizing our digital and traditional marketing campaigns across various marketing channels. To be successful as a Digital Marketing Specialist, you must be highly self-motivated, proactive, and have a working knowledge of current marketing tools and strategies in order to execute successful marketing campaigns.
You will develop and manage the online presence of the Credit Union through social media, online advertising, web content, search engine marketing, and other channels as appropriate. Drive business to FPCU through online channels; measure results and refine initiatives. Positively represent FPCU’s brand in the online space.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Create, manage, and report on online advertising campaigns. Develop search engine marketing campaigns. Select and test keywords and perform A/B testing. Continually evaluate and refine online advertising efforts.
Act as the primary contributor to the Credit Union’s social media channels. Produce and execute a content calendar. About Us:

NYSTEC is a non-profit technology consulting company, advising agencies, organizations, institutions, and businesses since 1996. Were independent and vendor-neutral so we have our clients best interests at heart. At NYSTEC, we know that we succeed when individuals and teams flourish personally and professionally, so our benefits and perks support this mindset. Are you ready to contribute to our engaged workforce and deliver the NYSTEC Experience?

About the Role:

As a Marketing Communications Specialist at NYSTEC, you will collaborate with team members to conceptualize, deliver, and support the company, our clients, and our teams. At NYSTEC, we understand that its imperative for consulting companies to have an internal team who can provide the foundational support our consultants need, allowing them to fully support our clients.

The Marketing Communications Specialist is primarily responsible for facilitating, editing, and formatting new business proposals; generating a variety of content formats; providing strong editorial and communication support; and offering a wide array of marketing and communication services for the company. This position serves NYSTECs Business Development, Service Delivery, and Internal Services by providing outstanding service to both internal and external stakeholders. Under general supervision, this position is responsible for a defined set of assignments, including but not limited to technical and creative writing, proposal management and development, ad-hoc event promotion and support, ad-hoc research, presentation development and support, and client deliverable reviews.

Location: Candidates will have the option to be based out of our Albany, NYC, or Rome office.

Key Responsibilities:
Facilitate the proposal development process, working closely with the proposal team to drive the development of new business and competitive proposals.
Provide quality assurance editorial support for proposals, reports, presentations, deliverables, and other content.
Help maintain the companys website and intranet by driving the companys content and social media strategy to execution.
Develop brochures, flyers, e-newsletter content, social media content, presentations, graphics, website content, and other marketing and communication materials, either ad-hoc or as part of an integrated marketing campaign.
Perform graphic artist duties as needed, including development of presentations, marketing slip sheets, ads, and other materials.
Serve occasionally with Service Delivery on client-facing teams for various projects and events.
Collaborate with Service Delivery to generate white papers and other client-facing content as needed.
Gather, analyze, and summarize information about markets, products, vendors, technology trends, and other factors that lead to business opportunities for NYSTEC and technology improvements for clients. Generate market reports as needed.
Provide marketing communication support for NYSTEC- and IgniteU-hosted events as needed.
Provide public relations support as needed, including media announcements/press releases, fielding media inquiries, and developing a media network.
About You:

Required Qualifications:
Excellent business, technical, and creative writing skills.
Strong editorial and verbal communication skills.
Ability to facilitate and manage projects, both independently and as part of a team.
Ability to write for different audiences (internal and external) in various styles and formats, including traditional reports, visually driven content, business letters, and digital content.
Strong organizational skills.
Ability to plan and execute deliverables while thriving in a rapidly changing environment under tight deadlines.
Ability to perform research, analyze and interpret market information and data, and provide clear, concise summaries and presentations (both written and verbal).
Ability to foster strong client relationships and be highly responsive to client needs.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat.
Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite and WordPress.
Familiarity with graphic design, with the ability to create ads, flyers, brochures, and other marketing collateral.
Ability to work collaboratively, internally and externally, and be goal oriented while maintaining a positive attitude and customer focus.
Preferred/Desired Qualifications:
Background in corporate communication.
Knowledge of public-sector (state and local government) environments.
Project management experience.
Education and Experience:
A minimum of a bachelor's degree with at least 5 years of related experience in technical and/or creative content generation is required. An equivalent combination of advanced education, training, and experience will be considered.
If youre an effective communicator who enjoys working in complex and collaborative environments, utilizing your critical thinking and research skills to develop solutions for clients, providing support to customers, and have the required education, experience and skills, we want to hear from you.

Job Description:
ETC Group is a leading international provider of network equipment sourcing and supply chain solutions with Corporate Headquarters in the United States centered in Edison, New Jersey and operations in Dallas, Texas. In addition to US operations, ETC Group, founded in 1993, has global operations in France, Israel, Portugal and the Dominican Republic.
We offer customers logistics management, procurement capabilities, an end-to-end catalog of state-of-the-art tools and test equipment, technical consultation and value-added services including product development for optical networks. The company is dedicated to partnering with long-standing global equipment manufacturers to offer world-class products and expert customer service.
The Carlyle Group has recently invested in the ETC Group with a focus on significant growth through expanding North American and US-based operations and services. Therefore, we are looking to build our US based capabilities to fuel this transformation, leading to exciting career opportunities across the US and Globally.
Together, we believe that new ideas, respectful values and customer focus creates an employee centric work environment we desire and feel necessary to grow our business.


Currently, we're hiring a Sales Account Manager in our Dallas, Texas facility. Read on!
The Sales Account Manager will contribute to ETC Group’s success as a sales expert growing and supporting large, complex, highly visible, key accounts. The Senior Sales Account Manager serves as a link between the strategic and tactical sides of the sales organization. With a strategic focus on developing new business opportunities, the Senior Sales Account Manager will have complete knowledge of all products and services working closely with the marketing, operations, analytics and technical functions to provide Sales Team Leadership that ensures sales contracts deliver product alignment, technical feasibility, revenue, and strategic business benefits. This role supports the lifecycle of critical sales strategic, organizational and operational projects designed to increase sales productivity, sales operational efficiency and sales development.
Responsibilities
Develop and execute strategic sales plans aligned with company goals; drive new business opportunities within existing key accounts and with account partners, deliver sales presentations, negotiate and close large deals of strategic importance.
Build customer relationships at all organizational levels to support, renew and further penetrate existing accounts.
Lead a unified, proactive, value-added account team approach to ensuring appropriate levels of direct customer support, while maximizing account team resources.
Review market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates.
Foster positive working relationships between ETC Group and customer organizations to ensure ongoing customer satisfaction. Participate in the development of strategic customer planning sessions and reviews to ensure organizational alignment with customer needs and desires.
Generate new ideas for service and product opportunities, monitor and evaluate the competitions’ activities and products, anticipate opportunities the competition may exploit and work to close the gap.
Represent ETC Group at industry events to promote products and services, network with relevant stakeholders, and stay current with market trends.
Analyze and control expenses to conform to accounting requirements and budgetary constraints.
Prepare periodic reports of sales volume, potential sales, competitive analysis and areas of proposed client base expansion.
Work with team to analyze competitive activity and develop counter sales strategies
Direct sales forecasting activities and set performance goals accordingly.
Maintain accuracy of online systems designed to report status and progress.
Develop, manage and measure the effectiveness of sales team results.
Key Experiences/Achievements
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent job-related experience
Minimum 12 years’ experience in technology sales with a solution sales approach
Successful track record of consistently maintaining a robust sales pipeline that supports/exceeds revenue forecasts
Track record of developing sales for new products
Must be action- and results-oriented, a team player, and adaptable
Able to think strategically and develop executive-level contacts quickly
Must have business savvy, strong negotiation skills, and ability to close large complex deals
Ability to solve practical problems, involving a wide range of variables, in a creative way
Knowledge of spreadsheet software and sales-related software
A sales leader who motivates by inspiring the organization and connecting business goals to their work
Preferred Qualifications
Executive presence and industry credibility to engage with top executives and large clients in Telecommunications/Cable industry with a keen understanding of Logistics and Supply Chain Consultative selling

Marketing Strategy

Develop, implement and oversee NIB’s marketing and advertising strategy to advance NIB’s mission and business development goals.
Develop and manage all marketing processes, measurement, and information systems, to enable the overall marketing functions – including branding, advertising, product and services marketing and packaging design - - to operate efficiently and effectively
Create and execute integrated marketing and advertising plans reflecting a deep understanding of traditional and digital marketing approaches

Oversee the branding and graphic design elements of a full range of marketing activities (advertising, collateral, packaging and design, publications, etc.) used to deliver brand and corporate messages, promotions, and a wide range of creative content, all working together in an integrated fashion.

Sauk Valley Community College seeks innovative individual for a full-time professional-technical opening as an Universal Design Specialist/Videographer.

For consideration applicants must apply at the following link: https://jobs.svcc.edu/postings/1191
FUNCTION OF THE JOB
The Universal Design Specialist will ensure SVCC’s online courses are accessible to students with disabilities using the generally accepted practices of Universal Design for Learning. The Videographer will be responsible for the Lightboard Studio and One Button Studio including video and file support.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Assist with formatting online resources to meet ADA regulations.
2. Coordinate captioning of video resources as Knowmia Caption Coordinator.
3. Create audio description for the College’s video assets.
4. Coordinate captioning for course videos from 3rd party providers (e.g., You Tube) through available software tools.
5. Structure and format documents to meet Universal Design standards.
6. Assist faculty with formatting pages for accessibility in the Learning Management System including captioning of materials, alternative text, and audio description.
7. Perform accessibility testing and tracking for website and software as directed.
8. Cooperate with Disability Support Services, Instructional Design, and the Accessibility Task Force to create and deploy an accessible training plan.
9. Assist with accessibility training of faculty and staff.
10. Responsible for the Lightboard Studio and One Button Studio including providing routine maintenance and troubleshooting equipment, promoting use of studio assets with faculty and staff, supporting faculty and staff with production and editing of video content, and managing props and supplies used in the video studios.
11. Responsible for video and file support including converting files for faculty, assisting faculty and staff with uploading issues, and facilitating captioning and audio description.
12. Support the SVCC Marketing department by producing and editing accessible video content, create/edit still photos for use in marketing campaigns, and provide alternative text for images.

For consideration applicants must apply at the following link: https://jobs.svcc.edu/postings/1191
REQUIREMENTS
Associate’s degree or equivalent education and experience is required; bachelor’s degree is preferred. Excellent communication skills and service orientation required. Must be proficient in the general accepted practices of Universal Design for Learning.

Diversity/EEOC Statement
SVCC is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer and is interested in receiving applications from individuals who would enhance the diversity of the College. Sauk Valley Community College is an institution of higher education that provides quality learning opportunities to meet the diverse needs of its students and communities.

About Us

At Aaron’s, our people share in our camaraderie and team spirit to win with integrity. What is a Hiring Event?

Our client is hiring a SENIOR REGULATORY AFFAIRS SPECIALIST to work for their growing Manufacturing and Supply business in the Portsmouth, NH area. As a leader in medical technologies and devices, our client is focused on providing a professional working environment that promotes working in a supportive, diverse, and inclusive environment. Solution oriented candidates who enjoy a dynamic and fast paced environment will thrive in this company that requires flexibility, creativity, and initiative.

The *Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist* provides hands-on regulatory affairs support for new product marketing approvals and renewals for existing products, including development of regulatory requirements/strategies and preparation of submissions. This position manages projects and performs regulatory submission/approval activities for specific medical products. The Specialist represents Regulatory with US and international regulators on submission reviews/approvals and ensures compliance with required regulations and established corporate standards.

This position also ensures that product approvals are properly maintained, and product re-registrations are properly managed. The Specialist will exercise creativity/innovation with expectations of independent research and use of accepted regulatory practices in the execution of tasks.
The position will be interfacing with regulatory bodies, third party consultants, marketing, and management, and assist in developing ideas for solutions consistent with our submission roadmap.
Primary Responsibilities: *
Define worldwide regulatory requirements necessary for regulatory approval of assigned products. Advise regulatory submission teams regarding such requirements and help coordinate implementation.
Complete worldwide regulatory assessments and strategies as required to support assigned projects and provide direction to project teams to support strategic new product development and product modifications as required.
Provide direction on application of external standards for assigned projects as required. Execute product submission strategies as directed.
Maintain all regulatory documentation to ensure availability for external audits and preparation of submission packages.
Review technical documentation, i.e. test reports, test protocols, etc., for completeness and compliance to regulatory standards. Review includes using scientific judgement to guide the teams in understanding how to close any gaps that exist.
Rigorous documentation for all phases of regulatory submissions, including priority setting, requirements research, documentation gathering, submission writing, project schedules, approvals, renewals, and change orders.
Lead or participate in projects related to regulatory compliance, such as MDR, Brexit, etc.
Provide guidance and oversight to team members related to regulatory compliance.
Assist customers and distributors with updating and renewing product registrations as required.
Review company marketing literature for compliance to applicable regulations.
Maintain a thorough knowledge of current QSR and ISO requirements as they apply.
Minimum Qualifications: *
BS degree in Science or Engineering.
Minimum of 5-7 years’ experience in Regulatory Affairs.
Minimum of 4 years medical device industry experience.
Working knowledge with quality systems regulations and guidelines.
Through understanding of international submission requirements including how to comply with standards and regulations.
Must have ability to develop clear, concise, and timely oral and written reports, plus communicate tactfully with all levels of personnel.
Working knowledge of medical devices, procedures, and terminology.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office.
Preferred Qualifications: *
8 years or greater of experience in medical device industry.
10 years working in Regulatory Affairs.
FDA, EU, Health Canada, TGA, PMDA, and international market submission experience.
RAC Certification
Demonstrated ability with project management skills in order to plan, conduct, and implement system assessments and robust submissions.
High level of planning and organizational skills.
Other Qualifications: *
Requires intense concentration in order to accurately assess compliance to applicable regulations for medical device manufacturers and comparing them to processes, policies, procedures, and other quality related documentation, which may involve point-by-point comparisons.
The work is detail oriented, often with multiple priorities.
The environment is deadline sensitive. Frequent high-pressure situations.
Travel requirements are minimal. Travel about 1 time per quarter for 3-5 days duration trip.
Comprehensive benefits package is offered including medical, dental, 401k, and a robust PTO plan.*
NO PHONE CALLS OR RECRUITERS PLEASE

Sauk Valley Community College seeks innovative individual for a full-time professional-technical opening as an Universal Design Specialist/Videographer.

For consideration applicants must apply at the following link: https://jobs.svcc.edu/postings/1191
FUNCTION OF THE JOB
The Universal Design Specialist will ensure SVCC’s online courses are accessible to students with disabilities using the generally accepted practices of Universal Design for Learning. The Videographer will be responsible for the Lightboard Studio and One Button Studio including video and file support.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Assist with formatting online resources to meet ADA regulations.
2. Coordinate captioning of video resources as Knowmia Caption Coordinator.
3. Create audio description for the College’s video assets.
4. Coordinate captioning for course videos from 3rd party providers (e.g., You Tube) through available software tools.
5. Structure and format documents to meet Universal Design standards.
6. Assist faculty with formatting pages for accessibility in the Learning Management System including captioning of materials, alternative text, and audio description.
7. Perform accessibility testing and tracking for website and software as directed.
8. Cooperate with Disability Support Services, Instructional Design, and the Accessibility Task Force to create and deploy an accessible training plan.
9. Assist with accessibility training of faculty and staff.
10. Responsible for the Lightboard Studio and One Button Studio including providing routine maintenance and troubleshooting equipment, promoting use of studio assets with faculty and staff, supporting faculty and staff with production and editing of video content, and managing props and supplies used in the video studios.
11. Responsible for video and file support including converting files for faculty, assisting faculty and staff with uploading issues, and facilitating captioning and audio description.
12. Support the SVCC Marketing department by producing and editing accessible video content, create/edit still photos for use in marketing campaigns, and provide alternative text for images.

For consideration applicants must apply at the following link: https://jobs.svcc.edu/postings/1191
REQUIREMENTS
Associate’s degree or equivalent education and experience is required; bachelor’s degree is preferred. Excellent communication skills and service orientation required. Must be proficient in the general accepted practices of Universal Design for Learning.

Diversity/EEOC Statement
SVCC is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer and is interested in receiving applications from individuals who would enhance the diversity of the College. Sauk Valley Community College is an institution of higher education that provides quality learning opportunities to meet the diverse needs of its students and communities.

Digital Marketing Specialist

IT BEGAN WITH A FLIP-FLOP. But not just any flip-flop. A sandal that revolutionized the industry, bringing biomechanical support to a quintessential summer staple. From these humble beginnings in Australia to the bustling San Francisco Bay Area, Vionic has grown from a fledgling business to a global footwear brand. We’re bringing together style and science and reimagining the look of supportive footwear.

Vionic has been named a 2018 Gallup Great Workplace Award Winner, and is the only company recognized in the fashion and retail sector. Vionic is one of just 39 companies globally to receive the prestigious award, which celebrates companies that achieve exceptional performance by creating a culture of high-reaching employee engagement. Gallup has rated Vionic among the top 2% of all companies based on "Employee Engagement” exceeding the national average by 65 percentage points. We are also officially certified and recognized as a Marin/Bay Area/California Green Business.

In a Nutshell

We are looking for Digital Marking Specialist to join our exciting and growing team focused on digital and eCommerce excellence. We are looking for someone who is passionate about all things digital marketing, who stays at the forefront of new technologies and is enthusiastic about delivering results. Reporting to Sr. Digital Marketing Manager, Growth & Acquisition, the Digital Marketing Specialist will work closely to manage and measure Vionicshoes.com full-funnel digital marketing strategy.

What You’ll Do:
Support the management day-to-day digital marketing channels including but not limited to: Paid Search, Paid Social, Display Media, Web Retargeting, and Affiliates.
Keep a tight pulse on paid channel performance through a keen understanding of Google Analytics reporting and Digital Ad Management reporting.
Manage and optimize eCommerce product feed for paid programs such as Google shopping, Facebook DPAs, Pinterest Shopping, and retargeting programs.
Manage Google Tag Manager to gather paid program insights, making recommendations, and ensuring effective ROI measurement.
Identify opportunities for ROAS improvement, program scalability, and testing as necessary.
Maintain the paid media creative calendar ensuring best performing and seasonally relevant creative is available & trafficked on time.
Work closely with the Creative team from brief, establish timelines, and acquire final approval on paid ads ensuring ads meet best practices and are delivered with correct specs.
Collaborate with external partners and agencies on launching new campaigns, creative testing, implementing/QA'ing tagging and tracking, and monitoring performance to continue growth and success of existing and new acquisition programs
Partner with Digital Channel Managers (email, social, brand marketing manager, and e-commerce website) to influence digital strategy and tactics with data-driven analysis.
Analyze digital campaign landing page performance, design testing initiatives to ensure traffic is being driven to the highest performing page on mobile and desktop.
Develop, launch, and scale email lead generation efforts to achieve monthly email subscriber goals and ROI.
What You’ll Bring to the Team:
Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university in a relevant subject (Math, Finance, Economics, Digital/marketing Analytics or related field);
2-3 years of managing and executing of performance marketing channels -previous digital marketing agency experience are highly regarded
Familiar managing self-service platforms like Facebook Ads, Google AdWords, Pinterest, Criteo
Proficiency in Google Analytics, GTM, designing custom reports, consumer funnels is a plus
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills; must be very comfortable with data analysis and enjoy working with data to understand performance, optimize campaigns, drive decisions, and measure results
Excellent time management, organizational skills; must possess a self-starter attitude with an eagerness to learn
Strong written and verbal communication skills; must be able to present ideas in a clear, concise, understandable, and organized manner
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Excellent Excel skills (e.g. you can do pivot tables in your sleep, know vlookups or index match, string parsing, etc) - SQL experience is a plus.
Highly curious, motivated, proactive, and adaptable to a fluid environment
How We Take Care of our People:

We offer a fun and dynamic workplace with a robust benefits package. You will have access to medical, dental, vision, 401K retirement plan with employer match, Long Term Disability, Life, and a generous amount of PTO. Fresh organic fruit and juices, wellness challenges, and celebrations abound, including Australia Day! You receive free shoes each season, and receive a seriously deep discount on our products because you will want more!

About Edelman Financial Engines

Since 1986, Edelman Financial Engines has been committed to always acting in the best interest of our clients. We were founded on the belief that all American investors – not just the wealthy – deserve access to personalized, comprehensive financial planning and investment advice. Today, we are America’s top independent financial planning and investment advisor, recognized by both InvestmentNews1 and Barron’s2 with 168 planner offices across the country and entrusted by more than 1.2 million clients to manage more than $192 billion in assets. Our unique approach to serving clients combines our advanced methodology and proprietary technology with the attention of a dedicated personal financial planner. Every client’s situation and goals are unique, and the powerful fusion of high-tech and high-touch allows Edelman Financial Engines to deliver the personal plan and financial confidence that everyone deserves.

Blucora has a bold aspiration: we are committed to giving all people the tools needed to lead healthy financial lives - tools often reserved for the wealthy.

We began our journey by bringing together two industry-leading firms to form a foundation in tax-smart investing that is unreplaceable in the industry. TaxAct is an innovative tax software company that helps more than 4 million Americans prepare their own taxes each year. HD Vest is the first firm in the world to make it possible for tax professionals to support clients’ wealth management needs (now over $45B for more than 300,000 Americans).

We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. Atypical for the financial services industry, we take a contemporary approach to strategy and product development that is founded in user insights, rapid testing and a singular focus on driving end-user value.

Since charting new territory on a daily basis is part of everyone's job at Blucora, we've attracted team members who thrive on the challenge, encourage each other, and are passionately committed to the goal. If you agree that problem- solving is a team sport, and feel energized by a good debate, deep dive research, or a fun night out with colleagues, we might be the right firm for you!

Position Summary

This position is responsible for writing and otherwise curating business communications, including traditional, digital, and video assets, for a variety of internal and external channels. Communications audiences include Avantax Wealth Management’s community of 4,000 Financial Professionals, their staff, and firms. The Communications Specialist will handle both proactive and reactive communications needs, with an emphasis on supporting the Avantax goal of attracting and retaining Financial Professionals while helping them grow their business, with a heightened focus on Wealth Management growth. The person in this position will support Communications efforts in ways that build trust, engage audiences, provide value to key constituents, and help enhance brand value and reputation.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

The position’s core responsibilities are listed below. To successfully perform the job, the individual must be able to execute each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The successful candidate will be integral to an active cadence of communications to Financial Professionals, including but not limited to managing – from concept to creation – the weekly digital newsletter sent to all Avantax employees and Financial Professionals. This work includes partnering with a variety of departments to identify story topics, schedule weekly news flows, and manage the overall production of the weekly newsletter.

The person in this role will also help identify strategic communications opportunities that align with Avantax Wealth Management business priorities and value propositions while also curating content for a variety of channels including:
Websites and other digital platforms.
Traditional print and digital communications.
Email content.
Weekly newsletters for the Avantax community of 4,000 Financial Professionals.
Managing editorial meetings and calendars for weekly newsletters.
Long-form communications (e.g., success stories, videos) and executive communications.
Support for company-sponsored conferences and industry tradeshows.
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, or related field.
3+ years of experience in public relations, content development, corporate communications/marketing communications (PR/marketing agency experience a plus).
Experience in business writing with the ability to convey complicated information simply and concisely.
Experience in standard communication tools, e.g., email, Microsoft Office, PDFs.
Project management experience – must be comfortable keeping a variety of projects and tasks moving forward simultaneously.
Familiarity with social media platforms.
Financial Services experience, including working with Compliance functions, a plus.
Basic HTML coding, video-editing, and digital marketing skills (e.g., Salesforce, Pardot) a plus.

Description

Do you have what it takes to keep up with one of the fastest-growing companies in America? If you work hard, play hard, and your tail’s always wagging, there may be a place for you at the most innovative name in pet insurance – Petplan!

Our headquarters are buzzing with talented professionals – and their pets! – who are helping Petplan turn the pet insurance industry on its tail. We’re looking for candidates who can balance the wisdom that comes from solid work experience with the passion to push the limits and always take a fresh approach.

We love people who come to work to create, collaborate, and contribute – and have fun doing it! In spite of our explosive growth, we’ve maintained our entrepreneurial spirit, which means we work as a team, celebrate each other’s achievements, and give it all we’ve got, every day.

The Email Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for flawless execution and proactive improvements of Petplan’s email marketing program. Reporting to the Email Marketing Manager, this individual will be responsible for day-to-day email activities, including scheduling, creation, execution, testing, and analysis of email marketing programs. This position will maintain the email marketing calendar and execute against it as scheduled.

Primary Responsibilities
Assist in the creation and execution of email marketing campaigns, including template designs, copywriting & coding as directed, building clear call-to-action, database segmentation, scheduling and reporting
Perform quality assurance tests to ensure emails render/deliver correctly across a wide variety of email clients such as testing browsers and devices for a consistent user experience
Daily monitoring of campaign and delivery performance reporting
Execute conversion rate optimization strategies within emails as well as A/B testing towards improved performance
Proactively propose new A/B tests, analyze results, and identify actionable opportunities and best practices to improve campaign performance
Generate regular and ad hoc reports on email performance summarizing the effectiveness of campaigns with recommendations for improvements
Monitor deliverability by reviewing sender score, domain reputation, open rates by domain, complaints, unsubscribes, bounce rates, blocked emails, inactivity, etc. on a daily basis
Partner with the creative team to drive the email creation for all campaigns by writing creative briefs and providing direction to ensure a high-converting experience
Work closely with performance marketing, business intelligence, and site management teams to support data-driven, lead nurturing email programs with a focus on high-converting users
Prepare Photoshop files, slice and resize images to be included in email communication
Purchase and upload gift card redemption codes

Requirements

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines, handle multiple projects simultaneously and implement last-minute changes as needed
Ability to code an email in HTML based on provided creative
Knowledge of email best practices, from subject line creation to email structure, all designed to drive performance
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) knowledge a plus
Working knowledge of Photoshop a plus
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Strong analytical skills; the ability to work with data efficiently and effectively
High proficiency in advanced Excel skills (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, SUMif statements, etc.)
An inquisitive nature. You should be excited to check the data on all campaigns each day and curious to find out the causes and effects of performance
Ability to learn required business systems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Qualifications
1-2 years of experience in a digital role such as: email management, site management, social, project management, or paid advertising in a direct to consumer brand or agency
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Data Science or other related field
Hands on experience with one or more of the following: Listrak, Salesforce, AWeber, Hubspot, Bronto, Klayvio, Mandrill, Mailchimp, Sendinblue, or Constant Contact
Google Analytics certification a plus
Impeccable attention to detail
Excellent team player; proven ability to succeed as part of a high performance team
A naturally curious, master problem solver, obsessed with ways to “make things better” and a never satisfied lust for learning
The position is full-time and employees receive competitive compensation. Other perks for the Petplan team include health, dental, 401K, paid vacation, pet insurance and lots (and we mean LOTS) of food!

Petplan’s office (or doghouse, if you will) in Newtown Square boasts amazing amenities in the 210-acre Ellis Preserve parkland campus, featuring:
a fitness center with on-site personal training staff
aerobic classes like spinning, step and yoga
a basketball court
weight room
juice bar
massage services
daycare facilities for gym patrons
The campus also has a full-service cafeteria, beautiful walking trails and outdoor seating for both people and pets!

At Petplan, it’s not just about what we get, but what we give; each employee receives one additional day of paid time per calendar year to devote to volunteering for the charity of their choosing. Our “Petplanthropy” program empowers employees to give back to the causes they believe in, as well as work together to support the company’s “pet” projects, like raising funds for MS Service Dogs, organizations like the North Shore Animal League and animal health researchers like the Morris Animal Foundation.

Petplan is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Social Community Specialist serves as the brand’s online ambassador by engaging potential customers and building trusted relationships with existing customers. The position is responsible for managing the online brand voice across all social communities. This role should be digitally savvy with a deep passion for fostering positive relationships with customers across all social media channels.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Respond to comments and customer queries in a timely manner ensuring brand voice and messaging consistency
Proactively participate in industry-related or trending conversations as well as online events to build community and boost brand awareness
Build online relationships with current customers, prospective customers, industry professionals, and journalists
Manage communication process with the customer service social team
Measure and report community engagement results. Provide reports on feedback and sentiment to relevant internal stakeholders
Stay updated on the specifics pertaining to current products, features, offers, partnerships and marketing campaigns
Work with outside departments to provide communication support for all products and partnerships
Assist in the content planning process and implementation of organic social media campaigns
Collaborate with copywriters to write engaging, unique and compelling content for organic social media channels
Collaborate with Brand & Communications Manager to develop the messaging framework to foster positive community engagement and add value to customers’ online experience
Support the development of the company’s influencer program, including researching potential influencer partners, strategizing campaigns, and managing social interactions
Stay abreast of the latest social media industry trends and find new opportunities to engage with customers and improve their experience with TaxAct
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, English, Journalism or related field
Minimum two to three years of experience with a digital consumer brand in a hands-on community engagement role or equivalent. Experience in a regulated industry is a plus
Experience in business and creative writing with the ability to convey complicated information in a simple and concise manner as well as adhere to brand tone of voice
Knowledge of communication tools, e.g. Microsoft Office, Hootsuite, WordPress
COMPETENCIES

KNOWLEDGE
Social Media – Working knowledge of Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube
Social Media and Digital Tools – Knowledge of Hootsuite or similar programs to manage online postings. Proficiency in Google Analytics preferred
English Grammar – Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition and grammar. Proven ability to proofread and copy edit
SKILLS
Writing Skills – Strong ability to communicate concepts, ideas and information in writing to appeal to and motivate others to act
Creating Thinking and Problem Solving – Ability to think creatively and conceptually and solve problems creatively with the inclination to think outside of the box
Reporting and Measurement – Analytical capabilities with the ability to interpret data including website traffic and online customer engagement metrics
ABILITIES/ATTRIBUTES
Customer centric brand steward
Enthusiasm for the category, marketing and digital
High energy with a keen sense of urgency and drive to perform/deliver
Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment resourceful and adaptable
Strong communicator
Excellent organization skills with extreme attention to detail
Capable of proactively managing multiple projects at various stages of completion and quickly shifting priorities as needed
Self-starter, confident and proactive
Able to empathize with consumer yet stay on brand
Strategic thinker and curious
Collaborative and flexible
Open and responsive to feedback

Move forward our content engine by delivering on an editorial calendar and identifying new topics and brand opportunities.

1SEO Digital Agency is looking for an ADVANCED full-time PPC (Pay Per Click) Specialist(s) to join their team due to rapid growth. The PPC Specialist(s) will be responsible for creating, implementing, and testing complex Pay Per Click strategies for clients. This individual will also configure Pay Per Click accounts, profiles, filters, and goals for 1SEO Digital Agency clients.
Responsibilities:
Deliver regular Paid Search Management services for assigned clients
Devise, implement and run innovative campaigns across your client accounts in line with the clients’ goals and objectives
Develop a strong understanding of the products, competition, industry, marketing goals and objectives of each of your clients
Manage budgets in line with strategy and ensure that Monthly Spend is on target
Optimize client accounts for maximum performance using a variety of PPC practices
Use a variety of proprietorial and third-party tools to compile and draw insight from both company-specific, sector-specific and generic industry data, in order to better understand user trends and behavior and add context to the performance of each account
Regularly attend and actively take part in client meetings either via phone or in person
Carry out regular maintenance for a number of assigned ongoing client accounts, ensuring the efficient day-to-day management of these campaigns
Ensure your knowledge of the Digital Marketing industry is kept up to date and relevant by networking / researching / reading blogs and news sources
Produce monthly reports for clients and 1SEO.com Digital Agency summarizing data, recommendations and a clear summary of performance
Setup and manage Google Shopping campaigns
Setup and Manage Google network ads (Display, Search Network, Remarketing, etc.)
Setup and Manage Bing ad campaigns
Setup and Manage YouTube ad campaigns (videos will be provided by client)
Job Requirements / Skills:
MINIMUM of 5 years of experience with Paid Search and Pay Per Click advertising
Experience building and managing ad campaigns for: Google network, Google Shopping, Bing & YouTube
Google AdWords, Google Analytics and Bing Certification is a major plus
Friendly, Personable, Positive, and Creative
Business communication skills, written and verbal
Hard Working, Detail Oriented, with the Ability to Multitask
General Hunger for Learning
Able to Meet Tight Deadlines and Perform Under Pressure
Innovative and creative, with a concise, precise and effective approach to problem solving
What You Can Expect From 1SEO.com Digital Agency:
* Open-floor office environment with NO cubicles whatsoever. Basketball, Foosball, Billiards, ping-pong, Shuffleboard & video games are in the employee lounge.
* A fully-stocked kitchen provided by ownership. There is no shortage of snacks & you could almost eat breakfast, lunch & dinner here every day.
* Access to the gym in our building with NO membership fee AND free workouts with our personal trainer.
* The office is open from 8 am to 6 pm Monday-Friday. We offer a flexible work schedule for BOTH early and late risers
* Ability to work from home on Fridays after 1 year
After 90 days of Full-time employment we offer our full-time employees:
* 50% funded healthcare benefits for the employee + supplemental health care insurance at a reduced cost
* Earn up to 2 weeks PTO with an additional week given at year 3 AND another week at year 5.
* You can join the 401K after your 1st year of employment. No matching % 's here, we provide 3% regardless of how much or little you contribute.
* Generous incentive program for each anniversary you celebrate.

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for the Marketing/Communication department business policies and processes, budget alignment, and projects management. This role oversees the department business center, ensuring that purchases, invoices, budget, and task orders have a reliable and detail-focused center in a fast-paced work and production environment. This role will also manage the mailing lists, provide CRM oversight, prepare reports on departmental activities, campaign effectiveness, budget and resources; as well as, assist in special event preparation and implementation, and take on special project manager assignments for department initiatives.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
•Serve as Budget Coordinator for Marketing; providing in-depth technical support regarding budget programming and budget development; monitor budget; track expenses, manage budget transfers.
•Manage contract and procurement activities; review invoices and ensure timely payment for goods and services provided to the department; monitor status of contracts for professional services; prepare requisitions and other forms as needed.
•Prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing key data indicators.
•Coordinate with Accounts Payable on budget input for invoices, budget stops, and other budget related items.
•Delegate AX items such as invoices, requisitions, purchase orders and budget items to appropriate approval managers.
•Determine cash-flow projections for the project execution, compare actual expenditures monthly, and maintain accurate project/program financial records.
•Monitor department expenses, adherence to payment terms, and identify discrepancies and facilitate appropriate resolution.
•Plan meetings and special events by coordinating department travel, developing schedules and assignments; as well as, identifying, assembling, and coordinating requirements.
•Conduct end-user training and provide ongoing support to staff on various agency systems such as Monday.com, SharePoint, Dynamics AX, Teams, etc.
•Keep promotional materials ready by coordinating requirements with graphics department; inventorying stock; placing orders; verifying receipt.
•Serve as marketing project coordinator on a variety of departmental initiatives.
•Manage and update contact and mailing lists. Act as lead user of department CRM.
•Proactively addresses challenges by identifying solutions and communicating effectively to stakeholders.
•Support Capital Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s Safety Management Systems (SMS) process by following safety and security policies, considering safety in every action and reporting safety and security concerns.
•Perform other duties as assigned.

Are You looking to be part of a Winning Team with Flexible Hours, Opportunity to work remotely?
