Blucora has a bold aspiration: we are committed to giving all people the tools needed to lead healthy financial lives - tools often reserved for the wealthy.

We began our journey by bringing together two industry-leading firms to form a foundation in tax-smart investing that is unreplaceable in the industry. TaxAct is an innovative tax software company that helps more than 4 million Americans prepare their own taxes each year. HD Vest is the first firm in the world to make it possible for tax professionals to support clients’ wealth management needs (now over $45B for more than 300,000 Americans).

We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. Atypical for the financial services industry, we take a contemporary approach to strategy and product development that is founded in user insights, rapid testing and a singular focus on driving end-user value.

Since charting new territory on a daily basis is part of everyone's job at Blucora, we've attracted team members who thrive on the challenge, encourage each other, and are passionately committed to the goal. If you agree that problem- solving is a team sport, and feel energized by a good debate, deep dive research, or a fun night out with colleagues, we might be the right firm for you!

Position Summary

This position is responsible for writing and otherwise curating business communications, including traditional, digital, and video assets, for a variety of internal and external channels. Communications audiences include Avantax Wealth Management’s community of 4,000 Financial Professionals, their staff, and firms. The Communications Specialist will handle both proactive and reactive communications needs, with an emphasis on supporting the Avantax goal of attracting and retaining Financial Professionals while helping them grow their business, with a heightened focus on Wealth Management growth. The person in this position will support Communications efforts in ways that build trust, engage audiences, provide value to key constituents, and help enhance brand value and reputation.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

The position’s core responsibilities are listed below. To successfully perform the job, the individual must be able to execute each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The successful candidate will be integral to an active cadence of communications to Financial Professionals, including but not limited to managing – from concept to creation – the weekly digital newsletter sent to all Avantax employees and Financial Professionals. This work includes partnering with a variety of departments to identify story topics, schedule weekly news flows, and manage the overall production of the weekly newsletter.

The person in this role will also help identify strategic communications opportunities that align with Avantax Wealth Management business priorities and value propositions while also curating content for a variety of channels including:
Websites and other digital platforms.
Traditional print and digital communications.
Email content.
Weekly newsletters for the Avantax community of 4,000 Financial Professionals.
Managing editorial meetings and calendars for weekly newsletters.
Long-form communications (e.g., success stories, videos) and executive communications.
Support for company-sponsored conferences and industry tradeshows.
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, or related field.
3+ years of experience in public relations, content development, corporate communications/marketing communications (PR/marketing agency experience a plus).
Experience in business writing with the ability to convey complicated information simply and concisely.
Experience in standard communication tools, e.g., email, Microsoft Office, PDFs.
Project management experience – must be comfortable keeping a variety of projects and tasks moving forward simultaneously.
Familiarity with social media platforms.
Financial Services experience, including working with Compliance functions, a plus.
Basic HTML coding, video-editing, and digital marketing skills (e.g., Salesforce, Pardot) a plus.

Description

Do you have what it takes to keep up with one of the fastest-growing companies in America? If you work hard, play hard, and your tail’s always wagging, there may be a place for you at the most innovative name in pet insurance – Petplan!

Our headquarters are buzzing with talented professionals – and their pets! – who are helping Petplan turn the pet insurance industry on its tail. We’re looking for candidates who can balance the wisdom that comes from solid work experience with the passion to push the limits and always take a fresh approach.

We love people who come to work to create, collaborate, and contribute – and have fun doing it! In spite of our explosive growth, we’ve maintained our entrepreneurial spirit, which means we work as a team, celebrate each other’s achievements, and give it all we’ve got, every day.

The Email Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for flawless execution and proactive improvements of Petplan’s email marketing program. Reporting to the Email Marketing Manager, this individual will be responsible for day-to-day email activities, including scheduling, creation, execution, testing, and analysis of email marketing programs. This position will maintain the email marketing calendar and execute against it as scheduled.

Primary Responsibilities
Assist in the creation and execution of email marketing campaigns, including template designs, copywriting & coding as directed, building clear call-to-action, database segmentation, scheduling and reporting
Perform quality assurance tests to ensure emails render/deliver correctly across a wide variety of email clients such as testing browsers and devices for a consistent user experience
Daily monitoring of campaign and delivery performance reporting
Execute conversion rate optimization strategies within emails as well as A/B testing towards improved performance
Proactively propose new A/B tests, analyze results, and identify actionable opportunities and best practices to improve campaign performance
Generate regular and ad hoc reports on email performance summarizing the effectiveness of campaigns with recommendations for improvements
Monitor deliverability by reviewing sender score, domain reputation, open rates by domain, complaints, unsubscribes, bounce rates, blocked emails, inactivity, etc. on a daily basis
Partner with the creative team to drive the email creation for all campaigns by writing creative briefs and providing direction to ensure a high-converting experience
Work closely with performance marketing, business intelligence, and site management teams to support data-driven, lead nurturing email programs with a focus on high-converting users
Prepare Photoshop files, slice and resize images to be included in email communication
Purchase and upload gift card redemption codes

Requirements

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines, handle multiple projects simultaneously and implement last-minute changes as needed
Ability to code an email in HTML based on provided creative
Knowledge of email best practices, from subject line creation to email structure, all designed to drive performance
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) knowledge a plus
Working knowledge of Photoshop a plus
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Strong analytical skills; the ability to work with data efficiently and effectively
High proficiency in advanced Excel skills (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, SUMif statements, etc.)
An inquisitive nature. You should be excited to check the data on all campaigns each day and curious to find out the causes and effects of performance
Ability to learn required business systems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Qualifications
1-2 years of experience in a digital role such as: email management, site management, social, project management, or paid advertising in a direct to consumer brand or agency
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Data Science or other related field
Hands on experience with one or more of the following: Listrak, Salesforce, AWeber, Hubspot, Bronto, Klayvio, Mandrill, Mailchimp, Sendinblue, or Constant Contact
Google Analytics certification a plus
Impeccable attention to detail
Excellent team player; proven ability to succeed as part of a high performance team
A naturally curious, master problem solver, obsessed with ways to “make things better” and a never satisfied lust for learning
The position is full-time and employees receive competitive compensation. Other perks for the Petplan team include health, dental, 401K, paid vacation, pet insurance and lots (and we mean LOTS) of food!

Petplan’s office (or doghouse, if you will) in Newtown Square boasts amazing amenities in the 210-acre Ellis Preserve parkland campus, featuring:
a fitness center with on-site personal training staff
aerobic classes like spinning, step and yoga
a basketball court
weight room
juice bar
massage services
daycare facilities for gym patrons
The campus also has a full-service cafeteria, beautiful walking trails and outdoor seating for both people and pets!

At Petplan, it’s not just about what we get, but what we give; each employee receives one additional day of paid time per calendar year to devote to volunteering for the charity of their choosing. Our “Petplanthropy” program empowers employees to give back to the causes they believe in, as well as work together to support the company’s “pet” projects, like raising funds for MS Service Dogs, organizations like the North Shore Animal League and animal health researchers like the Morris Animal Foundation.

Petplan is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Description

If you want to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team at Bridge Connector — where we are changing the way healthcare communicates and having a great time doing it. Bridge Connector delivers streamlined integration solutions for healthcare organizations. Founded on the idea that any healthcare organization should be able to automatically share data between disparate systems, Bridge Connector offers a seamless solution, regardless of platform and without requiring an IT team.

Vision: To change the way healthcare communicates. At Bridge Connector, we believe healthcare organizations should be able to efficiently transfer data between platforms so they can focus on what they do best: provide quality care.

Mission: Become healthcare’s trusted partner for effective, efficient, and affordable communication.

We deliver efficient, streamlined solutions to our customers and provide full-service integration solutions that are cost-effective and reliable.

Our Nashville office is housed in the Capitol View building and comes complete with just about every perk you'd expect a startup tech company: all the caffeine, snack bar goodies, proper hydration and ping pong tables you could ask for... with engaging all-company meetings and endless opportunities for creativity, collaboration and professional development.

We strive to hit that magic balance between rapid growth — hiring some of the brightest minds in healthcare and tech — and continuing to build a culture of authenticity and transparency where all can contribute. We go all-out to make sure our team feels supported: unlimited PTO (that they're encouraged to really use!), paternity/maternity leave, volunteer opportunities, paid medical insurance, a 401K program, free downtown parking, plus relocation assistance and the ability to work remotely for many positions.

The Bridge Connector Product Marketing Specialist will work with Marketing, Sales and Product teams while being a critical link to the Client Experience team.

The Bridge Connector Product Marketing Specialist will work with Marketing, Sales and Product teams while being a critical link to the Client Experience team.

• Understand our customers’ GTM strategies, and build packages to assist with customers’ internal and external educational efforts on Bridge Connector and our value offering

• Create customer advocates through collaboration with Client Experience and marketing teams

• Develop and manage user groups and communities within customer base with assistance from Client Experience

• Facilitate sales requests for marketing collateral and resources required to supplement the sales process

Essential Functions

• Serve as the market expert for a portfolio of Bridge Connector products, making data-driven decisions to grow market share

• Spend time with customers to understand how to best speak to them, bringing the Voice of the Customer into Bridge Connector

• Develop clear positioning that will guide messaging and other go-to-market strategies

• Craft storylines to communicate value that can be applied and contextualized for different buying scenarios

• Participate in product and feature release activities with cross-functional launch teams

• Collaborate with Sales and creative teams to create sales enablement materials

• Spend time with customers to understand their GTM strategies

• Collaborate with Client Experience and marketing teams to create customer enablement materials

• Collaborate with Client Experience and marketing teams on retention campaigns

• Create and foster customer advocacy programs and user communities

• Understand the customer journeys for multiple personas and develop customer experiences to support those journeys, specific to cyclical buying journey for subscription-based products

• Use survey and research tools to continue to surface insights

Requirements

Education and Experience

• Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field

• 3-5 years of product management/marketing experience

• Experience with customer retention programs or community management a plus, but not required

Certifications, Licenses, and other Special Requirements

• Third-party certifications, such as Pragmatic Marketing Institute, are a plus

Management/Decision-Making

• Requires leading and influencing cross-functional teams

• Decision-making for messaging and positioning approval

Knowledge and Skills

• Mastery of product marketing principles

• Experience marketing subscription-based technology products

• Ability to create sales enablement resources

• Ability to manage multiple projects at once

• Strong knowledge of data-insight tools and ability to perform individual data analysis

• Requires ability to work cross-functionally with multiple departments and customers

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple combines uber comfort with science-backed technology to make sleep and sit products for everyday life. Their award-winning marketing represents the company's quirky, colorful culture and their over 100 granted and pending patents guarantee that this company is one-of-a-kind. Nestled at the base of the Wasatch mountain range, Purple sits as one of Utah's fastest growing companies. Poised to take over the world — or at least the mattress industry — Purple is looking for the most-rad, ultra-cool, totally-awesome peeps to join the team.
Position Summary
Under the direction of the Affiliate and Partnership Marketing Manager, the Affiliate Marketing Specialist plans, develops, and executes marketing programs that support and recruit new and existing influencers and partners. The position interfaces with Product Marketing, Brand Marketing, Marketing Acquisition, Marketing Communications, and other teams to roll out different affiliate and partnership marketing initiatives. The Affiliate Marketing Specialist performs marketing research on potential influencers and partners; monitors influencers and enforces company procedures around influencer programs; reviews contracts, nurtures relationships with external vendors, influencers and partners; and creates campaign reports that show progress and return on investment.

Responsibilities:
Assist Paid Media Manager in driving offline channel performance to meet customer and revenue targets, and perform weekly/monthly/quarterly analysis across direct mail, shared mail, print, and OOH to inform learnings, best practices and the evolution of each channel.
Assist Paid Media Manager in deploying regular testing within all channels, with the ultimate goal of establishing new, scalable marketing/targeting strategies to drive customer acquisition and business growth
Develop a strong and collaborative relationship with Purple's creative team.
Work as a fluid member with other members of the Offline Acquisition team (including TV, radio, podcasts), to properly distribute budget to opportunities with the highest return
Help Paid Media Manager in fostering a culture of continuous optimization by developing and implementing a framework for iterative testing.
Develop and maintain strong vendor relationships, troubleshooting issues and ensuring strong brand positioning.
Inform creative development to optimize campaigns and further learnings via testing agendas.
Other duties as required.
Qualifications:
Minimum two-years of experience with offline channels (i.e. TV, radio, podcast).
Online streaming channel experience (i.e. Spotify, Pandora, CTV/TVe) a big plus.
Minimum 1-year progressive experience in performance marketing, ideally in an e-commerce company or startup environment.
Agency experience preferred.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, lead, and hit fixed goals.
A data-driven, and highly analytical mindset.
Excellent communication skills, both written & verbal.
Excellent negotiation and communication skills.
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects/priorities.
Highly proficient in Google’s suite of products and third-party analytics platforms.
Experience working with different business units and different goals, including retail, wholesale, and blended/omni-channel, all of which lead to one overarching revenue goal is a plus.
Experience working internationally and creating media plans for customer acquisition in markets outside of the US is a plus.
College degree preferred, experience in lieu of degree on a two-year experience for one-year education basis.
BENEFITS AND PERKS
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

Who Are You: A rock star with at least 2+ year of hands-on experience in digital marketing with experience in paid search. You love to craft paid search strategies to help clients meet greater business goals. You’re able to dive into existing accounts and find opportunities for improvement and are looking to learn how to further elevate your expertise in search.

You’re excited to learn more about this always-evolving industry and are passionate about finding new and innovative ways to maximize results and help clients meet their marketing and business goals.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities:
Passionate about growing your paid search skillset in an agency environment
Manage end-to-end paid search campaigns and seek new areas of opportunity through keyword research and analysis, campaign strategy, ad copy creation, bid management, CPA optimization, and landing page testing
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including other media specialists to plan, implement, and improve account performance aligned with client goals and initiatives
Proactively manage relationships with search engines (Google Ads, Microsoft Ads)
Provide benchmark and tracking reports to Account Managers, Clients, and Media Team on positions, traffic, conversions and other metrics
Analyze traffic trends and improve paid search performance based on the client’s KPIs

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications or related field
2+ years paid search marketing; agency environment a plus
Advanced knowledge in search engine advertising, including Google and Bing
Google Ads certification a plus
Experience with online marketing metrics such as ROI, click-through rate, cost-per-click, cost-per-action, conversion rate, average order size, etc.
Exceptional analytics, project management skills, writing and organizational skills
Ability to work in a fast paced environment
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, especially Excel
Experience managing performance-based lead generation and experience with 3rd party bid optimization tools such as Kenshoo, Marin, DBM a plus
R2i is an independent, full-service digital marketing agency with offices in Baltimore, Seattle, and Silicon Valley that creates digital solutions that connect and accelerate customer experiences to drive measurable impact for the clients we serve. Our core capabilities across strategy and insights, marketing technology, experience design, media, and digital marketing are designed to advance customer engagements and deliver measurable results. For over a decade, we have worked with both enterprise and mid-market brands to deploy best-in-class marketing technology solutions to support an integrated approach to managing the customer journey. R2i serves high tech, healthcare, industrial/manufacturing, professional services, higher education/non-profit, and consumer clients including Microsoft, Pentair, Leidos, Purdue, Johns Hopkins, Atlantic Health System, and Fiat Chrysler Uconnect.

Primary Function:

The Marketing Specialist SEO role focuses on growing and maintaining content visibility among search engines, YouTube, Amazon, and other external web properties.

Ensure websites and content have been technically optimized to attract and engage those visitors that match the profile of our target audience

Other duties as assigned
Primary Responsibilities:
Develop a feedback loop to ensure program managers are informed of efforts to increase visibility for their units; make recommendations
In collaboration with other team members, execute workflow to enhance our process for ensuring on-page content for e-commerce SKUs (resources and events) are productive
Maintains appropriate vendor services as needed, and serves as point person for those vendors

Manage assigned customers to ensure high level of customer satisfaction while looking to deepen and strengthen relationship with Domino
Work collaboratively with all internal resources to meet and exceed customers needs

Desire to learn and grow

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for the Marketing/Communication department business policies and processes, budget alignment, and projects management. This role oversees the department business center, ensuring that purchases, invoices, budget, and task orders have a reliable and detail-focused center in a fast-paced work and production environment. This role will also manage the mailing lists, provide CRM oversight, prepare reports on departmental activities, campaign effectiveness, budget and resources; as well as, assist in special event preparation and implementation, and take on special project manager assignments for department initiatives.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
•Serve as Budget Coordinator for Marketing; providing in-depth technical support regarding budget programming and budget development; monitor budget; track expenses, manage budget transfers.
•Manage contract and procurement activities; review invoices and ensure timely payment for goods and services provided to the department; monitor status of contracts for professional services; prepare requisitions and other forms as needed.
•Prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing key data indicators.
•Coordinate with Accounts Payable on budget input for invoices, budget stops, and other budget related items.
•Delegate AX items such as invoices, requisitions, purchase orders and budget items to appropriate approval managers.
•Determine cash-flow projections for the project execution, compare actual expenditures monthly, and maintain accurate project/program financial records.
•Monitor department expenses, adherence to payment terms, and identify discrepancies and facilitate appropriate resolution.
•Plan meetings and special events by coordinating department travel, developing schedules and assignments; as well as, identifying, assembling, and coordinating requirements.
•Conduct end-user training and provide ongoing support to staff on various agency systems such as Monday.com, SharePoint, Dynamics AX, Teams, etc.
•Keep promotional materials ready by coordinating requirements with graphics department; inventorying stock; placing orders; verifying receipt.
•Serve as marketing project coordinator on a variety of departmental initiatives.
•Manage and update contact and mailing lists. Act as lead user of department CRM.
•Proactively addresses challenges by identifying solutions and communicating effectively to stakeholders.
•Support Capital Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s Safety Management Systems (SMS) process by following safety and security policies, considering safety in every action and reporting safety and security concerns.
•Perform other duties as assigned.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime.

At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of our 15,000 employees across the world.

We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us?

About the role


We are looking for a candidate to strengthen our sales enablement & field marketing capabilities in the Americas region for our Reinsurance business. The ideal candidate has a proven track record in helping client-facing teams improve sales performance, have a deep understanding of the B2B marketing & sales funnel and expertise in a variety of marketing methodologies – all with the ultimate goal of helping to drive revenue.

You must have a passion for improving the client & sales experience, you are comfortable working with multiple internal groups within a matrixed organization, and you have an entrepreneurial spirit. This is a growth position, and you will have the opportunity to scope the role and influence the implementation of Swiss Re's vision for sales enablement & field marketing in the Americas.

Bottom-line, we are seeking an energized, qualified candidate to help us equip and provide our sales teams with the knowledge, tools and resources needed to successfully engage buyers throughout the buying process.

Key technical responsibilities:
Support our P&C reinsurance group to expand our market share with US regional and specialty clients and prospects and meet our ambitious financial targets.
Drive the deployment and usage of effective sales tools, information sharing and training particularly as it relates to key initiatives.
Develop and execute creative outreach strategies to build our awareness with new prospects.
Qualify leads derived from marketing and communications initiatives and effectively usher them through the sales funnel.
Develop a comprehensive understanding of all Swiss Re's value-added service offerings & products in order to best support the sales team in creating a relevant and compelling value propositions.
Work closely to become a valued discussion partner with internal groups to guide outbound communications campaigns and oversee compliance of marketing materials produced. When needed, create original sales kit material.
Upgrade & improve our RFP process to make our pitches the best in class.
Work as an extension of the Americas Marketing team to align with the regional marketing plan and report out on activities.
Work with our Broker sales unit to support them in effectively engaging our broker partners.
Reviews output from client insight surveys (proprietary and industry) for the region to advise and enhance Swiss Re's sales approach.
Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties of the position at any time.

About the team


This role is part of the Americas Marketing Team, which is part of the Strategy department within the Division Americas Reinsurance business. The Americas Strategy Team works closely with senior sales leaders in the region and aspires to co-pilot the strategic direction in the Americas to position Swiss Re for success today and tomorrow. The Americas Sales Enablement Specialist role is responsible, within that group, for planning and implementing marketing efforts to achieve our sales and growth goals within the US P&C Regional I unit.

About You
BA or BS degree, preferably in marketing or related field
> 5 years of professional level experience
Ability to wear many hats, be the convergence point between sales, marketing and product development
Experienced professional with B2B sales enablement and field marketing background
Experienced with Customer Relationship Management tools and sales enablement platforms
Excellent written communication skills with keen ability to translate technical information into straight forward and compelling sales material, when needed
A collaborative, approachable, engaging and solution-oriented team player
A results-driven, outgoing, "can-do" outlook, self-starter
Strong influencing/networking capabilities
Stamina and persistence to pursue new ideas
A strong conceptual, strategic and data-driven thinker
Ability to meet and provide realistic deadlines to other stakeholders
A structured person that is always up to speed with the recent market developments
Ability to manage quick turnaround times
Excellent listening & verbal communication skills across all seniority levels, including strong command of English
Sound business understanding and judgment
Knowledge of re/insurance is a plus, but not required

Company Overview:
Fabick Cat is the authorized dealer of Caterpillar equipment, prime and stand-by power systems, parts and service, compact construction, and rental equipment for major portions of Illinois, Missouri, the entire state of Wisconsin and the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. We have been in business for over 100 years and are headquartered in Fenton, Missouri. For more information visit http://www.fabickcat.com/

Job Summary:
The Sales Administration work tool Specialist provides administrative support to the Prime Product Sales & Used Equipment Departments with work tool and attachment sales, manages the work tool inventory and provides assistance to the Rental Manager with the Prime Product rental fleet.

Responsibilities:
Manages the work tool inventory for all Fabick locations including; ordering, transportation and preparation, inventory turns, aged inventory management, dealer transfers and searches, sales reporting, and unit forecasting.
Primary contact for all work tool inventory questions.
Maintains a database of all work tool inventory which includes sizing and specifications.
Monitors CAT stock and availability. Works with the Service Department on all work tool installations and establishes flat rates.
Researches and documents work tool inventory best practices.
Actively sells surplus and or obsolete work tools to out of territory retail and wholesale customers and distributors.
Acts as Fabick's Primary contact to Allied Vendors who sell work tools and attachments. Manages the relationship in efforts to optimize (negotiate) our sales variance and/or terms that we receive from these Vendors. Also influences (improve) delivery schedules, especially when Cat product is not available in a timely fashion.
Maintains a strong knowledge of the markets that our customers serve. Is aware of general market conditions. Keeps abreast of product work tool updates for the products that they represent along with competitor's products. Keeps management informed as to changes in the market. Works with customers to develop solutions for their needs.
Approves allied vendor invoices.
Attends company, customer meetings and association events as assigned by the management.
Learn to receive inventory into our system
All other duties as assigned

Qualifications:
High school diploma required
A Bachelor's degree in business, engineering or related discipline from a four year college or university preferred
2-3 years of related experience is preferred
Must have experience in dealing with markets that consume high value capital goods.
Strong working knowledge of work tools and applications which they are used for
Sales background in the construction equipment industry.
Knowledge of construction equipment is preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills are a must.
Must be able to effectively merchandise a complex piece of equipment in a highly competitive market that is constantly changing.
There must be a solid understanding of marketing and sales psychology as well as mathematical and computer capabilities.
Computer Skills: Microsoft Office and email.
Ability to make decisions confidently and independently as required.
Strong persuasion and negotiation skills.
Special Physical Demands:
In addition to being able to sit, stand, walk, read, talk, write and hear, to perform the essential functions of this job an individual must be able to do the following additional activities: Ability to multi-task, take direction from multiple people, sit for long periods, bend and stoop, and occassionally lift and/or move up to 20 lbs. 100% inside, general office environment.

Golden Hippo Media is a young, growing digital marketing company committed to helping everyone live their healthiest life. We create cutting edge health, wellness, and beauty products and work tirelessly to get them into the hands of the people who need them most - our customers. We're growing fast, but our core values remain the same as when we were founded in 2010.

Golden Hippo Media is currently looking for a QA Regulatory Specialist to ensure regulations are met for cosmetic and personal care products and brands. They will evaluate and approve contract manufacturers, maintain registration of products, and ensure product quality per regulations for all products. There are 2 actors on a network, people and machines. People use usernames and passwords to identify and get access to machines. Machines use keys and certificates to identify and get access each other. Venafi is the inventor of the technology that secures and protects keys and certificates, the most important assets of our Global 5000 customers. We are Warriors!

Are you passionate about making a positive impact and protecting the world from cyber criminals? If so, you may be a natural Venafi Warrior!

How you'll be protecting the world:

As a Marketing Production Specialist at Venafi you'll be part of an extremely motivated, dedicated, and experienced team that protects many of the largest organizations in the world.

In this role you will help chart a path to success for the Marcom Content Operations team as we look to refine our content ecosystem. You will be essential to the sustained success of our initiatives by playing a key role in the foundational work of the Content Strategy team. Whether assisting with team deliverables or coordinating with partner teams to provide value-add communications, you will evolve and expand as the needs of our content ecosystem continues to mature.

Venafi's Content team exists to enable the smoothest possible journey of Marcom content through our workflows from idea to publication. We're continually improving alignment with content developers, building effective and unified content pipelines, and providing all stakeholders with visibility into workflows and content catalogue to help unlock program efficiencies, and maintain consistent implementation of new systems and processes.

Responsibilities of this role:
Coordinate the collection of information about content assets including asset specifications, channel requirements, process workflows.
Assist with formal communications plans for socializing value-add information
Coordinate, document and socialize the strategic projects of the Content Team
Work with content development and design team members to ensure timely completion and delivery of individual implementation tasks
Help the marketing team meet milestones by resolving potential issues/blockers and assisting with work completion
Evaluate gaps in knowledge and documentation, and work towards creating a full suite of educational tools for all content development stakeholders
Provide regular updates to the marketing leadership team
Assist with presentation development
Be a proactive disruptor. Get involved, look for opportunities to make a difference.
The ideal Venafi Warrior will be armed with:
A Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, finance, economics, or a related field preferred
1 - 3 years of experience in marketing operations; content production experience strongly preferred
Experience with CRM and digital marketing programs preferred
Outstanding oral and written communication skills
Excellent time and project management skills with exceptional attention to detail
The ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize, and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Proven success in collaboration and working well in a cross-functional team environment
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite required, Brainshark and Drupal experience preferred.
What sets you apart?
You are a strategic, systems level thinker, with the ability to clearly articulate and implement plans.
You are highly curious and eager to learn
Your willingness to jump in and help the team with a variety of projects including research, documentation, status reports and purchasing.
While you are busy protecting the world, we've got you covered!

In addition to fostering a work environment with a strong work from anywhere ethic, Venafi offers a benefit package that is in the top 1%. We provide 100% employer paid premiums for both team members and their families. That includes health, dental, and vision insurance. YES, REALLY! We offer four weeks of PTO (Paid Time Off), eleven holidays, and a "pick your own community service day." We also offer 401(k) and company matching, company HSA contribution, 2x salary employer paid life insurance and parental leave. We even offer pet insurance!

More About Venafi:

Venafi is the undisputed heavy weight champion in Machine Identity Protection. Why? Because we created the category and are light years ahead of anyone that would consider competing! Gartner has recognized Venafi as number one in our space and as it turns out, one is NOT the loneliest number!

Venafi is the inventor of the technology that secures and protects keys and certificates. Venafi protects machine identity types by orchestrating cryptographic keys and digital certificates for SSL/TLS, IoT, mobile and SSH. Many of the largest organizations in the world use Venafi.

Billions of dollars have been spent protecting usernames and passwords and almost nothing protecting keys and certificates—organizations are just now realizing that protecting keys and certificates is as important as protecting usernames and passwords. The bad guys know this and are using stolen or forged keys and certificates to attack networks and steal data. In fact, Gartner says 50% of network attacks will use certificates.

Come help us protect the world!

Job Summary
The Office of Human Capital and Talent Management (HCTM) is the U.S. Agency for International Development's (USAID's) (the "Agency") center of excellence and focal point in providing worldwide leadership and technical expertise in the area of human capital and talent management. As such, HCTM aligns resources with identified humanitarian and development needs. HCTM is the Agency repository for state-of-the-art thinking in this area and works to produce advances and innovations that can benefit USAID and its Missions throughout the world.

This position is in the Office of Operations (HCTM/OPS) which reports directly to the Chief of Staff (CoS), who serves as the Communications Specialist to the Acting Chief Human Capital Officer and Deputy Chief Human Capital Officer on broad technical and operational matters relating to the mandate of HCTM. The Office of the CHCO provides leadership on the design, implementation, review, coordination, and evaluation of human capital and talent management initiatives, programs, and activities and ensures that the activities of HCTM complement and support the broader goals of the Agency and are in compliance with legislation and Agency rules and regulations.

The Communications Specialist will serve as a key internal and external relations liaison within USAID’s Office of Human Capital and Talent Management. Within USAID, the Communications Specialist will work closely with the HCTM Centers and Offices, as well as staff in the Bureau for Legislative and Public Affairs, as necessary.

The Communications Specialist will be responsible for assisting the Sr. Communications Specialist with internal and external communications planning and implementation, utilizing social media for reaching staff deployed worldwide, as well as multi-media including, but not limited to, email, webcasts, blogs, and e-newsletters.

The statements contained in this job description reflect general details as necessary to describe the principal functions of this job, the level of knowledge and skill typically required, and the scope of responsibility. It should not be considered an all-inclusive listing of work requirements. Employee may perform other duties as assigned, including work in other functional areas to cover absences or relief, to equalize peak work periods or otherwise to balance the workload.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities
Strategy and Message Development
Develop and execute effective and integrated communication plans, including strategies and tactics across all channels, and leveraging all communication opportunities.
Develop and create clear, strategic, and messaging focus on HCTM’s vision – People First, Mission Always – Developing a 21st Century Workforce.
In line with priorities, develop messaging and talking points for engagements that shape the public voice for our HCTM front office principals based on a sound understanding of the audience and USAID HCTM priorities.
Develop clear messaging and channels for different stakeholders – Headquarters, Missions, Foreign Service, Civil Service, Foreign Service Nationals, Eligible Family Members, and non-direct hires.
Execution
Work with HCTM Centers and Offices to develop and package information based on an understanding of information the community needs and where we want them to focus.
Develop and execute messaging for HCTM.
Work with individuals within USAID to develop internal and external messages on key priorities.
Ensure consistency of message in all communications products.
Ensure each channel and group of stakeholders is approached regularly, with the right messaging, and with appropriate clarity of deliverables.
Identify, set up, staff external speaking/engagement opportunities for HCTM leadership.
Organize special events to reinforce HCTM’s technical and implementation leadership role on in Human Capital and Talent Management.
Management
Manage, develop, and maintain an editorial calendar and other key strategic tools, as requested, to implement, evaluate, and evolve internal communications.
Manage communication projects, including tracking, reporting status, project budgets and measurement of tactics.
Oversee and manages HCTM communication POCs to increase and elevate HCTM communication and ensure single messaging of HCTM's mission and goals.
Manage, monitor and coordinate with HCTM Communication POCs on Intranet development and activity.

0 - 10%

Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Journalism, or related-field, with related Master’s Degree preferred.

This candidate needs to have a strong strategic communications background – at least 8 – 10 years – either professional or academic or both – preferably with experience in the human capital and talent management area.

Qualifications and Requirements

Demonstrated ability to organize, prioritize, and manage multiple tasks and work well under the pressure of deadlines.

Ability to research a diverse array of HR related topics and distill the key messages in preparation for presentations.

Ability to work cooperatively and strategically in a team environment with HCTM leadership, technical and administrative staff.

Job Title: Recruitment Marketing Project Manager (1.0 FTE, Days)
Job Description:
Human Resource

1.0 FTE, 8 Hour Days

At Stanford Children’s Health, we know world-renowned care begins with world-class caring. That's why we combine advanced technologies and breakthrough discoveries with family-centered care. It's why we provide our caregivers with continuing education and state-of-the-art facilities, like the newly remodeled Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford. And it's why we need caring, committed people on our team - like you. Join us on our mission to heal humanity, one child and family at a time.

Job Summary


This paragraph summarizes the general nature, level and purpose of the job.

The Project Manager's primary function is to lead and coordinate Marketing/Recruitment initiatives and generate innovative ideas to build a solid candidate pipeline for organization’s short and long-term talent acquisition goals. This position includes support, guidance, and oversight for a broad range of projects, programs, services, related to the recruitment marketing needs and process improvement related to candidate and employee experience. Generates social media strategies and programs in support of organization’s Diversity & Inclusion people strategies, while enhancing candidate attraction effectiveness of career website and other social media platforms. The project manager will bring new and innovative ideas, techniques, and marketing opportunities to the forefront to benefit Stanford Children’s Health in external recruitment efforts, and internal employee advocacy as brand ambassadors.

Essential Functions


The essential functions listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.

Employees must abide by all Joint Commission Requirements including but not limited to sensitivity to cultural diversity, patient care, patient rights and ethical treatment, safety and security of physical environments, emergency management, teamwork, respect for others, participation in ongoing education and training, communication and adherence to safety and quality programs, sustaining compliance with National Patient Safety Goals, and licensure and health screenings.

Must perform all duties and responsibilities in accordance with the hospital’s policies and procedures, including its Service Standards and its Code of Conduct.
Partners with leadership, recruitment team and hiring managers to create recruitment-marketing plans for ongoing recruitment and continual hospital expansion needs and identifies areas of refinement to build awareness and generate interest in new positions targeting both internal and external audiences.
Partners with enterprise Marketing team to identify points of alignment across corporate and employer brand and leverage across campaigns for recruitment marketing efforts to continually develop the talent pipeline for organization’s talent and workforce planning goals.
Extends the current recruitment strategies to include special diversity recruitment initiatives consisting of sourcing and pipeline initiatives, and career website and employer branding refresh to promote LPCHS as diversity employer.
Partners with leadership and recruitment team in continuous process improvement initiatives targeted to enhance candidate and hiring manager experience for the end-to-end recruitment cycle.
Partners with hiring managers and recruitment team to update and standardize recruitment collateral for events and conferences.
Partners with recruitment Sourcer and digital marketing team to test and identify the best social media/web channels to reach targeted audiences, and implements a repeatable process for ensuring that all recruitment marketing finds its way to those targeted channels, while ensuring a measurable ROI.
Drafts content for newsletters, brochures, manuals, website, ERP (employee referral program) etc. Edits and facilitates the final production of publications developed individually and/or in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders and vendors. May also create content for Internet-based communications.
Collaborates with the enterprise digital marketing team to leverage social media advertising to generate an interest in open positions and/or joining our Talent Network for upcoming positions. Assumes responsibility for identifying channels for media buys, designing ads (digital, radio, urban transit) and preparing a digital campaign for execution.
Plans and executes on-site recruitment events in partnership with the recruitment team. Continually enhances the effectiveness of the Employee Referral Program to increase candidate referrals and create brand ambassadors to build greater employee advocacy and reputation.
Prepares executive presentations as needed, and provides recruitment effectiveness data analytics and insights for viable recognition awards and activities of organization’s successful recruitment and workforce planning strategies.
Minimum Qualifications


Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.
Education: Bachelor's degree in a work - related discipline / field from an accredited college or university
Experience: Three (3) years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience
License / Certification: None required.
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities


These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification.
Ability to apply judgment and make sound decisions.
Ability to foster effective working relationships and build consensus.
Ability to plan, organize, prioritize, work independently and meet deadlines.
Ability to work effectively both as a team player and leader.
Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization.
Knowledge of Windows-based office software, computers and operating systems.
Knowledge of concepts, principles and methods of developing and executing marketing promotional/advertising strategies.
Knowledge of research processes, data development, data analysis, syndicated data and consumer information resources.
Ability to work in a matrix environment with multiple stakeholders and clients.
Ability to conduct research, conduct analysis, reach conclusions, and present findings.
Physical Requirements

The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions in which the job is typically performed are available from the Occupational Health Department. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Job Title: Recruitment Marketing Project Manager (1.0 FTE, Days)
Job Description:
Human Resource

1.0 FTE, 8 Hour Days

At Stanford Children’s Health, we know world-renowned care begins with world-class caring. That's why we combine advanced technologies and breakthrough discoveries with family-centered care. It's why we provide our caregivers with continuing education and state-of-the-art facilities, like the newly remodeled Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford. And it's why we need caring, committed people on our team - like you. Join us on our mission to heal humanity, one child and family at a time.

Job Summary


This paragraph summarizes the general nature, level and purpose of the job.

The Project Manager's primary function is to lead and coordinate Marketing/Recruitment initiatives and generate innovative ideas to build a solid candidate pipeline for organization’s short and long-term talent acquisition goals. This position includes support, guidance, and oversight for a broad range of projects, programs, services, related to the recruitment marketing needs and process improvement related to candidate and employee experience. Generates social media strategies and programs in support of organization’s Diversity & Inclusion people strategies, while enhancing candidate attraction effectiveness of career website and other social media platforms. The project manager will bring new and innovative ideas, techniques, and marketing opportunities to the forefront to benefit Stanford Children’s Health in external recruitment efforts, and internal employee advocacy as brand ambassadors.

Essential Functions


The essential functions listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.

Employees must abide by all Joint Commission Requirements including but not limited to sensitivity to cultural diversity, patient care, patient rights and ethical treatment, safety and security of physical environments, emergency management, teamwork, respect for others, participation in ongoing education and training, communication and adherence to safety and quality programs, sustaining compliance with National Patient Safety Goals, and licensure and health screenings.

Must perform all duties and responsibilities in accordance with the hospital’s policies and procedures, including its Service Standards and its Code of Conduct.
Partners with leadership, recruitment team and hiring managers to create recruitment-marketing plans for ongoing recruitment and continual hospital expansion needs and identifies areas of refinement to build awareness and generate interest in new positions targeting both internal and external audiences.
Partners with enterprise Marketing team to identify points of alignment across corporate and employer brand and leverage across campaigns for recruitment marketing efforts to continually develop the talent pipeline for organization’s talent and workforce planning goals.
Extends the current recruitment strategies to include special diversity recruitment initiatives consisting of sourcing and pipeline initiatives, and career website and employer branding refresh to promote LPCHS as diversity employer.
Partners with leadership and recruitment team in continuous process improvement initiatives targeted to enhance candidate and hiring manager experience for the end-to-end recruitment cycle.
Partners with hiring managers and recruitment team to update and standardize recruitment collateral for events and conferences.
Partners with recruitment Sourcer and digital marketing team to test and identify the best social media/web channels to reach targeted audiences, and implements a repeatable process for ensuring that all recruitment marketing finds its way to those targeted channels, while ensuring a measurable ROI.
Drafts content for newsletters, brochures, manuals, website, ERP (employee referral program) etc. Edits and facilitates the final production of publications developed individually and/or in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders and vendors. May also create content for Internet-based communications.
Collaborates with the enterprise digital marketing team to leverage social media advertising to generate an interest in open positions and/or joining our Talent Network for upcoming positions. Assumes responsibility for identifying channels for media buys, designing ads (digital, radio, urban transit) and preparing a digital campaign for execution.
Plans and executes on-site recruitment events in partnership with the recruitment team. Continually enhances the effectiveness of the Employee Referral Program to increase candidate referrals and create brand ambassadors to build greater employee advocacy and reputation.
Prepares executive presentations as needed, and provides recruitment effectiveness data analytics and insights for viable recognition awards and activities of organization’s successful recruitment and workforce planning strategies.
Minimum Qualifications


Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.
Education: Bachelor's degree in a work - related discipline / field from an accredited college or university
Experience: Three (3) years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience
License / Certification: None required.
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities


These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification.
Ability to apply judgment and make sound decisions.
Ability to foster effective working relationships and build consensus.
Ability to plan, organize, prioritize, work independently and meet deadlines.
Ability to work effectively both as a team player and leader.
Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization.
Knowledge of Windows-based office software, computers and operating systems.
Knowledge of concepts, principles and methods of developing and executing marketing promotional/advertising strategies.
Knowledge of research processes, data development, data analysis, syndicated data and consumer information resources.
Ability to work in a matrix environment with multiple stakeholders and clients.
Ability to conduct research, conduct analysis, reach conclusions, and present findings.
Physical Requirements

The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions in which the job is typically performed are available from the Occupational Health Department. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Position Summary

The Communications Specialist is a key member of the Communications team responsible for developing and executing on our internal and external communication strategies at Phoenix Children’s. This role is part of a collaborative team working to enhance the communications experience for all of our internal and external stakeholders (employees, providers, patients, etc.), inspire and promote our culture, mission and values, deepen our stakeholder relationships and continue to strengthen the Phoenix Children’s brand. This position plans, executes and evaluates the effectiveness of communications efforts to drive awareness, understanding, preference and loyalty to Phoenix Children’s with our various stakeholders. This involves crafting strategic messaging, delivering the messaging to the intended audiences through the right channels and receiving feedback, all while keeping the specific communications purpose in mind. The Communications Specialist will use their planning, writing and editing skills to create materials, organize events for stakeholders, communicate key messages across various platforms (newsletters, emails, fliers, social media, etc.) and manage tools to produce print and digital communication to engage and inspire stakeholders and maintain a positive image for Phoenix Children’s.

PCH Values

Family-Centered care that focuses on the need of the child first and values the family as an important member of the care team
Excellence in clinical care, service and communication
Collaborative within our institution and with others who share our mission and goals
Leadership that set the standard for pediatric health care today and innovations of the future
Accountability to our patients, community and each other for providing the best in the most cost-effective way.

Position Duties

Communications and Project Planning
Works with stakeholders to identify effective strategies to achieve organizational and department communications goals. Identifies opportunities to achieve goals for various stakeholders and prioritizes projects appropriately to meet deadlines. Develops and executes integrated communications plans in-line with agreed upon goals. Works closely with Marketing and Communications team to ensure alignment of messages and timelines. Ensures activities conform to legal standards, including but not limited to HIPAA and Stark.
Project Management
Ability to deliver on multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously, meeting deadlines, quality measures and budgets.
Editorial, Collateral and Content Management
Researches, writes and produces material targeted to various stakeholders (employees, patients, providers, etc.) in support of organization initiatives and priorities. This may include, e-newsletters, flyers, brochures and other communications vehicles. Works with appropriate individuals to develop approaches to projects with topic ideas that with appeal to intended audiences and support enterprise-wide strategies and goals. Writes in top professional quality (style, grammar, interest, readability and tone), presents facts and quotations accurately, and ensures the finished product communicates effectively with appropriate language geared to its audience. When editing others’ writing, handles with respect for the writer and an understanding of the project goals and intended use(s). Writes using AP and Phoenix Children's style guides with a commitment to error-free content.
Research and Strategy Development
Uses research to better understand stakeholders in order to develop strategies and tactics to communicate appropriately. Regularly reviews Phoenix Children's strategic objectives and needs to build impactful and creative communications strategies that keep the organization and its stakeholders informed about Phoenix Children's developments.
Performs miscellaneous job related duties as requested.

Job Title: Advertising Account Manager - Client Success - Channel Bakers
Job Description:
Advertising Account Manager - Client Success Team - Channel Bakers

**So we can reach you and our emails aren't sent to spam, please whitelist "@app.bamboohr.com

Account Managers at Channel Bakers are the beating hearts of our account teams. You are the glue that holds everything together as you oversee the day to day running of client accounts and ensure that all strategy is executed on time and to budget.

As a seasoned Account Manager, you will have the confidence and competence to support across a diverse range of clients from New to Market right through to the more strategic complex clients/brands.

You are a strong and effective communicator, taking the lead on day to day client interactions and seamlessly sharing information and data to the Strategic Account Executive and Advertising Specialists. With acute attention to detail, you oversee and track click credits, budget pacing, customer deliverables and take any ad hoc client requests in your stride. You are a guru on all things related to Search Strategy and Demand Side Platform (DSP) and utilize this knowledge to leverage optimum campaign outputs for our clients.

As the right hand to the Account Executive, you support them with strategic client communication, quarterly business reviews, presentations and developing media plans. Supporting the Advertising Specialist, you ensure that they are set up for success with all of their daily tasks which include building & optimizing campaigns, key word development and developing Calls to Action. You clearly and comfortably delegate both routine and important tasks and provide help and direction as required.

You are able to communicate clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles and can get messages across that have the desired effect. You make good decisions based on a combination of analysis, wisdom, experience and judgement and are often sought out by others for advice or solutions. You enjoy working hard, are action oriented and are full of energy for things you see as challenging. You value time and know how to use it effectively to optimize your own efficiency.

This position is based at our US HQ in Anaheim Hills, CA and reports to the Director of Strategic Accounts. It may require domestic travel, approximately 10% of the time.

Required Experience & Qualifications:
Minimum of 3 to 4+ years of Marketing or Advertising experience in a fast moving, client facing environment
Degree in Business, Public Relations, Marketing, Advertising, Communications or equivalent preferred
Experience of Amazon Search Advertising preferred and exposure to DSP (Demand Side Platform) a significant advantage
Experience of being part of a performing team
Strong analytical and qualitative skills are essential - data and numbers don't scare you!
Proven ability to cultivate and foster new relationships and depend existing ones
Proficient user of standard office software (MS Office etc). Intermediate or advanced Excel necessary
Proven track record of driving your own professional and personal development
Everyday Tasks:
Communicate regularly with clients via calls, email and in person meetings to update on campaigns and discuss campaign actions and activities.
Oversee budget pacing & management, click credits tracking, launching campaigns, optimizing rulesets and all DSP activity
Prepare reports and analyze data and insights
Carry out brand and product research
Support the Strategic Account Director or Executive with strategic client needs.
Support Advertising Specialist to ensure their tasks are completed accurately and on time.
Partner with the Advertising Operations Lead to identify process challenges and find solutions.
Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally within Channel Bakers with other key stakeholders including Finance, Engineering, Creative and People & Culture.
Working at Channel Bakers:

Working at Channel Bakers is a job like no other.

Our beautiful USHQ is situated in Anaheim Hills overlooking the spectacular views of Chino Hills State Park. We take pride in our inspirational office decor and offer a fun and engaging environment to help our employees bring their best selves to work every single day. Our kitchen is stocked with snacks and refreshments to keep us hydrated and energized all day long and we regularly take time to connect and have fun together as a team. We get to work alongside some incredibly talented co-workers and partner with some of the world’s most prolific and inspirational Brands. We are a truly global organization with offices located in Seattle, the Philippines and the UK and proud to have a very diverse team of Bakers not only from the US but also Germany, France, Brazil, Scotland and Mongolia to name a few!

Our core tenet is that we exist to help people and this is at the heart of all that we do.

We enjoy the challenge of new and unfamiliar tasks, change is our normal and we can shift gears comfortably. We love to exceed our goals, both work and personal and most importantly we are dedicated to exceeding the expectations or our clients. We value self-development, it helps us help others, better.

Regular team social events

Access to Employee Assistance Program

Company Description
Located in Howard County, Maryland, Iron World is the fastest growing manufacturer and distributor of top-quality ornamental fencing and slide gates in the country. Our world class products meet the highest standards of excellence for design, durability and functionality. You will find our products at such places as the Pentagon, the Washington Monument, the Washington Nationals’ Stadium, Norfolk Naval Base, Badger Stadium, Quantico, New Jersey Devil’s Arena, Patriots Stadium and numerous bridges, highways and schools throughout the country.

At Iron World, our products are made from raw steel, giving us the ability to make tubing, posts and pickets of all shapes and sizes. Once the steel has been formed and posts are cut to your size requirements, they go through our extensive coating process. We coat our products using a five stage pre-treatment, ending with a non-chromatic conversion coating to seal the surface and provide additional corrosion protection. Fourteen oscillating, automatic spray guns then apply a polyester powder to the G90 galvanized steel to ensure all parts of the iron fence and gate products are evenly reached with a 3.0-3.5 mil thickness of coating.

Our iron fences and gates are coated pre-assembly to ensure a smooth, consistent finish that resists cracking, flaking and peeling at the panel’s pivot points. This process ensures a full measure of protection in the areas where moisture accumulates and rust begins. Our in-house powder coating line is the largest in the manufacturing industry; over 1200 feet in length and equipped to handle fencing and gates that are up to 50 feet in length, 8 feet in height, and 27 inches in width. To ensure top quality of the powder coating process, two manual gun technicians inspect the final coat of all materials.

Once your decorative iron fencing and gates are ready to be delivered, we place them in polyurethane bags and shrink wrap them closed with heat. This ensures that contaminates cannot enter the packaging, preventing scratches and abrasions during transit. Everyone on the Iron World staff is focused on providing the highest quality product and service at a competitive price. No hidden charges – the price we provide is complete.

Director, Product Marketing
Job Overview
The Director, Product Marketing will help build and execute Marchex’s product marketing strategy, including overall positioning and messaging for our Analytics and Marketplace products and solutions, leading the product marketing team in the creation and execution of sales enablement tools, competitive positioning, partnering with Demand Generation on key marketing deliverables, driving customer advocacy, and partnering with our data sciences team to drive insight from the wealth of information we collect from our clients. This role will be responsible for managing a team of product and content marketing managers as well as analysts from the Marchex Institute.
Job Impact
This job will have a direct impact on our ability to execute our sales and marketing vision for the conversational intelligence space. This role will lead a team of marketers to develop and drive an inspirational and differentiated message to the marketplace and prospects and create a compelling reason to purchase our solutions for new and current customers.
Team
The Marketing team delivers both internal and external communications on how Marchex helps business succeed with conversations. The Marketing group keeps our leadership teams informed of market trends, and creates programs and initiatives that keep us ahead of the curve and drive the industry. They touch all of our potential and current clients, and help us reach the right audiences at the right times to help drive more adoption of all of the Marchex product lines.
Outline of Duties and Responsibilities
Lead and build a high performance product marketing team that leads our organization in achieving our revenue goals for our product and solution offerings
As Marchex’s chief storyteller, lead the product marketing team in identifying target audiences, their key business problems and pain points, articulating the Marchex value proposition and key business outcomes and benefits
Develop product go-to-market plans for Marchex and our portfolio of solutions that aligns with our revenue strategy and marketing assets, including launch strategies, bills of materials and execution plans for Marchex product launches and announcements
Lead our Marchex Institute data analysis and consumer behavior team in working with our customers and industry specialists to demonstrate the value our solutions provide, as well as to unearth new trends and insights for our customers and the marketplace
Lead sales enablement efforts, developing and delivering sales tools, content, support and training that keeps our sales team in a position to efficiently drive sales
Help socialize and evangelize messaging consistency for Marchex products and change perception of our solutions at scale through Marchex and industry events, internet presence, analyst relations, and direct customer engagement
As the team with expertise in our products’ sales cycle, partner with our product, engineering and sales teams to facilitate feedback and drive continuous improvement of the product positioning, benefits to our customers, and sales enablement tools
Stay on top of market trends and competitors and partner with product, engineering and sales teams to ensure our value prop is the most differentiated across our key competitors
Coach, mentor, and manage our talented product marketers, content marketers and data sciences team in the Marchex Institute
Support the Guiding Principles and vision of the company and the team through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested
Experience, Skills and Qualifications
BA/BS degree in related field or equivalent experience, MBA a plus
8-10 years as a product marketing manager and 4-5 years as a marketing leader
Demonstrable and proven product marketing knowledge in a relevant B2B market. Demonstrated success in launching new SaaS enterprise products and enabling sales to gain competitive differentiation with your product set in the marketplace
Track record of building and leading successful and resourceful teams
Super competitive and driven to find a way to be successful
Results-driven in winning outsized share of wallet with our customers vs. the competition
Experience building and managing effective customer advocacy and evidence programs, working with customers to capture, highlight and promote business value to equip the sales team and inform prospects
Experience in working in digital environments to rapidly test and iterate messaging and key value propositions to drive digital engagement, downloads, and qualified leads to the sales team
Data-driven, with a history of measuring and optimizing marketing strategies to consistently improve business results and drive revenue
Excellent business judgement; ability to prioritize independently, overcome blockers, create clarity and move forward in dynamic or ambiguous circumstances
Ability to explain key end-user scenarios and product architecture and to proactively and quickly learn new products and technologies
Excellent storytelling, verbal and written communication skills
Experience in leading discussions with the product and engineering team here at Marchex and to outside audiences at conferences and to key industry analysts
Strong project management, leadership, management and cross-group collaboration skills are critical to your success in this position; proven success in leading teams to meet deadlines and see projects through to completion
A profound sense of ownership and accountability is absolutely required alongside the ability to influence, inspire large and sometimes skeptical audiences
Experience with enterprise customers and building and delivering product demonstrations and speaking at events and conferences is a big plus

The Senior Content Marketing Specialist will focus on special projects, video strategy and execution, social media, and new tactics as well as serve as a mentor to other team members. The Senior Content Marketing Specialist should be highly skilled in editing, detailed in nature, and eager to learn the many intricacies of the insurance industry. This person should have a strong understanding of digital marketing best practices and emerging trends, and how they can be applied in a B2C environment. Preference will be given to candidates with a strong background in customer journey, email, social media, and video marketing as well as those who can locate and correct the typo(s) in this job posting. The Senior Content Marketing Specialist reports to the Content Marketing Director.
Responsibilities: *
Stay up-to-date on new and existing content tools and trends
Work closely with the Internal and External Marketing teams as well as the company’s Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to develop content in support of the firm’s growth strategy
Establish analytics across marketing functions to understand how our content marketing activity turns into customers, and continually refine our process to convert customers.
Work closely with stakeholders in developing broad range of content strategies, including social media (paid and organic), video, webinars, and new tactics
Regularly report on new and emerging trends/tactics/best practices within marketing, and detail how they can be implemented to benefit TRANZACT
Generate new leads, including marketing-qualified leads, by content creation across all mediums and channels with stage-appropriate goals

Scrappy, resourceful, proactive, strong desire to get things done to the best of your ability

Adobe Creative Suite
