DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.

It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That’s why we say, “When our customers prosper, we all win.”

Job Description:

Join the product portfolio marketing team focused on the agriculture business at DTN!

This role includes managing and executing product marketing plans that will drive awareness, demand, and adoption of DTN Ag products that range from grain supply to agronomic solutions to general agriculture content and expertise.

Assignments for this role include developing a deep understanding of our audiences, our products, and our go-to-market tools and practices. You will work closely with the DTN Ag product, sales and customer success team to bring a best-in-class experience to our clients. You will also collaborate with internal marketing channel and capabilities teams in areas that include digital tactics, social, public relations, branding, design, marketing technology and events management to develop robust and impactful campaigns and programs that drive business and build the DTN brand.

Our ideal candidate is a highly driven, self-motivated individual who will bring a fresh approach to reaching all segments of the market. They understand different types of marketing and communications campaigns and can effectively leverage marketing tools and channels and are excellent at collaborating across a diverse set of teams.

This position will be based in our Burnsville, MN headquarters.

Responsibilities
Gain expertise and understanding across a the DTN agriculture product portfolio by working closing with the DTN product team
Create and execute product marketing campaigns and programs with minimal oversight
Work with Center-of-Excellence marketing teams to execute on campaigns
Define appropriate metrics to assess marketing effectiveness for the developer market, ensuring a return on investment
Develop evergreen marketing materials including collateral sell sheets, case studies, web and social content, videos, blogs, and white papers
Socialize programs and campaigns with internal stakeholders
Manage external agencies, market intelligence efforts, and budgets
Requirements
5+ years of product marketing experience with a proven track record in achieving results
Excellent written communication and storytelling skills
Excellent at managing multiple projects and collaboration with cross-functional teams
Energetic, creative, and self-motivated
MBA, with a focus on marketing preferred
Interest in change and growth. The Ag area of DTN is going through substantial change to meet growing needs.
Recommended Qualifications
Experience with agriculture industry
Experience with marketing and sales technology, such as Eloqua, SalesForce, and similar
Content development and writing skills
Why DTN?

OUR VISION: To be the independent, trusted source of insights to our customers who feed, protect, and fuel the world.

OUR MISSION: Empower our customers with intelligent and actionable insights that exceed their expectations and enable their success on a daily basis.

OUR VALUES: Customer Delight, Education, Teamwork, Colleague Focus, Innovation, Integrity

We have great benefits at DTN – apply today to find out more!

At DTN, we are an equal opportunity employer. Come join us as we help feed, fuel, and protect the world!

** DTN is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

BS in Project Management, Marketing, Business, etc. equivalent degree, or experience.

The PolyPeptide Group - One of the world’s largest companies specializing in the manufacture of peptides and related compounds for research and pharmaceutical applications. More information is available at our website, www.polypeptide.com
Quality Assurance Specialist – Compliance:
Job Overview: Work directly with the Manger, Quality Assurance to maintain, help develop and implement all aspects of a proactive Quality Assurance Systems. The system (quality policies and procedures) must adhere to FDA and global regulatory organizations. Assure compliance with FDA & EU regulations, ICH guidelines and State of California regulations.
Essential Job Responsibilities:
Participate and contribute through team functions such as supplier audits, annual product review, change control, CAPA, complaint handling, document control systems, and cGMP training of employees. Back up activities of Quality Assurance Specialist (Operations) which includes working on: deviations, batch record review, clinical and commercial product release. Enter data into databases in accurate and timely manner.
Insure Quality System, cGMP and ICH guidelines are followed on site. Help with annual analysis of upgrades to Quality System in terms of both Operations efficiency as well as new FDA or ICH regulatory changes.
Partner with Regulatory Affairs, Manufacturing, Development, Marketing as well as Corporate Quality on customer projects, regulatory submissions, and harmonization of PPL Group’s Global Quality standards across PPL Group sites.
Maintain our successful track record with FDA and other regulatory agencies.
Required Skills/Qualifications:
Minimum undergraduate degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering or other life science degree.
Minimum of three to five years of experience in quality assurance, quality control and compliance in the cGMP active pharmaceutical ingredient contract manufacturing industry or pharmaceutical company that internally produces their APIs.
Experience in FDA, EMEA inspections with documented successful outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to apply comprehensive, in-depth understanding of pharmaceutical industry regulatory compliance with emphasis on cGMP, IND, and NDAs.
Excellent technical writing skills and effective communication skills needed
Experience in all aspects of Quality Assurance from preclinical to commercial product phases (phase appropriate cGMPs)
Ability to juggle multiple tasks, deadlines and priorities. Must collaborate across organization and functional boundaries including customers as a team player and occasional team leader.
PolyPeptide Laboratories offer’s competitive salaries (commensurate with skills and experience), a quality work environment, excellent benefits (Health Insurance and 401 K) and an opportunity to grow your skills.
An Equal Opportunity employer.

FBC Remodel is a design/build residential re-modeler. We have been specializing in this wonderful niche for 23 years and look forward to growing our team! We were voted as one of the 153 Best Company Cultures in America in the March, 2017 issue of Entrepreneur Magazine and we were given an honorable mention in Outside Magazine's Best Places to Work of 2018 and 2019! Most recently we were named as one of the Best and Brightest Companies in America for 2019 and we are in the running for a 2020 nomination as well.
If you were to join our team, you would be working with our award-winning design and construction team creating spaces that become the most fun part of a home. We have been awarded the prestigious national awards, including the coveted Chrysalis award, and local design and construction honors through NARI and home builders’ associations. Most recently we were awarded the HGTV Faces of Design Award. While some clients like funky design, others prefer traditional spaces.
Who we are looking for:
The Marketing Director role would be someone who has a creative and visionary mindset, but can also think strategically with regard to a marketing plan to help us generate consistent and quality leads for our design team. This role would also be responsible for a small team and would need to mentor and coach this team in their growth plans. We have a strong culture and this role would require a direct, but kind approach to all things marketing.
Job Responsibilities:
Develop yearly marketing plan companywide and ensure it is executed by the marketing team with both short- and long-term goals.
Coach, mentor, collaborate and hold your team accountable with team meetings as well as weekly one on ones with a team of 3-4 people.
Understanding of and ability to develop budgets for the year.
Drive team on building brand awareness.
Plans and oversees the social media, SEO, content, trade shows, print, web and sponsorships.
Oversees and evaluates marketing performance and adjust marketing strategy to meet changing market and competitive conditions.
Continuously research new marketing strategies and target market demographics for multiple target markets.
Establish and maintain successful outsourced relationships.
Create and maintain consistent brand standards throughout all promotions materials and events.
Identify potential issues that must be addressed for the success of the department.
Conduct monthly reviews or check-ins with the marketing team.
Ability to create and present a clear plan to the leadership team with solutions for marketing road blocks.
Develop strategies for nurturing past, present and future clients.
Build partnerships with local communities.

Job Requirements:
10 plus year of marketing expertise with experience running successful national, multi-market campaigns using multiple product lines.
Construction industry experience preferred.
Bachelor degree in marketing or related field.
Knowledge in PPC, SEO, Email Campaigns, Direct Mail, Social Media Marketing, Wordpress (from a strategy standpoint).
Experience with lead generation/sales and a thorough understanding of how a sales process is executed using marketing tools.
Excellent communication with all levels of the company.
Collaborative in a team environment.
Able to navigate and mitigate conflict as it arises.
Broad functional experience in areas of strategic planning and marketing, business and market development and market research and planning.

PERFORMANCE STANDARDS:

Goal oriented and self-motivated with a strong desire to succeed in a team atmosphere; action and solutions oriented

Goal-oriented and self-motivated

Who is CSS?

CSS is a National Staffing and Recruitment provider specializing in niche recruitment, placing professional talent in Accounting and Finance, Human Resources, Sales and Marketing, Call Center and Office, and Technical positions. COMMUNITY SUPPORT SPECIALIST - AFFORDABLE HOUSING (Southern Tier/Rochester Area)

AS A COMMUNITY SUPPORT SPECIALIST at Conifer Realty, you will be responsible to support our Rural Development property teams in various day-to-day activities. The assigned portfolio will include Rochester and Southern Tier NYS apartment communities (approx. 18 sites). Home Office base for the position will be determined based on final candidate’s location. Position will include assisting Community Managers with heavy workloads, lease-ups, marketing and outreach efforts, resident income certifications and applications. Affordable Housing experience a must with Rural Development and Low-Income Housing Tax Credits program knowledge; housing certifications preferred. Must be a self-starter who works well independently; is proactive and reliable and enjoys making a positive difference in the lives of the residents. Ability to multi-task projects with excellent time-management and organizational skills essential. Excellent communication and customer service skills to interact with team, residents, vendors, community reps, and visitors a must. WEEKLY TRAVEL IS REQUIRED to assigned sites, with an occasional overnight stay for conferences, regional meetings, training's.

Conifer Realty is a professional, service-oriented organization offering a competitive salary commensurate with experience, along with excellent benefits that include ongoing training, promotion from within; paid holidays, paid time off (PTO); 401K with company match; medical, HSA, dependent care Flex account, dental, vision; company-paid life, short and long-term disability insurances; a wellness program.

Join our dynamic, growing Conifer Realty Team -- Conifer is a nationally ranked, full-service real estate company specializing in the development, construction, management and ownership of high-quality, affordable housing communities. Since its inception in 1975, Conifer has grown considerably – currently owning and managing over 15,340 multifamily units representing over 228 apartment communities in New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Maryland.

APPLY TODAY via our website link: http://www.careersatconifer.com and scroll to job #NY20101 to complete our application process and attach your resume. You will hear directly from the hiring manager on next steps in the process. Thank you for your interest in joining the Conifer Team!

Conifer Realty LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected status or characteristic. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran

Requirements

• Minimum 3+ years’ prior affordable housing site management experience, with RD, LIHTC, HUD-Section 8, Fair Housing, Public/Fair Housing compliance expertise.

• Strong experience with leasing, recertifications, move-in and move-out requirements.

• Demonstrated experience in employee Training/Development, Performance Management, coaching, mentoring.

• Strong Financial management experience with excellent understanding of managing fiscal operations needed.

• Reliable transportation and a valid driver’s license and auto insurance policy required for required weekly travel.

Description

SUMMARY OF POSITION

The Adobe Analytics Marketing Analyst will bring unique Adobe Analytics (Omniture/SiteCatalyst) experience to R2i’s Digital Marketing Analytics department. The role requires a deep understanding of digital marketing and the key performance indicators used to track specific channels including web, social, paid search, SEO, email, etc. The Adobe Analytics Marketing Analyst will work with the Digital Marketing team to set up Adobe Analytics for new clients, integrate Adobe Analytics into R2i’s reporting dashboards, and analyze reporting data to provide insights that drive our clients’ business decisions.

Specific projects will include analytics audits, analytics configurations, testing, implementation strategy & execution, creating reporting dashboards that blend multiple data sources, data analysis, visualizations, and educating clients on new trends and features within the Adobe Analytics platform. These projects will be done in close collaboration with R2i Account Managers, Digital Marketing Strategists, Search Strategists, Social Strategists, Data and Software Engineers, etc. so the ability to work in a team oriented setting is critical. The right candidate is a self-starter who gets a thrill from digging into data and uncovering compelling insights that will wow clients.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

• Monitor analytics for a portfolio of clients on an ongoing basis.

• Set up analytics configurations for new clients through the completion of analytics audits and evaluations.

• Ensure the flow of data through various stages of our clients’ customer journeys.

• Collaborate with Digital Activation team to develop, execute, and analyze results for online marketing campaigns.

• Work with business teams & senior leadership to define requirements & KPIs to align with client goals.

• Utilize third-party tools including Adobe Analytics (Omniture/SiteCatalyst), Adobe Activation (Dynamic Tag Management), Adobe Launch, Adobe Target, Tableau, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager.

Requirements

EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent business experience required.

• Adobe Analytics Business Practitioner certification a plus.

EXPERIENCE

• 2-5 years experience working with a web and digital marketing analytics platform. At least 1 year of Adobe Analytics (Omniture/SiteCatalyst) required.

• At least 1 year of Adobe Dynamic Tag Management/Adobe Activation preferred. Experience with Adobe Launch a plus.

• Experience with analytics data layers.

• Experience setting up Adobe Analytics (Omniture/SiteCatalyst) & Adobe Launch for multiple clients or previous employers.

• Experience leveraging various reporting tools within the Adobe Analytics such as: Analysis Workspace, Ad Hoc Analysis, Report Builder and Data Warehouse and creating polished, actionable dashboards and reports for various client stakeholders.

• Digital marketing and business acumen to connect data to actionable insights.

• Agency experience not required but preferred.

• Data visualization tool experience such as Tableau or Adobe Data Workbench a plus.

• Adobe Target and other Adobe Experience cloud product experience a plus.

ENVIRONMENTAL AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Fast-paced/unstructured environment while working on multiple client projects on a daily basis.

ABOUT R2INTEGRATED

R2integrated is a digital marketing agency with national presence, headquartered in Baltimore. Our value is in delivering integrated technology solutions that connect customer experiences and drive measurable impact for our clients. Core capabilities span across marketing technology, experience design, media, and digital marketing, designed to advance customer engagements and deliver impactful results. For over fifteen years, we have worked with clients to deploy best-in-class marketing technology and unify the customer journey. R2i serves segment leading clients, including Hershey, Perdue, MIT, Pentair, CloudBlue, Feeding America, University of Michigan, Johns Hopkins Carey Business School, and Senseonics.

Digital Media Specialist

Benefits Data Trust (BDT) seeks a Digital Media Specialist to develop and execute digital communications strategies, under the Communications Manager’s oversight, to help BDT connect more people to critical public benefits and increase awareness of BDT’s work and impact. The Specialist will oversee all social media properties and email campaigns, and work with the Design team to manage website and SEO content to engage existing and develop new audiences. They will analyze digital content and be responsible for original content creation, both for paid and non-paid media. They will also be the subject-matter expert in all things digital marketing-related and suggest new or replacement platforms to help the organization meet its aggressive growth goals.

Based in our Center City Philadelphia office, the Digital Media Specialist will report to the Communications Manager.

Due to COVID-19, BDT is operating under a remote-working protocol, following governmental requirements and CDC guidelines. While this job will begin as fully remote, when BDT determines it is safe to do so based on public health recommendations, we will move back into our Centre Square office. At that time, all Philadelphia-based staff are expected to transition back into the office.

Responsibilities:
Help develop and execute a digital communications plan designed to raise awareness of BDT’s work and impact
Build, manage, and expand BDT’s digital presence on social media
Work with the Design team to implement SEO and website content, and analyze performance through Google analytics
Manage a website redevelopment process
Analyze digital platforms to curate and create digital content
Stay apprised of trends in digital marketing and investigate and propose new digital outreach
Help develop and execute the team’s digital communications calendar, and collaborate with contributing departments and external partners
Coordinate content for and develop monthly eNewsletters on MailChimp, as well as segment lists, and perform testing
Audit existing digital platforms and systems, including email management, list management, and social media, for ROI
Build followers, fans, and newsletter subscribers to increase the network of supporters
Manage external vendors (video) and paid platforms (Hootsuite, e.g.), as needed
Work with Projects team to analyze communications messaging best practices
Other duties as assigned
Requirements:
Two to three years of direct experience in the field; related degree preferred
Experience at a social services nonprofit, foundation, or government agency preferred
Must possess creativity, and strong project and time management skills
Must have the ability to collaborate across teams, manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize assignments, and work independently
Design skills, such as experience with Canva, InDesign, Photoshop, and video editing platforms, a plus
Ability to self-direct and proactively identify and address departmental/organizational needs
Strong relationship development and management skills, as well as a level of proficiency and comfort level working with people of varying backgrounds
Superior written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated attention to detail
Basic knowledge of HTML helpful
Knowledge of CRM applications a plus
Video filming and editing capability or photography background is a plus
Some evening and weekend work may be required
About BDT

Benefits Data Trust (BDT) is a national nonprofit that helps people live healthier, more independent lives by creating smarter ways to access essential benefits and services. Each year, BDT helps tens of thousands of people receive critical supports using data, technology, targeted outreach, and policy change. Since its inception in 2005, BDT has screened more than one million households and secured over $7 billion in benefits and services. BDT employs more than 200 people and provides enrollment assistance to individuals in six states, and policy assistance to states nationwide. For more information, visit bdtrust.org.

We are looking for world class closers to join our dynamic Customer Account Management team. -Must be personable and persistent

-Must be articulate and able to think on your feet

-Must be Self-motivated, always seeking to improve and grow

Who we are:

Our product discovers hidden patterns and relationships between markets to formulate incredibly accurate price forecasts. This is a very exciting time to join our growing company and be part of the advancements we’re making with this technology. For more information on our product, visit www.vantagepointsoftware.com.

Job Title: Advertising Account Manager (Mandarin Fluent) - Channel Bakers
Job Description:
Advertising Account Manager (Mandarin Fluent) - Asia Pacific Team - Channel Bakers

*So we can reach you and our emails aren't sent to spam, please whitelist "@app.bamboohr.com

Advertising Account Managers at Channel Bakers are the beating hearts of our account teams. You are the glue that holds everything together as you oversee the day to day running of client accounts and ensure that all strategy is executed on time and to budget.

As a seasoned Advertising Account Manager, you will have the confidence and competence to support across a diverse range of clients from New to Market right through to the more strategic complex clients/brands.

You are a strong and effective communicator, taking the lead on day to day client interactions and seamlessly sharing information and data to the Strategic Account Executive and Advertising Specialists. With acute attention to detail, you oversee and track click credits, budget pacing, customer deliverables and take any ad hoc client requests in your stride. You are a guru on all things related to Search Strategy and Demand Side Platform (DSP) and utilize this knowledge to leverage optimum campaign outputs for our clients. You love analyzing data to help make informed strategic account management decisions and you are considered to be a bit of an Excel geek!

As the right hand to the Account Executive, you support them with strategic client communication, quarterly business reviews, presentations and developing media plans. Supporting the Advertising Specialist, you ensure that they are set up for success with all of their daily tasks which include building & optimizing campaigns, key word development and developing Calls to Action. You clearly and comfortably delegate both routine and important tasks and provide help and direction as required.

You are able to communicate clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles and can get messages across that have the desired effect. You make good decisions based on a combination of analysis, wisdom, experience and judgement and are often sought out by others for advice or solutions. You enjoy working hard, are action oriented and are full of energy for things you see as challenging. You value time and know how to use it effectively to optimize your own efficiency.

This position is based at our US HQ in Anaheim Hills, CA and reports to the Senior Strategic Account Executive. It may require some travel, approximately 5% - 10% of the time.

*** As this position services our Asia Pacific based clients, this position will require a flexible approach to working hours (due to the international time difference), generally working 12pm - 9pm (3 - 4 days per week). This will be discussed in more detail with candidates.

Required Experience & Qualifications:
Minimum of 3+ years of Advertising or Marketing Account Management experience in a fast moving, client facing environment
Degree in Business, Public Relations, Marketing, Advertising, Communications or equivalent preferred
Experience of Amazon Search Advertising preferred and exposure to DSP (Demand Side Platform) a significant advantage
Experience of Google or Facebook advertising advantageous
Experience of being part of a performing team
Strong analytical and qualitative skills are essential - data and numbers don't scare you!
Have a strong understanding of Eastern business culture and practices.
Proven ability to cultivate and foster new relationships and depend existing ones
Proficient user of standard office software (MS Office etc). Intermediate or advanced Excel necessary
Proven track record of driving your own professional and personal development
Everyday Tasks:
Communicate regularly with clients via calls, email and in person meetings to update on campaigns and discuss campaign actions and activities.
Oversee budget pacing & management, click credits tracking, launching campaigns, optimizing rulesets and all DSP activity
Prepare reports and analyze data and insights
Carry out brand and product research
Support the Strategic Account Director or Account Executive with strategic client needs.
Support Advertising Specialists to ensure their tasks are completed accurately and on time.
Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally within Channel Bakers with other key stakeholders including Finance, Engineering, Creative and People & Culture.
Working at Channel Bakers:

Working at Channel Bakers is a job like no other.

Our beautiful USHQ is situated in Anaheim Hills overlooking the spectacular views of Chino Hills State Park. We take pride in our inspirational office decor and offer a fun and engaging environment to help our employees bring their best selves to work every single day. Our kitchen is stocked with snacks and refreshments to keep us hydrated and energized all day long and we regularly take time to connect and have fun together as a team. We get to work alongside some incredibly talented co-workers and partner with some of the world’s most prolific and inspirational Brands. We are a truly global organization with offices located in Seattle, the Philippines and the UK and proud to have a very diverse team of Bakers not only from the US but also Germany, France, Brazil, Scotland and Mongolia to name a few!

Our core tenet is that we exist to help people and this is at the heart of all that we do.

We enjoy the challenge of new and unfamiliar tasks, change is our normal and we can shift gears comfortably. We love to exceed our goals, both work and personal and most importantly we are dedicated to exceeding the expectations or our clients. We value self-development, it helps us help others, better.

Job Perks:
Access to Medical Insurance (including Chiropractic and Acupuncture), Dental, Vision and Life Insurance.
Fully vested 401K with up to 4% employer match
Flexible Working
Paid Time Off (vacation, public holidays, birthday, sick, bereavement etc).
Paid volunteer time
Ergonomic workstations with standing/sitting desks
Regular team social events
Stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages
Free access to Financial Advisor support
Access to Employee Assistance Program

About Patra

Patra Corporation is the worldwide leader in insurance agency back-office and account management business process outsourcing. Patra offers a wide range of services designed to lower costs, reduce risk and improve employee productivity through the transfer of account management and producer support functions, such as policy checking, certificate issuance, quality control and account audits, to operations centers in the U.S. and India.

About this job

The Commercial Lines Account Manager candidate needs to be a self-starter, well organized, highly detailed, possess excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as having a solid commercial lines insurance knowledge base and property& casualty license in this work from home position. The Account Manager serves as the primary contact and liaison with small commercial lines clients; ensures ongoing consistency as well as managing the day-to-day servicing, renewals, and new business. Our commitment is to provide positive and quality customer service in all areas, ensuring timely delivery, and accuracy of work/service provided.

·Maintain and continue to develop client and company business relationships

·Retain and manage all policies including service center, non-service center, and surplus lines

·Promote growth of existing book through account rounding

·Market when necessary on renewal and new business

·Maintain clients / policies in agency management system

·Manage and coordinate processing of renewals, certificate of insurance, endorsements, audits, cancellations, auto ID cards, binders, summary of insurance, and edits with team

·Inform, educate, and make recommendations to clients about policy coverages, changes, exclusions, and insurance coverage needs

·Stay abreast and maintain detailed knowledge of current market conditions and technical knowledge

·Maintain knowledge / understanding of technology-based tools and solutions

·Provide good customer service

·Use analytical and critical thinking in work processes and communication skills

·Maintain a paperless workflow

·Protects confidentiality of information

·Other duties as assigned

Carlisle Construction Materials (CCM), is a global leader in the building materials industry. We've been around since 1917. In just the past six years, our company has grown by nearly 70%.

If you love a good challenge, you'll fit right in.

We are looking for a Territory Sales Specialist to join our PVC Sales team in Chicago, IL.

This position will cover northern Illinois and Wisconsin and will be responsible for providing PVC technical sales support to enhance Carlisle sales efforts in a given territory. This position must work closely with the existing sales teams in the development of the strategies to grow the PVC business. PVC sales responsibilities will include presentations to Building Owners, Consultants, Architects, contractors and Distributors. This position will manage the development and implementation of the PVC Territory Development Plan for the market.

Travel requirement: 75% with 30-35 % overnight travel

Job Responsibilities
Track, quote, influence and close existing PVC specifications.
Identify building owner targets that have a preference for PVC and insure that Carlisle is added to their base specification.
Implement a CRM job tracking system.
Maintain a working knowledge of company PVC products, special sales programs and marketing efforts within the sales division.
Attend and/or participate in trade shows, conferences and other marketing events including follow up of leads.
Identify new markets and new product opportunities.
Receive and collect market intelligence on a regular basis on customer requirements and competitor developments.
Develop technical sales support material for members of the sales team and organizing distributor training.
Provide answers to inquiries (telephone/fax/mail/etc.) to assist all customers including roofing contractors, technical representatives, sales representatives, architects, specifiers and roof consultants.
Assist with the implementation of various sales and marketing programs designed to promote the growth of PVC products.
Discuss the use of products, emphasizing product features based on analyses of customers' needs and on knowledge of product capabilities.
Other -- Miscellaneous duties as assigned by the sales manager as deemed essential to the success of the company
Develop a Distribution Program for targeted distribution. Conduct programs including: education, Hands on Demos, Product Demo's, Contractor incentives in identified markets.
Develop Contractor relationships to drive buying habits through Distribution
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field
A minimum of 1 year of experience in the roofing or construction industry
A minimum of 1 year of experience in outside sales preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong presentation skills

We are looking to recruit two North American Pro-AV OEM account managers. One role is based in California, the other one is based in the Boston-Washington area.

NETGEAR is undertaking a search for a seasoned technical major account manager. We are pursuing a major initiative to expand the sales of our industry leading IP networking switching products and need the help of energized individuals to drive business growth with our key partners. This role will be interfacing with companies in New England and upper mid-west so residency on the Northern East Coast is ideal. While not a commissioned sales role, this job will be part of our company bonus plan indexed to performance measures tied directly to this role.

Job Description:
Define, Plan and Execute the sales strategy in order to achieve the POS target on the assigned territory
Identify the key partners in the territory (ProAV equipment makers, OEMs).
Develop NETGEAR business with them. Recruit if needed, Build relationships with Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Marketing, Channels
Build forecast and deliver expected sales
Analyze OEM business and drive actions to ensure sales development is inline with set objectives, goals and targets on regular basis.
Build and maintain strong product knowledge to increase sales effectiveness.
Coordinate with internal NETGEAR resources (SE – Marketing – Product management -Sales – Tech Support) to optimize sales result.
Provide all information relevant for NETGEAR to improve business (Competitive information, market trend, channel/tecnological hidden issues impacting performance)
Be responsible to run sales plays in your field from time to time, which may require you to find a specific type of OEM partner (specialists) to accelerate the adoption of certain products within the NETGEAR portfolio.
Job Requirement & Candidate Profile:
Relevant experience in ProAV sales , preferably in a OEM channel sales role for a Silicon Valley or ProAV vendor. Relevant recent experience in business development or territory account management role in a company targeting professional AV
Demonstrated success in managing a sales channel with project pipeline including administration and reporting
Self-motivator and go-getter personality; hunter; tenacious, hungry, and extremely proactive
Ready to work for a challenger in a challenging market: tenacity, agility, recognition will come over time and initial failure should not be a stopper.
Dynamic and Entrepreneurial personality to develop relationship at different levels in OEM partner organizations.
Strong presentation-, analytical, interpersonal and business relationship building skills.
Good level of written and spoken English
Have an understanding of the ‘economics’ of OEM partnering and how partnership requirements change over time
Understand how vendors and partners work together to achieve customer satisfaction and competitiveness
You must understand the importance of Networking to a pro-AV solution deployment. Ideally you would bring a minimum of 5-10 years of experience in the professional Audio-Visual industry in a similar role.
You will be on the road for more than 50% of the time – from joint calls to integrators and end-customers with the OEMs, to generating awareness/preference/leads at trade shows, to working the corridors of influence at the OEM’s offices to drive integration of NETGEAR products as part of the OEM’s solution offering.
Your presence will be felt and these OEMs and their personnel must view you as their most-trusted network equipment player as they take their pro-AV business forward
NETGEAR (NASDAQ: NTGR) is a global networking company that delivers innovative products to consumers, businesses and service providers. The Company's products are built on a variety of proven technologies such as wireless (WiFi and LTE), Ethernet and powerline, with a focus on reliability and ease-of-use. The product line consists of wired and wireless devices that enable networking, broadband access and network connectivity. NETGEAR products are sold in approximately 23,000 retail locations around the globe, and through approximately 22,000 value-added resellers, as well as multiple major cable, mobile and wireline service providers around the world. The company's headquarters are in San Jose, Calif., with additional offices in approximately 25 countries. More information is available from the NETGEAR investor page.

NETGEAR is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best available people in every job. Company policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition including genetic characteristics, sexual orientation, military and veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. It also prohibits unlawful discrimination based on the perception that anyone has any of those characteristics, or is associated with a person who has or is perceived as having any of those characteristics.

We are looking to recruit two North American Pro-AV OEM account managers. One role is based in California, the other one is based in the Boston-Washington area.

NETGEAR is undertaking a search for a seasoned technical major account manager. We are pursuing a major initiative to expand the sales of our industry leading IP networking switching products and need the help of energized individuals to drive business growth with our key partners. This role will be interfacing with companies in New England and upper mid-west so residency on the Northern East Coast is ideal. While not a commissioned sales role, this job will be part of our company bonus plan indexed to performance measures tied directly to this role.

Job Description:
Define, Plan and Execute the sales strategy in order to achieve the POS target on the assigned territory
Identify the key partners in the territory (ProAV equipment makers, OEMs).
Develop NETGEAR business with them. Recruit if needed, Build relationships with Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Marketing, Channels
Build forecast and deliver expected sales
Analyze OEM business and drive actions to ensure sales development is inline with set objectives, goals and targets on regular basis.
Build and maintain strong product knowledge to increase sales effectiveness.
Coordinate with internal NETGEAR resources (SE – Marketing – Product management -Sales – Tech Support) to optimize sales result.
Provide all information relevant for NETGEAR to improve business (Competitive information, market trend, channel/tecnological hidden issues impacting performance)
Be responsible to run sales plays in your field from time to time, which may require you to find a specific type of OEM partner (specialists) to accelerate the adoption of certain products within the NETGEAR portfolio.
Job Requirement & Candidate Profile:
Relevant experience in ProAV sales , preferably in a OEM channel sales role for a Silicon Valley or ProAV vendor. Relevant recent experience in business development or territory account management role in a company targeting professional AV
Demonstrated success in managing a sales channel with project pipeline including administration and reporting
Self-motivator and go-getter personality; hunter; tenacious, hungry, and extremely proactive
Ready to work for a challenger in a challenging market: tenacity, agility, recognition will come over time and initial failure should not be a stopper.
Dynamic and Entrepreneurial personality to develop relationship at different levels in OEM partner organizations.
Strong presentation-, analytical, interpersonal and business relationship building skills.
Good level of written and spoken English
Have an understanding of the ‘economics’ of OEM partnering and how partnership requirements change over time
Understand how vendors and partners work together to achieve customer satisfaction and competitiveness
You must understand the importance of Networking to a pro-AV solution deployment. Ideally you would bring a minimum of 5-10 years of experience in the professional Audio-Visual industry in a similar role.
You will be on the road for more than 50% of the time – from joint calls to integrators and end-customers with the OEMs, to generating awareness/preference/leads at trade shows, to working the corridors of influence at the OEM’s offices to drive integration of NETGEAR products as part of the OEM’s solution offering.
Your presence will be felt and these OEMs and their personnel must view you as their most-trusted network equipment player as they take their pro-AV business forward
NETGEAR (NASDAQ: NTGR) is a global networking company that delivers innovative products to consumers, businesses and service providers. The Company's products are built on a variety of proven technologies such as wireless (WiFi and LTE), Ethernet and powerline, with a focus on reliability and ease-of-use. The product line consists of wired and wireless devices that enable networking, broadband access and network connectivity. NETGEAR products are sold in approximately 23,000 retail locations around the globe, and through approximately 22,000 value-added resellers, as well as multiple major cable, mobile and wireline service providers around the world. The company's headquarters are in San Jose, Calif., with additional offices in approximately 25 countries. More information is available from the NETGEAR investor page.

It also prohibits unlawful discrimination based on the perception that anyone has any of those characteristics, or is associated with a person who has or is perceived as having any of those characteristics.

POSITION: ACE Family Engagement Specialist

REPORTS TO: ACE Project Director

POSITION TYPE: 12-month

START DATE: 20-21 School Year

COMPENSATION: $47,852 - $62,208

THE CHALLENGE

Across the nation, only half of all students from low-income communities graduate from high school and only 10% earn a college degree. Even though 87% of our students are economically disadvantaged, YES Prep provides evidence that different outcomes are possible. Eighty-three (83%) of YES Prep alumni matriculate to college within one year and alumni like Eddie Zapata are earning their college degrees at five times the rate of their peers with similar socioeconomic backgrounds. How do we do this? YES Prep has 19 campuses serving 6th-12th graders, like Monique Bowie. While students typically enter YES Prep one or more grade levels behind, they quickly find themselves on a different life trajectory. To combat this further, YES Prep is opening 2 elementary campuses starting in the 20-21 school year, and adding 2 elementary campuses per year until 2024, to serve even more families and provide access to a college preparatory mindset from a childs first schooling experience.

Houston is the 4th largest city and our increasing population translates into 2,000 families on YES Preps waitlist. YES Preps student enrollment is estimated to grow from 14,123 students currently, to 23,000 by the 2024 2025 school year.

THE OPPORTUNITY

YES Prep needs a dynamic ACE Family Engagement Specialist with a diverse set of experiences to make our mission a reality. As a YES Prep employee, you will achieve jaw-dropping results, create pathways to opportunity for our students, build transformative relationships, and eliminate educational inequities to advance social justice.

To put it simply, you will play an integral role inoverseeing the implementation and management of YES Preps Afterschool Centers on Education (ACE) family engagement program.

THE ROLE

When you join the YES Prep team, some of the exciting work and responsibilities will include:
Serving as the ACE program family engagement expert, articulating the ACE family engagement vision, mission, and objectives to staff, students, families, service providers, and community members;
Creating or revising existing family engagement handbook, processes and systems to effectively serve ten schools and coordinate with district stakeholders;
Assisting schools with planning and implementing ACE family engagement activities;
Assisting schools with developing ACE marketing and recruitment strategies for family engagement;
Coordinating with external partners listed in YES Prep ACE Cycle 10 grant application to ensure successful implementation of stated partnerships;
Supporting ACE Project Director in sustainability planning for afterschool programming after grant ends;
Monitoring ACE program and budget to ensure compliance with state and federal grant requirements, e.g., conduct site visits, monitor TX21st data including participation and operational hours requirements, coordinate internal data collection, monitor evaluation metrics;
Aiding ACE Project Director in monthly site coordinator workshops, including creating workshop content and materials;
Conducting regular one-on-one check-ins with site coordinators and provide ongoing support;
Conducting periodic meetings with site coordinators supervisors and Principals to support campus and program family engagement initiatives;
Participating in required external ACE trainings, webinars, and meetings;
Supporting ACE Project Director in annual Key Task Assessment document review audit by external evaluators, including collecting and organizing required family engagement grant documents from ten campuses and site monitoring visit;
Monitoring progress to goals listed in YES Prep ACE cycle 10 grant application for family engagement activities;
Supporting campus ACE operations as needed;
Working closely with Community Engagement and Student Support teams to ensure ongoing communication and collaboration between YES Prep and ACE family services;
Supporting the building of a strong network of community partnership to provide wraparound services students and families need;
Additional duties as assigned.
THE PERSON

We seek staff with diverse backgrounds, talents, interests, and ideas. Certain traits consistently shine through for our most successful employees: passion for the mission, drive for results, care for students, resilience, and humility. Other traits needed and desired for this role are:

THE MUST HAVES
Bachelors degree from an accredited four-year educational institution
Community and family services experience
Excellent organizational, time management, and communication skills
Fluent in Spanish
Belief in and commitment to the mission and core value of YES Prep Public Schools
Openness to giving and receiving frequent feedback
Ability to maintain emotional control under stress
Ability to work urgently in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment
Ability to juggle multiple tasks and initiatives at once
Demonstrated ability to work on a team
A dedication to learn, grow, and develop as a professional
THE NICE TO HAVES
Groups facilitation and team management experience
21st CCLC grant experience
THE PERKS
Compensation This position is an exempt, salaried, grant-funded position; offers commensurate with experience and the grant.
Health and Supplemental Insurance A $10.00 medical option that includes $600 towards a Health Savings Account, in addition to a variety of supplemental benefits including Dental, Vision, Short and Long-Term Disability, Pet Insurance, Life, etc.
Retirement Plans Participation in Teacher Retirement System of Texas and a 457 Retirement Plan.
Paid Time Off 15 days of Paid Time Off in addition to the system closures of our Academic Calendar.
Paid Leave Programming In the event you need to be out due to medical needs (including maternity and paternity leave), YES Prep offers 6 - 12 weeks of full paid leave.
Professional Development - YES Prep values longevity and performance over time. We invest in developing leaders through high-quality programs, effective coaching, and ongoing professional development.
Award Winning Culture The strong cultures of our campuses and Home Office are just one of many reasons we were named Houstons Best Place to work in 2018 and 2019. We won the 2012 Broad Prize for Excellence in Urban Education and were a 2016 finalist as well.
WE ARE DEEPLY COMMITTED TO EQUITY & DIVERSITY

YES Prep strives to recruit a diverse team of leaders. We believe there is a transformative academic and social benefit for students when their teachers and leaders reflect a diversity of backgrounds. Ninety-five percent (95%) of staff members agree that the organization provides a welcoming environment given their background and identity according to our latest system survey.

YES Prep is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or parenthood.

THE NEXT STEPS

TheAmerican Academy of Dermatology is seeking a Senior Public Relations Specialistlocated in Rosemont, IL.This position will be responsible for conducting the Academy’s national media and public relations activities, specializing in the promotion of new scientific research in dermatology. This includes, but is not limited to, reviewing, promoting and responding to dermatology-related research; developing news releases, media pitches and key messages, and organizing media activities prior to and during the AAD Annual Meeting and Innovation Academy.

About Us:

TheAmerican Academy of Dermatology (Academy), founded in 1938, is the largest, most influential, and most representative of all dermatologic associations. A sister organization to the Academy, the American Academy of Dermatology Association is the resource for government affairs, health policy and practice information for dermatologists, and plays a major role in formulating policies that can enhance the quality of dermatologic care.

Witha membership of more than 20,746 physicians worldwide, the Academy is committed to: advancing the diagnosis and medical, surgical, and cosmetic treatment of the skin, hair and nails; advocating high standards in clinical practice, education, and research in dermatology; and supporting and enhancing patient care for a lifetime of healthier skin.

-Instagram (www.instagram.com/aadskin1)

Responsibilities:
Monitorcurrent issues/events affecting dermatology and respond to national and local media inquiries for information and interviews daily. Provide counsel on high-profile media inquiries to senior staff and member leadership.Includes providing contact information for dermatologists with a particular expertise, drafting talking points, and coordinating interviews for the Academy president.Establish and maintain relationships with key members of the media.Determine and evaluate the effectiveness of the Academy’s media relations efforts. Analyze this data and make recommendations for the AAD’s future media relations activities.
Researchand write news releases for the Academy’s media events and other programs, as assigned, including the Annual and Summer meetings and SPOT Skin Cancer utilizing AP Style. This includes coordinating the topic selection process, communicating with the physicians, and coordinating physician and Council review/approval.Responsible for the press office and other media-related logistics on-site for the AAD Annual Meeting and Innovation Academy.
Serveas the departmental liaison to theJournal of the American Academy of Dermatology. Review accepted articles for potential topics of interest to the public and/or the media, as well as articles that may be appropriate for member communications or those that support the Academy’s advocacy and specialty positioning efforts. Develop news releases and media pitches to promote selected articles to the national media and distribute them through the appropriate channels.
Managethe Academy’s online Media Relations Toolkit, updating content as necessary to reflect current dermatology issues in the news. Develop and distribute the Academy’s Key Messages and update the Academy’s fact sheets. Ensure that information presented in the Key Messages, fact sheets and other Academy communications is accurate and consistent. Coordinate and promote resources for National Healthy Skin Month.
Contributeto the continued development of the Academy’s strategic communications plan, including assisting with the development and implementation of integrated communications plans for Academy issues such as the specialty positioning initiative.Identify emerging science/research that will impact the Academy’s public, member, and stakeholder communications. Assist the Director and Associate Director with the Academy’s crisis communications.
Developand implement strategic communications plans, including media relations and public education components, for the Academy’s integrated communications efforts targeting the public, patients and media, as well as the Academy’s scientific agenda.Work with colleagues in Publishing and Marketing to ensure consistent and accurate branding and messaging across all forms of the Academy’s written and visual communications.Serve as the Communications Department’s liaison to the Science, Quality and Practice Department, and represent the Integrated Communications Division on the core guideline staff stakeholder group.
Provideoverall staffing to assigned council, committees and task forces in conjunction with the staff liaisons and chairs of these organizational groups.This includes drafting programs/strategies to be discussed and reviewed via email ballot, conference call or meeting, tracking follow-ups, incorporating feedback and assisting with developing and monitoring the committee budget.
Assistthe Director and Associate Director with recommending and determining appropriate strategic and financial goals that relate to the department and the overall Academy mission. Develop and implement programs to fulfill these goals.Assist in the development of the departmental budget, monitor revenue and expenses, and assist with quarterly variance reports.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Communications, English or Journalism.
Minimum three to five years of public/media relations experience preferred.
Experience with medical/scientific writing required.
Experience with public and media relations preferred.
Excellent writing and editing skills.
Proficient in AP Style.
Ability to translate science into public education messages.
Ability to identify and define problems;examine relevant information and choose correct course of action required.
Ability to consistently complete work accurately and locate the errors of others when required.

What it is: As a Solution Specialist on the Private Markets team, you will interact directly with clients and prospects to cultivate strong relationships and guide them through the use of eVestment’s Private Markets products. You’ll communicate daily with Institutional Investors, Consultants, and Asset Managers to better understand their business processes and data analytics requirements and help them make the most of eVestment tools. You will also prepare and perform product demonstrations as part of the sales process.

To be successful in this role, you’ll have first-class written and verbal communication skills. You’ll be comfortable interacting with clients and prospects via phone, email, and in-person and possess the ability to quickly understand their business procedures to effectively communicate intended use of eVestment Private Markets applications. You will provide training, support, and ongoing relationship management and proactively communicate with investment managers to introduce them to eVestment. Additionally, you’ll collaborate with the eVestment client service, product strategy, marketing, sales, and technology teams regularly. A strong interest and knowledge of the Private Markets investing environment and trends is crucial.

What it isn’t: If the thought of partnering with clients, leading Web-exes, and troubleshooting doesn’t appeal to you, then this role won’t be a good fit. We love technology and metrics, as well as client interaction. This role isn’t routine or unhurried. If you prefer relaxed, quiet days or don’t have a well-developed sense of urgency, it would be best to pass on us and keep looking.

Requirements

We are looking for proof of your passion for financial software and data. Having a BS/BA/BBA in Business, Economics, or Finance is a great start along with 5+ years of experience in financial services—preferably in the Private Markets space. Exceptional attentiveness to detail and strong customer service skills are a must.

A certain degree of personal accountability, creativity, and latitude are required and encouraged. Your desire to build working knowledge of applicable financial terminology and industry best practices will help you be successful in this role and in our company. We need excellence. This means your communication skills are stellar: polished, professional communication skills and detailed analytical skills are vital as client interaction is high. We need innovation. This means you question the status quo and love asking “What if…?” We need teamwork. This means when a colleague asks “Can someone help me with…?” you’re quick to answer “Yes.” We need humility. This means you understand about lending a hand where necessary. We need integrity. This means you deliver results with little supervision and don’t hesitate to acknowledge, own, and resolve errors you’ve made (we all make them, we just have to learn from them).

Benefits

eVestment is a leading fintech firm headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia with offices around the world. Our primary goal is to transform the institutional investment industry though data, insights and innovative technologies. Consistently ranked as a top workplace, our environment is fun, smart and energetic. Completion of high school, or equivalent.

Previous experience using analytical tools and reports preferred.

Extremely proficient with Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.

Why Join CO-OP?


CO-OP is committed to fostering a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and connected. We are dedicated to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their value; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives. You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP’s commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. Our vast technological ecosystem facilitates more than 6.5 billion transactions every year and equips credit unions of all sizes to deepen member engagement and prosper in the fast-paced world of fintech.

Health benefits – medical, dental, & vision plus wellness programs and gym reimbursements.

Tuition reimbursement.

We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. ABOUT THE COMPANY:

Curion is a leader in sensory and consumer product research and serves Fortune 500 and other blue-chip customers in the food & beverage, personal care, fine fragrance, and home & fabric care industries. In 2019 alone, the company tested 127,000 consumers in its facilities in San Francisco, Chicago, Dallas, and New York metropolitan areas. Curion's insights provide data such as: product readiness for launch, consumer purchase decision process, competitive landscape and more to its clients. TheAmerican Academy of Dermatology is seeking a Senior Public Relations Specialistlocated in Rosemont, IL.This position will be responsible for conducting the Academy’s national media and public relations activities, specializing in the promotion of new scientific research in dermatology. This includes, but is not limited to, reviewing, promoting and responding to dermatology-related research; developing news releases, media pitches and key messages, and organizing media activities prior to and during the AAD Annual Meeting and Innovation Academy.

About Us:

TheAmerican Academy of Dermatology (Academy), founded in 1938, is the largest, most influential, and most representative of all dermatologic associations. A sister organization to the Academy, the American Academy of Dermatology Association is the resource for government affairs, health policy and practice information for dermatologists, and plays a major role in formulating policies that can enhance the quality of dermatologic care.

Witha membership of more than 20,746 physicians worldwide, the Academy is committed to: advancing the diagnosis and medical, surgical, and cosmetic treatment of the skin, hair and nails; advocating high standards in clinical practice, education, and research in dermatology; and supporting and enhancing patient care for a lifetime of healthier skin.

-Instagram (www.instagram.com/aadskin1)

Responsibilities:
Monitorcurrent issues/events affecting dermatology and respond to national and local media inquiries for information and interviews daily. Provide counsel on high-profile media inquiries to senior staff and member leadership.Includes providing contact information for dermatologists with a particular expertise, drafting talking points, and coordinating interviews for the Academy president.Establish and maintain relationships with key members of the media.Determine and evaluate the effectiveness of the Academy’s media relations efforts. Analyze this data and make recommendations for the AAD’s future media relations activities.
Researchand write news releases for the Academy’s media events and other programs, as assigned, including the Annual and Summer meetings and SPOT Skin Cancer utilizing AP Style. This includes coordinating the topic selection process, communicating with the physicians, and coordinating physician and Council review/approval.Responsible for the press office and other media-related logistics on-site for the AAD Annual Meeting and Innovation Academy.
Serveas the departmental liaison to theJournal of the American Academy of Dermatology. Review accepted articles for potential topics of interest to the public and/or the media, as well as articles that may be appropriate for member communications or those that support the Academy’s advocacy and specialty positioning efforts. Develop news releases and media pitches to promote selected articles to the national media and distribute them through the appropriate channels.
Managethe Academy’s online Media Relations Toolkit, updating content as necessary to reflect current dermatology issues in the news. Develop and distribute the Academy’s Key Messages and update the Academy’s fact sheets. Ensure that information presented in the Key Messages, fact sheets and other Academy communications is accurate and consistent. Coordinate and promote resources for National Healthy Skin Month.
Contributeto the continued development of the Academy’s strategic communications plan, including assisting with the development and implementation of integrated communications plans for Academy issues such as the specialty positioning initiative.Identify emerging science/research that will impact the Academy’s public, member, and stakeholder communications. Assist the Director and Associate Director with the Academy’s crisis communications.
Developand implement strategic communications plans, including media relations and public education components, for the Academy’s integrated communications efforts targeting the public, patients and media, as well as the Academy’s scientific agenda.Work with colleagues in Publishing and Marketing to ensure consistent and accurate branding and messaging across all forms of the Academy’s written and visual communications.Serve as the Communications Department’s liaison to the Science, Quality and Practice Department, and represent the Integrated Communications Division on the core guideline staff stakeholder group.
Provideoverall staffing to assigned council, committees and task forces in conjunction with the staff liaisons and chairs of these organizational groups.This includes drafting programs/strategies to be discussed and reviewed via email ballot, conference call or meeting, tracking follow-ups, incorporating feedback and assisting with developing and monitoring the committee budget.
Assistthe Director and Associate Director with recommending and determining appropriate strategic and financial goals that relate to the department and the overall Academy mission. Develop and implement programs to fulfill these goals.Assist in the development of the departmental budget, monitor revenue and expenses, and assist with quarterly variance reports.

Excellent writing and editing skills.
Proficient in AP Style.
Ability to translate science into public education messages.
Ability to identify and define problems;examine relevant information and choose correct course of action required.
Ability to consistently complete work accurately and locate the errors of others when required.

What it is: As a Solution Specialist on the Private Markets team, you will interact directly with clients and prospects to cultivate strong relationships and guide them through the use of eVestment’s Private Markets products. You’ll communicate daily with Institutional Investors, Consultants, and Asset Managers to better understand their business processes and data analytics requirements and help them make the most of eVestment tools. You will also prepare and perform product demonstrations as part of the sales process.

To be successful in this role, you’ll have first-class written and verbal communication skills. You’ll be comfortable interacting with clients and prospects via phone, email, and in-person and possess the ability to quickly understand their business procedures to effectively communicate intended use of eVestment Private Markets applications. You will provide training, support, and ongoing relationship management and proactively communicate with investment managers to introduce them to eVestment. Additionally, you’ll collaborate with the eVestment client service, product strategy, marketing, sales, and technology teams regularly. A strong interest and knowledge of the Private Markets investing environment and trends is crucial.

What it isn’t: If the thought of partnering with clients, leading Web-exes, and troubleshooting doesn’t appeal to you, then this role won’t be a good fit. We love technology and metrics, as well as client interaction. This role isn’t routine or unhurried. If you prefer relaxed, quiet days or don’t have a well-developed sense of urgency, it would be best to pass on us and keep looking.

Requirements

We are looking for proof of your passion for financial software and data. Having a BS/BA/BBA in Business, Economics, or Finance is a great start along with 5+ years of experience in financial services—preferably in the Private Markets space. Exceptional attentiveness to detail and strong customer service skills are a must.

A certain degree of personal accountability, creativity, and latitude are required and encouraged. Your desire to build working knowledge of applicable financial terminology and industry best practices will help you be successful in this role and in our company. We need excellence. This means your communication skills are stellar: polished, professional communication skills and detailed analytical skills are vital as client interaction is high. We need innovation. This means you question the status quo and love asking “What if…?” We need teamwork. This means when a colleague asks “Can someone help me with…?” you’re quick to answer “Yes.” We need humility. This means you understand about lending a hand where necessary. We need integrity. This means you deliver results with little supervision and don’t hesitate to acknowledge, own, and resolve errors you’ve made (we all make them, we just have to learn from them).

Benefits

eVestment is a leading fintech firm headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia with offices around the world. Our primary goal is to transform the institutional investment industry though data, insights and innovative technologies. Consistently ranked as a top workplace, our environment is fun, smart and energetic. We hire self-motivated people and provide them with exceptional opportunities for development through on-the-job learning and benefits like tuition reimbursement. From robust health coverage to matching 401k and even pet insurance, we understand the critical work-life balance needed for success doesn’t stop inside our walls. Oh, did we mention additional perks like catered lunches every week and regular team-building activities?

If you are interested in joining the team, please submit your resume. We look forward to speaking soon.

The Opportunity


CO-OP Financial Services is bringing digital transformation to the credit union movement. We’re creating innovative technology solutions that help not-for-profit credit unions best serve their members and compete with the big banks. As a result, our world-class team is growing faster than ever! If you’re passionate about technology and want to be part of a purpose-driven organization, this is an exciting opportunity to provide real value and help shape the future of human-centered financial services.

We are seeking a talented Marketing Coordinator to support the Marketing Production Manager with managing integrated marketing projects, campaign development/production and cost control. This role is responsible for managing projects, including planning, budgeting, developing, executing and follow-up for B2B and B2C programs.

Under guidance, coordinate product marketing campaigns including cost control, traffic projects from creative development, to estimate approvals and budgeting, creative production (may involve print, interactive, social or other channels) and final execution, all while meeting deadlines and having strong project communication. Researches industry trends, products, competitive intelligence on an as-needed basis. Develops findings reports.

Actively supports our CO-OP culture and embraces our core values of Work as Partners, Communicate Openly and Honestly, Demonstrate Excellence and Champion Change in all interactions.

Why Join CO-OP?


CO-OP is committed to fostering a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and connected. We are dedicated to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their value; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives. You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP’s commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. Our vast technological ecosystem facilitates more than 6.5 billion transactions every year and equips credit unions of all sizes to deepen member engagement and prosper in the fast-paced world of fintech.

Blucora has a bold aspiration: we are committed to giving all people the tools needed to lead healthy financial lives - tools often reserved for the wealthy.

We began our journey by bringing together two industry-leading firms to form a foundation in tax-smart investing that is unreplaceable in the industry. TaxAct is an innovative tax software company that helps more than 4 million Americans prepare their own taxes each year. HD Vest is the first firm in the world to make it possible for tax professionals to support clients’ wealth management needs (now over $45B for more than 300,000 Americans).

We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. Atypical for the financial services industry, we take a contemporary approach to strategy and product development that is founded in user insights, rapid testing and a singular focus on driving end-user value.

Since charting new territory on a daily basis is part of everyone's job at Blucora, we've attracted team members who thrive on the challenge, encourage each other, and are passionately committed to the goal. If you agree that problem- solving is a team sport, and feel energized by a good debate, deep dive research, or a fun night out with colleagues, we might be the right firm for you!

POSITION SUMMARY

The CRM Operations Specialist is responsible for building and managing TaxAct’s email and display campaigns, maximizing revenue opportunities from the company’s CRM and customer databases. This role is also responsible for campaign deployment tasks including final development of email creative, audience segmentation, email creative proof creation and testing, deployment scheduling, and email deployment.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Managing the development of email and display campaigns

Digital Marketing Director

The Digital Marketing Director will be a passionate digital marketer with design and technology expertise, who intuitively knows how to drive digital campaigns to support business objectives. Curion is a leading marketing research firm, with 4 facility locations throughout the US, onsite partner solution facilities and dozens of certified facility partners. This position will have a high level of involvement across recruiting and client services teams to support the B2C marketing goals and strategies.

You will be responsible for developing, planning and managing our digital marketing strategy to grow our consumer population and increase the engagement of our database of 80,000+ consumers. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with excellent communication skills and a proven track record of digital marketing success. You have a flair for creativity, but you base success on measurable results and ROI.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage all B2C marketing initiatives, budget, planning and optimization

Proactively devise forward thinking strategies, new concepts and campaigns to grow the consumer population and engagement
Lead content creation, design, and execution of creative for all marketing channels
Demonstrated experience launching successful marketing campaigns at scale and managing a digital B2C marketing calendar across multiple platforms.
Measure, track, report, analyze and optimize effectiveness of all marketing communications based on a comprehensive view of full funnel analytics
Develop CRM/database strategy, including effective email program to maintain engagement with consumers in our database and grow individual profiles for enhanced recruiting results
Maximize conversion of consumers joining our database, and ROI of the companys online marketing spend to participant show rates.
Evaluate, recommend, and enforce best practices and consistency across platforms
Regularly communicate company-wide objectives.
Manage a small team, to help with creative development and database management.
QUALIFICATIONS:

5+ years of direct experience in a similar B2C digital marketing role(s)
Bachelors degree in business/marketing/digital media preferred
Demonstrable experience in designing and implementing successful digital strategies
Strong understanding of current digital marketing channels and B2C design trends
Solid knowledge of online marketing tools and best practices
Demonstrated ability to think both creatively and strategically with detail-oriented execution, constantly bringing new ideas to the table

Results and data driven with excellent analytical skills to interpret data and translate it into actionable changes.
