A Key Account Manager will be responsible for managing, and growing relationships with INAP’s Mid-Market and Enterprise customer base. A true salesperson, this individual will accept chats, tickets, and phone calls from INAP’s existing strategic client base as well as proactively reach out to customers to grow and sustain INAP’s portfolio. Total new monthly recurring revenues, churn, and client growth are the primary responsibilities.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

● Manage a portfolio of high value clients; ensure client satisfaction through consistent communication with client base.

● Foster growth within client base by selling upgrades and additional services.

● Be responsible for all phases of the renewal sales process and maintaining customer contact regularly throughout the year.

● Work with customers to ensure they are maximizing INAP’s products/services and achieving success.

● Taking leads from existing client base. Growing client base through upsells and additional services.

● Understand product strengths, functionality, services and pricing models in sufficient depth to qualify and upsell new business.

● Track sales process and forecasting of coming weeks deals and activities within Salesforce.com/Netsuite system.

● Perform sales activities by reaching out to and responding to existing clients, performing online product demonstrations, Quarterly Business Reviews, Customer Check-Ins, and occasional on-site presentations.

● Present key selling points/features and benefits while focusing the message on customer needs and expectations.

● Manage time (daily and weekly) to best allow for multiple client visits and/or calls within each work week to facilitate long sales cycle.

● Work to achieve deals and new clients without sacrificing (large discounting or low profit margin).

● Provide pipeline reports to leadership on weekly basis.

● Provide timely reporting to Management regarding daily performance and activities.

● Attend weekly sales meetings and trainings.

● Communicate any operational problems to the Sales Manager on a timely basis.

● Responsible for following client review guidelines/process to ensure that fraudulent clients are not accepted.

● Achieve monthly, quarterly, and yearly goals set by leadership.

● Achieve recognized monthly recurring revenue growth month over month.

● Ensure that client concerns are addressed, and clients understand their contact(s) to reach out to for questions/problems.

● Provide clear alignment with new client concerning their account(s) and products and services to be provided by INAP in accord with pricing agreements.

● Maintain an honest, professional demeanor when communicating with team and clients.

Knowledge, Skills& Abilities:

● Effective organizational and time management skills

● Must possess strong interpersonal, verbal, written communication and customer relationship skills

● Demonstrates persistence, overcomes obstacles, and strives to improve skills and achieve goals

● Consistently moves the customer or prospect towards commitment and closes sales that exceed customer expectations

● Ability to meet or exceed individual goals set by team manager

● Must be highly self-motivated, detail-oriented, organized, and flexible

● Positive attitude, with the desire to work in a rapid-growth, entrepreneurial environment

● Must have a background in Cloud, Colocation, and/or Infrastructure as a Service




Education& Work Experience Required:

● BA/BS undergraduate degree and 2-5 years successful technology sales experience

● Experience in an inbound/outbound call metrics-focused environment

● Experience with Microsoft Office and Salesforce/Netsuite

● Experience attaining>$1M annual quotas

POSITION: ACE Family Engagement Specialist

REPORTS TO: ACE Project Director

POSITION TYPE: 12-month

START DATE: 20-21 School Year

COMPENSATION: $47,852 - $62,208

THE CHALLENGE

Across the nation, only half of all students from low-income communities graduate from high school and only 10% earn a college degree. Even though 87% of our students are economically disadvantaged, YES Prep provides evidence that different outcomes are possible. Eighty-three (83%) of YES Prep alumni matriculate to college within one year and alumni like Eddie Zapata are earning their college degrees at five times the rate of their peers with similar socioeconomic backgrounds. How do we do this? YES Prep has 19 campuses serving 6th-12th graders, like Monique Bowie. While students typically enter YES Prep one or more grade levels behind, they quickly find themselves on a different life trajectory. To combat this further, YES Prep is opening 2 elementary campuses starting in the 20-21 school year, and adding 2 elementary campuses per year until 2024, to serve even more families and provide access to a college preparatory mindset from a childs first schooling experience.

Houston is the 4th largest city and our increasing population translates into 2,000 families on YES Preps waitlist. YES Preps student enrollment is estimated to grow from 14,123 students currently, to 23,000 by the 2024 2025 school year.

THE OPPORTUNITY

YES Prep needs a dynamic ACE Family Engagement Specialist with a diverse set of experiences to make our mission a reality. As a YES Prep employee, you will achieve jaw-dropping results, create pathways to opportunity for our students, build transformative relationships, and eliminate educational inequities to advance social justice.

To put it simply, you will play an integral role inoverseeing the implementation and management of YES Preps Afterschool Centers on Education (ACE) family engagement program.

THE ROLE

When you join the YES Prep team, some of the exciting work and responsibilities will include:
Serving as the ACE program family engagement expert, articulating the ACE family engagement vision, mission, and objectives to staff, students, families, service providers, and community members;
Creating or revising existing family engagement handbook, processes and systems to effectively serve ten schools and coordinate with district stakeholders;
Assisting schools with planning and implementing ACE family engagement activities;
Assisting schools with developing ACE marketing and recruitment strategies for family engagement;
Coordinating with external partners listed in YES Prep ACE Cycle 10 grant application to ensure successful implementation of stated partnerships;
Supporting ACE Project Director in sustainability planning for afterschool programming after grant ends;
Monitoring ACE program and budget to ensure compliance with state and federal grant requirements, e.g., conduct site visits, monitor TX21st data including participation and operational hours requirements, coordinate internal data collection, monitor evaluation metrics;
Aiding ACE Project Director in monthly site coordinator workshops, including creating workshop content and materials;
Conducting regular one-on-one check-ins with site coordinators and provide ongoing support;
Conducting periodic meetings with site coordinators supervisors and Principals to support campus and program family engagement initiatives;
Participating in required external ACE trainings, webinars, and meetings;
Supporting ACE Project Director in annual Key Task Assessment document review audit by external evaluators, including collecting and organizing required family engagement grant documents from ten campuses and site monitoring visit;
Monitoring progress to goals listed in YES Prep ACE cycle 10 grant application for family engagement activities;
Supporting campus ACE operations as needed;
Working closely with Community Engagement and Student Support teams to ensure ongoing communication and collaboration between YES Prep and ACE family services;
Supporting the building of a strong network of community partnership to provide wraparound services students and families need;
Additional duties as assigned.
THE PERSON

We seek staff with diverse backgrounds, talents, interests, and ideas. Certain traits consistently shine through for our most successful employees: passion for the mission, drive for results, care for students, resilience, and humility. Other traits needed and desired for this role are:

THE MUST HAVES
Bachelors degree from an accredited four-year educational institution
Community and family services experience
Excellent organizational, time management, and communication skills
Fluent in Spanish
Belief in and commitment to the mission and core value of YES Prep Public Schools
Openness to giving and receiving frequent feedback
Ability to maintain emotional control under stress
Ability to work urgently in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment
Ability to juggle multiple tasks and initiatives at once
Demonstrated ability to work on a team
A dedication to learn, grow, and develop as a professional
THE NICE TO HAVES
Groups facilitation and team management experience
21st CCLC grant experience
THE PERKS
Compensation This position is an exempt, salaried, grant-funded position; offers commensurate with experience and the grant.
Health and Supplemental Insurance A $10.00 medical option that includes $600 towards a Health Savings Account, in addition to a variety of supplemental benefits including Dental, Vision, Short and Long-Term Disability, Pet Insurance, Life, etc.
Retirement Plans Participation in Teacher Retirement System of Texas and a 457 Retirement Plan.
Paid Time Off 15 days of Paid Time Off in addition to the system closures of our Academic Calendar.
Paid Leave Programming In the event you need to be out due to medical needs (including maternity and paternity leave), YES Prep offers 6 - 12 weeks of full paid leave.
Professional Development - YES Prep values longevity and performance over time. We invest in developing leaders through high-quality programs, effective coaching, and ongoing professional development.
Award Winning Culture The strong cultures of our campuses and Home Office are just one of many reasons we were named Houstons Best Place to work in 2018 and 2019. We won the 2012 Broad Prize for Excellence in Urban Education and were a 2016 finalist as well.
WE ARE DEEPLY COMMITTED TO EQUITY & DIVERSITY

YES Prep strives to recruit a diverse team of leaders. We believe there is a transformative academic and social benefit for students when their teachers and leaders reflect a diversity of backgrounds. Ninety-five percent (95%) of staff members agree that the organization provides a welcoming environment given their background and identity according to our latest system survey.

YES Prep is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or parenthood.

We are looking to recruit two North American Pro-AV OEM account managers. One role is based in California, the other one is based in the Boston-Washington area.

NETGEAR is undertaking a search for a seasoned technical major account manager. We are pursuing a major initiative to expand the sales of our industry leading IP networking switching products and need the help of energized individuals to drive business growth with our key partners. This role will be interfacing with companies in New England and upper mid-west so residency on the Northern East Coast is ideal. While not a commissioned sales role, this job will be part of our company bonus plan indexed to performance measures tied directly to this role.

Job Description:
Define, Plan and Execute the sales strategy in order to achieve the POS target on the assigned territory
Identify the key partners in the territory (ProAV equipment makers, OEMs).
Develop NETGEAR business with them. Recruit if needed, Build relationships with Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Marketing, Channels
Build forecast and deliver expected sales
Analyze OEM business and drive actions to ensure sales development is inline with set objectives, goals and targets on regular basis.
Build and maintain strong product knowledge to increase sales effectiveness.
Coordinate with internal NETGEAR resources (SE – Marketing – Product management -Sales – Tech Support) to optimize sales result.
Provide all information relevant for NETGEAR to improve business (Competitive information, market trend, channel/tecnological hidden issues impacting performance)
Be responsible to run sales plays in your field from time to time, which may require you to find a specific type of OEM partner (specialists) to accelerate the adoption of certain products within the NETGEAR portfolio.
Job Requirement & Candidate Profile:
Relevant experience in ProAV sales , preferably in a OEM channel sales role for a Silicon Valley or ProAV vendor. Relevant recent experience in business development or territory account management role in a company targeting professional AV
Demonstrated success in managing a sales channel with project pipeline including administration and reporting
Self-motivator and go-getter personality; hunter; tenacious, hungry, and extremely proactive
Ready to work for a challenger in a challenging market: tenacity, agility, recognition will come over time and initial failure should not be a stopper.
Dynamic and Entrepreneurial personality to develop relationship at different levels in OEM partner organizations.
Strong presentation-, analytical, interpersonal and business relationship building skills.
Good level of written and spoken English
Have an understanding of the ‘economics’ of OEM partnering and how partnership requirements change over time
Understand how vendors and partners work together to achieve customer satisfaction and competitiveness
You must understand the importance of Networking to a pro-AV solution deployment. Ideally you would bring a minimum of 5-10 years of experience in the professional Audio-Visual industry in a similar role.
You will be on the road for more than 50% of the time – from joint calls to integrators and end-customers with the OEMs, to generating awareness/preference/leads at trade shows, to working the corridors of influence at the OEM’s offices to drive integration of NETGEAR products as part of the OEM’s solution offering.
Your presence will be felt and these OEMs and their personnel must view you as their most-trusted network equipment player as they take their pro-AV business forward
NETGEAR (NASDAQ: NTGR) is a global networking company that delivers innovative products to consumers, businesses and service providers. The Company's products are built on a variety of proven technologies such as wireless (WiFi and LTE), Ethernet and powerline, with a focus on reliability and ease-of-use. The product line consists of wired and wireless devices that enable networking, broadband access and network connectivity. NETGEAR products are sold in approximately 23,000 retail locations around the globe, and through approximately 22,000 value-added resellers, as well as multiple major cable, mobile and wireline service providers around the world. The company's headquarters are in San Jose, Calif., with additional offices in approximately 25 countries. More information is available from the NETGEAR investor page.

NETGEAR is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best available people in every job. It also prohibits unlawful discrimination based on the perception that anyone has any of those characteristics, or is associated with a person who has or is perceived as having any of those characteristics.

The Social Paid Media Specialist


STORYTELLER | SOCIAL AD-GURU | GOAL-GETTER

A Cloud Guru is seeking a Social Paid Media Specialist to grow and manage social advertising efforts, with the intent to drive awareness, engagement, leads, revenue, and new customer acquisition. As the Social Paid Media Specialist you will strategize, launch, and optimize media campaigns through major social ad platforms in order to hit acquisition goals.

Hello, we're A Cloud Guru


Our friends call us ACG.

We're on a mission to teach the WORLD to cloud. A Cloud Guru is the largest online cloud school on the planet. Our training feels more like logging into Netflix or Spotify - it's entertaining and playful. The people are the #1 reason employees say they stay at ACG. We're a quirky, tight-knit crew that cares about our customers and each other. No egos here. Our leaders encourage thoughtfulness, compassion, being humble, and we have a bit of fun along the way.

It's an exciting time to join the team, because we're in a really unique space. We have an amazing product that people want, and we're in an industry that's tripling in size overnight.

What makes the Marketing team awesome...


We design the graphics, write the words, and funnel the funnels. We bring the brand to life with a sidecar of delight along for the ride in every interaction with our students. Play around with a brand that understands the value of not being stuffy and corporate, even on the business side. Everyone is receptive and encouraging of new ideas. There's a lot of creativity and bouncing ideas off of each other. We believe everyone brings value. It's refreshing and energizing to be in a collaborative environment like that.

We're always looking for fun and creative ways to go above and beyond what's necessary or just good enough. It can be something simple that other organizations might not consider worth the time, like adding an animated GIF to an email or spending a little more time on a landing page to make the experience a bit more special. It's all about giving our students a little bit more joy in any way we can. - Matt, River-tubing Guru (and Creative Director)

As a Social Paid Media Specialist at ACG, you'll get to:
Develop A Cloud Guru's paid customer acquisition strategy across all social advertising channels designed to amplify our voice and meet growth goals within an approved media budget.
Collaborate closely with the Marketing & Creative teams to develop paid B2B and B2C campaigns to support growth at various stages of the marketing funnel.
Regularly analyze the performance of digital advertising programs, focusing on proactive course-correction to meet goals.
Own our social paid landing page strategy & inventory You understand what makes a well-converting landing page and know the levers to pull to improve it. You'll be able to collaborate with in-house CRO and UX experts as well.
Use data from cross-functional resources to inform social paid media strategy, ideate on and launch new campaigns.
Monitor paid traffic performance and site analytics using Google Analytics.
Collaborate with non-paid social, SEO and CRO roles for action items.
Utilize cutting-edge tools outside of native analytics for optimization of campaigns and reporting.
What you bring to the table


We focus on hiring values aligned people, because we believe the right person can learn all the things to be successful in their role. Self-confidence plays a big part in what you apply for. We encourage all job applicants to apply even if they are nervous to do so. College degrees aren't required for any roles, and career gaps or switches are totally welcome.
3-5 years experience in paid user acquisition, paid media, and funnel marketing at a fast-growing startup or digital advertising agency
Experience managing fast-growing projects on a large scale working cross-functionally with many collaborators (aka you're a team player)
Experience with Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, Quora, Reddit, and other social ad platforms
When to use which type of ad Text, Display, Video, and HTML5 ads
You're a storyteller of data and you use Google Analytics to help you create that story
You have planned, managed, implemented, and measured paid social advertising campaigns with a focus on performance and positive ROI and you've gotten results!
You're a reporting-guru and you know how to get actionable insights from reports and you understand the context of numbers
You have a solid understanding of content marketing, performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition
Demonstrable experience in both B2C signup acquisition funnels as well as B2B lead-gen acquisition funnels
We want the people who care about doing a good job. The ones who have the humility and hunger to learn. - Sam Kroonenburg, Co-Founder and CEO

More than a job


Where you work isn't just a career decision -- it's a life decision. We get it. That's why we want all of our Gurus to feel a sense of belonging that comes from feeling supported in all areas of their lives. Everyone has family, friends and interests outside of their careers, so we offer perks and benefits to make work, work better for you.
4 weeks PTO, plus 10 sick days, and holidays. Whether it's hiking to a waterfall in Costa Rica or bonding with your couch, we all need downtime. All Gurus get four weeks paid time off, 10 sick days, and enough holiday to make a banker blush.
Let's get lunch. Lunches are catered three times per week, and our kitchen stays stocked with a smorgasbord of the team's most requested snacks and drinks.
Parking is on us. We have your Downtown parking covered. We offer paid garage parking nearby the office. We also have perks for going green by walking and taking public transit.
We've got you covered. We offer insurance plans that pay for 100% of your medical, dental, and vision, and 80% for your family/dependents.
Gender-neutral paid parental leave. Expanding your family? We offer 12 weeks of gender-neutral paid parental leave, and reimburse up to $10,000 for eligible adoption expenses.
$1,000 continuing education budget. All Gurus get $250 a quarter to spend on personal development, and 2 hours each week reserved for learning something new.
What's the interview process like at ACG?


Applying for a job can feel intimidating and like a full-time job of its own. You shouldn't have to burn through a week of sick time or all your best out-of-office excuses just to put feelers out for a new career opportunity. We want to be as transparent about the process as possible to help ease your mind. It's our goal to provide you a fair, efficient interviewing experience that respects you and your time and to do it all with a sidecar of delight.

Once you submit an application, we'll review it. If you're a good fit, you'll have an initial chat with a recruiter over the phone. A phone interview with a manager typically follows. Depending on your role, you might then be asked to do a little homework (but nothing too time consuming). Then we'll schedule a Zoom call to meet other members of the team, answer any questions you have, and give you a feel for what it's really like to work at ACG. If you're on the fence, just give it a try.

Keep being awesome, Cloud Gurus.

Signature Systems Group is a high-growth manufacturer of composite matting for temporary roadways and access platforms used across multiple industries including oil and gas, construction, transmission and distribution, military and special events. To date, our products can be found in more than 60 countries and many of the world’s highest profile events, making Signature the largest modular flooring and turf protection company in the world. We are headquartered in Flower Mound, with facilities in Orlando, Los Angeles and Darlington, U.K.

Our industry-leading products have a strong value proposition, providing solutions that help companies large and small protect people, property and their bottom line at even the most challenging work sites. There’s tremendous potential for market share growth in untapped markets that have used inferior solutions and materials for decades.

Signature works where our customers work, with products that provide real-world solutions for safety, superior strength and protection, and a provable long-term return on investment.

The Role

We are seeking an enthusiastic, forward thinking, results-driven sales representative with a proven track record in developing new business and aggressively growing marketing share to join our team! This individual is a strong communicator with a strategic sales approach. This role reports to the Director of Sales.

The E-Commerce Account Manager for Palram Americas, Inc., based in the home office at the Kutztown facility, is responsible for developing the E-Commerce Program through existing channels and new customer acquisition in a B2B environment. This role requires constructive cross functional cooperation with other departments including Marketing and Supply Chain to improve online product content and customer experience with an end goal of maximizing company return. This role will analyze, organize, and update a wide range of information including program functionality, product assortments, and pricing in order to develop improvements and provide feedback and reporting to the Business Unit Manager.

Receive Assignment From: Business Unit Manager

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

• Operate as the lead point of contact for any and all matters specific to assigned Customers

• Identifies new sales opportunities via new and existing customers.

• Prepares and presents program proposals to prospective customers.

• Reviews online marketing content and works with Marketing to develop and improve content continually.

• Work with marketing and sales team to implement marketing plans which maximize sales performance

• Develops promotional pricing where appropriate

• Utilize Company and Customer systems for reporting and data gathering.

• Provides analysis of sales performance with recommendations for improvement and identifies trending in e-commerce best practices to enhance Palram customer experience

• Prepare complete, accurate and detailed reports within established timelines (weekly, monthly, and special reports as needed)

• Suggests and initiates new product configurations as needed to support the business from initial approval to new product creation.

• Coordinates with supply chain on appropriate inventory levels and monitoring of slow-moving items

• Follows up with customers pertaining to delivery/order status, shipment tracking, clarifications, technical inquiries and coordination of product returns

• Resolves account questions regarding pricing, shortages, and variables in returns by coordinating with other departments

• Improves business processes that impact customer satisfaction via problem order resolution from initiation to conclusion via cross functional collaboration

• Utilizes Palram’s CRM system to develop and maintain strategic target list for new business opportunities

• Responsible to perform other duties and activities as directed

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.

• Bachelor’s degree (B.A) required

• A minimum of 1 year working in an e-commerce environment

• Energetic and positive attitude

• Creativity and innovation when driving sales performance

• Detail oriented with problem solving abilities

• Critical reasoning skills

• Strong multi-tasking skills

• Solid basic math and analytical skills

• History of utilizing data analysis in decision making

• Exhibit excellent communication and organizational skills

• Computer skills to include an excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook) along with ability to adapt to internal ERP systems (SAP experience preferred)

• Ability to define products, gather data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions

• Ability to work well with others in a team approach

• Punctual and strong work ethic

• Possess professional phone manner and presence

• Ability to read, analyze and interpret business correspondence and technical procedures and processes to offer solutions/ideas

• Good conflict resolution skills and ability to react professionally to a diverse range of customer interactions

• Ability to use independent judgment to act responsibly and professionally in all interactions with speed to market

Requirements
Minimum 1 year working in an e-commerce environment

POSITION SUMMARY
Are you searching for a new sales position that offers independence, opportunities to interact with others, variety and change along with freedom from rigid structure? If you are a risk-taking, socially poised, sales professional that is open-mined to learning more about a new Account Manager role, keep reading.

IDL Print is about building profound relationships with brands and retailers through the vibrant power of production and we are looking for a true relationship builder that considers themselves self-confident, persuasive, stimulating, fast-paced and inspiring for a new Account Manager role.

If you are interested in learinging more about the Account Manager role with IDL, please click Apply Now for immediate consideration.
ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT:
Above all else you should be fierce with a passion for growth and increasing sales revenue.
Always willing to put the client first.
Making connections with people, motivating and inspiring them to achieve results.
Maintaining relationships and being ambitious as you build effective partnerships with new clients to help grow the company’s portfolio.
Participating in the development of innovative proposals to capture both account growth and new business opportunities.
Ensuring the meeting of volume and revenue targets for each account.
Building new relationships and nurturing existing relationships with internal and external clients.
Participating in meetings with existing clients and internal teams to identify adequate new services/offerings to meet clients’ evolving needs as required; serves as the Subject Matter Expert on processes, capacity, timelines, etc.
Ensuring high quality standards in all client deliverables.
Partnering with the client, the Account Team, and project teams to resolve identified project issues.
Partnering with Client Integration and the Account Team to ensure a smooth transition for new clients; attend pre-integration and planning meetings as needed.
Participating in cross-functional teams to develop and/or adapt processes, policies, and workflows to improve efficiency, accuracy, speed, quality, etc.
Providing solutions for business-related issues and situations and generate specific plans that achieve objectives.
Managing and balancing marketing budgets to maximize Return on Investment (ROI) and drive incremental sales.
Providing expertise on customer pricing and promotional planning.
Planning, directing, and coordinating activities of employee(s) to ensure goals or objectives are accomplished.
Developing a team.
DO YOU HAVE EXPERIENCE WITH:
A high degree of “selling”, whether of ideas and policies within the organization, or products or services in the marketplace.
Thriving in an environment that is fast paced and results oriented.
Being responsible for understanding the needs of clients as well as having a firm grasp on manufacturing techniques that could be employed as part of the solution.
Partnering with a broader project team to ensure deliverables are completed on time and on budget.
Utilizing an understanding of the Company's and the client's industry, business, and products to identify opportunities to sell additional solutions to meet existing client needs.
WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE:
Poise and an engaging, empathetic communication style based on natural warmth and enthusiasm is the key to achieving the goals of this job.
The work involves driving toward results by enrolling the commitment and buy-in of others. While the job requires strong initiative and self-direction, results are only achieved with and through people.
A self-confident, extroverted style that can enliven, engage and positively impact individuals and groups is essential.
A sincere appreciation for people and how they are each uniquely motivated is the foundation for designing and implementing interactive communication and decision-making processes.
Knowledge and skill in how to successfully influence and persuade others by understanding how their individual needs and motivations link to goals is essential.
Because goals and desired results can quickly change, the job requires regularly meeting and pro-actively establishing relationships with new groups. The ability to understand, quickly react and motivate others to adapt to the changing organization environment is a critical key to success. In general, the core of this position requires a motivated and motivating team builder and organization developer.
JOB CHARACTERISTICS:
Variety of activities
Multiple projects occurring simultaneously
Multi-tasking
Sense of urgency for goal achievement
Fast-paced environment
People/relationships focus
Team building
Inspire, motivate others, and engage their commitment
Involve others in decision-making process
Cooperative, collaborative decision-making
Must assume responsibility for risk
Extroverted, warm, enthusiastic, empathetic
Stimulating communicator
Persuasive “selling” style
Collaborative approach
Leadership based on ability to motivate others
Strong commitment to results
Delegate authority readily
QUALIFICATIONS
Your four to eight years of account management experience with brand space in the consumer industry will set you up for success.
Bachelor degree in Marketing, Sales or other Business related field is preferred.
An understanding of print would be helpful but not required if you are open-minded to learning from our industry experts.
High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications.
Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), and planning skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning).
Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients.
Demonstrated ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Ability to work with and influence peers and senior management.
Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting.
TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:
This is a high travel role with expectations of 75% domestic travel. Due to the frequently of travel, you may sit anywhere in the continental United States, but having easy access to an airport would be beneficial.

However, if this role doesn’t quite meet your expectations, please join our Talent Network so that you can be informed about job opportunities and events that match your interests.

The product management team at DrFirst is a fast-paced, forward thinking group, focused on launching innovative new features and functionality to help improve patient lives and outcomes. As a Product Specialist on the Provider Solutions platform, you will uncover what patients actually want and need in order to navigate today's healthcare challenges and then roll that information into vision, strategy, and roadmap. Working in tight collaboration with tech and design, you will bring it all to life.
We are a passionate, entrepreneurial, and curious team that is constantly experimenting and learning, and expect you to as well. You will be required to learn and understand technical and business aspects of our product solutions. In addition to focusing on the end user and the product, you will lead all business aspects including strategic product planning, product evangelism, and business analysis within and outside of the organization. You will work on market research and analysis, collaborate on enhancement requests with development teams, ensure everything is set up for a successful product rollout, and tie it all together with support teams to resolve post go-live issues to enhance our customer experience.
Who will love this job:
An advocate who will champion the product within and outside the company; someone who will look at the big picture while maintaining a deep understanding of the needs of the users and stakeholders
An organizer who can find a balance between the product’s commercial, technical, operational, and strategic issues while working across departments to execute and launch a product
An expert who can track the market/industry trends to understand our products, their goals, and potential issues they might face, as well as recommend new product development opportunities
A creative innovator who comes up with new ideas and innovations for the product and his/her team’s processes; someone who can look within and outside the company for inspiration and cues
A critical thinker who can understand the challenges that lie ahead of us, synthesize them in a clear language and come up with an effective strategy
A communicator who can determine what the client values and wants and effectively communicate how our products can fulfill those specific need

In this role, you will:
Contribute to the product roadmap by writing user stories (business requirements of the solution) with guidance from the Product Manager, working with our business technical analysts
Maintain and help organize product and project Confluence (team collaboration software) pages artifacts
Manage projects and coordinate operations across internal teams and external stakeholders
Participate in product development scrums to represent business requirements and the customer’s voice to the development team
Communicate, collaborate, and influence cross-functional teams to successfully develop and release products, support marketing and sales efforts, and streamline and enhance internal processes
Assist the Product Manager with analyses such as competitor evaluation, market trends, and customer feedback
Assist with roll-out and support tasks for new and existing campaigns
Take initiative to proactively identify opportunity and problem areas, and engage with others in a planned course of action to address those areas
Collaborate to bring a team-based approach to problem-solving

Bachelor's degree (technical or engineering geared degrees *preferred)
Combination of business and technical acumen, with a understanding of technology
Three plus (3+) years in product management, technical project management, technical product marketing or product development
Be comfortable interacting with external customers, both in writing and verbally
Able to effectively juggle multiple priorities and manage time efficiently, and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Demonstrated ability to manage and drive cross-functional groups across an organization
Multidisciplinary skillset, with broad understanding of the following areas, and intermediate-level expertise in at least one: hospital/clinical informatics, software engineering, marketing, business
Exceptional problem-solving and decision-making skills, with a structured approach to problem analysis and solution development
Solid understanding of the software development process and knowledge of a programming language or SQL desired

75% Desk/phone work
25% Standing/moving throughout the office

As an Account Manager for ProEst Software, you’ll be joining a high growth team focused on our most important priority - our relationships with our customers. By deeply connecting with our customers and understanding their success goals, you will drive adoption and usage of our software, with outcomes leading to renewals, expansion, and advocacy across your portfolio of accounts.

What You’ll Do

Quarterback exceptional customer experiences by coordinating resources across the ProEst org (Sales, Product, Marketing, Services)
Collaborate closely with Sales to support pilot customers, renewals, and expansion opportunities
Represent the voice of the customer to inform our sales process and product roadmap
Identify opportunities for customers to act as ProEst advocates (e.g. testimonials, case studies)

Who We Are
We are proud to be a family owned and managed business. We are dedicated to serving our customers – construction businesses who rely upon us for expert help estimating and managing complex jobs – and our co-workers – the talented men and women who contribute their life energy to the customers we serve, and to each other. We know we succeed only when we passionately serve each other and the construction businesses who need our help.

Our Purpose: We create software solutions that construction companies love
Our Values: Integrity, Dedication to Excellence and Loyalty

We invest in the distinctive people who lend us their talent to fulfill our company purpose. We offer extensive professional and personal development opportunities.

Who You Are
Personal Characteristics
Bias for action
Ability to create structure in ambiguous situations and design effective processes
Strong leadership skills
Impressive executive presence and communication abilities
Driven, self-motivated, enthusiastic
Passion for technology and for being a part of a fast-growing SaaS company
Comfort in a startup environment we move quickly and wear many hats in a dynamic environment

BA/BS
Ideally 3+ years of experience in Customer Success, Account Management, Business Development, or another customer-facing role for a SaaS company
Experience in working with complex, multi-divisional, multi-geographical customers
Experience building and maintaining relationships, while working to mitigate churn and drive engagement and renewals
Experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g. Sales, Product, Marketing, Services)

TheAmerican Academy of Dermatology is seeking a Senior Public Relations Specialistlocated in Rosemont, IL.This position will be responsible for conducting the Academy’s national media and public relations activities, specializing in the promotion of new scientific research in dermatology. This includes, but is not limited to, reviewing, promoting and responding to dermatology-related research; developing news releases, media pitches and key messages, and organizing media activities prior to and during the AAD Annual Meeting and Innovation Academy.

About Us:

TheAmerican Academy of Dermatology (Academy), founded in 1938, is the largest, most influential, and most representative of all dermatologic associations. A sister organization to the Academy, the American Academy of Dermatology Association is the resource for government affairs, health policy and practice information for dermatologists, and plays a major role in formulating policies that can enhance the quality of dermatologic care.

Witha membership of more than 20,746 physicians worldwide, the Academy is committed to: advancing the diagnosis and medical, surgical, and cosmetic treatment of the skin, hair and nails; advocating high standards in clinical practice, education, and research in dermatology; and supporting and enhancing patient care for a lifetime of healthier skin.

-Instagram (www.instagram.com/aadskin1)

Monitorcurrent issues/events affecting dermatology and respond to national and local media inquiries for information and interviews daily. Analyze this data and make recommendations for the AAD’s future media relations activities.
Researchand write news releases for the Academy’s media events and other programs, as assigned, including the Annual and Summer meetings and SPOT Skin Cancer utilizing AP Style. This includes coordinating the topic selection process, communicating with the physicians, and coordinating physician and Council review/approval.Responsible for the press office and other media-related logistics on-site for the AAD Annual Meeting and Innovation Academy.
Serveas the departmental liaison to theJournal of the American Academy of Dermatology. Review accepted articles for potential topics of interest to the public and/or the media, as well as articles that may be appropriate for member communications or those that support the Academy’s advocacy and specialty positioning efforts. Develop news releases and media pitches to promote selected articles to the national media and distribute them through the appropriate channels.
Managethe Academy’s online Media Relations Toolkit, updating content as necessary to reflect current dermatology issues in the news. Develop and distribute the Academy’s Key Messages and update the Academy’s fact sheets. Ensure that information presented in the Key Messages, fact sheets and other Academy communications is accurate and consistent. Coordinate and promote resources for National Healthy Skin Month.
Contributeto the continued development of the Academy’s strategic communications plan, including assisting with the development and implementation of integrated communications plans for Academy issues such as the specialty positioning initiative.Identify emerging science/research that will impact the Academy’s public, member, and stakeholder communications. Assist the Director and Associate Director with the Academy’s crisis communications.
Developand implement strategic communications plans, including media relations and public education components, for the Academy’s integrated communications efforts targeting the public, patients and media, as well as the Academy’s scientific agenda.Work with colleagues in Publishing and Marketing to ensure consistent and accurate branding and messaging across all forms of the Academy’s written and visual communications.Serve as the Communications Department’s liaison to the Science, Quality and Practice Department, and represent the Integrated Communications Division on the core guideline staff stakeholder group.
Provideoverall staffing to assigned council, committees and task forces in conjunction with the staff liaisons and chairs of these organizational groups.This includes drafting programs/strategies to be discussed and reviewed via email ballot, conference call or meeting, tracking follow-ups, incorporating feedback and assisting with developing and monitoring the committee budget.

What it is: As a Solution Specialist on the Private Markets team, you will interact directly with clients and prospects to cultivate strong relationships and guide them through the use of eVestment’s Private Markets products. You’ll communicate daily with Institutional Investors, Consultants, and Asset Managers to better understand their business processes and data analytics requirements and help them make the most of eVestment tools. You will also prepare and perform product demonstrations as part of the sales process.

To be successful in this role, you’ll have first-class written and verbal communication skills. You’ll be comfortable interacting with clients and prospects via phone, email, and in-person and possess the ability to quickly understand their business procedures to effectively communicate intended use of eVestment Private Markets applications. You will provide training, support, and ongoing relationship management and proactively communicate with investment managers to introduce them to eVestment. Additionally, you’ll collaborate with the eVestment client service, product strategy, marketing, sales, and technology teams regularly. A strong interest and knowledge of the Private Markets investing environment and trends is crucial.

What it isn’t: If the thought of partnering with clients, leading Web-exes, and troubleshooting doesn’t appeal to you, then this role won’t be a good fit. We love technology and metrics, as well as client interaction. This role isn’t routine or unhurried. If you prefer relaxed, quiet days or don’t have a well-developed sense of urgency, it would be best to pass on us and keep looking.

Requirements

We are looking for proof of your passion for financial software and data. Having a BS/BA/BBA in Business, Economics, or Finance is a great start along with 5+ years of experience in financial services—preferably in the Private Markets space. Exceptional attentiveness to detail and strong customer service skills are a must.

A certain degree of personal accountability, creativity, and latitude are required and encouraged. Your desire to build working knowledge of applicable financial terminology and industry best practices will help you be successful in this role and in our company. We need excellence. This means your communication skills are stellar: polished, professional communication skills and detailed analytical skills are vital as client interaction is high. We need innovation. This means you question the status quo and love asking “What if…?” We need teamwork. This means when a colleague asks “Can someone help me with…?” you’re quick to answer “Yes.” We need humility. This means you understand about lending a hand where necessary. We need integrity. This means you deliver results with little supervision and don’t hesitate to acknowledge, own, and resolve errors you’ve made (we all make them, we just have to learn from them).

Benefits

eVestment is a leading fintech firm headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia with offices around the world. Our primary goal is to transform the institutional investment industry though data, insights and innovative technologies. Consistently ranked as a top workplace, our environment is fun, smart and energetic. We hire self-motivated people and provide them with exceptional opportunities for development through on-the-job learning and benefits like tuition reimbursement. From robust health coverage to matching 401k and even pet insurance, we understand the critical work-life balance needed for success doesn’t stop inside our walls. Oh, did we mention additional perks like catered lunches every week and regular team-building activities?

If you are interested in joining the team, please submit your resume. We look forward to speaking soon.

Blucora has a bold aspiration: we are committed to giving all people the tools needed to lead healthy financial lives - tools often reserved for the wealthy.

We began our journey by bringing together two industry-leading firms to form a foundation in tax-smart investing that is unreplaceable in the industry. TaxAct is an innovative tax software company that helps more than 4 million Americans prepare their own taxes each year. HD Vest is the first firm in the world to make it possible for tax professionals to support clients’ wealth management needs (now over $45B for more than 300,000 Americans).

We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. Atypical for the financial services industry, we take a contemporary approach to strategy and product development that is founded in user insights, rapid testing and a singular focus on driving end-user value.

Since charting new territory on a daily basis is part of everyone's job at Blucora, we've attracted team members who thrive on the challenge, encourage each other, and are passionately committed to the goal. If you agree that problem- solving is a team sport, and feel energized by a good debate, deep dive research, or a fun night out with colleagues, we might be the right firm for you!

Managing the development of email and display campaigns

Why Join CO-OP?


CO-OP is committed to fostering a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and connected. Health benefits – medical, dental, & vision plus wellness programs and gym reimbursements.

Tuition reimbursement.

Ahern, one of the leading mechanical and fire protection contractors in the United States, has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Account Manager to join our Milwaukee office. Qualys (NASDAQ: QLYS) is one of the leading cybersecurity companies in the world.

We are looking for a Senior Public Relations Specialist to help evangelize Qualys and its role in making the digital world a safer place!

As the Senior PR Specialist, you’ll handle inhouse media relations, developing and pitching stories to the media working closely with the Director of Corporate Communications. You’ll also help with writing content including press releases, blog posts, ghostwritten articles, case studies, video scripts and more.

We’re looking for a PR professional that is passionate about technology, preferably with a background in cybersecurity, and is continually thinking of innovative ways to drive greater impact. The ideal candidate must have a PR agency background, be skilled at media relations and assimilate technical information transforming it into clear, compelling content.

This position is based out of our Foster City, CA, headquarters.

Roles/ Responsibilities
Media/Influencer Relations - Demonstrate strong relationships with key media and thought leaders across business and industry. Understands and follows the news agenda and positions Qualys and its solutions within the wider news narrative. Proactively researches new media and opportunities for Qualys and conducts regular and ongoing proactive pitches that generate meaningful coverage across a variety of outlets.
Writing – Ability to generate and edit award submissions, press releases, fact sheets, backgrounders, biographies, briefing books, contributed articles, speaking abstracts, pitches, Q&As and pitch in on general marketing content.
Social Media - Uses social media platforms to expand your network, develop media relationships and positively impact results. Assist community manager with management of social media channels
Contribute to the success of the overall marketing team with activities including copyeditor for a variety of marketing materials. Be an arbiter of best practices in grammar, messaging, writing, and AP style.
Reporting and analysis - Familiar with Cision and TrendKite. Tracks and reports on media activity, including coverage reports, press clippings and online media engagement.
Knowledge and Skills:
3- 5 years of experience with at least two years working in a technology-focused PR agency, ideally with experience in cybersecurity
Bachelor’s Degree in PR, Communications, Marketing, English or related field
Knowledge of social media and PR software including Cision and Trendkite
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
Ability to operate independently – taking responsibility for projects and seeing them through to completion. And, as an in “the trenches” team member, pitch in as needed to get the job done
Video and audio storytelling experience from concept through to production is a plus

Build out keyword recommendations to set client budgets

Launch campaigns and provide consistent quality assurance (QA) of recently launched and running campaigns on an ongoing basis

Consistently look for ways to improve current processes or introduce new approaches that will contribute to company success
Stay informed on evolving search landscape channels, tools and trends
Preparing daily/weekly reporting analysis and agendas for client meetings

Responsible for learning all relevant tools for reporting, analytics and competitive analysis - bid management platforms, Benchtools, Google Insights

Bachelor’s degree required; 1+ years of related work experience
Basic project management skills required
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills
Adaptable and able to work within a team, handle multiple assignments, and meet tight deadlines
Demonstrate genuine curiosity and interest in our clients & their business
Extremely detail-oriented, with clear and proven organizational skills
Ability to work autonomously and demonstrated self-starter
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Search/Digitally savvy, with specific proficiency at Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint

JOB TITLE: Client Solutions Account Manager
DEPARTMENT: Client Solutions
LOCATION: South Region, Florida
MANAGER/SUPERVISOR: Director, Client Solutions Account Management

SUMMARY:


Combining a suite of software-enabled services with industry best practices, PartsSource empowers customers to drive costs out of healthcare supply chain delivery. By automating the highly complex workflow associated with procurement, PartsSource delivers the industrys only online, fully-integrated medical products and repair parts marketplace. PartsSource facilitates millions of transactions annually by connecting 6,000 OEMs and suppliers to over 3,000 hospitals and 12,000 clinical sites worldwide.

Founded in 2001, rapidly growing, and profitable, PartsSource continues to expand its marketplace of procurement and service solutions to ensure Healthcare is always on. PartsSource is answering the call for healthcares strong demand for game-changing eCommerce technology.

The Client Solutions Account Manager is responsible for building, maintaining and growing strong relationships with key customer accounts.

Facilitate communication with customers and build long-term relationships to achieve business goals, and identify and address specific needs

Provide ongoing training and support to customers
Ensure brand consistency and high levels of overall customer experience

Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction; and maintain high customer experience ratings
Liaise with Sales and Marketing to gather customer feedback and implement strategies for new products

Actively develop and pursue new business opportunities and work with key internal personnel as appropriate in developing strategies to secure those opportunities.

Lead efforts to improve processes, quality and overall customer experience.
Aid in any billing resolutions or disputes internally and with the client.

In-depth understanding of sales and operational performance metrics

Demonstrated business acumen, decision making skills, and identification of new business opportunities.
Hands on experience with Microsoft applications (Power Point, Excel, etc)
Excellent analytical and organizational skills
Strong communication skills and ability to interact and present to executive leadership roles
Experience and ability to lead and motivate team members

B.A. degree in Sales, Business Administration or relevant field

Curion is a leader in sensory and consumer product research and serves Fortune 500 and other blue-chip customers in the food & beverage, personal care, fine fragrance, and home & fabric care industries. In 2019 alone, the company tested 127,000 consumers in its facilities in San Francisco, Chicago, Dallas, and New York metropolitan areas. Curion's insights provide data such as: product readiness for launch, consumer purchase decision process, competitive landscape and more to its clients. The company pioneered many of the sensory methodologies considered industry standards today, including Quantitative Descriptive Analysis (QDA)® and Partnership Solutions (PS).

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple combines uber comfort with science-backed technology to make sleep and sit products for everyday life. Their award-winning marketing represents the company's quirky, colorful culture and their over 100 granted and pending patents guarantee that this company is one-of-a-kind. Nestled at the base of the Wasatch mountain range, Purple sits as one of Utah's fastest growing companies. Poised to take over the world — or at least the mattress industry — Purple is looking for the most-rad, ultra-cool, totally-awesome peeps to join the team.
Position Summary
Content Specialist (Contact Center)

Position Description
Department:

Customer Care

Classification:

Exempt
Reports To:

Manager, Content & Internal Communications

Date:

POSITION SUMMARY

The Content Specialist in Purple’s contact center will support the operation by creating, maintaining, improving and constantly updating articles, canned responses, quick replies, macros, triggers, policies, procedures, and scripts, to ensure the department has access to an accurate, current and comprehensive knowledge base.

The ideal candidate will have superb technical and creative writing skills, an eye for detail, and experience creating content in a contact center environment.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.
Follows a deadline-driven content release calendar.
Maintains content for knowledge base (KB) - both internal and customer facing - ensuring content is current, accurate, high-quality, professional, engaging, grammatically correct, and easy to understand.
Takes lead in personally writing and updating canned responses, macros, quick replies, and KB articles.
Works closely with Training and QA departments to ensure consistency in customer communications, as well as proper utilization of KB.
Helps maintain department Policies & Procedures Manual.
Manages and completes all requests to update content.
Stays current with product details and features (creating new content, and updating existing content as needed).
Stays current with all policies and procedures (creating new content, and updating existing content as needed).
Creates sample scripts/responses to every possible question a customer might ask.
Works with systems administrators and workforce analysts to drives efficiencies through automations, triggers and macros (largely in Zendesk).
Increases contact deflection through effective use of self-service functionality (largely dependent on solid content in KB).
Works closely with key stakeholders and leaders to translate complex processes into simple, end-user focused solutions.
Anticipates agent needs with an eye for the continuous evolution of the content management program.
Works with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Manages and implements various projects as assigned.
Discovers and defines new process improvement opportunities.
In periods of excessive call volume, may assist with incoming calls, emails, chats, etc.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s Degree preferred (courses in communications, journalism, English helpful) but not required.
Minimum two (2) years contact center experience, or two (2) years experience in a customer facing role (e.g., marketing or communications) which required content creation; or combination of experience to equal two (2) years or more.
Must have prior experience working with knowledge base software and systems.
Experience working with CRM, ERP, ACD/IVR systems and contact center support applications (e.g., NetSuite, Zendesk, inContact) highly preferred.
Some formal experience with both technical and creative writing required.
Experience with CRM process scripting, design and automation preferred.
Some project management experience preferred.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIREMENTS

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies to perform the essential functions of this position.
Must have superior, top-notch writing skills (structure, style and grammar).
Exceptional attention to detail. This is a must!
Superior organizational skills and the ability to self-manage multiple tasks and priorities.
Excellent overall communication skills and the ability to effectively communicate with a diverse audience at every level of the organization.
Lead by example with exceptional interpersonal skills and brand representation.
High computer literacy. Proficient in Word, Excel, Power Point.
Ability to work independently on projects and as a member of a team.
BENEFITS AND PERKS
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

SUMMARY

The Account Manager is the internal customer champion within Dedicated Computing and the face of Dedicated Computing to its customers. This role is responsible for guiding our organization in successful execution of business operations in support of our customers needs for products and services. The Account Manager is also responsible and accountable for managing Customer accounts by providing regular, proactive communication, day-to-day support, managing product lifecycle, managing the customer forecast and being the advocate for customer escalations.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Account Management

Communications & Sales
Proactively communicate with external and internal stakeholders with the goal of maintaining and improving customer satisfaction.
Partnered with the Account Executive team, drive the account strategy including responsibility and authority for delivery of customer revenue.
Develop and maintain collaborative relationships with customer stakeholders.
Identify and communicate new lines of business within assigned accounts through marketing and sales processes.
Identify and communicate opportunities to add value to current customer programs through software or services.
Act as the primary internal point of contact and escalation point between customer and Dedicated Computing.
Initiate and drive customer escalation processes and proactively communicate with customer and internal teams on resolution.
Proactively monitor customer satisfaction level including customer scorecards and lead continuous improvement actions in response.
Create quotations and manage pricing for released products.
Establish and maintain consistent forecasting practices with the customer and, using the ERP system, drive forecast into demand and supply planning processes.
Collaborate with customers to improve demand forecast accuracy.
Recommend and drive process and communication improvements with customers and internal stakeholders.
Act as a point of escalation for all internal stakeholders.
Facilitate customer meetings and Quarterly Business Reviews, either at Dedicated, the customer site or via remote conference.
Understand and ensure execution to the terms and conditions of customer contracts including Master Supply Agreements, Statements of Work and related amendments.
Setup and maintain customer view of the Dedicated extranet.
Lifecycle & Bill of Material Management
Proactively drive life cycle management strategy and product phase-in and phase-out plans.
Identify program level transition opportunities and work with the PMO, Outside Sales and Product Manager to initiate the transition process.
Coordinate with Sustaining Engineering, Product Management and Sourcing on platform End of Life (EOL).
Initiate & coordinate the Engineering Change Order process as needed.
Coordinate with Sustaining Engineering & Procurement on customer process change or product change requests through the documented change management process.
Leadership
Take responsibility and authority for delivery of results to customers and internal support teams.
Make decisions on behalf of Dedicated in support of the customers and business objectives.
Drive efficient use of time in the business and direct the efforts of others through good organization as well as excellent oral and written communication.
Use critical thinking and experience to make recommendations and decisions that improve customer satisfaction while maintaining or improving the profitability of the enterprise.
Work closely with all parts of the organization, internal and external, as an active team member and leader.
Recommend, participate in and lead process improvement activities.
QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

Required:
Bachelors Degree and at least 3 years of experience managing customers in a related technology industry or at least 1 year of experience managing OEMs; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Must be PC literate with experience using ERP systems and Windows Office applications.
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages and margin.
Good organizational skills.
Must be self-motivated and able to work as a member of a team.
Ability to travel to customer locations, approximately 5-10%.
Preferred:
Extensive knowledge of the computer industry.
Project management experience and/or certification
Experience within Military, Medical, and/or Simulation Markets.
Experience working with forecasting and data analysis methods.
Valid Drivers License.

Job Description:

Join the EandM Sales Team and help our customers change the world every day!

Work in industries ranging from aerospace to solar energy and more….

Who is EandM?
EandM represents the finest automation products in the world
EandM is a company with a sixty-year history. We are proud of our company history and we work hard as a team.
We're proud of our products, too: our Siemens product lines are industry leaders on the West Coast.
A Day in the Life of an EandM Account Manager?
As a salesperson at EandM, you will craft a sale based on a partnership with your customer and provide a solution that meets their technical and business requirements for the project. It's satisfying work; different and demanding every day.
EandM Account Managers have curious minds and a willingness to commit to on-going training and education.
They have the drive and enthusiasm and we provide a world-class technical team and product lineup.
This is a great job for someone with years of experience in automation sales, but we're willing to consider applicants at all levels of experience -- what will really impress us is your work ethic, curiosity, and intelligence.
At EandM we expect the following from our Account Managers:
Develop direct customer relationships. Contact and build relationships with new customers.
Log sales activities (phone calls, site visits, quotes) in our custom CRM to help you stay on track.
Be able to evaluate potential accounts. Understand the account potential, competition, and business issues.
Provide sales support at EandM roadshows and workshops.
Follow up leads from EandM’s continuous marketing programs.
Determine the cost of a customer’s problem and deliver a solution of superior value
This is a high-volume sales environment, so a high daily call and customer visit volume is expected and central to the position.
If you are proud to call yourself a sales professional, this is the job for you -- our sales culture is for hunters, not farmers.

In this role, you’ll work partly from our office in Seattle, partly from your home office, and mostly on the road visiting customers.
Required Experience:

What experience is required to be a successful Account Manager at EandM?
Sales experience! The proven ability to initiate customer contact and grow revenue with new and existing customers is the number one requirement for this position.
Computer literacy required. Some technical knowledge in IT, networking, or industrial automation preferred.
Organized and committed to documenting sales activity.
Some sales experience in our industry (or a technical educational background) is required. Familiarity with PLC's or sensor products is a huge bonus!
Bachelor's Degree in an engineering field preferred.
How to Apply?

You're a sales professional -- sell yourself to us! We're willing to consider candidates at all levels of experience, so convince us you're perfect for this role.

EandM is an E-Verify and an Equal Opportunity Employer

From: EandM

The Role

We are currently looking for a lead generation ninja to join our marketing group. Townsquare Interactive is a B2B web design and SEO company which serves SMBs across the USA. We are seeking an experienced marketer to join our team and help support the growth of our inbound marketing efforts. The ideal candidate would have a broad-based knowledge of a number of digital direct response channels such as email, social, and paid search.

We are looking for someone that is a builder and thrives in high-velocity orgs.

As a Lead Gen Specialist at TSI, you will:
Support the development and execution of a lead-based customer-acquisition strategy through paid and non-paid programs, partner marketing, etc., to generate highly profitable customers for Sales.
Constantly brainstorm the development of additional audiences to present our offers
Constantly refresh marketing collateral such as ads, landing pages and nurturing campaigns to maintain acceptable funnel performance metrics.
Constantly test new offers to maintain acceptable lead volume and cost.
Build & optimize landing pages and oversee copy optimization
Develop Buyer Personas to be used in nurture campaigns
Helpful Skills and Experience You'll Need to Succeed:
A minimum of 3+ years of experience building and maintain a scalable lead gen program.
Working knoweldge of the following acquisition channels: Paid Search (Adwords, Bing), Paid Social (Facebook, LinkedIn), SEO, Display & Remarketing, Affiliate, and Email
Deep understanding of full-funnel performance marketing & growth levers (acquisition, adoption/activation, monetization, retention)
Experience with marketing automation & CRM tools (a must-have) (eg Pardot, Salesforce, Google Analytics)
Blend of strategic thinking, analytics capability, and excellent hands-on skills: you are not afraid to roll your sleeves up and get the job done
Experience managing paid advertising partners and affiliate channel vendors
Why Townsquare Interactive?

Townsquare Interactive (TSI) is a division of Townsquare Media—the third-largest broadcasting company in the country. We develop digital marketing campaigns for small businesses by offering SEO, website design, social media management, online reputation monitoring and more. Did we mention that we've been voted Charlotte's Best Place to Work FIVE years in a row? We also earned the Best and Brightest Companies to Work For award in 2017 and won the Top Workplace award from the Charlotte Observer in 2017, 2018 and 2019!

Why Will You Love Working at TSI?

We are a team of driven individuals who push ourselves and those around us to develop personally and professionally. You can expect a dynamic and competitive work environment. To foster your success, you'll take part in a comprehensive training program, surrounded by a positive and supportive culture that encourages everyone to help develop themselves and others. We've had countless internal promotions, and our goal is to continue the rapid growth of our company. Whatever your professional goals, you'll have the opportunity to make steps toward your target and take your career to new heights!

HPOne, a rapidly growing tech company that connects Seniors with the best possible Medicare plan (also named CT Magazine's "Great Places to Work"), is looking for an experienced Marketing Director to join an exciting new acquisition team in NYC.

The Marketing Director will be responsible for the development and execution of the strategic marketing plan within the company's growing pharmacy channel.

What you'll be responsible for:
Own the strategic and tactical execution of consumer acquisition marketing campaigns across multiple media channels including offline, in-store and digital media to meet business objectives including sales and profitability.
Develop relationship marketing programs that engage our channel partners (chain and independent pharmacies) to increase adoption of our solutions within each partner.
Drive the design and development of marketing creative concepts using insights and results based on best practices, industry knowledge and previous internal testing.
Manage the design and implementation of marketing tests, results reporting, and analysis, and maintain a quality assurance processes to ensure flawless execution and performance measurement of all testing.
Work with the creative team to develop and maintain a pipeline of new creative concepts that aim to improve the key performance metrics that drive the marketing channels.
Support execution of the SEO strategy and additional marketing channels as the business evolves.
Support customer marketing efforts including the development and execution of lead nurturing campaigns through emails, newsletters, and other concepts as needed.
Independently manage program schedules and coordinate with other support teams to meet project deadlines; deliver a high-quality work product.
Understand key marketing performance metrics and tracking tools to measure the effectiveness of the marketing activities; translates results into actionable insights for marketing team.
What you need:
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing or relevant concentration with at least 7 years of related direct response marketing experience.
Proven success in creating and managing direct mail and offline campaigns.
Extensive experience with testing and analysis of all marketing campaigns.
Creation and management of Alternative Media campaign development.
Planning and analytical skills with attention to detail.
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects at the same time.
Excellent communication skills to understand and present marketing ideas.
Collaborative, team player who works well in a team and across departments.
