Summary:

The Sales Support Specialist is responsible for providing sales support while developing and defining key sales processes and systems to optimize productivity and enable efficiency and effectiveness of the Sales organization. This position shall increase sales productivity by simplifying processes, handling day to day connectivity and information flow between the company’s commercial program; to encompass the Sales, Finance, Marketing and Independent Distributor teams. The Specialist remains a flexible resource, providing general sales support and works to maintain a high level of interaction and assistance for the sales organization while the Sales team executes the company’s sales strategy developed by AlloSource leadership and the Vice President of Sales.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Sales Operations
Play a key role on the team identifying opportunities, developing strategies, and designing execution of projects and programs to increase sales productivity and the improve operational efficiency of the overall sales operations.
Based on the needs of the Sales team members, management and the Finance team, create, strategize and lead efforts such as: ongoing oversight of distributor compensation, forecasting, implementation and maintenance of resources for targeting and prospecting and pricing guidance.
Primary administrator of tools associated with sales performance, CRM, pricing guidance, departmental training compliance,
Support the Sales Organization by working with commercial finance team to develop analytical tools to identify trends to make informed decisions on business opportunities.
Independent Distributor Program
Is a single point of contact for development and maintenance of Independent Distributor process and administrative relationships.
In coordination with Finance, provides data to enable economic & financial analyses including development, evolution and support of business cases, strategic planning and market analyses for the Independent Distributor market and specific opportunities.
Handles requests by AlloSource Sales personnel to establish new Independent Distributor agreements.
Management of Independent Distributor application process, background checks, agreement drafting, administrative implementation, internal checklist and process flow for approvals, notifications, and training.
Creation of and/or compilation of materials to be used for Independent Distributor onboarding.
Completing and/or facilitating onboarding to include training meetings to ensure understanding of AlloSource sales model, operations and products and services.
Identify, minimize and resolve issues that can impact distributor onboarding and all aspects of the administrative relationship between AlloSource and the distributor.
Post sign-on activities to include drafting of timely contract amendments, assisting Area Managers with preparing business reviews, annual renewals and termination notices of Independent Distributor Agreements.
Ensuring communication to appropriate AlloSource stakeholders with respect to Independent Distributor enrollment and status changes.
Provide outstanding support to Independent Distributor by strengthening administrative relationships by providing consistent, best in class sales support.
Coordination of meetings between key staff and Independent Distributors to improve communication and relationships to increase sales and resolve customer service issues.
Communicating opportunities, distributor business trends, and issues to appropriate management/staff in a timely manner.
Maintain a working knowledge of all relevant distributor issues, actions and remedies for effective relationship management.
Resolving distributor requests/complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, preparing reports and making recommendations to management.
National Accounts and Domestic Sales Support
Maintain a corporate office presence to provide daily participation and engage cross functional resources to enable effective and timely execution of Sales/distributor needs. This includes daily and weekly onsite meetings and collaboration.
Assist in tracking, updating and providing information on current customer accounts and pricing, to include account enrollments, account/pricing expirations and admin fee coordination.
Gather and prepare information to assist in responses to Request for Quotations (RFQ), Request for Information (RFI), Request for Proposals (RFP), product review boards and cross references.
Assist with updating group SharePoint page with current, revised, and updated contracts, amendments, and membership rosters.
Engage Marketing resources and coordinate product specific and sales operation training program for new AlloSource Sales employees and newly onboarded distributors
Onsite Coordination of requests for product samples, as requested by distributors and/or Sales personnel.
Manage and complete sales related projects as assigned by CBD leadership (e.g. miscellaneous requests for exporting customer & pricing information).
Assist internal Sales staff as department administrator for the SmartSolve Document Management System.
Hospital credentialing system administration for Sales staff to facilitate consistent hospital account access.
May perform other related duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or relevant field
3-5 years’ experience in lieu of degree
3+ years’ experience overseeing projects, processes or in a business development role
Ability to understand data analytics acumen and process
Ability to understand direct and indirect sales models
Proficiency in Microsoft applications (Word, Excel and Adobe)
Work well in a high-pressure environment
Well organized, detail oriented and efficient
Capable of handling multiple projects concurrently
Goal oriented with proven ability to consistently meet deadlines
Self-motivated with ability to work both independently and with cross-functional teams
Preferred Experience:
Familiarity with CRM systems and RFP process/analytics
Ability to understand and apply basic contracting terms and conditions.

POSITION SUMMARY:

We are looking for a Social Media Specialist with a community-oriented mindset to help manage our social media channels and written content. This person will be responsible for coordinating and curating social media campaigns, advocating fan engagement, and generating content and copy.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Supports team with the day-to-daymanagement of social media channelsand blog.
Maintains and publishes social media calendar in close collaboration with all marketing team members.
Clearly communicates social media calendar, content releases, and reports any changes with all stakeholders including international teams in a timely manner.
Assists with creating social media and blog content including pre-planned static content, as well as interactive, rapid response content.
Ensures key brand moments, brand campaigns, product initiatives and relevant social media holiday content is executed on time.
Works with other marketing team members to find content opportunities to be shared on owned channels.
Find ways to leverage blog content among various social media properties.
Identifies social media content to be supported with paid.
Defines content requirements, enforces best practices, and suggests ways to improve content for social media channels.
Maintains the content approval process and ensures all content is approved by key stakeholders before launches.
Ensures brand voice stays consistent across all social media channels and blog.
Actively engages with consumers across all social platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.) in accordance with brand guidelines and business policies.
Identify opportunities to drive consumer engagement on social platforms.
Works closely with Customer Service and Community Managers to implement best practices for social monitoring and fan engagement.
Tracks social performance by developing monthly and quarterly reports, as well as measure and reports on social campaigns.
Other duties may be assigned to accomplish company or department objectives.
QUALIFICATIONS:
2 years of experience in social media or copy writing.
Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills.
Knowledge of social media platforms.
Exceptional attention to detail.
Strong time management, organizational skills and ability to coordinate multiple projects/activities.
Self-starter, highly collaborative, true team-player.
Enjoys working with people and social media communities.
Contains a passion for writing.
Ability to work and travel weekends, evenings and overnights as needed, or requested.
Bachelor’s degree in English, Communications, Public Relations, Journalism or Marketing.

Account Manager- Integrated Marketing (NYC)

Join FINN PARTNERS and be part of building one of the most dynamic and fastest growing integrated marketing firms in the world. Were entrepreneurial-minded, global, and focused on integrated programs that bring to life the world-changing technologies, products and services of our client-partners.

The Account Manager is a relationship manager and the primary liaison between the client and the agency and is responsible for all details related to the client relationship. The AM handles multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and has a close eye on both the macro and micro view of accounts. The AM is responsible for setting a vision for how the account should run successfully and is measured on their ability to proactively deploy the processes and tools needed to reach a successful outcome.

Applicants must have at least four-plus years of agency or design studio experience in account/project management.

Responsibilities:
Manages all day-to-day details of ongoing projects and ensures quality control of creative work
Serves as the primary internal point of contact for all project details
Proactively seeks opportunities to improve process on accounts; takes responsibility for success and failures of the internal team
Ability to navigate and adapt to different work styles and work in the grey areas
Understands how to develop successful client relationships and proactively develops the account to allow for that success
Manages client expectations about budgets, schedules and project scope
Participates in creative and PR meetings
Cultivates positive client relationship and looks for opportunities to grow existing business; takes opportunities to visit clients in-person
Works closely with Traffic Manager, PMs and internal teams to help ensure projects meet deadlines
Manages status of project budgets; proactively navigates risks
Works closely with the team to ensure that projects meet deadlines
Resolves problems associated with projects to ensure client satisfaction
Oversees business intelligence reporting (budget, burn rate, resourcing) from project manager and proactively flags issues
Delegates work to the relationship coordinator and project managers
Supports some new business pitches and direction
Requirements:
Bachelors degree
At least four-plus years of agency or design studio experience in account/project management
G Suite (sheets, docs, slides), Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel); Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator) and Acrobat experience a plus
An in-depth understanding of websites, content management systems (WordPress), social media, digital advertising, and user experience is key to success in this position
An in-depth understanding of timelines and budgets
Creative, diplomatic, cool under pressure with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong project communication, management, and organizational skills
Must be a solutions-oriented problem solver and strategic thinker
Must be a team player
Must thrive on managing multiple projects
TO APPLY:

Please upload your resume, your cover letter detailing your agency based client relationship leadership experience, your USA Right To Work Status, and your desired salary in $USD for this role.

FINN PARTNERS:

Finn Partners was launched in late 2011 to realize Peter Finn's vision to create a leading communications agency dedicated to shaping a bold new future in which innovation and partnership are strong drivers of the brand. Finn Partners specializes in the full spectrum of communications services, including digital and social media. Specialty areas include technology, consumer, education, travel & lifestyle, CSR, arts, health, and public and corporate affairs.

Finn Partners was named Best Midsize Agency in 2015, "Best Agency to Work For" in 2013 and "Best New Agency" in 2012 by the industry's Holmes Report. Headquartered in New York City, the company has over 750 employees, with offices in Chicago, Detroit, Fort Lauderdale, Boston, Jerusalem, London, Los Angeles, Munich, Nashville, Paris, San Francisco and Washington D.C., and has additional international capabilities through its own global network and PROI Worldwide. Job Description:

Join the Wonderware California Sales Team!

Aveva/Wonderware is the Global leader for Industrial Automation Software. Sell the best!

Who is Wonderware California?
Wonderware California is the exclusive sales organization for All Aveva/Wonderware efforts in California.
Wonderware California is at the very front of the high growth Software market for the industrial marketplace. We often get to see and be a direct part of many new industries and concepts well before the rest of the world. This is a fun and challenging job place to work! Check out Wonderware in Action! https://sw.aveva.com/success-stories/adnoc
We are automation experts and understand/deliver both simple and complex software solutions. We maintain and grow long term relationships with our customers.
What will you do here?:
Develop, Drive and Close new business opportunities. You are here to help lead our customers, understand their challenges and use our expertise to find the right solution and then of course close the deal.
Leverage existing relationships to bring in new solutions. We have a very large installed base that is eager to take advantage of their existing investment with new Aveva tools.
Be the face of Wonderware California at roadshows and workshops. This is a public facing position - you will be recognized in the industry.
Exceed quotas and enjoy your success. We want sales people to do very well. We like it.
Log sales activities (phone calls, site visits, quotes) in our Custom CRM to help you stay on track. Documenting your activity is a must
Be responsive! Todays market demands fast same hour response from sales people. If you don’t jump now a competitor will
Why do you want to work here? Great Question!
You get to be at the forefront of a rapidly expanding and fascinating industry. AR/VR/Digital twins/real time 3D data are just some of the concepts we offer our customers
You will be challenged intellectually. Aveva/Wonderware has 77+ industrial software products - that is enough to stretch anyone’s mind
You get to be out front and be the face of our organization. Tackle as big a challenge as you can handle. The size and shape of opportunity in our space is growing exponentially
Sell the solutions you like and make your own path. We reward imagination and those who can grab a new market.
Have fun and work on a team with the most experienced technical staff as your direct resources. We have the best right behind you to help.
A large existing installed base to leverage! Our customers are waiting for your call.
Our marketing efforts generate a lot of noise. We try to make it as easy as possible.
You can be as technical as you want to be. If you want to become a technical expert even though you are in sales - we will support that goal and help you.
Weekly training - we all need help to learn more.
Required Experience:

What is Required to be successful as at Wonderware California?
Energy. If you aren’t self motivated then you are not likely to succeed. If you are energetic - then please talk to us.
A drive to constantly self educate. The world is becoming more complex - only you can keep improving your skills. But we have the tools and leadership to guide you and accelerate that growth.
Personal Motivation. This is sales - nobody should need to micro manage you.
You like people and you like sales. This is a job where you talk to and meet people constantly.
Computer literacy required. Some technical knowledge in IT, networking, or industrial automation preferred.
Organized and committed to documenting sales activity.
Some sales experience (or a technical educational background) is highly preferred. Familiarity with HMI/Scada or MES or software sales is a big plus.
Bachelor's Degree in a technical field preferred.

Segra is seeking a successful Mid-market Account Manager. Leverage relationships with existing base to act as referrals to prospective major companies.

Paid Media Specialist

Job Details
Level
Entry

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple combines uber comfort with science-backed technology to make sleep and sit products for everyday life. Their award-winning marketing represents the company's quirky, colorful culture and their over 100 granted and pending patents guarantee that this company is one-of-a-kind. Nestled at the base of the Wasatch mountain range, Purple sits as one of Utah's fastest growing companies. Poised to take over the world — or at least the mattress industry — Purple is looking for the most-rad, ultra-cool, totally-awesome peeps to join the team.
Position Summary
Purple is seeking a Paid Media Specialist to join our Acquisition and Brand Marketing Team. This person will assist the manager and coordinate end-to-end strategy and implementation of cutting-edge marketing campaigns across traditional and paid media: Streaming, TV, Radio, Podcasts, direct mail, shared mail, print, and OOH. The ideal candidate will have experience in an agency or brand environment. This person will be responsible for coordinating and assisting the Paid Media Manager in test design, results reporting and analysis, budget management within and across these specific marketing channels, and informing the tradeoffs/benefits of how each channel fits into the larger offline portfolio. The position will also collaborate and coordinate creative assets with brand management, creative, video production and other teams.

Responsibilities:
Assist Paid Media Manager in driving offline channel performance to meet customer and revenue targets, and perform weekly/monthly/quarterly analysis across direct mail, shared mail, print, and OOH to inform learnings, best practices and the evolution of each channel.
Assist Paid Media Manager in deploying regular testing within all channels, with the ultimate goal of establishing new, scalable marketing/targeting strategies to drive customer acquisition and business growth
Develop a strong and collaborative relationship with Purple's creative team.
Work as a fluid member with other members of the Offline Acquisition team (including TV, radio, podcasts), to properly distribute budget to opportunities with the highest return
Help Paid Media Manager in fostering a culture of continuous optimization by developing and implementing a framework for iterative testing.
Develop and maintain strong vendor relationships, troubleshooting issues and ensuring strong brand positioning.
Inform creative development to optimize campaigns and further learnings via testing agendas.
Other duties as required.
Qualifications:
Minimum two-years of experience with offline channels (i.e. TV, radio, podcast).
Online streaming channel experience (i.e. Spotify, Pandora, CTV/TVe) a big plus.
Minimum 1-year progressive experience in performance marketing, ideally in an e-commerce company or startup environment.
Agency experience preferred.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, lead, and hit fixed goals.
A data-driven, and highly analytical mindset.
Excellent communication skills, both written & verbal.
Excellent negotiation and communication skills.
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects/priorities.
Highly proficient in Google’s suite of products and third-party analytics platforms.
Experience working with different business units and different goals, including retail, wholesale, and blended/omni-channel, all of which lead to one overarching revenue goal is a plus.
Experience working internationally and creating media plans for customer acquisition in markets outside of the US is a plus.
College degree preferred, experience in lieu of degree on a two-year experience for one-year education basis.
BENEFITS AND PERKS
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

The CAM develops and closes a pipeline of Commercial transactions utilizing both direct sales and channel partner relationships in the assigned vertical and regional markets, and ensures Ygrene’s quality standards via continuous oversight of contractor performance.

Commercial Account Manager Duties and Responsibilities:

Business Development: 40%
Sourcing, marketing and networking with affiliates in vertical markets.
Conducting follow up and generating new improvement projects
Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel in designated channel accounts, and works to win and fund transactions.
Train affiliate and channel partners on Ygrene’s financing options, qualification criteria, and arms partners with the information and sales tools needed to compellingly present Ygrene financing to their customers.
Develop business cases with partners to demonstrate how our program generates additional profits and/or top line revenue for that partner.
Work directly with senior leadership, marketing and sales teams at each partner to earn the right to be each partner’s preferred financing option.
Proactively leads a joint partner planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones associated with a productive partner relationship.

Premier Packaging provides innovative packaging solutions through a combination of curiosity, drive, and a culture that embraces an entrepreneurial spirit. We are responsive to our customers’ needs, responsible to one another and the environment, and improve our processes to deliver quality products. We ask ‘Why’ so we can deliver the ‘How’.

This position is a crucial supporting role within the Amazon Customer Focus Team. This position executes the order entry and purchasing process for materials required for Amazon Vendor Flex, 3PL, or Sort Centers that are run through the Project Team. Essential Functions
Work with Master Planner to understand inventory needs and levels required throughout the network.
Enter production and transfer orders.
Adjust delivery releases as needed.
Accurately enter orders for billing.
Initiates purchase orders based on quoted costs, quantities, and delivery schedules for all items manufactured by an outside vendor, including both corrugated and industrial items.
Process transfers of inventory throughout network to ensure optimal inventory levels.
Work with multiple logistics companies to arrange freight shipments and ensure on-time-delivery to customers.
Responsible for compiling proof of deliveries from outside vendors and receiving parts into the ERP system.
Perform follow-up on outstanding PO’s and delivery paperwork.
Maintain constant communication via phone calls, e-mail and fax with all parties both internally and externally.
Communicate with clients at all levels to resolve issues and inquiries
Generate innovative ideas to support customers and boost Premier brand, product and service capability awareness
Use client feedback to improve customer experience
Stay up-to-date with product launches and provide support to clients and the sales team

Ability to manage workload with various distractions

Candidate must have a general inquisitiveness and strong desire to learn
High problem-solving aptitude
Strong organizational and project management skills with attention to detail

Job Title: Senior Product Development Specialist- Growing Healthcare Organization
Job Description:
About Fallon Health
Founded in 1977, Fallon Health is a leading health care services organization that supports the diverse and changing needs of those we serve. In addition to offering innovative health insurance solutions and a variety of Medicaid and Medicare products, we excel in creating unique health care programs and services that provide coordinated, integrated care for seniors and individuals with complex health needs. Fallon has consistently ranked among the nation’s top health plans, and is accredited by the National Committee for Quality Assurance for its HMO, Medicare Advantage and Medicaid products. For more information, visit www.fallonhealth.org.
Position Purpose:
Proposal Management: Develops proposals, bids, quotations, or other documents describing organizational products and services in response to requests from prospective clients. Collaborates with members of the sales, marketing, finance, legal, or product teams to ensure proposal content is complete, accurate, and timely. Is responsible for developing responses to the most complex or high-value inquiries including organizational procurement activities for Mass Health, Senior Care Options program, The Group Insurance Commission, and The Connector QHP. Responsible for the oversight and maintenance of the corporate content for efficiency and integrity.
Market Intelligence: Leads data gathering for Fallon’s competitive intelligence activities This person will be the internal expert in competitors’ products, pricing, membership, and financial performance across product lines (commercial, Medicare, Medicaid). In addition, he/she will be expected to research and assess national trends in the healthcare industry as well as national competitor’s offerings, strategies, strengths and weaknesses. This position will be responsible for assisting the Director with preparing regular environmental assessments that include extensive detail on competitors, industry trends and important regulatory insights.
Product Development: Responsible for assisting the commercial and Medicare product managers with a variety of projects. This will include but not be limited to:
helping to QC product materials, filings with the Connector and CMS
leading smaller product management initiatives
assisting in annual commercial and Medicare bids and vendor management.

Proposal Management
Develops strategies and then responds to large complex proposals, bids, quotations, procurements or other documents for strategic clients that describe organizational products and services in an effort to further Fallon Health’s initiatives.
Prepare individual proposal schedules, setup strategic meetings, and plan and coordinate required resources for writing and development of the proposal deliverable.
Collaborate with members of the sales, marketing, finance, legal, operations, Medicare, Medicaid, Navicare and product teams to ensure content is complete, accurate, timely; and that it reflects the Fallon Health brand and value proposition.
Oversee the production of final proposals, including creating the electronic documents, creating CD, printing, and binding hard copies in compliance with requirements.
Interface with senior management and support staff to ensure best resources are provided in a timely manner to support proposal and related efforts.
Competitive Intelligence
Identify competitive and environmental developments that impact Fallon Health and assist in assessing their strategic implications for the organization
Assist in preparation of regular competitive environmental assessments.
Collect quarterly pricing data on direct competitors and prepare a quarterly analysis of pricing strategy.
Collect, analyze and compare competitors commercial and Medicare product portfolios.
Collect data on and analyze competitors’ networks for Commercial, Medicare and Medicaid products.
Travel to the DOI to pull statuary filings quarterly.
Conduct ad hoc research to support product development
Assist with other Market Intelligence projects as required
Product Development
Assist product managers with
vendor and supplemental benefit management (for example Smart Shopper, Oh Baby, Benefit Bank)
research and response to member grievances.
quality control proofing and documentation for product materials (EOC, SOB, SBC, PBPs etc).
annual Connector Seal of Approval project.
annual Medicare Bid development.

Education:
Bachelor's degree in English, Marketing, Business, or Health Care related field
Experience:
Minimum 3-6 years in a managed care or a healthcare setting.
Knowledge of health plan operations, finance, product, pricing, sales and marketing necessary. Sales and/or proposal writing experience required. Experience with Microsoft Office.
Demonstrated experience analyzing RFP requirements, creating proposal outlines, and assignment schedules and timelines.
Strong project management skills including exceptional organizational abilities.
Demonstrated ability to interact with all professional levels including executive level management.
Must possess an ability to acquire and communicate effectively complex information for submission
Demonstrated ability to work under and enforce tight deadlines.
Experience handling multiple projects with rapidly changing priorities and deadlines and the ability to prioritize efficiently and effectively
Possess outstanding written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Extensive knowledge of the health insurance industry; its concepts, practices, and procedures is important.
JT18

The iX.co Account Management team engages with our clients at the most-senior level. We are responsible for the development and growth of our business with our clients. The Sr. Account Manager ("AM") role offers an opportunity to be front and center in driving our client's success through innovative and high-quality digital experiences.

We are looking for a qualified Sr. Account Manager ("AM") to oversee and manage our business growth with our clients. The chosen candidate will be tasked with generating revenue at iX.co accounts by providing strategic counsel, proposing digital solutions to business problems and opportunities, and creating and managing our account growth strategies.

The ideal candidate is a digital-savvy professional who is results-driven and aspires to achieve specific goals. Candidates should also be able to provide technical, product and business knowledge to support sales processes and strengthen client relationships.

This role will be responsible for overseeing an existing iX.co client that is in the golf tournament business. Ideal candidates should have professional work experience in, or be intimately familiar with and passionate about, the sport of golf.

The Account Manager will report to the VP, Commercial Operations. We are open to remote candidates.

Responsibilities
Generate revenue at existing accounts by providing digital counsel and creating value based on the business objectives of the account.
Develop and manage account growth plans to annual targets.
Manage sales pipeline and other sales metrics via CRM (Salesforce).
Establish and maintain ongoing client relationships at a senior level.
Become intimately knowledgeable of the client(s) and their business.
Collaborate with internal delivery teams in order to identify potential opportunities and to assist in resolving client issues.
Analyze customer needs and suggest approaches that meet their requirements.
Formulate proposals and manage the contract process.
Requirements
Proven work experience as an Account Manager, ideally in a professional services business (at least 7+ years experience).
Proven ability to manage and set client expectations.
Experience building account growth strategies and managing to and achieving sales targets.
Hands on experience in digital technologies (experience in Project Management a plus).
Familiarity with frontend and backend software development, mobile applications, connected devices, etc.
A background or interest in golf.
An ability to grasp client needs and suggest timely solutions.
Demonstrated skills in communication, presentation, collaboration. leadership, and client negotiation.
Ideal Candidate Background
Professional Services Sales or Account Management experience.
Project Management, or Software Development background.
Experience delivering digital products/platforms, specifically content/video experiences.
Experience in the sports and sports media industry, specifically golf.
About iX.co

iX.co, a digital media company focused on the way data science and technology can create more personal experiences for users while growing audiences for content owners, bridges the gap between storytelling and technology, creating digital platforms and experiences to help global brands engage with audiences and monetize their investments.

iX.co works with many of the biggest names in sports, media, entertainment, and active lifestyle, using data-driven insights to cater to audience passions and empower businesses to make millions of lasting impressions.

With offices across North America, Europe, and Asia, iX.co is proud of the impact it has helped create for elite organizations like the PGA TOUR, NASCAR, FOX, Chelsea FC, AS Roma, the International Ski Federation and the International Basketball Federation, among countless others.

Benefits

Multiple insurance options

Retirement benefits
Fully stocked pantry with snacks and coffee bar
Flexible working arrangements
Weekly Happy Hours and periodic team activities
Work in a high-growth, energetic environment

Navient (Nasdaq: NAVI) provides asset management and business processing solutions to education, healthcare and government clients at the federal, state, and local levels. We help our clients and millions of Americans achieve financial success through our services and support. The Digital Marketing Director is responsible for the execution and measurement of demand creation programs and automated online marketing campaigns that drive acquisitions and retention. This skilled digital marketer is confident leveraging sales and marketing systems to drive optimal customer and prospect journeys and revenue. This individual has proven experience with demand generation marketing and is an expert in marketing automation systems (and CRM systems).

The Digital Marketing Director must be a strategic thinker, problem solver, and a well-rounded marketer with a strong customer focus. In this role, the ideal candidate will be responsible for defining campaigns and programs to hit monthly targets, measuring on performance, utilizing marketing automation systems, and collaborating on forward-looking budgets to support growth plans. The Digital Marketing Director will have proven ability to manage multiple projects, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and the ability to work collaboratively.

Essential Job Functions:

1. Marketing Enablement:
Strategically plan and execute all marketing, demand generation, and automated digital marketing programs to help the company obtain marketing, sales, and revenue goals.
Develop the marketing automation infrastructure, implementing best practices, including guidelines for emails, landing pages, campaigns etc.
Determine the appropriate mix of on-line and off-line campaign elements including search, social, direct mail, email, direct response online, etc. with the most compelling and creative calls to action.
Collaborate with internal and external partners to make data-driven decisions around what content to feature, which calls-to-action to place where, how and when to improve quarter after quarter through continuous testing and refinement strategies.
Leverage real-time personalization technology to ensure the right message is delivered to the right person at the right time.
Manage the performance and effectiveness of all marketing programs and lead generation campaigns
Implement testing methodologies (e.g. A/B and multivariate testing) on all elements of the digital marketing mix to improve conversion rates (content, email templates, landing pages, offers, etc.) optimize campaign results, and measure the relative impact of various tactics, messages, and media
Develop clear and measurable KPIs and goals, report progress regularly, communicate results, and re-incorporate results to improve future campaigns.
2. Administrative:
Administer and manage software licenses.
Responsible for vendor management, including contract negotiations, contract renewals and cancellations, billing.
Adhere to companys compliance and data-retention requirements.
Potential future management responsibilities.
3. Innovation:
Regularly seek out knowledge and insights to improve and evolve work product and processes
Proactively offer creative thinking, ideas, and solutions to business partners
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelors Degree
6+ years experience in a marketing role within the financial services industry
3-5 years' hands-on experience in direct to consumer and demand generation marketing
3 years hands-on, demonstrable experience and proficiency with marketing automation platforms, including Marketo
3+ years executing email and cross-sell strategies to existing customers
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Consumer lending experience

The Account Manager provides direct oversight and management of accounts for an assigned Producer. This position is responsible to handle client interface and day-to-day contact and will manage all aspects of placing insurance both new and renewal business for the Producer.

Overview


Headquartered in Fenton, Missouri, a suburb of St. Louis, Vanliner Insurance Company is a member of Great American Insurance Group. For over 30 years, Vanliner has grown to become the country’s top insurance provider for the moving and storage, parcel and home delivery industries. Our mission since day one, has been to provide first-class insurance products and unparalleled customer service to all of our customers. Our success is driven by the expertise, innovation and commitment to customer service that our employees provide. If you are ready to join an engaging and driven team such as ours, we would love to hear from you!

Responsibilities
Prospects and initiates contact with prospective new business partners.
Markets the company's products / services through interaction with agencies, brokers and clients.
Tracks statistics on prospect lists, hit ratios and new business production.
Develops and employs innovative, creative and resourceful methods for achieving new business development.
Works collaboratively with management to develop, monitor and adapt a business / marketing plan for area of responsibility and to support division goals.
Participates in the development of agency or client business goals.
May support underwriting in fact gathering, underwriting and pricing of renewals.
May prepare reports to analyze and develop existing business profile / mix and the quality and quantity of new business.
May promote additional coverage / programs to existing accounts.
Responsible for achieving premium development and retention / persistency goals.
Builds strategic relationships with business partners (clients agents, brokers, producers) to achieve targeted profit goals of the division.
Regularly corresponds and visits with clients, agencies and brokers. Monitors the delivery of excellent customer service and follows-up on any customer concerns that need to be addressed.
May assist with coordinating / transferring books of business and ongoing contract management.
Identifies issues / potential issues and triages to appropriate staff to resolve.
Provides continuing education to assigned agents regarding company products, programs, product line news / issues, eligibility guidelines, risk and pricing philosophy.
May author / distribute promotional correspondence (newsletters, pamphlets, et.) and / or marketing collateral to existing and potential customers.
Plans and hosts both internal and external events to achieve area / regional marketing initiatives.
Maintains familiarity with competitors and market conditions. May be required to gather, analyze and maintain competitive information. May utilize a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database to improve services or target marketing efforts.
Collaborates with Underwriting, Product Development, Product Management, Corporate Legal and Corporate Communications to develop marketing initiatives, new products and the supporting marketing materials. May collaborate with other business units on cross-marketing efforts.
Attends industry and association events.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications


Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.Field of Study: Liberal Arts, Business or a related disciplineExperience: 6 months to 3 years of related experience. May require insurance licensure or FINRA Series 6 depending on product line.

Ultimate Medical Academy’s (UMA) HR Team is looking to add an expert in the Leave of Absence area to the team. The Leave Administration Specialist must be experienced.
Ultimate Medical Academy (UMA), a non-profit organization, trains students for careers in healthcare that make a difference in their lives, and the lives of others. Founded in 1994, UMA has supported more than 50,000 students through graduation and beyond through both online and on campus programs.
The HR and Talent Acquisitions teams are part of UMA’s Shared Services. From developing student communications as part of the Marketing team to providing crucial data for UMA in Business Intelligence, Shared Services oversees various departments that all work to positively impact UMA and its students, graduates, and Team Members. Shared Services supports UMA, so UMA’s student services departments can in turn support our students.
We have an immediate job opening with the HR Team at our institutionally accredited school that focuses on healthcare education.
As a Leave Administration Specialist, you will have ownership and accountability for the full process of all UMA Leave of Absence types including FMLA, ADA, Military, Jury Duty, Religious Accommodations, bereavement and UMA specific leave programs. The Leave Administration Specialist owns all communication, support and education with the team member requesting/on leave, the business leadership and the third-party vendors that UMA partners with to ensure adherence to established benefit plans, company policies and procedures, and applicable state and federal laws.
Apply now to become a UMA Puma and join a great team of HR professionals!
What You’ll Be Doing:
Team Member Support:
Manages team member situations pertaining to Leave of Absence administration which includes Short Term Disability, Federal and State Medical Leave and Unpaid LOA, including the complicated and unique leaves in CA.
Communicates leave information to Team Members, including but not limited to communicating Medical, Dental, Life, STD, LTD and leave eligibility, informing Team Members of their rights, enrollment requirements and ability to make changes under UMA policy and applicable state and federal leave laws.
Responds to complex inquiries from team members and leaders regarding LOA issues and information requests.
Ensures that team members are aware of their responsibilities and of any documentation and notice required to qualify for and to take
Handles the FMLA leave administration process from the team member’s initial notice of the need for leave to the return to work. This includes gathering and completing all required paperwork, determining leave eligibility, designating leave as FMLA-qualifying, requesting medical certification as needed, and accounting for intermittent and reduced schedule leave use.
Maintains reasonable communication with team members on leave to facilitate smooth and timely return to work; relays communication between team members and their leaders during leave within reason.
Advises leaders and team members on the interaction of leave laws with paid time off, workers compensation, and short-term and long-term disability benefits.
Oversees the return-to-work process for team members returning from extended FMLA, workers compensation, or other leave(s).
Facilitates other leave requests, which include accommodation requests under the ADA.
Administers other company leave/time-off programs as assigned in accordance with internal policy and applicable laws.
Process:
Create, document and maintain solid operational processes and practices to ensure compliance and consistency in the execution and administration of all Leave of Absence programs.
Coordinate with third party administrator(s) to ensure that they secure and provide analysis of information pertaining to team member’s eligibility status, medical condition(s), occupational or employer requirements, and statutory regulations to accurately determine eligibility for leave.
Tracks and monitors critical dates in the leave cycle and communicates with the team member and leader as appropriate.
Demonstrates an in depth understanding of institutional HR policies and processes related to FMLA, ADA, Medical Non-FMLA, Military, and General LOAs.
Develops leave related reports; monitors trends, provides insights and recommendations for action to HR/business leaders to improve team member experience while effectively managing costs.
Maintains complete and accurate records of leave and accommodation requests in accordance with specified legal requirements and documentation of best practices.
Preserves confidentiality of team member medical documentation and files.
Maintains knowledge of all applicable leave and accommodation laws including the FMLA, ADA, and state and local laws.
Participates in policy & program rollout initiatives.
Support Institutional Initiatives:
Keep current on institutional goals, objectives, and progress
Engage in institutional sponsored activities and initiatives as appropriate
Manages and assists in coordinating efforts between departments within UMA
Compliance:
Demonstrates knowledge of, and carefully follows all applicable federal and state compliance requirements and regulations including those prescribed by the Department of Education, accrediting agencies, CIE, and internal UMA policies and procedures.
Effectively communicates compliance requirements to students and other staff as appropriate and quickly escalates any compliance concerns to the Compliance department.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree with a Human Resources or Business focus or equivalent experience
Minimum 3 years’ experience in Leave Administration in a high leave volume organization
Minimum 2 years’ experience in high-touch mid to large size organizations.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in Human Resources
Extensive knowledge of the leave requirements and other legal protections afforded by the FMLA, ADA, and other applicable laws.
Strong skills in using HRIS to look up information and upload documentation
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written. Must be able to communicate with all level of the organization as well as be able to adjust communication style appropriate to the person they are interacting with.
Ability to appropriately maintain confidentiality.
Proficient verbal and written English
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent time management, follow through, attention to detail, work ethic and initiative.
Act independently and accomplish goals without direct supervision or relying on other staff members
Ability to handle and manage multiple assignments and projects while effectively balancing schedules and ad hoc requests.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Able to support a diverse and inclusive work environment
Preferred Requirements:
Completion of specialized certification or training on FMLA/leave administration a plus.
Experience working with Third-Party Leave Administrators
Experience with UltiPro HRIS software
HR/Benefits/Leave focused certifications including PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, etc.
Ergonomics and safety background
Working Environment:
Office Environment/Call Center - Must be able to work in the UMA Office for the majority of the work week.
Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed.
Must be able to remain in a stationary position (sitting at a desk) for 80% of the time
Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed
UMA Employment Policies:
You are not eligible to work at UMA if you meet any of the following criteria:
You were or are currently a UMA student (whether you graduated or not).
You are related to a current UMA Team Member (parent, sibling, cousin, spouse, etc.).
You were a previous UMA Team Member that is not eligible for rehire.

Description
This position is responsible for implementing communications, public relations, social media and online reputation-rating management strategies to support the Louisiana ministries of CHRISTUS Health, which include CHRISTUS St. Frances Cabrini, CHRISTUS Shreveport-Bossier Health System and CHRISTUS Ochsner Southwestern Louisiana. To accomplish this, the Specialist will work under the direction of CHRISTUS Health's Media and Public Relations Manager and collaborate closely with the Director of External Communications as well as key system and ministry leaders.

Specifically, the Specialist engages with audiences in those areas to support and promote business objectives through earned media opportunities and social media channels. This includes PR and social media campaigns, online advocacy, community outreach efforts, promotions, communications, online and real-time crisis management, etc.

The Specialist will represent CHRISTUS Health positively and consistently at all times. This position will lead the proactive management of CHRISTUS' brand to include management of social media engagements with online audiences to support and increase the CHRISTUS Health online presence and develop positive news coverage and responses to events as appropriate. The Specialist must understand the specifics of health care, media and social media while generating stakeholder engagement in meaningful ways that meet regulatory requirements and compliance oversight.

The Specialist will develop the strategies for social media and reputation management to include proactive and reactive crisis response; proactive and reactive reputation management and rating improvements for Louisiana ministries through rating sites like Yelp, Facebook and Google; campaign engineering; online advocacy; community outreach efforts; promotions and public relations. Working with other members of the Louisiana marketing teams and the CHRISTUS Health external communication team, the Specialist will achieve proactive improvement of Louisiana facility and physician online ratings and respond reactively to comments, inquiries, issues and negative reviews compassionately and effectively, working with local partners.

This position will require daily interfacing with a number of constituents, including senior leadership, Communications Council, CHRISTUS Associates across the Louisiana ministries, news reporters and community and political leaders. This role will be privy to and responsible for protecting the integrity of confidential corporate information to include but not limited to strategic plans, financial information, risk management and patient information.
Create and manage the social media calendar for CHRISTUS ministries in Louisiana, working collaboratively with local Marketing and Communications Directors and local leaders.
Draft content (e.g. media releases) for media or news section of website
Liaise with media and handle requests for interviews, statements etc.
Pitch stories to the media and coordinate news coverage. Identify key topics of national and local interest and conversation of interest to the media. Identify key members of the media and their areas of interest/specialization. Identify key spokespeople and prepare them to respond appropriately and represent CHRISTUS effectively.
Foster relationship with reporters and key stakeholders in CHRISTUS Louisiana ministries.
Measure and oversee monthly news and publicity tracking for the Louisiana ministries, ensuring data in the tracking software is correct and updated and properly quantifies media relations outputs.
Create and manage best practices related to social media and reputation management to include creating responses for complaints received via reputation management platforms and social media postings.
Provide corporate media measurement KPI report regularly. Understand key performance indicators (KPIs) that accomplish engagement goals defined in social media plan/strategy and ensure the corporate social media presences and monthly earned media reports are achieving those goals.
This position will lead the proactive management of social media accounts to include management of all social media engagements with online audiences to support and increase the CHRISTUS Health online presence in Louisiana ministries.
Collaborate across departments to stay aware of key issues/messages and ensure consistent branding, messaging and responses when speaking to the media, members on social networks, blog, private messages and email.
As appropriate, coordinate outreach responses regarding media channels, media influencers and reporters via social media channels.
Monitor social media and earned media to locate and address any mention of CHRISTUS Health as necessary, both positive and negative.
Identify key topics of online conversation and key influencers. Provide real-time consumer feedback on the company brands and competitors.
Communicate in a professional manner that is aligned with the culture and communication style of CHRISTUS Health and its Louisiana ministries.
Manage the collection of original and user-generated content. Source, create and share via appropriate channels deeply compelling content about CHRISTUS and its ministries.
Assist with story- and publicity-relevant photography and video assignments across the system, including shooting and editing photos and videos when necessary.
Manage risk inherent in media and social media and assist in crisis response when media or social media crises arise.
· Collaborates with Director of External Communication and the external communication team on social media and media relations, both proactive and reactive, including pitching stories to media representatives, handling social media presences, etc.

· Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, Business or related field required.
Solid understanding of the social media universe and experience communicating via a variety of online media, including the use of YouTube, Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Instagram, Snapchat, Reddit, forums and blogs from a business perspective.
Experience in copywriting and editing
Ability to work extended hours on occasion, including some weekends and evenings.
Must be able to work rapidly, under pressure, and with frequent interruptions.
Ability to respond to difficult or crisis-level issues in online forums in a way that addresses concerns and decreases further growth of issue, often quickly with little oversight.
Ability to travel.
Ability to use a computer for extended periods of time, including word processing, presentation, spreadsheet, social media and various graphics and video programs.
Ability to work extended hours on occasion, including some weekends and evenings.
Exceptional oral and written communications skills
3 - 5 years of experience in organizational social media and/or public relations roll required.
5+ years in a health care setting is strongly preferred but not required.
Experience with Online Repuation Platforms like Yext and social media and news monitoring platforms like Sprout Social and Meltwater as well as photography editing (via Photoshop or some other program) and video editing preferred but not required.

Ultimate Medical Academy’s (UMA) HR Team is looking to add an expert in the Leave of Absence area to the team. The Leave Administration Specialist must be experienced.
Ultimate Medical Academy (UMA), a non-profit organization, trains students for careers in healthcare that make a difference in their lives, and the lives of others. Founded in 1994, UMA has supported more than 50,000 students through graduation and beyond through both online and on campus programs.
The HR and Talent Acquisitions teams are part of UMA’s Shared Services. From developing student communications as part of the Marketing team to providing crucial data for UMA in Business Intelligence, Shared Services oversees various departments that all work to positively impact UMA and its students, graduates, and Team Members. Shared Services supports UMA, so UMA’s student services departments can in turn support our students.
We have an immediate job opening with the HR Team at our institutionally accredited school that focuses on healthcare education.
As a Leave Administration Specialist, you will have ownership and accountability for the full process of all UMA Leave of Absence types including FMLA, ADA, Military, Jury Duty, Religious Accommodations, bereavement and UMA specific leave programs. The Leave Administration Specialist owns all communication, support and education with the team member requesting/on leave, the business leadership and the third-party vendors that UMA partners with to ensure adherence to established benefit plans, company policies and procedures, and applicable state and federal laws.
Apply now to become a UMA Puma and join a great team of HR professionals!
What You’ll Be Doing:
Team Member Support:
Manages team member situations pertaining to Leave of Absence administration which includes Short Term Disability, Federal and State Medical Leave and Unpaid LOA, including the complicated and unique leaves in CA.
Communicates leave information to Team Members, including but not limited to communicating Medical, Dental, Life, STD, LTD and leave eligibility, informing Team Members of their rights, enrollment requirements and ability to make changes under UMA policy and applicable state and federal leave laws.
Responds to complex inquiries from team members and leaders regarding LOA issues and information requests.
Ensures that team members are aware of their responsibilities and of any documentation and notice required to qualify for and to take
Handles the FMLA leave administration process from the team member’s initial notice of the need for leave to the return to work. This includes gathering and completing all required paperwork, determining leave eligibility, designating leave as FMLA-qualifying, requesting medical certification as needed, and accounting for intermittent and reduced schedule leave use.
Maintains reasonable communication with team members on leave to facilitate smooth and timely return to work; relays communication between team members and their leaders during leave within reason.
Advises leaders and team members on the interaction of leave laws with paid time off, workers compensation, and short-term and long-term disability benefits.
Oversees the return-to-work process for team members returning from extended FMLA, workers compensation, or other leave(s).
Facilitates other leave requests, which include accommodation requests under the ADA.
Administers other company leave/time-off programs as assigned in accordance with internal policy and applicable laws.
Process:
Create, document and maintain solid operational processes and practices to ensure compliance and consistency in the execution and administration of all Leave of Absence programs.
Coordinate with third party administrator(s) to ensure that they secure and provide analysis of information pertaining to team member’s eligibility status, medical condition(s), occupational or employer requirements, and statutory regulations to accurately determine eligibility for leave.
Tracks and monitors critical dates in the leave cycle and communicates with the team member and leader as appropriate.
Demonstrates an in depth understanding of institutional HR policies and processes related to FMLA, ADA, Medical Non-FMLA, Military, and General LOAs.
Develops leave related reports; monitors trends, provides insights and recommendations for action to HR/business leaders to improve team member experience while effectively managing costs.
Maintains complete and accurate records of leave and accommodation requests in accordance with specified legal requirements and documentation of best practices.
Preserves confidentiality of team member medical documentation and files.
Maintains knowledge of all applicable leave and accommodation laws including the FMLA, ADA, and state and local laws.
Participates in policy & program rollout initiatives.
Support Institutional Initiatives:
Keep current on institutional goals, objectives, and progress
Engage in institutional sponsored activities and initiatives as appropriate
Manages and assists in coordinating efforts between departments within UMA
Compliance:
Demonstrates knowledge of, and carefully follows all applicable federal and state compliance requirements and regulations including those prescribed by the Department of Education, accrediting agencies, CIE, and internal UMA policies and procedures.
Effectively communicates compliance requirements to students and other staff as appropriate and quickly escalates any compliance concerns to the Compliance department.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree with a Human Resources or Business focus or equivalent experience
Minimum 3 years’ experience in Leave Administration in a high leave volume organization
Minimum 2 years’ experience in high-touch mid to large size organizations.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in Human Resources
Extensive knowledge of the leave requirements and other legal protections afforded by the FMLA, ADA, and other applicable laws.
Strong skills in using HRIS to look up information and upload documentation
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written. Must be able to communicate with all level of the organization as well as be able to adjust communication style appropriate to the person they are interacting with.
Ability to appropriately maintain confidentiality.
Proficient verbal and written English
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent time management, follow through, attention to detail, work ethic and initiative.
Act independently and accomplish goals without direct supervision or relying on other staff members
Ability to handle and manage multiple assignments and projects while effectively balancing schedules and ad hoc requests.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Able to support a diverse and inclusive work environment
Preferred Requirements:
Completion of specialized certification or training on FMLA/leave administration a plus.
Experience working with Third-Party Leave Administrators
Experience with UltiPro HRIS software
HR/Benefits/Leave focused certifications including PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, etc.
Ergonomics and safety background
Working Environment:
Office Environment/Call Center - Must be able to work in the UMA Office for the majority of the work week.
Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed.
Must be able to remain in a stationary position (sitting at a desk) for 80% of the time
Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed
UMA Employment Policies:
You are not eligible to work at UMA if you meet any of the following criteria:
You were or are currently a UMA student (whether you graduated or not).
You are related to a current UMA Team Member (parent, sibling, cousin, spouse, etc.).
You were a previous UMA Team Member that is not eligible for rehire.

About Press Ganey

Press Ganey pioneered the health care performance improvement movement more than 30 years ago. Today, Press Ganey offers an integrated suite of solutions that enable enterprise transformation across the patient journey. Delivered through a cutting-edge digital platform built on a foundation of data security, Press Ganey solutions address safety, clinical excellence, patient experience and workforce engagement. The company works with more than 33,000 health care facilities in its mission to reduce patient suffering and enhance caregiver resilience to improve the overall safety, quality and experience of care.

Position Description/Overview:

The Account Manager (Engagement) is responsible for client set-up and ongoing maintenance for data collection, data reporting, and PG online for Press Ganey services (employee / physician partnership, safety and future products). The Account Manager I ensures that the client’s account is setup and maintained according to the plan and that necessary information is communicated to the Relationship Executive and Client Improvement Manager to allow them to build, change and maintain the account plan. This position will be located in our South Bend, IN office.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Set up new services and facilitate ongoing updates (survey and cover letter customization, unit/specialty/provider tables, peer groups, demographic profile, report customization requests).
Use analytical skills to deduce sampling strategy.
Track response rates, minimum n, and sampling to maximize data collection and achieve client’s goals with respect to use of data.
Solve problems related to errors in data collection and reporting.
Setup, maintain and verify account information (report cycles, delivery addresses, logging calls, client contact information, PGonline administrative functions, verification of any lists distributed, perform audits).
Provide support for service failures/recovery.
Act as an effective member of a team and cross-team product group.
Advise client on report interpretation (statistics, calculations, etc.).
Build and maintain relationship with the primary client contact and facilitate a collaborative team environment to break down barriers for our clients.
Collaborate with Relationship Executive and Client Improvement Manager to establish appropriate distribution methods, sampling, and reporting requirements
Qualifications:
1-3 years of health care, quality improvement or project management experience.
Proven excellence in the support and service to complex and demanding customers is preferred.
Use of demonstrated analytical skills to identify, research, and solve complex problems with a sense of urgency.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) with demonstrated higher level Excel skills preferred.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to question, probe, and/or challenge clients in order to ensure the client’s ultimate needs are met.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting strict deadlines.
Minimum Education:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field is required

Google Ads (SEM) PPC Specialist

The Google Ads (SEM) PPC Specialist is responsible for the execution, management and optimization of a high volume of Pay Per Click B2C campaigns across Google AdWords and Facebook, as well as managing and developing third-party Pay-Per-Call and Pay-Per-Click initiatives. This position requires great depth of tactical knowledge and vast experience in paid search marketing tasks such as research, bid management, copy writing, landing page testing, budget management and reporting.

Core Competencies & Character Attributes:
Strategize, create, monitor, maintain and optimize high volume of campaigns across Google AdWords, Bing AdCenter & Facebook Ads Manager and other third party digital media outlets.
Oversee growth in performance. Manage campaigns to meet client’s ROI goals and respond in a rapid manner to optimization suggestions from digital strategists.
Continuous analysis of performance and reporting on digital campaigns.
Efficient management of budgets across all engines and campaigns.
Optimize and plan landing page testing.
Craft eye-catching and informative pay-per-click text ads as well as the continuous implementation of text ads – A/B testing.
Report on key performance indicators and lead generation initiatives, calculate Cost Per Leads, project spend, adjust to demand and seasonality.
Qualifications:


Experience in Google AdWords, Google AdWords Editor, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads Manager and Facebook Business Manager.
Bing AdCenter experience as well as Bing Ads Desktop Tool familiarity.
Keyword research, campaign buildout, ad creation, A/B copy testing and extensive bid management and lead generation experience.
Landing page testing experience.
Vast experience in the Google Content Network and with overall Display Advertising.
Experience with bid management tools such as Marin and Kenshoo as well a deep understanding of Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Experience in the management of Social Media campaigns in Facebook and LinkedIn.
Knowledge and experience in retargeting/remarketing.
Key Attributes:


Integrity, initiative, creativity, positive attitude, team player, dependable

Are you a people person?

Are you motivated by helping others?

Do you thrive in a busy, ever-changing environment?

WHO IS HUB?

At HUB International, we are a team of entrepreneurs. We believe in empowering our clients and we do so by protecting businesses and individuals in our local communities.

HUB International was born in 1998 with the merger of 11 privately held insurance brokerages and has since grown to one of the largest brokers in the world. We are a network of more than 400 integrated brokerages across North America - all carrying the HUB banner.

Our structure gives us the technology and expertise of a large firm, but still maintains the local flavor of each of our offices, enabling our teams to preserve their own unique regional culture.

HUB Gives! Service is one of our founding values not an abstract concept but a commitment. And we believe that no one deserves that commitment more than our clients and the communities in which we all live and work. Each regional hub has adopted projects in their regions which allow them to give, volunteer, engage, and serve their communities.

Check out our profile on the Muse at https://www.themuse.com/profiles/hubinternational#people !

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:

Our Account Managers play a vital role in ensuring our clients receive the service they need to properly manage their insurance policies. You are the facilitator of positive and effective relationships with our valued clients and insurance carrier staff. As the point-of-contact, you will assist the team by managing a book of personal line accounts, including marketing to carriers, preparing quotes and proposals, quickly responding to policy inquiries (email, phone), maintaining renewal controls on expirations and binders, checking policies/endorsements/audits for accuracy, and maintaining accurate and organized account files. This position will have multiple duties working for 2 locations who are in growth mode and will also be partnering with a Sales Executive to grow the book.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:

You are perfect for this opportunity if you hold a high school diploma/GED (college preferred), have some insurance experience, and even better if you're currently licensed. Additionally, if you have the confidence and demeanor to effectively interact with all levels within the organization and can hold your own while working a computer (Microsoft Office Suite and Outlook), you will find our HUB culture a great fit. You must be self-driven and self-sufficient, be interested in developing your insurance career, and taking on additional responsibilities in the future.

If this describes you, then keep reading.

WHAT DOES HUB OFFER YOU?

At HUB, we believe in giving our employees the room and space they need to do their job. We believe in paying a fair wage with bonus opportunities and offering great benefits like a 401k plan where the Company matches 50% of the first 6% you contribute, medical, dental, and vision options, paid vacation, paid holidays, and more! We offer a large selection of benefits that are customizable to fit your personal needs - a portfolio of both comprehensive and affordable choices.

Our work environment encourages critical and independent thinking, problem-solving and project-management. We trust our employees to make good decisions for our clients and we give them the space to do that. Our work atmosphere is comfortable and offers a dress for your day policy as well as a flexible work schedule.

LIKE US SO FAR?

Take the first step toward creating a future that combines a diverse, challenging work environment with financial security and career satisfaction. Apply online today!

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Develops and implements programs and processes to ensure that company products are safe, legal and meet or exceed customer expectations for compliance with national/regional/global regulations. Prepares document packages for regulatory submissions for new and mature products to ensure alignment and compliance with local and regional registration requirements and company policies. Compiles materials required in submissions, license renewal and annual registrations and maintains updated information about national/regional/global regulatory requirements. Proactively manages the changing regulatory environment for company products, prevents barriers to trade, eliminates duplication of effort and identifies and mitigates areas of risk. Reviews product labeling and marketing materials for accuracy and compliance with regulations. Responds to customers and/or authorities requests/inquiries dealing with regulations and product compliance. Represents company in external bodies dealing with standards and/or product regulations at the national/regional/global level. May assess requirements and identify strategies for earliest possible approvals of clinical trials applications.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Serve as the regulatory representative for new product introduction and new product improvement projects for all product types; participate in team meetings and coordinate quality activities as required
New product development includes design, development and commercialization of assays for pathogen testing on RT-PCR, NGS and Microarray technologies
Assist in FDA EUA submissions, EU Self Certify / IVDR submissions and ROW submissions of products
Assist with the verification and validation experimental design; coordinate with regulatory affairs and R&D to confirm experimental design conforms to appropriate regulatory requirements
Create and update design and process FMEA
Review, create, and update traceability matrices
Conduct detailed reviews of all design history files; coordinate with project management, R&D, and manufacturing as needed ensure the project deliverables are complete, accurate, and in compliance with regulatory requirements
Coordinate efforts associated with the preparation of regulatory documents or submissions in a timely manner to facilitate worldwide product launches
Assess and update design and quality process documentation as required to elevate existing Research Use Only (RUO) products to Class I Clinical Laboratory Instruments, Software, General Purpose Reagents and/or CE-IVD regulations
Identify gaps and update Design History Folders (DHF) and Device Master Records (DMR) for the existing products
Identify gaps in design verification and validation and update them to meet the requirements of Class I and / or II / or EUA medical devices
Create and update technical files
Coordinate with production manufacturing to bring device master record documentation to QSR levels
Bachelors or Master's Degree or equivalent in Biological science or equivalent
4+ years experience in a biological manufacturing environment
Must have prior experience with wet-lab benchwork
Experience writing and executing validation protocols and reports for the medical device industry
Experience writing and submitting regulatory submissions (FDA, EU, or Canada)
Experience in ISO13485 or quality environment supporting clinical markets
Proficient in Microsoft office suite
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with bioinformatics and statistical design
Experience using bioinformatics data analysis software
Prior experience with next-generation sequencing

Provide product and technical support for assigned accounts

5-7 years relevant experience
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Able to travel throughout sales territory
'Big 4' or similar consulting experience a plus
