Job Title: Senior Technical Marketing Engineer, Endpoint ICs
Job Description:
It’s an exciting time to be at Impinj! We provide Digital Life for Everyday Items with our market leading RAIN RFID platform. Our platform connects billions of items to enterprise applications providing the identity, location and authenticity of these items. If you’ve purchased apparel from a major retailer, run a race, or checked bags at airports worldwide then you’ve probably interacted with our technology. We have delivered item connectivity for over 30 billion items since our inception and have plenty of opportunity ahead.

We are looking for someone with a passion for technology to join our existing team of Technical Marketing Engineers (TMEs) responsible for enabling our partners’ success with the Impinj IoT platform for RAIN RFID. With a specific focus on our newest generation of Endpoint ICs,(Integrated Circuits) the Impinj M700 Series.

Partners are a critical element of our commercial success and as a TME, you will be responsible for delivering the tools, content, and programs crafted to help our global endpoint partners successfully adopt our newest products. You would not be alone in this! Collaboration between internal teams across the company as well as, at our external partners will enable you to contribute heavily to the success of our clients and Impinj.

What we need from you:
Be the technical domain specialist for our global partners and field sales teams on the Endpoint IC components of the Impinj product portfolio
Provide consultation to our partners on technical issues related to their adoption of the newest generation M700 Series ICs and apply this knowledge to help scale our global ecosystem
Develop technical content crafted to help our partners be successful with our Endpoint IC products, including technical whitepapers, standard methodology tips, e-learning content, and technical demonstrations
Train Impinj and partner technical staff on new product features, capabilities, and applied standard methodologies
Act as an escalation point to back-up our field sales and customer support teams as needed
Represent new customer requirements back to product management and engineering teams
Skills and experience you have:
8+ years of customer facing application/systems engineering experience, preferably in the embedded RF arena
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation abilities, to effectively represent our platform to technical audiences, both internal and external
Relevant understanding of semiconductor technologies, wireless communications infrastructure, and embedded sensor systems
Deep knowledge of silicon wafer manufacturing processes
Proven experience working with customers or partners to understand requirements and respond with technical guidance and solutions to help them succeed
Demonstrated ability to collaborate successfully across multiple teams (sales, marketing, product management and engineering)
Prior RFID experience strongly preferred
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering (BSEE) preferred
Willingness and ability to travel, up to 30%, including some international travel
Why Impinj?

Join a team of exceptionally capable colleagues who work passionately on everything from silicon chip designs to Ember.js web interfaces. Collaboration and teamwork are highly valued, and accomplishments are duly celebrated. We have bi-weekly open Q&A sessions with our executive team. We have an open time-off policy paired with a profound respect for work/life balance. Impinj has a commitment to a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome applications from all backgrounds and walks of life.

About Us

Acumed is a global leader of innovative orthopaedic and medical solutions developed to improve patient care. With over three decades of experience in the orthopaedic industry, our mission is to aid the afflicted through the ingenuity of our minds, the labor of our hands and the compassion of our hearts. The company is headquartered in Hillsboro, Oregon with a global sales and distribution network supported by offices worldwide.

ASC (Ambulatory Surgery Center) Account Manager

The Ambulatory Surgery Center (ASC) Account Manager, develops new business in national and local Ambulatory Surgery Center (ASC) accounts, drives compliance in facilities with existing Letters of Commitment (LOC) or contracts. Utilizes analytical, interpersonal, and critical thinking skills to develop and maintain strong working relationships with administrative, contracting and clinical leaders at assigned accounts, presenting Acumed as the solution to their problems.

This position works remotely, preferably near a major US Airport.

Duties/Responsibilities
Close new business deals by coordinating requirements, responding to (Requests for Proposal) RFP's, developing and negotiating contracts, and integrating contract requirements with business operations.
Facilitates resolution of customer product issues and concerns.
Act as a content expert on national contract portfolio of ASC accounts, supporting field teams with strategies to optimize existing agreements.
Serve as a key member of the sales team who contributes to strategic direction by developing, making recommendations and implementing account strategy with ASC's.
Assist in the preparation and operation of ASC site visits, trade shows, conventions, and/or clinical meetings.
Routinely update/engage local sales team from rep to manager on business status changes and pending strategies
Maintain routine communication with sales forces to both gather information as input to development of account strategy and share information gathered from account.
Analyze and interpret sales and trend data to develop targeted action plans.
Coordinate activities involving contracting strategies including sales of Acumed products in Ambulatory Surgery Centers
Execute ASC specific strategies by analyzing data for increasing market share within ASC's, coordinating with Sales, Marketing, Contracting, Pricing and new product development
Coordinate specific objectives for ASC's within the National Account strategic plan
Establish relationships with pertinent supply chain personnel, including heads of contracting and value analysis and develop and maintain key decision maker contact list
Close new business opportunities by coordinating requirements, responding to RFP's, developing and negotiating contracts and integrating contract requirements with contracting
Maintain routine communication with the sales force, contracting and the National Account Managers to gather information and coordinate efforts to maintain ASC strategy
Assist in developing training content in coordination with Medical Education for Regional Business Managers, Agents and Sales Representatives
Qualifications
BA/BS in Business or related field highly preferred, equivalency in experience required
3+ years' experience in medical device sales
Solid understanding of US Business Practices and markets management related to medical device sales.
Strong negotiation and sales skills.
Ability to determine which company resources are needed to effectively win ASC contracts and facilitate and coordinate those resources as required.
Strong presentation skills, written and verbal, to both administrative and clinical audiences.
Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills, demonstrated ability to interact with other professionals to gather and disseminate information.
Strong attention to detail, tolerance for time sensitive deadlines and the ability to manage multiple priorities.
Computer literacy is required. Strong working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).Ability to read and speak English sufficiently to understand, and complete all paperwork.

Job Description:
About the role.


The Large Account Underwriting Specialist is a key member of a zonal underwriting team. The Large Account Underwriting Specialist reports directly to the Large Account Underwriting Practice Leader with accountability to the region(s) for which they are aligned. The primary goal of this position is to profitably grow a book of business of $50,000+ accounts in annual premiums by actively partnering with brokers, field sales and marketing, and the underwriting team to generate leads and win accounts. The Specialist will plan and budget for the book of business, develop and maintain strong broker relationships, be accountable for the quality of underwriting decisions and execution, and help identify those capabilities needed to best serve large accounts.

What you’ll do.
Business Management. Work closely with the Regional Executive and Large Account Underwriting Practice Leader on planning and budgeting for the book of business, tracking and reporting performance to plan, and developing a clear view of market conditions and competitive landscape within the Midwest and Gulf Regions.
Underwriting Execution. Responsible for the Regions’ new business underwriting execution, including selecting risks in line with PURE’s strategy and underwriting guidelines, operating within authority and documentation guidelines, following up on large accounts and closing new business. In conjunction with the RUMs, the Large Account Underwriting Specialist will also develop the acumen and build out the capabilities of the underwriting teams. Conduct and report on quarterly self-audit.
Field Sales Partnership. Collaborate with the Sales & Underwriting teams to source large account opportunities, develop terms and engage with COI’s, Brokers & Members. Develop, maintain and manage broker partnerships within the Regions including the development of strategies, goals, and tracking of progress; and positioning PURE within an agency for largest accounts.
Exceptional Service, Empathy & Trusted Advisor: Partner with brokers to craft the best and creative solutions for their largest clients; share knowledge and best practices
What we’re looking for.
5+ years HNW underwriting experience. A Bachelor’s degree is required.
Proven track record of strong broker partnership including extensive field travel and presence.
Ability to demonstrate leadership, integrity, creativity in problem solving, and establish trust and credibility.
Regular Field Travel to Brokers in the assigned territories is required

LearnWell is specialized and dedicated to supporting the 49% of all students who may be struggling with an underlying mental health condition—such as depression, anxiety or other mood disorders—which often manifest in self-destructive behavior, substance use, and eating disorders. In partnership with treatment facilities and school districts, we provide an integrated set of academic and mental wellness services for students and their families throughout the continuum of care.

We are hiring an Account Manager to forge administrator-level district relationships and help launch our new mental health counseling services for districts services. This individual will focus heavily on LearnWell’s top 150 customers to deepen our relationship with those districts, cross-sell LearnWell’s academic and tutoring services, while continuing to expand our reach to new customers in each geographic market.

This role is a true hunter-farmer role and will build a book of business and then expand within those key accounts by positioning LearnWell’s unique mental health counseling services. We expect this new service to be a crucial support for school districts and we anticipate high demand.

Key job responsibilities include:
Establish relationships with decision-makers at LearnWell’s top 150 school districts with the goal of introducing and/or cross-selling LearnWell counseling and teaching services
Effectively communicate the purpose, value and use case scenarios for all services offerings
Conduct ongoing outreach to existing district customers to optimize sell-through and usage of services
Manage the annual contracting process, negotiate fixed-fee agreements with districts as necessary
Conduct quarterly customer review meetings to demonstrate program impact and gather feedback
Cultivate reference accounts, customer champions and pursue referrals to new districts
Manage the selling process for all in-bound leads for counseling and academic services outside of LearnWell’s top 150 school districts
Qualifications
At least three years in K-12 sales and account management at the district level, with at least two years of experience generating new business
Excellent client engagement skills: listening, analyzing, speaking, writing, and presenting
Proven success in high-volume, deadline-driven environment
Track record of goal attainment in sales and customer service
Proficient use of computer software, including Salesforce.com and Microsoft Office
Ability to travel up to 25%

Sales Account Manager - Healthcare Division (Cedar Rapids, IA)

Position Summary
Are you driven, goal oriented, growth minded, focused on the people, and eager to build a career as a trusted advisor and industry differentiator?

What you should know about GreatAmerica:

GreatAmerica is a national commercial equipment finance company dedicated to helping our distributers be more successful and achieve the goal of keeping their customers for a lifetime. While GreatAmerica has grown to more than 600 team members, our entrepreneurial spirit remains and endless opportunities lie ahead.

We have experienced unparalleled year over year growth since our founding in 1992. GreatAmerica is structured in cross functional teams which allow individuals to make informed decisions benefiting the company and our customers. There is no doubt in our minds we are building the greatest company of its kind, offering the finest products and services available anywhere. When you are part of the GreatAmerica team, you are part of the future, part of an opportunity to grow professionally and to reach your potential while enjoying your work.

About this position:

Our Account Manager Sales professionals within our Healthcare division are critical to our mission of helping our customers achieve greater success. They have exceptional listening skills and use this ability to tie GreatAmerica solutions to business needs. As an Account Manager, you will have the opportunity to sell creative financing programs to business owners in the Healthcare industry. This will include bring on net new opportunities, but the primary focus is to cultivate and grow existing GreatAmerica relationships to increase their leasing volume. You must be able to successfully use consultative selling methods and you will be accountable for achieving sales volume goals in your territory. You will work collaboratively with a team to drive success in your territory, including individuals from sales, collections, account support, documentation and credit. Specific job duties will involve:
Contribute to stated monthly and yearly funded volume goals for assigned accounts by executing on daily/weekly outbound activity driven by phone calls, emails, webinars, tradeshows, travel to accounts, etc.
Work collaboratively to develop and implement programs that complement the accounts’ strategic initiatives and increase GreatAmerica finance volume, while increasing sales success of the accounts.
Working with key accounts to manage relationships, map account contacts, look for new sales opportunities and secure existing business.
Implement sales rep and sales management training programs to ensure a finance alternative is part of every sales proposal.
Become involved with the accounts’ marketing departments to ensure financing is part of all promotional and communication pieces.
Actively develop industry expertise in order to represent the highest industry standards and unyielding dedication to GreatAmerica’s customers.
Actively develops skills that will enhance the ability to sell GreatAmerica value and overcome objections.
Collaborate with internal departments and leverage leadership to ensure sales goals are met and customer satisfaction levels are high.
Participate in on-site customer visits and off-site customer events as needed.

Position Qualifications
To be successful in this role you’ll have:
Strong business acumen to quickly build trust with business owners.
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with at least 1 year of recent outbound business to business (B2B) sales experience with account management experience preferred.
Proven ability to sell value by helping customers envision how GreatAmerica programs can save them money and/or increase productivity.
Proven ability to build solid working relationships with a variety of businesses, and an interest in learning about ways to add value to an evolving industry.
Excellent communication, account management, relationship management, working autonomously, and time management skills.


We’re growing! Is your sales career? Let’s build something together.

To apply for this position, please follow the online application process at greatamerica.com. Be sure to fully complete the form, including your resume, and complete the Predictive Index assessment.

Blucora has a bold aspiration: we are committed to giving all people the tools needed to lead healthy financial lives - tools often reserved for the wealthy.

We began our journey by bringing together two industry-leading firms to form a foundation in tax-smart investing that is unreplaceable in the industry. TaxAct is an innovative tax software company that helps more than 4 million Americans prepare their own taxes each year. HD Vest is the first firm in the world to make it possible for tax professionals to support clients’ wealth management needs (now over $45B for more than 300,000 Americans).

We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. Atypical for the financial services industry, we take a contemporary approach to strategy and product development that is founded in user insights, rapid testing and a singular focus on driving end-user value.

Since charting new territory on a daily basis is part of everyone's job at Blucora, we've attracted team members who thrive on the challenge, encourage each other, and are passionately committed to the goal. If you agree that problem- solving is a team sport, and feel energized by a good debate, deep dive research, or a fun night out with colleagues, we might be the right firm for you!

POSITION SUMMARY

TaxAct is looking for a talented Marketing Analyst to join the team to help provide insights and recommendations to marketing leadership and senior management regarding TaxAct’s marketing activities, initiatives and strategy. This role will be focused on identifying targeted marketing strategies that are ROI positive and as well as which media campaigns and techniques - across email, paid search, display, retargeted display, tv, programmatic tv, affiliates and social media - will contribute to unit growth in our TaxAct product. This role will also work with the Brand & Product Marketing team to ensure we’re tracking and reporting out on key segment and consumer life-cycle behavior and KPIs to help inform marketing strategies.

The ideal Marketing Analyst is someone who has a natural customer orientation, a passion for business building is adept at both thinking strategically about difficult business problems and using cutting edge data analytics techniques.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Bring together, explore and analyze large scale datasets to find actionable business insight, with an emphasis on customer segmentation, customer behavior, website usage, and market trend data across a number of channels including: Paid / Organic Search, Paid Social (Facebook, LinkedIn), Display, TV, CTV, Radio, OOH, Email, and Affiliate.

· Support the design and management of digital analytics performance measurement plans; report on successes of digital campaigns and implement improvements in areas of opportunity.

· Create measurement solutions including: measurement frameworks, reporting, dashboards, and campaign attribution models.

· Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Media, Brand & Product Marketing, Creative, Martech, BI and Finance, the Marketing Analyst) to understand the business situation and develop data-driven insights to drive marketing, digital, search, and social strategies to engage with customers.

· Identify and analyze the impact of marketing and product changes on customer behavior, acquisition and retention.

· Utilize analytic techniques to determine customer lifetime value and ultimately to change behavior and drive customer profitability and retention.

· Use insights to recommend changes to marketing investments across the business.

· Create segmentations and forecasting models as part of larger analytic inquiries.

· Communicate analytical findings and recommendations in a clear and concise way to non-technical audiences, both in oral and written presentations.

· Use hypothesis-driven approach to drive setup and analysis of A/B tests, and provide recommendations based on the test performance.

· Automate reporting to be self-serve and improve processes to increase efficiency

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

· Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or analytical discipline (e.g. Business, Finance, Engineering, Economics, statistics).

· 3+ years of working experience data driven marketing environment, analytical roles or consulting.

· Strong organizational, multi-tasking, decision-making, and problem-solving abilities along with an analytical aptitude, inquisitive nature, and a passion to turn data into insights.

· Worked with complex data before using multiple data sources to create insights

COMPETENCIES

SKILLS:

The candidate will need to have an appropriate level of strategic and financial acumen and a proven record of converting data into knowledge and intelligence that drives marketing outcomes. The candidate will have a proven track record of successfully building/managing marketing analytic capabilities across Paid/Owned/Earned channels including, but not limited to:

· Familiarity with digital marketing including (Organic search, paid search, email/CRM, social and display)

· Proven analytical skills with demonstrated experience in data-driven, logical problem-solving skills

· Some experience with Google Analytics, Tableau, Google Campaign Manager, Search Ads 360, Google Data Studios, Adobe Analytics, Proprietary data warehouse or other major digital analytics tools, required

· Some experience developing SQL quires to research, analyze, and create business reports.

· Ability to display data visually, including creating presentations that demonstrate the value of analytic deliverables

· An ability to translate a business question into an analytical framework, generate insights through analysis and effectively communicate recommended actions.

· Help execute the marketing analytics strategy to improve data, build compelling dashboards, and form the tools & processes necessary for a robust, democratized, data-driven marketing machine.

· Meticulous attention to detail and impeccable organization skills

· Strong proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

· Proven verbal and written communication skills

ABILITIES:

· Oral Expression — The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

· Oral Comprehension — The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

· Written Comprehension — The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.

· Deductive Reasoning — The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

· Fluency of Ideas — The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).

The Marketing Operations & Project Management role is responsible for architecting and managing the systems, strategic projects, & processes that support Saviynts go-to-market efforts. This person will play a key role in integrating technologies, developing workflows that enable marketing and sales execution, and developing programs that optimize our customers journey. This position aligns with various teams including sales and products to drive major programs that support the acquisition, conversion, and retention of customers in an enterprise global, cloud, B2B environment.

In this position you will be expected to:
Administer and optimize our entire tech stack including CRM, data & ad platforms, and their integration with our website, Salesforce, product, and other apps & systems.

Maintain and optimize data governance efforts including segmentation, validation, cleansing, and augmentation/appending.
Develop and help implement advanced nurture programs. This includes optimizing data capabilities and customer communications across web, email, digital advertising, and automation.

Measure the impact and ROI of marketing on pipeline and revenue quarterly goals for management, marketing, and the sales teams. Provide data-driven recommendations on how to optimize ongoing go-to-market plans and campaigns.
Stay on top of best practices for email deliverability, CAN-SPAM, and other digital regulations.
Act as marketing chief of staff and develop, project-manage, and implement business processes that improve team efficiency and communication.
Build and maintain marketing metrics & data including tracking worksheets and visual presentation.
We are looking for someone with:
5 + years of experience in marketing/business operations
CRM & lead data pipelines experience required
Previous experience with demand gen programs
Salesforce & email marketing/automation administration experience
B2B lead and campaign management knowledge
Strong project management and communication skills
BA/BS/MBA in marketing, business or equivalent related experience

The Bill Howe Family of Companies is a San Diego-based family-owned and operated plumbing, heating and air conditioning, restoration and flood services company. Since its inception in 1980, Bill Howe Plumbing, Inc. strived to be San Diego’s most reliable plumbing company. Through high quality work and competitive pricing, Bill Howe Plumbing not only became a company of success stories, but also grew into one of San Diego’s largest commercial and residential property services companies.

Bill Howe is currently hiring a Backflow Specialist.
Objectives*
Assist in the development and implementation of the company’s brand strategy
Ensure all marketing efforts serve to achieve immediate and long-term business goals, identifying and executing improvements for processes, content, and lead generation.
Provide market research, forecasts, competitive analyses, campaign results, and consumer trends.
Support the maintenance and development of internal tools.
Further knowledge and education regularly through workshops, research, and seminars, and share best practices, and local marketing ideas and tactics with the team.
Responsibilities*
Test, repair and installation of backflow assemblies, above and below grade
Heavy digging and plumbing work including PVC, copper, ductile iron etc.
Respond to emergency service calls in a timely manner
Maintain parts inventory in service vehicle and turn in supply/parts request forms
Work independently or with other Bill Howe Plumbing, Inc. employees
Complete test reports on a daily basis
Comply with company safety policies and procedures
Other duties as assigned
Represent the Company in a professional manner at all times
Provide excellent Customer Service and communication to the office staff and customers in the field
Be a detail-oriented team player and able to work in a fast-paced environment with the ability to prioritize multiple competing tasks according to procedures with accuracy and proper follow-up.
Qualifications*
Three or more years of progressively responsible experience in the repair and maintenance water and/or wastewater systems required.
One year of experience assisting in the placement of backflow and cross- connection devices required.
Clean driving record and driver's license required.
AWWA Backflow Prevention Assembly General Tester Certificate required.
American Backflow Prevention Association (ABPA) or Backflow Prevention Assembly Tester Certificate preferred.
AWWA or ABPA Cross-Connection Control Specialist Certificate preferred.
Core Competencies*
Demonstrated ability to interact in a positive, respectful manner and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.

Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.
Ability to exercise strict confidentiality in all matters.
Physical Requirements*
This role routinely uses construction equipment such as heavy machinery, hand and power tools.
While performing duties of the job the employee may work aloft, climb, bend, pull, reach overhead, stand/walk for long periods of time and lift up to 50 lbs.
Frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; and reach with hands and arms.
Environmental Conditions*
Travel to a variety of worksites every day.
May work in varying temperatures; both inside and outside, including inclement weather, heat, humidity, cold, and dampness.
May work in areas with exposure to moderate/high noise levels.
May be exposed to fumes or airborne particles including dust.
May be required to work in confined spaces or from high heights.

Position Summary:

Responsible for managing the successful delivery of BIM services throughout all stages of design, preconstruction, construction and transition to facility management. The BIM Manager is charged leading and guiding the efforts of the BIM department and multiple project teams to enable our projects to realize the 3D/4D/5D benefits of Building Information Modeling.

The BIM/VDC Specialist will seek to strategically and operationally leverage BIM technology to expand our client's industry leading business base. He or she will interface with division leadership, BIM staff, project managers, estimating, customers and subcontractors giving the candidate a full bodied and rewarding job experience.

How you will contribute:
Manage the total scope and quality of BIM services.
Accountable for the development, implementation and management of project BIM strategy; coordinate with project or division management.
Assist in the identification of projects which are to utilize BIM services; coordinate with operations managers and other senior management team members.
Coordinate with owners, design teams, operations and estimating personnel to determine overall scope of BIM activities to be performed on assigned projects; ensure that projects are offered comprehensive slate of BIM services, as appropriate.
Ensure that communication is maintained with operations and management personnel in regard to all BIM issues for their particular projects.
Take lead role in the development and delivery of innovative, technically creative presentations and software demonstrations for projects and other BIM marketing opportunities; effectively communicate and present.
Assist with responses to RFP questions and requirements; maintain library of example models and past BIM experience for demonstration of capabilities.
Assume key role in the implementation of BIM on projects utilizing an Integrated Project Delivery approach.
Prepare BIM Action Items List for assigned projects and take action; ensure that scheduled completion of assigned tasks is achieved to meet project requirements; coordinate responsibilities and assignments between field and office personnel.
Establish effective coordination procedures with design teams to ensure that design phase completion levels, level of detail issues, and quality control matches expectations; ensure that questions regarding projects and model information are properly documented and addressed to design team.
Lead the creation, development and ongoing maintenance of BIM models (or conversion of 2D plans or PDF's to 3D models) for projects; create conceptual models based on similar projects and historical cost information.
Guide preconstruction and operations personnel in the utilization of BIM for visualization, coordination, and constructability; prepare models to effectively convey cost management alternatives, when appropriate.
Assist preconstruction personnel with quantity extraction and ensure the preparation of clear, properly formatted material takeoff schedules from the building model.
Any other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education

Four-year college degree in related field (B.S. or B.A. degree in Building Science, Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architecture and/or Associates degree in drafting/design) Preferred

Experience
Demonstrated experience in the implementation and utilization of BIM technologies and/or related design/drafting/graphics software on multiple projects - 3 to 5 years BIM experience
Preconstruction/estimating experience preferred - 2 years.
Field/Operations experience preferred - 2 years.
Healthcare experience, preferred - 2 years
Proficient with blueprint reading, document interpretation for all design disciplines
Proficiency with BIM software.
SpawGlass is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Paid Social Specialist is responsible for managing specific social campaigns pre and post launch, as well as ensuring social RFPs and campaign launches are managed in a proactive manner. This role has responsibility for building strategic campaign plans and providing volume estimates for social RFP requests. The Social Specialist is responsible for understanding the media plan objectives and how social can directly affect overall performance of the campaign.

ABOUT THE TEAM

Centro’s national Paid Social team leverages Basis to help plan, execute, streamline, and analyze strategic, paid social media campaigns for agencies and brands. Always positive and eager to try new tools and tactics, their passion lies in finding unique and creative ways to problem-solve for clients. Internal collaboration and communication is critical, as they work closely with the Ad Ops and Analytics teams. These Centrons are committed to thinking outside the box, supporting each other, and pushing themselves to be the best.
WAYS YOU'LL CONTRIBUTE
Build strategic campaign plans and volume estimates for social RFP requests
Launch and analyze paid social campaigns including Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, Linked In, Snapchat and Pinterest
Ensure all accounts pace according to budget and goals
Work with digital media specialists and campaign performance analysts to develop performance stories and highlight the value Centro brings to secure future opportunities
Actively work with internal teams to ensure campaign success based on the KPIs and act as a subject matter expert on the paid social media marketing space
Act in a client facing manner when needed for specific campaigns or client requests and participate in client calls for upcoming plans and regular check-ins in regards to social campaigns
Review client deliverables for quality, ensuring that recommendations and work product are sound and viable
Provide training on social platform tools to clients and account management teams
Assist in the development and documentation of best practices related to social media management for both internal and external documents and assets
Assist in training, mentoring, and developing associate team members
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
2-3 years’ experience in Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Snapchat and Pinterest paid advertising
Knowledge of social media management platforms
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Proficient in Excel
Precise attention to detail
Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, under tight deadlines
Strong analytical skills
Exceptional customer service and communication skills
Adaptable and flexible
A fun, positive attitude that embodies the Centro’s culture
LIFE WITH CENTRO

We take care of our people. Our team has put together a thoughtful benefits package and provides a wide range of perks, including competitive 401k matching, a tax-free health savings account, tuition reimbursement, generous maternity/paternity leave, and more.

Aside from benefits, we’re always finding new ways to invest in the personal and professional growth our employees. We’re proud to support a variety of employee-led communities that enrich our culture of uniqueness, inclusivity, and empowerment. Centro is more than a workplace.

Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and support an inclusive workplace diverse in thought, perspective and culture. We celebrate all team members regardless of gender/identity, sexual orientation, race or cultural background, religion, physical disability and age. We are better together.

Company Description

MMIT is growing from the leading drug coverage data business into a comprehensive, integrated market access company serving pharmaceutical manufacturers, health insurers, PBMs and healthcare IT companies. Their suite of applications is designed to manage an ever-changing proprietary set of pharmacy and medical benefit information and to provide a structured view of complex market access information. By embedding their data and SaaS applications across healthcare, they help ensure transparency, consistency and informed prescription decisions across the MMIT Network. They partner with hundreds of payers and pharma manufacturers ensuring that their products continually capture and analyze coverage and restriction criteria for more than 98% covered lives.

Job Description

The Marketing Director will report to the Senior Vice President, Go-to-Market (GTM) and will take on a highly visible role in the development, analysis, and implementation of strategic product-related marketing initiatives. The Director will be responsible for shepherding new solutions to market by designing GTM strategies, developing sales materials and marketing campaigns, facilitating enablement of the sales team, and monitoring performance and ROI. The immediate focus for the role will be to drive high-conversion MQL volume across a diverse and growing set of solutions that span multiple buyer personas. This individual will be a key leader in identifying and supporting the translation of product benefits into a persona-specific, use case-oriented framework for sales and marketing.

The Director will work across functions, serving as a liaison between the marketing, sales, and product teams. Development of new products and solutions is critical to MMIT’s ability to meet its aggressive long-term growth targets. Therefore, this position comes with significant responsibility for helping MMIT enhance its portfolio of solutions to meet both revenue targets and the needs of the market.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

· Develop, drive, and execute comprehensive product specific GTM strategies, including development of sales tools, collateral, promotions, and communication strategies.

· Identify and document the buyer’s journey: including where they get information, and the who, what, when and why behind their buying decisions.

· Collaborate with operations, client service, product and sales teams to ensure that concepts are developed in to functional, market-ready products that are successfully launched.

· Develop product positioning and messaging that resonate with our target buyer personas.

· Support development of marketing materials and promotional cadences by authoring persona-based messages that will fuel ongoing lead flow.

· Collaborate with product and sales to develop sales collateral and other materials to support continued competency and objection handling in the field.

· Conduct customer research and collect competitive and market intelligence; aggregating learnings across internal and external channels to maintain an ongoing knowledge base that influences messaging and GTM strategy.

· Assess the effectiveness of the integrated sales and marketing activities based on established MQL and SQL conversion tracking per product and persona.

Qualifications
8+ years of experience working in a product marketing, or product development capacity with 2+ years of experience in a market-facing role (e.g. delivering/preparing presentations to customers and prospects, conducting competitor and market research).
In depth knowledge of the healthcare industry, preferably with pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and/or payer-related experience in market access.
Demonstrated experience leading product-specific initiatives with creativity, innovative thinking, rigorous analytical ability, and a strong understanding of the market.
Proven ability to gain a deep understanding of potential buyer personas, needs, potential use cases and buying triggers.
Significant experience with business case development, project management, key performance indicator (KPI) measurement, and ROI-tracking and analytics.
Comfortable using CRM, analytics and marketing automation tools such as Salesforce, Hubspot, InsightSquared, and Google Analytics.
Superior organizational, interpersonal communication and management skills.
Ability to lead multiple complex cross-functional initiatives simultaneously in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment.
A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion.
Education:

Bachelor's degree in marketing/business or related discipline. Master’s preferred.

Additional Information

Travel:

Occasional travel to regional MMIT offices. Up to 5%

Location:

Position based in Yardley, PA

Who we are


Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 277 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

Job Description Summary:

As part of PayPal’s Corporate Affairs organization, the Merchant Communications team is responsible for developing and executing strategic communications programs that showcase the company’s ability to help companies join and succeed in the digital and global economy. This role will report to the Senior Director of Merchant Communications, and will partner with the rest of the team (and broader Corporate Affairs function) to advance and amplify PayPal’s work with large enterprise businesses.

Job Description:

The successful candidate will leverage strong writing and project management skills to highlight PayPal’s position as a key partner for enterprise clients. This person will have strong media relations, knowledge about content creation/distribution, be proficient in digital media (including paid), and work collaboratively across the broader communications team including financial communications, leadership communications, etc. Must be based in Chicago, New York or San Francisco.

Responsibilities to Include
Work with sales and marketing to identify objectives for business unit; develop and execute strategic communications plans against those objectives
Align with global colleagues to ensure a single narrative and message is being highlighted in relevant markets
Collaborate with marketing and product to identify and launch new products into the market
Develop programming across earned, social, owned and paid media to raise visibility of PayPal with core audiences and decisionmakers.
Consistently collaborate across other key Corporate Affairs teams – including but not limited to Internal Communications, Corporate Financial Communications and Government Relations – to ensure strategic integration and consistency, as well as maximize opportunities
Develop social media presence for business unit general manager, working directly with executive
Support PayPal internal communications team as needed
Prepare and support executive leaders and partner with outside agencies as necessary
Job Requirements
Minimum of five years of experience in communications or related field
Previous experience working across other communications channels/disciplines (e.g., media relations, digital/social media, etc.) – agency experience recommended, but not required
Demonstrated understanding of landscape and trends in the leadership communications space, as well as key relationships of relevance in our space
Proficient in digital media and content creation/distribution
Strong organizational skills – ability to successfully manage multiple projects/deadlines simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communicator, with a strong attention to detail
Highly collaborative – builds strong relationships internally and externally with positive/can-do attitude
Entrepreneurial mindset – thinks creatively and outside the box, brings outside-in thinking to every project, and always figures out a way to get things done
Global orientation – experience in an international market recommended, but not required
Connection to PayPal’s brand and commitment to PayPal’s mission, vision and values
Bachelor’s degree required
Subsidiary:

PayPal

San Francisco - Braintree/Venmo, California, United States of America

Digital Marketing Analyst.

Mindgruve is seeking a self-motivated, results-driven Digital Marketing Analyst with a focus on Analytics. Our ideal candidate will proactively identify opportunities while staying up to date on the latest trends and best practices within the industry.

WHAT YOU’LL DO HERE:
Creation and interpretation of client program analysis and reporting (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, ad-hoc)
Development and maintenance of client facing dashboards
Provide subject matter expertise on web analytics, user experience and behavior, data analysis and reporting
Responsible for coordination and tracking tags and tracking parameter implementations supporting reporting, analytics and Digital Intelligence efforts.
Create data-driven insights about visitor behavior from website data on traffic patterns, order volume, conversion, navigation behavior, product selections, etc.
Identification of opportunities for efficiencies in processes (i.e. Automation)
Follow and stay on top of industry best practices
Deliver online and digital reporting to executive management and internal teams as it relates to budget, campaign performance and testing results.
Development and occasional presentation of client ready presentations
Weekly client reporting
Travel to client for meetings as needed
Build and maintain an understanding of current topics in Performance Media, web analytics, data management, tools and technologies related to teams core responsibilities.

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree – preferably in mathematics, statistics or other discipline (with relevant work experience).
2-5 years experience at a digital agency, and/or consulting firm, and/or corporate online marketing department, and/or software provider in an analytical capacity.
2+ years of experience in web analytics using Google Analytics, WebTrends, and/or Adobe SiteCatalyst; running experiments using Google Content Experiments, WebTrends Optimize, and/or Adobe Test and Target. (Similar experience with other analytical and testing platforms will be considered.)
2+ years of experience developing measurement and reporting methodologiex for Paid Search, SEO, Display and Social Media campaigns.
Knowledge of online ad serving platforms, such as DoubleClick, Flashtalking or Atlas, and online ad networks, such as Microsoft, Yahoo, etc.
Experience with competitive intelligence and audience selection and targeting tools, such as comScore, Kantar and HitWise a plus.
Experience with traditional/offline marketing not required, but helpful
Exposure to Big Data and the challenges associated with harnessing data to drive insight
Some technical knowledge of databases, data warehousing, B.I. (i.e. Tableau) and data tools desirable.
Proficiency in the Microsoft Office software Suite and Apple Productivity Apps (Pages, Keynote & Numbers)
Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Professional and personal integrity
A detail-oriented mindset, focused on driving results and analyzing data to gain insights and opportunities for growth
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Compensation commensurate with experience. We offer competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision, flex spending accounts and 401K. This is an in-house position. No headhunters, contractors, freelancers, overseas agents or professional job-hoppers will be considered.

Qualified candidates MUST email a cover letter, resume and salary expectations to careers@mindgruve.com with “Digital Marketing Analyst” in the subject line.

Job Title: Field Account Manager - NC SC GA & FL
Job Description:
Endicia/stamps.com has a great opportunity for a Field Account Manager (FAM) for NC SC GA FL. The Field Account Management team is a growing, highly qualified group of sales representatives that drives existing client growth within an assigned portfolio. The team helps leading ecommerce sellers fulfill their products to their buyers using the most efficient and economical path. The FAM is required to be an industry expert in the areas of technology solutions and carrier services. Our FAM partner with our internal Business Services team to successful manage all client needs and implement unique solutions for customers. We are looking for experienced sales representatives experienced driving growth by partnering with top valued clients. This position works remotely and the optimal location GA or NC (SC will also be considered for the right candidate.)
Endicia Company Overview:
Stamps.com, Endicia® electronic postage solutions make it easier and more affordable to ship parcels through the U.S. Postal Service®. Our solutions have helped thousands of businesses print more than $14 billion in postage. As a long-time, trusted partner of the U.S. Postal Service, we've built our reputation on our commitment to simplifying, improving, and enhancing the shipping process for our customers. That's what we call “innovation with purpose.”
Stamps.com offers solutions that help businesses run their shipping operations more smoothly and function more successfully under the brand names Stamps.com, Endicia®, ShipStation®, ShippingEasy®, ShipWorks®, and MetaPack®. Stamps.com’s family of brands provides seamless access to mailing and shipping services through integrations with more than 475 unique partner applications.
Company Perks:
Competitive pay, 401k with company match, Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, 3-weeks vacation, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Educational Reimbursement, Commuter benefits, Discount programs, Inventor patent bonuses. Pet Insurance!

Purpose of the Position:
The Multimedia Specialist is an innovation engineer, creating content and prototypes which illustrate the future of the online course room. The Multimedia Specialist strategically uses Multimedia to enhance the UMA learners’ experiences, increase motivation, and positively impact student retention and placements. The Multimedia Specialist demonstrates skillsets across areas such as media arts, animation, motion graphics, illustration, and video production.
The Multimedia Specialist reports to the Manager, Multimedia.
Key Responsibilities:
Functional:
Develop products which encourage an interactive, engaging, and thought-provoking learning environment
Leverage design knowledge with modern multimedia techniques to take projects from their conception to the final deliverable
Provide curriculum recommendations, including but not limited to branding, design, layout, functionality, etc.
Utilize the UMA style guide and partner with key stakeholders in marketing to ensure UMA branding guidelines are adhered to, while pushing the limit on innovation
Utilize the Adobe Creative suite, as well as Adobe Captivate, to bring course content to life
Record and edit voice overs to enhance video and module content
Demonstrate video production skills and ability to film/edit content.
Display ability to direct and coach talent to create believable and professional content
Use storytelling (via animation, film, etc.) to engage students in relevant examples of course content
Communicate often with peers and manager to discuss projects and timelines, taking initiative to problem-solve and adjust timelines to proactively remain ahead of deadlines
Demonstrate time management, flexibility, critical thinking, self-reflection, and an overall growth mindset when facing challenges, barriers, or opportunities for improvement
Demonstrate leadership and professionalism, leading by example to encourage teamwork, collaboration, and personal growth across the team
Effectively present information through emails, job-aids, one voice documents, presentations, face to face/virtual trainings, focus groups, etc.
Serve as a brand ambassador during professional development sessions, conferences, annual summits, and advisory board meetings, developing relationships across the industry and with other institutions
Review deliverables for adherence to design principles and established templates and standards and maintain design tools, templates, and standards
Maintain source files for each product on a local workstation hard drive as well as the shared drive and maintain clear and concise naming conventions for source files
Research new trends in multimedia and proactively identify new approaches that may improve program performance
Participate in and present professional development, including but not limited to department lunch and learns, talent management trainings, team presentations, webinars, conferences, etc.
Attend and/or facilitate meetings, including but not limited to Project Check-Ins, Team Meetings, Department Meetings, etc.
Effectively partner with Curriculum and Instructional Design Specialists, Instructional Technology Specialists, and Leadership
Upload, closed caption, and manage videos on YouTube or other video hosting sites.
Perform other duties and special projects as assigned
Support Institutional Initiatives
Keep current on institutional goals, objectives, and progress
Engage in institutional sponsored activities and initiatives as appropriate
Lead with courage in support of change initiatives that impact organization
Manages and assists in coordinating efforts between departments within UMA
Compliance:
Demonstrates knowledge of, and carefully follows all applicable federal and state compliance requirements and regulations including those prescribed by the Department of Education, accrediting agencies, CIE, and internal UMA policies and procedures.
Effectively communicates compliance requirements to students and other staff as appropriate and quickly escalates any compliance concerns to the Compliance department.
Work Experience, Skills & Abilities:
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Media Arts, Animation, Film, communication or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Online curriculum multimedia experience
Experience working with a Learning Management System
Proficiency with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere, After Effects, Audition, Animate, and Captivate. Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other business tools such as Skype and Microsoft Teams.
Able to professionally communicate fluently in verbal and written English.
Able to support a diverse and inclusive work environment
Preferred Requirements:
Demonstrated expertise in project management and meeting facilitation skills
Excellent interpersonal, communication, time management and organizational skills
Passion and enthusiasm for delivering results by through demonstrated strong work ethic
Ability to appropriately prioritize and organize to complete all job responsibilities in a timely manner
Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment under tight time constraints
Ability to provide clear, constructive feedback on instructional and creative deliverables
Adaptable and flexible; able to think outside the box, yet operate within the lines - Creative, innovative, thought leader
Working Environment:
Office Environment – Must be able to work in the UMA Office
Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed.

Requires long periods of sitting at a desk working on a computer

Requires occasional lifting of up to 10 lbs.

Global Industrial, a Systemax Company
Corporate Overview

For over 70 years Global Industrial has been an industry leader providing private label and brand name industrial equipment and supplies to businesses throughout North America.

We carry over 1.7M industrial, material handling and business products that are sold through our website, corporate sales people and full color catalogs. We are constantly increasing our product offerings to meet the diverse and changing needs of our customers. Our customers include small to large corporations, institutions and government agencies as well as consumers.
Key Responsibilities
Global Equipment has a customer focused sales approach which includes the following core competencies:
Planning and Organizing.
Develop and manage a tactical account/territory sales plan.
Thorough client analysis to assess customer needs, values, purchasing behavior, and motivation.
This includes extensive researching, competitor and market analysis.
Execute a sales strategy for penetrating accounts and maximize sales, e.g. prospecting, cold calling, identifying key decision makers and determining buying criteria.
Effectively develop and manage your sales plan by setting daily/weekly/monthly goals and objectives, prioritizing tasks, utilizing your time effectively and efficiently, and taking full advantage of available resources.
Utilize sales planning tools and the pipeline management process to obtain business objectives and goals.
Relationship Building.
Build trust and credibility with clients.
Learning and engaging the customer to understand the process of what they value, e.g. strategic and investigative questioning.
Assist your customer with finding solutions that will help them achieve their goals and added value.
Provide support, information, and guidance by researching and recommending new profit and service improvements.
Position yourself for new opportunities through networking and identify cross selling and up selling opportunities.
Providing superior customer service which includes learning everything you can about them so you can tailor your service approach to their needs and buying habits.
Courtesy and timely follow up are key.
Product Knowledge.
Understanding of Global Equipment Company industry and products
Stay abreast of industry trends.
Utilize internal resources to gather information regarding new product offerings.
Communication Skills.
Effective verbal communication skills, e.g. speaking clearly, listening attentively, building rapport.
Ability to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings, e.g. business letters and emails
Ability to effectively persuade by asking intelligent business questions to determine customer needs.
Competencies and skills
Requires Bachelor degree in business or marketing or at least 2 years of telephone business to business sales experience.
Knowledge and competence in the major elements of inside sales including cold calling, business development, customer qualification, and customer acquisition.
Superior sales planning and business development skills.
Excellent written/verbal communication and presentation skills.
Strong computer skills to include proficiency in Microsoft Word, Outlook and PowerPoint and CRM Software.
Self motivated with superior problem solving and negotiation skills.
Effectively prioritize sales efforts and activities.
Excellent organization and time management skills are essential.

PetroChoice is a premier distributor of lubricants and services to thousands of companies. We distribute and offer services from more than 50 locations in 32 states and include top brands of oils, greases and other lubricants.
Our history is marked by consistent growth and expansion. Our mission is to provide lubrication solutions that create value for our customers. We will realize this mission through our commitment to our employees as well as to the highest standards of service, quality, integrity, and safety.
We are hiring a Field Sales Specialist for our Crown Point facility.
The Field Sales Specialist (FSS) is a multifunctional role designed to increase sales and enhance customer relationships. The FSS may be assigned responsibility for a portfolio of national accounts and house accounts, or support Territory Sales Manager (TSM) assigned accounts. This posiition involves overnight travel.
What We Offer:
Competitive starting salary
Major Medical/Dental/Vision
401k Company Match
Paid time off & Holiday Pay
Company paid life insurance
Company paid long term disability
A company cell phone, iPad Pro, monthly vehicle allowance and fuel card.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include but are not limited to the following. The Company reserves the right to add to, delete, change or modify the essential duties and responsibilities at any time. All work is to be completed with minimum supervision and in accordance with Company standards. Other duties may be assigned.
Manage relationships and support the needs of customers to increase penetration and retention; Gain comprehensive understanding of customer’s business.
Become an advocate for the customer while balancing needs of the company.
Understands and supports company sales policies, procedures and sales culture to provide effective customer service.
Travel to high-priority existing and prospective locations as needed.
Schedule outbound calls to proactively engage customers and build relationships to ensure account retention.
Leverage tools and resources to retain and gain customers.
Participates in establishing, maintaining and achieving goals and objectives.
Follow-up with sales leads generated through incoming calls, referrals, new National Accounts and other methods.
Implement sales processes and marketing strategies developed by company; Provide feedback on market trends and industry conditions.
Maintain computer files and submits appropriate paperwork to management including, but not limited to expense reports, mileage and call reports.
Completes new account paperwork accurately and submit in a timely fashion.
Provide sales support to TSMs as required.
Share customer and market knowledge with TSMs and Sales Management.
Address inbound inquires for accounts related to product information, sales/billing information and delivery or other issues or refer as appropriate.
Establish contract pricing in collaboration with the Sales Manager or TSM.
Responsible to meet technical services goals for assigned accounts.
Takes samples at customer locations as directed.
Performs technical writing tasks as assigned.
Provide and document S3 Solution to the customer.
Perform necessary administrative work, including documenting & sharing of critical customer information through our CRM program and other acceptable means. Respond to internal requests for information and supports TSM technical services needs
Look for opportunities to sell value added solutions to the customers. This would include but not be limited to Contamination Control, Auto-Lubrication, and Lubrication Services.

Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Marketing or Engineering and at least 2 years of B2B Industrial Sales Experience preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Language Ability:
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. AFFOA is seeking an individual with a passion for marketing, communication and graphic design. The ideal candidate will be strategic, flexible, detail-oriented, and have excellent interpersonal skills. This position requires the ability to work cross-functionally, distill information effectively, the capacity to move quickly and be flexible while delivering high-quality results.

The successful candidate will have an exciting opportunity to grow in a complex environment that combines advanced technology, product development, manufacturing, and education and workforce development. As a part of an integrated team, the role will report to the Sr. Director of Business Development and work closely with business development, program management, product and technical staff.

Job Duties
Lead planning and execution of annual marketing and communications plan
Create and produce digital and print marketing collateral for institute products, projects and stakeholder meetings, including board decks, presentations, product decks, posters and other items
Generate and manage content development for internal and external communications (e.g. website, member portal, social medial, brochures, press activities, presentations, conferences, technology one pagers, business development toolkits, etc.)
Execute marketing projects from conception to production, including website development updates, app screens, marketing collateral, presentation decks, brochures and branding
Manage, lead and support all creative marketing and graphic design activities for projects and product development that span market segments including apparel, accessories, footwear, architectural, industrial, automotive, medical and others
Work with internal and external stakeholders, including team members of different areas at AFFOA, entrepreneurs, and other teams to ideate and create marketing collateral
Support, manage and/or lead marketing activities for member events, trade shows and other AFFOA programs
Communicate institute wins, projects, products and innovations in a clear and effective manner to a variety of audiences
Manage AFFOAs social media accounts and external marketing efforts through creation and execution of content
Perform additional duties, as assigned
Qualifications
Bachelors degree in Marketing or Communications required
5+ years proven, direct experience in a marketing or communications role required
Experience with web & social media tools required
Graphic design skills required
Proven ability to research, analyze, plan and execute in the areas of message development, external marketing communications, meetings management, and marketing/communications effectiveness measurement
Ability to engage and work effectively in a team-based environment and partner with internal/external stakeholders required
Strong demonstrated attention to detail, organizational skills and project management experience required
Copywriting and editing of marketing materials for various audiences preferred
Self-driven and resourceful to achieve goals independently as well as work well in groups
Ability to deal effectively with people at all levels of the organization
Ability to work under time constraints and adapt to change
Ability and flexibility to adjust to changing requirements, schedules and priorities
Other duties as assigned
Work Authorization: Must be eligible to work in the United States

EEO Statement: AFFOA is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

It is our people behind life’s passions who will make the big difference. If you are interested in becoming part of a company that delivers market leading products, driving your own career and working with brands committed to active lifestyles, then you’ve found your fit.

Have what it takes? Join us.

Position Summary:
The Inside Dealer Account Manager for TLC is responsible for establishing and building profitable market share in their respective dealer territories. Candidate will be based out of Fort Wayne Operations in Indiana.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Proactively build relationships with customers and promote sales of all Lowe, Crestliner and Thunder Jet products.
Meet or exceed sales objectives while maintaining acceptable gross margins.
Establish and manage yearly dealer sales targets and provide the company with accurate sales and inventory forecasts.
Plan and execute dealer sales plans and strategies as part of overall company strategy.
Assist brands in product development, pricing and retail and wholesale incentive programs.
Carry-out brand-specific training programs for dealers when required.
Provide input into product materials, including catalogs, brochures, website content, boat shows and other marketing events.
Assist brands and dealers with event planning and execution, including boat shows, dealer open-houses and other like events.
Create dealer-specific marketing plans for their respective markets. This also may include training the dealer on how to maximize investment through e-marketing, etc.
Support communication across Brunswick business units, particularly Mercury Marine and other Brunswick boat companies.
Provide company with accurate and timely competitive information.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Minimum of 5 years sales experience, preferably in the marine or power sports industry.
Demonstrated experience in managing distribution channels and dealer networks.
Experience in customer call planning.
Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint, e-marketing skills a plus.
Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills.
Understanding of basic financial statements (Income, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow.)
Proficiency with problem analysis and resolution at both strategic and functional level.
Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities,
Ability to obtain passport for travel to Canada
Travel about 20% of time.
About Brunswick
Headquartered in Mettawa, Ill., Brunswick Corporation’s leading consumer brands include Mercury Marine outboard engines; Mercury MerCruiser sterndrive and inboard packages; Mercury global parts and accessories including propellers and SmartCraft electronics; Power Products Integrated Solutions; MotorGuide trolling motors; Attwood, Garelick, and Whale marine parts; Land ’N’ Sea, BLA, Payne’s Marine, Kellogg Marine, and Lankhorst Taselaar marine parts distribution; Mercury and Quicksilver parts and oils; Bayliner, Boston Whaler, Crestliner, Cypress Cay, Harris, Heyday, Lowe, Lund, Princecraft, Quicksilver, Rayglass, Sea Ray, Thunder Jet and Uttern boats; Boating Services Network, Freedom Boat Club, NAUTIC-ON, OnBoard Boating Club and Rentals. For more information, visit https://www.brunswick.com.

R+L Global Logistics is seeking a Logistics Account Manager (Supply Chain Consultant) to join our Logistics team.

Are you ready to make an immediate impact? Do you have experience working for a non-asset brokerage (3PL)? Do you have a proven ability to increase revenue by building relationships? If so, this is the opportunity for you!

Why our employees love working at R+L Global Logistics
Values "I love working for a company that I am proud to represent based on its morals and people"
Opportunities "It's exciting to play a part in building an organization knowing that as you succeed, more and more opportunities become available"
People "While we are a larger company, I've still been able to form new friendships and relationships with the people around me"
Leadership "I love coming in each day and knowing that I my opinion matters to our leadership team"
Exciting Benefits Including Vacation Properties "I love being able to go to Fort Myers Beach for a weekend getaway"
Logistics Account Manager (Supply Chain Consultant) Summary of Key Responsibilities

Responsibilities and essential job functions include, but are not limited to the following:
Research leads, develop entrance strategies and qualify your prospects transportation spend to generate new business
Present R+L Global Logistics full range of services to your customer base, allowing yourself to build a complete logistics and supply chain solution for the customer
Build strong customer relationships and understand trends that affect their business to creatively and strategically develop solutions
Prepare quotes for new and existing business partners to meet your monthly and quarterly goals
Work with the Capacity Procurement team to ensure loads are covered and dispatched
Communicate frequently with the Capacity team and or carriers to ensure the shipper and consignee are aware of any challenges or issues that may arise
Logistics Account Manager (Supply Chain Consultant) Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Exude drive, assertiveness, passion and dedication
Manage complex or emotional transactions promptly and professionally
High school Diploma or GED
Bachelor's Degree in Business or similar field of study with emphasis in: International Business, Logistics/Supply Chain, Marketing, Psychology, Sales or Transportation preferred
5+ years working with full truckload business development and operational environment preferred
Previous experience in some or all of the following modes: dry van, expedited, flatbed, oversized, refrigerated, intermodal preferred
Company Benefits - Company Vacation Properties, PTO, Sick Time, Paid Holidays, 401k, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & Disability Insurance, Pet Insurance and Group Home & Auto Insurance

R+L Global Logistics is a world-class provider of high quality domestic and international logistics and supply chain services, with a reputation for offering the highest quality freight solutions and services to our customers. With 14 offices across the country, we have locations in Atlanta, Chicago, Cincinnati, Denver, Fort Myers, Indianapolis, Kansas City, Laredo, Los Angeles, Nashville, Newark, Ocala, Orlando and San Antonio allowing our logistics team to optimize the supply chain process for our customers.

To learn more, please apply online today at www.rlglobal.com

POSITION SUMMARY

Responsibilities
Development and execution of the Warehouse Products marketing strategy.
Attain desired market position with assigned territory accounts.
Making necessary sales and support calls, presentations and communication between corporate, retail network and customer.
Increasing Class I, II III and VNA truck sales and profit goals.
Market strategy should include such products and services as fleet management, rental and leasing, power systems, allied products, warehouse rack, industrial shelving, storage systems, and lead sharing with the Engineered Products and Industrial Sales groups.
Must be able to effectively identify, communicate and work through customer problems, issues and opportunities with corporate and retail network.
This position reports to Regional Sales Director but close relationships with Branch General Manager and Sales Manager is essential to ensure proper processes and procedures are met in obtaining customer service excellence.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Responsible for Effective Professional Selling Principles in the working environment.
Increase overall revenues of New OEM Narrow Aisle and VNA Equipment, Power Systems, Warehouse Rack, Industrial Shelving, Storage Systems, Used Equipment and Aftermarket products.
Increase visibility including market share for unit and aftermarket sales for both current and new customers.
Perform other duties as assigned by management.
Reasonable Accommodations Statement
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Functions Statement(s)
Maintain and grow existing relationships with current customer base
Work with existing customer base to ensure proper fleet size, specifications and utilization
Develop and execute strategy to penetrate assigned Warehouse Products target accounts
Work closely with neighboring Industrial Sales group to identify new target account opportunities
Lead share with Engineered Products, Power Systems, Industrial Cleaning and Material Handling to provide one stop resource for existing and new customer accounts.
Participate in product training courses within Equipment Depot, our OEM’s and online to ensure current and competitive product knowledge.
Work closely with local Branch Operations and Departmental Manager to ensure customer service expectations are met.
Provide timely and accurate fleet reporting to existing customer base.
Effectively follow the Equipment Depot sales process including all sales reporting, ordering and CRM requirements.
Qualifications
SKILLS & ABILITIES

SKILLS & ABILITIES
Education: College Degree Preferred

Experience: Prefer a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience selling electric forklifts, powers systems, and warehouse storage systems.

Computer Skills: Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office products, prior knowledge and use of CRM and Auto-Cad a plus

Other Requirements: 20% travel required

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Work environment varies from office to job site to industrial locations

OUR CORE VALUES

Passion to Perform – We are passionate to perform and focus on concrete achievements

Trust to Act – We are empowered to act, and act in a powerful way

Act Responsibly – We are responsible for our actions and the consequences they have for our stakeholders and our environment

Make it Fun! – We are serious about making work fun; it’s the way we do things
