Leasing Specialist

POSITION: Leasing Specialist

REPORTS TO: Community Manager

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Leasing Specialist is a sales driven position that performs a variety of administrative tasks geared toward the goal of maximum occupancy by quality residents and performs other functions as assigned by the Community Manager.

PRIMARY DUTIES:

Performs all tasks relating to leasing the property, such as showing the property to prospective residents, preparing lease packets, running credit reports.
Abides by and enforces the Fair Housing Laws.
Prepares lease packets and performs move in process for new residents.
Generate traffic through internet, print and outreach marketing.
Responds to telephone and email communication from residents and prospects.
Develop social media initiatives to connect and engage residents; post announcements, photos, updates, and event information.
Deliver timely and remarkable customer service to community residents.
Play a key role in resolving resident concerns and issues.
Aggressively works on resident retention through positive resident relationships.
Assist the Community Manager in all duties as assigned.
SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:

Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Must be organized, detail oriented and have good time management skills
Ability to work week-ends and evenings as needed
Ability to drive and access to a vehicle
Ability to multi-task and work in a busy environment
Candidates will be required to pass a criminal background investigation and a drug screening.

The Franklin Johnston Group is an equal employment opportunity company.

Job Title: Lab Products & Solutions Sales Specialist - Furniture Dealership
Job Description:
Lab Products & Solutions Sales Specialist - Furniture Dealership
San Francisco Bay Area
The Company
Nestled in our five locations around the Bay Area, we create great spaces, and our offices are no exception. Standing desks, treadmill desks, a huddle room or lounge space – you choose how you work.
Our work culture believes in treating people like family and projects like relationships. We’ve always had confidence that it’s the environments where we spend most of our time that ultimately shape and bring the best in us. That is one of the reasons why we have been recognized as one of the best places to work by the Silicon Valley Business Journal.
Our people work on diverse projects that promote workplace happiness, productivity, and well-being – from Operations to Sales and Design.
Come be a part of the fabric of One Workplace!
Overview/Position Summary
Serves as OWP’s primary specialist in lab furniture products and solutions. Functions as the primary expert and point of contact internally and externally to develop business and partnerships in a new market segment. Works both independently and collaboratively with internal and external partners to develop creative lab solutions solutions to meet customer needs. Engages with customers at a high level to gather programmatic information, develop business relationships, and solve complex problems. Involved in elements of business development, customer engagement, design and implementation of lab projects and related tasks from inception to final installation.
Responsibilities:
Partner with internal and external partners to manage existing lab partnerships, projects, accounts and customers to ensure client satisfaction and on-going business relationships.
Partner with internal and external partners to develop new lab partnerships, projects and accounts and customers to ensure client satisfaction and on-going business relationships.
Stay current with key trends and important issues in the lab market.
In partnership with Leadership & Marketing teams, establish strategy and tactics to engage and grow business in the lab market.
business relationships.
Stay current with key trends and important issues in the lab market.
In partnership with Leadership & Marketing teams, establish strategy and tactics to engage and grow business in the lab market.
Produce and present design concepts to internal and external clients
In partnership with internal resources and external partners, produce lab furniture block plans, space plans, finish palettes, furniture specifications, finish boards and installation drawings.
Perform field verifications and conduct product inventories.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience

The Personal Insurance Account Manager is responsible for proficiently assisting our clients with service and risk management needs in accordance with agency standards and workflows.

 Responsible for sales of personal insurance products to existing clients.

Job Title: Advertising Account Manager - Client Success - Channel Bakers
Job Description:
Advertising Account Manager - Client Success Team - Channel Bakers

**So we can reach you and our emails aren't sent to spam, please whitelist "@app.bamboohr.com

Account Managers at Channel Bakers are the beating hearts of our account teams. You are the glue that holds everything together as you oversee the day to day running of client accounts and ensure that all strategy is executed on time and to budget.

As a seasoned Account Manager, you will have the confidence and competence to support across a diverse range of clients from New to Market right through to the more strategic complex clients/brands.

You are a strong and effective communicator, taking the lead on day to day client interactions and seamlessly sharing information and data to the Strategic Account Executive and Advertising Specialists. With acute attention to detail, you oversee and track click credits, budget pacing, customer deliverables and take any ad hoc client requests in your stride. You are a guru on all things related to Search Strategy and Demand Side Platform (DSP) and utilize this knowledge to leverage optimum campaign outputs for our clients.

As the right hand to the Account Executive, you support them with strategic client communication, quarterly business reviews, presentations and developing media plans. Supporting the Advertising Specialist, you ensure that they are set up for success with all of their daily tasks which include building & optimizing campaigns, key word development and developing Calls to Action. You clearly and comfortably delegate both routine and important tasks and provide help and direction as required.

You are able to communicate clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles and can get messages across that have the desired effect. You make good decisions based on a combination of analysis, wisdom, experience and judgement and are often sought out by others for advice or solutions. You enjoy working hard, are action oriented and are full of energy for things you see as challenging. You value time and know how to use it effectively to optimize your own efficiency.

This position is based at our US HQ in Anaheim Hills, CA and reports to the Director of Strategic Accounts. It may require domestic travel, approximately 10% of the time.

Required Experience & Qualifications:
Minimum of 3 to 4+ years of Marketing or Advertising experience in a fast moving, client facing environment
Degree in Business, Public Relations, Marketing, Advertising, Communications or equivalent preferred
Experience of Amazon Search Advertising preferred and exposure to DSP (Demand Side Platform) a significant advantage
Experience of being part of a performing team
Strong analytical and qualitative skills are essential - data and numbers don't scare you!
Proven ability to cultivate and foster new relationships and depend existing ones
Proficient user of standard office software (MS Office etc). Intermediate or advanced Excel necessary
Proven track record of driving your own professional and personal development
Everyday Tasks:
Communicate regularly with clients via calls, email and in person meetings to update on campaigns and discuss campaign actions and activities.
Oversee budget pacing & management, click credits tracking, launching campaigns, optimizing rulesets and all DSP activity
Prepare reports and analyze data and insights
Carry out brand and product research
Support the Strategic Account Director or Executive with strategic client needs.
Support Advertising Specialist to ensure their tasks are completed accurately and on time.
Partner with the Advertising Operations Lead to identify process challenges and find solutions.
Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally within Channel Bakers with other key stakeholders including Finance, Engineering, Creative and People & Culture.
Working at Channel Bakers:

Working at Channel Bakers is a job like no other.

Our beautiful USHQ is situated in Anaheim Hills overlooking the spectacular views of Chino Hills State Park. We take pride in our inspirational office decor and offer a fun and engaging environment to help our employees bring their best selves to work every single day. Our kitchen is stocked with snacks and refreshments to keep us hydrated and energized all day long and we regularly take time to connect and have fun together as a team. We get to work alongside some incredibly talented co-workers and partner with some of the world’s most prolific and inspirational Brands. We are a truly global organization with offices located in Seattle, the Philippines and the UK and proud to have a very diverse team of Bakers not only from the US but also Germany, France, Brazil, Scotland and Mongolia to name a few!

Our core tenet is that we exist to help people and this is at the heart of all that we do.

We enjoy the challenge of new and unfamiliar tasks, change is our normal and we can shift gears comfortably. We love to exceed our goals, both work and personal and most importantly we are dedicated to exceeding the expectations or our clients. We value self-development, it helps us help others, better.

Job Perks:
Access to Medical Insurance (including Chiropractic and Acupuncture), Dental, Vision and Life Insurance.
Fully vested 401K with up to 4% employer match
Flexible Working
Paid Time Off (vacation, public holidays, birthday, sick, bereavement etc).
Paid volunteer time
Ergonomic workstations with standing/sitting desks
Regular team social events
Stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages
Free access to Financial Advisor support
Access to Employee Assistance Program

ProValue Insurance is an independent agency providing comprehensive insurance products and business services to organizations in need of risk protection. Delivering unparalleled knowledge and experience, ProValue helps protect against more than organizational risk, offering coverages for personal assets to individuals throughout Mid-America. Other ProValue Insurance affiliated and/or owned companies include Ag-Services, LLC.
A Day in the Life: *
As an Insurance Sales Account Manager for ProValue Insurance, you will be responsible for cultivating new insurance customers across a wide variety of organizations including commercial, trucking, agribusiness, and farms. This includes cold calling on potential new clients to introduce them to the products and services offered by ProValue Insurance. You are expected to also obtain referrals from current customers for new business. This job requires an individual who is a natural relationship builder who sees the value of ProValue Insurances products and services and is willing to work with customers on managing various aspects of their risk exposures. In addition, this professional is responsible for retaining current insurance customers by providing timely renewal quotes and all applicable service work. The Insurance Sales Account Manager is expected to work as a team within the organization by collaborating with operation personnel (CSA, insurance carriers, etc.) behind the scenes to ensure a smooth customer service experience. As a Sales Account Manager, you are expected to work daily on developing relationships with our valued insurance carrier partners.

You will also collaborate with other professionals within ProValue Insurance and our affiliated company to cross-sell services and prove to clients that we are a full-service insurance agency.
What You Will Need to Do This Job: *
A bachelors degree in a related field, 3-5 years of insurance sales, other sales experience or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience is preferred.
Thoughtful, analytical, strategic, and resourceful in job performance.
The ability to create and maintain strong customer relationships.
An entrepreneurial and competitive spirit and drive to succeed.
Persistence and creativity in problem solving.
Excellent public speaking skills and presence.
Ability to use and understanding technology including a computer, smart phone, tablet and various software programs and apps.
Property & casualty insurance license /or willingness to obtain a property & casualty insurance license.
A valid drivers license.
The ability to travel 70-80% of the time, day travel with regular overnights.
This position generally works in an office environment but is occasionally exposed to outdoor conditions or other locations. Long periods of sitting, standing and computer work are required. The ability to speak, hear, and type is also required. You will regularly lift 20 pounds or less.
This position will also be required to perform other duties as assigned by management.
DISCLAIMER*
This Job Description indicates the general nature and level of work expected. It is not designed to cover every activity, duty or responsibility required of the employee. This job description in no way alters employment-at-will and is not a guarantee of employment now or in the future.

Director, Product Marketing
Job Overview
The Director, Product Marketing will help build and execute Marchex’s product marketing strategy, including overall positioning and messaging for our Analytics and Marketplace products and solutions, leading the product marketing team in the creation and execution of sales enablement tools, competitive positioning, partnering with Demand Generation on key marketing deliverables, driving customer advocacy, and partnering with our data sciences team to drive insight from the wealth of information we collect from our clients. This role will be responsible for managing a team of product and content marketing managers as well as analysts from the Marchex Institute.
Job Impact
This job will have a direct impact on our ability to execute our sales and marketing vision for the conversational intelligence space. This role will lead a team of marketers to develop and drive an inspirational and differentiated message to the marketplace and prospects and create a compelling reason to purchase our solutions for new and current customers.
Team
The Marketing team delivers both internal and external communications on how Marchex helps business succeed with conversations. The Marketing group keeps our leadership teams informed of market trends, and creates programs and initiatives that keep us ahead of the curve and drive the industry. They touch all of our potential and current clients, and help us reach the right audiences at the right times to help drive more adoption of all of the Marchex product lines.
Outline of Duties and Responsibilities
Lead and build a high performance product marketing team that leads our organization in achieving our revenue goals for our product and solution offerings

Company Description:

Traeger Grills, headquartered in Salt Lake City, has been revolutionizing BBQ grilling and outdoor cooking for 30 years. We obsess over providing world-class experiences to not only our customers, but also to our retail partners and vendors. Recently voted as a 2016,2017, & 2018 Best Company to Work For, and a Top 25 Fastest Growing Company by Utah Business Magazine, we're looking for individuals who are committed to winning. We pride ourselves on maintaining a culture based around teamwork, quality, innovation and constant growth and development. We cook together and we win together!

Job Description:

Sales Operations Account Managers are members of the Retail Operations team, which has the mission of making Traeger the easiest vendor to do business with. Sales Operations Account Managers are the internal operational advocates for their accounts. They are quantitatively focused with a problem-solving mindset, developing a detailed understanding of customer's business which allows them to anticipate and solve potential problems proactively. They also work to directly support the Sales Team with operational and related duties.

What You Will Accomplish:
Oversees orders through entire order lifecycle from order entry to shipment of orders, ensuring EDI transactions flow through accurately and non-EDI transactions are processed efficiently. When possible, pushes for automation through EDI or equivalent integrations. (Early morning hours may be required)
Owns all operational duties for designated list of accounts as directed by the Retail Operations Manager.
Manages monthly collaborative planning, forecasting, and replenishment (CPFR) process for key partners, using a sell-through oriented forecast to maximize retail turns while minimizing inventory requirements. Accounts included in the CPFR process will be defined by head of planning.
Works closely with Demand and Supply Planning teams to ensure internal Traeger sell-in forecast is accurate and we can effectively meet the demands of customers. (short term tactical forecasting)
Understands all aspects and intricacies of assigned set of accounts and ensures Traeger delivers to them. This includes customer defined success metrics, shipping requirements, chargeback potential, credits and product shortages, organizational layout, etc.
Proactively works cross-functionally to solve operational problems for assigned retail partners and further develop internal operations to meet the changing demands of retail partners.
Develops relationships with counterparts at retail partners, acting as conduit between Traeger and the retail partner's operations.
Supports Sales Team with operational performance data and ad hoc reporting.
Owns item setup and data maintenance in vendor portals.
Owns implementation of marketing and other relevant assets at retail, including POP displays, shippers, etc.
Assists Sales Team in ensuring goals are met by providing detailed information on actuals vs. forecast, expected incoming orders, and status of current orders.
Owns new model launches and store resets from an operational standpoint, ensuring all dates are met efficiently by Traeger.
Advocates for assigned accounts and their needs in collaborative / cross functional processes or projects. Examples include product allocation, warehouse transitions, IT implementations, etc.
Works collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Although Traeger provides a flexible work environment, account management must factor in account needs when planning to be out of the office.


Experience and Skills That Will Make You Successful
Bachelor's Degree or relevant experience
Customer/Retail Services Experience preferred
Problem Solving Skills
Sales Analysis Experience
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
What We Offer:
Generous 401(k) plan
Full medical/dental/vision package to fit your needs
Employee Discounts on all Traeger Products!
Open-PTO Policy
Tuition Reimbursement
Individual professional development programs and initiatives that help you grow and develop professionally
A positive and supportive team to work with
Company provided meals throughout the week, Utah Gold Ski passes, Discounted Gym Memberships, Discounted Public Transit passes, Company Sponsored Community Service Opportunities, and much more!

InsightSquared is seeking an Implementation Specialist to join our Services team.

Drive successful InsightSquared experience by identifying opportunities for documentation and service automation, and participating in creating those tools.

Navigate relational databases using engines such as SQLite and MySQL to troubleshoot data in the product and craft customer solutions.

Personable, clear, and consultative communication style via email, on the phone, and in person

Analytic problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Experience in technical systems and languages, such as SQLite, MySQL and command line
Collaborative personality that will partner with sales, services, engineering, and customers
Professional, polite, and encouraging to customers and team members
An above-and-beyond team player who will do whatever it takes to make us a better team and keep customers engaged, knowledgeable, and productive
2-4+ years relevant experience in customer implementation, onboarding, consulting, support, sales engineering, or technical problem-solving

Familiarity with marketing business processes and automation tools (Marketo, Hubspot, Eloqua, Salesforce, etc)

Senior Living Sales Director needed for beautifully appointed New State of The Art community in Fairfax County, VA. If you're a candidate with a strong sense of relationship building and referral development, this may be the opportunity for you!

We're not seeking an "I can sell widgets, so I can sell anything," sort of salesperson here. Candidates should really come from Senior Living and have creative ideas for sales outreach & referral development. Essential too is the ability to partner with all property department heads to ensure great ideas are backed up by prompt, excellent service.

The Director of Sales and Marketing is involved in building positive relationships with referral sources, responsible for educating prospects on the communities philosophy and services to guide them through the decision making process, learning their motivations and objectives along the way.

Part of that internal partnership involves educating the other departments on how valuable their part is to the overall occupancy. The Director of Sales and Marketing educates employees as to their role in marketing. The Director leads by example showing staff how to exude the values of the organization through having a professional image and by acting with integrity.

With that in mind, our ideal candidate will need to have clear and open communication style, with a love of mentoring and education. Our Sales and Marketing Director should be providing a smile as well as kindness and helpful service.

Any applicant will be expected to demonstrate a track record of measurable success in their previous positions along with stable tenure.

An impressive and measurable track record of success in prior sales roles

This fun team of professionals has been Keeping Staffing Weird for almost 20 years now – and we’re not slowing down anytime soon! Job Description:
Overview


National Interstate is a member of Great American Insurance Group. As one of the leading commercial transportation insurers in the nation, we offer risk financing solutions in all 50 states tailored to meet the needs of a wide variety of transportation classes. Our offerings include traditional insurance and innovative alternative risk transfer (ART) programs, including more than a dozen group captive programs catering to niche wheels markets. Prospects and initiates contact with prospective new business partners.

Collaborates with Underwriting, Product Development, Product Management, Corporate Legal and Corporate Communications to develop marketing initiatives, new products and the supporting marketing materials. May collaborate with other business units on cross-marketing efforts.

Why Watlow

The world’s leading companies start Watlow. Watlow®, a privately-owned company, is the industry leader in the design, manufacture and integration of complete thermal systems including electric heaters, temperature sensors, temperature controllers, power controllers and supporting software.

At Watlow, we are constantly driven to do more to help our customers. We take on big technical challenges. We are committed to projects that help our fellow human beings and we strive to learn more. From single components to high performance systems, we bring our thermal expertise to numerous applications, including semiconductor processing, energy processes, diesel, foodservice equipment, life sciences and others.

Tell me about the role!

As our Senior Account Manager at our San Jose Advanced Technology Center, you will maintain and grow relationships with one of our key accounts in the semiconductor industry. You will be responsible for supporting and achieving Watlow’s business goals and delighting our customer with solutions that meet their needs and grow their business.

In this advanced role, you are responsible for the daily support, management and growth of the account. You will be the primary interface with Watlow teams/departments in meeting our customer demands and expectations and in achieving the customers overall quality needs as measured by the customer’s scorecard. We will rely upon you to monitor our scorecard performance and champion continuous improvement initiatives. You will often serve as an industry subject matter expert and have autonomy and ownership for your account and its relationships.

You will report to the Director of Strategic Accounts for the Semiconductor Business Unit and engage directly with functional leaders across Watlow in providing innovative solutions and product leadership for our semiconductor customers.

What will I be doing?
Building knowledge and personal relationships with key account
Effectively advising internal teams about account dynamics, customers preferences, emerging needs and promoting overall customers satisfaction
Leading and managing the customer scorecard process and reporting to the organization.
Identifying, coordinating and driving to completion all efforts associated with management of change and continuous improvement as measured by customer scorecard and Watlow key performance indicators (KPIs)
Responding and ensuring timely resolution of customer concerns, returns and technical support.
Engaging with the customer to ensure understanding product quality needs, concisely communicate needs to the business, and provide leadership towards satisfying those needs.
Executing quality strategies with stakeholders to maximize customer satisfaction and growth for assigned customers.
Determining scope and implementation timeframes of assigned projects
Organizing and managing internal audits and customer visits (and any follow up actions) to promote best practices and ensure alignment with customer expectations
What are the qualifications to apply?
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, technical or business discipline
Minimum of 5 years in account management
Semiconductor industry experience preferred
Additional success factors:
An “ownership” mind set where you feel responsible for the success of the customer engagement
Experience in the semiconductor industry and understanding of the competitive environment highly desired
Experience managing multiple, detailed projects to a successful end while working under tight time deadlines
Experience supporting/engaging with the customer on meeting their quality requirements
Demonstrated excellence and success with customer relationships, negotiations and problem resolution
Demonstrated skills at developing strong relationships and fostering collaboration
Familiarity with quality management principles
Technical aptitude and verbal skills that allows for understanding and communication of technical industry and products information
Ability and willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and assignments
Experience in a lean based organization modeled after Toyota Production Systems

If you are interested in this opportunity and do not now or in the future required

sponsorship, we are happy to have you apply.

Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities

Senior Marketing Coordinator

You thrive when juggling multiple projects in a fast-paced environment. You’re a hands-on operator, fine-tuning as you go to improve end results. You’re known for your flexibility, jumping on new projects to seize opportunities when they present themselves. Comfortable with ambiguity and a wide array of personalities, you excel at keeping projects moving and stakeholders looped in.

You’ll work closely with the marketing leader and team members across the operations, recruiting, and consulting functions to ensure that the firm’s message is communicated effectively through all touchpoints. You’ll also support stakeholders in their efforts to forge connections with clients and prospects. You’ll have access to a first-class design and web team, a writer/editor, marketing automation software (Act-On), and a custom WordPress CMS website.

Representative Tasks
Prepare digital communications in Act-On
Remind newsletter contributors about upcoming editorial deadlines
Collect content, assemble and test blasts, and ensure that appropriate lists, timing, and settings are used
Participate in Salesforce/Act-On database cleansing and maintenance activities
Coordinate editorial meetings as appropriate
Coordinate quarterly webinar program
Send webinar attendee confirmations and reminders
Host WebEx events
Generate and distribute continuing education certificates; maintain appropriate paperwork
Produce short written items, including but not limited to:
Descriptions for conferences
Bios
Summaries of thought leadership (TL) pieces
Conference communications and mailers
Carry out calendaring and other tracking-related logistics
Own tracking and archiving of TL
Track due dates and milestones for multiple conferences, projects and commitments
Use Basecamp, Outlook, Excel, and other tools as needed
Connect with team members and gently but firmly move processes forward
Ensure that written materials are reviewed by appropriate parties to ensure technical accuracy, adherence to brand standards, and grammatical correctness
Update website
Draft and post updates for speaking engagements, conferences, webinars, and other events
Post blog articles, ECIBs, webinars, white papers, and other materials to the website, ensuring that appropriate summaries are present, gates and landing pages are used appropriately, tags/keywords are implemented, etc.
Update the homepage to ensure that new materials and events are appropriately displayed, and older items are removed
Double-check links and dates
Update LinkedIn feed when needed
Collaborate with outside web team on site upgrades and tweaks as appropriate
Drive mailing campaigns
Clean and merge data files using Excel text manipulation, VLOOKUP, and other functions
Ensure appropriate grammar, spelling, and formatting
Liaise with printers, outside editors, and design team as needed
For in-house mailings, perform mail merges; corral interns; and supervise folding, stuffing, etc.
Collaborate on an array of initiatives
Liaise with Operations and Delivery teams re: address list generation and data storage
Work with EM Ops and Recruiting on various outreach projects
Oversee and validate follow-ups
Drive improvements to tracking, documentation, and other processes
Coordinate collateral reprints and updates, giveaway reorders, and similar tasks
Participate in and coordinate brochure production
Ensure that brand standards and messaging are present on all materials
Own tradeshow and event participation
Communicate with conference organizers and other external parties to gather logistical information, due dates, etc.
Ensure that required paperwork and other information required by the conference organizers is submitted appropriately
Order exhibitor services and restock giveaways, collateral, and any other supplemental items as needed
Manage the inventory, packing, and shipping processes for tradeshows and other events
Vet potential dinner event venues and drive the planning and execution from thought to finish
Collaborate with consulting leaders to ensure strong dinner event attendance
Required Skills and Characteristics
Flexible, organized, detail oriented and energetic; a reliable, thoughtful colleague
Strong analytical reasoning capabilities; does not shy away from data intensive tasks
Superior command of English grammar and usage
Aggressively sees projects through to completion; comfortable with ambiguity
Willing to be accountable for outcomes and results, not inputs or politics (not a “9-to-5” job)
Feels comfortable tapping people on the shoulder with questions or reminders; keeps stakeholders looped in on progress
Always thinks ahead and plans for contingencies; has “uncommon common sense”
Seeks out information and has a track record of mastering new skills independently
Assertive AND diplomatic; comfortable taking independent action AND collaborating with and/or deferring to others when appropriate
Moves fast, yet knows when to slow down and dive into details
Demands excellence from themselves and values it in others
Comfortable using a CMS and marketing automation software
Intermediate knowledge of MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Has empathy for people who work extremely long hours; will pitch in as needed to help meet team goals
Can start remotely due to COVID-19
Desired Skills and Characteristics (Icing on the Cake)
Some experience with photo editing, desktop publishing software, HTML, and/or the Creative Cloud
Experience with long-form writing
Camera and video skills
A Few Signs That The Job Isn't Right for You
Can’t someone else do that?”, “That’s not my responsibility”, and “Why does this depend on me?” are routine parts of your inner dialogue.
You’ve said, “The deadline is tomorrow, but it’s 6:00 PM so it’ll have to wait” and meant it.
You assess someone who lets a deadline slip because they’re working 70 hours per week serving clients as just “not having it all together.”
You often ask questions of others that can be answered with a brief Google search, phone call, or record check.
You believe file versioning and naming conventions are a stupid waste of time.
You think it’s unreasonable when stakeholders expect you to provide information that will give them assurance that tasks are being completed appropriately.
If you don’t know what to do next, you wait. And wait.
You’re more worried about what people think of you than the quality of the outcome you produce.
You resent ambiguous or unstructured situations and require perfect clarity at all times to be happy at work.
Changes to plan, multiple revisions, and new assignments that pop up unexpectedly are unacceptable to you.
You are comfortable letting team members down.
About Equity Methods

Equity Methods is a finance, accounting, and human capital consulting firm that embraces the synergistic role of technology and expertise in creating client impact. We deliver impact-rich services across three core practice groups: financial reporting, valuation services, and HR advisory.

With over 80 professionals and experience serving hundreds of publicly traded clients (including 35 Fortune 100 companies), Equity Methods seeks to combine the best of a large professional services firm with the best of an entrepreneurial, technology-enabled company. We work hard in the quest to have high impact and deliver exemplary client service that supports our client retention and overall growth story. We have consistently been rated a Top Company to Work for in Arizona.

Account Manager

Real support means real leadership backing you up. You'll be armed with the tools and know how to best serve clients and take your career to the next level. In the classroom, online and in the field, our most accomplished sales professionals will teach you their most successful formulas and execution strategies that directly lead to success.

Sales Specialist - Heavy Truck Segment

Job Details
Level
Experienced
Job Location
Mt Laurel - Mt Laurel, NJ
Position Type
Full Time
Job Category
Sales
Description
POSITION SUMMARY

This position is responsible for the development and execution of sales, service, rental, parts and OEM market strategies to attain and /or maintain desired market position within the Heavy Truck Segment.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Reasonable Accommodations Statement
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Functions Statement(s)

• Develop strategic sales plans and work with the company leadership, parts and service, and Equipment Depot’s Senior Manager of the Heavy Truck segment to ensure market position.

• Manage the development and activity of the Heavy Truck Segment including commercial proposals, lease agreements, service contracts, and all customer facing sales support.

• Call on accounts, develop and make sales presentations and ensure adequate aftermarket support in accordance with the company’s value proposition.

• Responsible for effective communications with the retail network as well as all sales support functions.

• Work closely with sales and marketing management to segment the local Heavy Truck market, collect and analyze competitive market intelligence, and sales and marketing strategies to support regional growth plans.

• Collaborate with branch management and internal departments regarding pipeline management, receivables, and allied equipment.

• Utilize company CRM tools to consolidate specific pipeline, account and opportunity information.

• Identify customer application needs and communicate commercial and technical support requests to key OEM partners and suppliers.

• Work closely with Equipment Depot’s Senior Manager for Heavy Trucks and local sales teams in the performance of all essential functions
Requirements
SKILLS & ABILITIES
Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred

Experience: 8-10 years proven sales in heavy truck or port machinery segments preferred
Computer Skills: Basic knowledge and abilities

Other Requirements: Above average travel required

WORK ENVIRONMENT
Work environment varies from office to job site to industrial locations

OUR CORE VALUES
Passion to Perform – We are passionate to perform and focus on concrete achievements
Trust to Act – We are empowered to act, and act in a powerful way
Act Responsibly – We are responsible for our actions and the consequences they have for our stakeholders and our environment
Make it Fun! – We are serious about making work fun; it’s the way we do things

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

The TAM must possess a "HUNTER/CLOSER" mentality with a proven track record of winning "value-driven" sales. The TAM must have proven repeatable and sustainable "sales process". The TAM will use Salesforce.com (CRM) to manage accounts throughout the sales process. The TAM will submit accurate forecasts and attend weekly 1:1 meetings with manager to review pipeline. The TAM will work closely with Qualys TAM (Technical Account Managers), partners to grow overall coverage of territory.

Minimum qualifications:
5 years driving "complex" software sales
Integrity, Intelligent, Positive Attitude and Self-Driven.
Strong level of sales and business acumen.

Excellent time management, collaborates well and strong multi-tasker.

Adaptive to change and fast moving environments
BA/BS
Preferred qualifications:
Relevant work experience driving "complex" Network Security software sales.
Technically proficient and confident (security, networking and/or auditing)
Demonstrates strength in building and managing relationships along with presenting to a diverse audience ranging from business Stack holder, Technical user, Audit & Compliance team, Dev team to C-level executives.

Knowledge of Auditing/IT-GRC, PCI, NIST & CIS).
Knowledge of Patch Management technology.

Position Summary:

Jewish Family & Children's Service seeks a creative, data-driven and results-oriented leader to oversee the strategy, implementation and management of JF&CS marketing, public relations and communication program. Reporting to the Chief Advancement Officer, this role is responsible for building awareness and support for JF&CS's wide range of human service programs, in order to drive philanthropy, fee-based revenue, client impact, and community support. The Director of Marketing will provide leadership, strategic vision and direction to a small team of marketing and communication professionals while also being a key hands-on contributor. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of success and bring expertise in multi-channel platforms, promoting diverse service lines and an ability to both manage and roll up their sleeves. With over $26 million in revenue, 40 programs, and 14,000 clients, JF&CS is a complex agency, and this highly visible position offers a unique combination of marketing challenge and social impact. This position works across the agency and with external partners, participates as a key business leader on organization-wide strategic priorities, and works closely with the agency's top executives. JF&CS provides an opportunity to innovate and work creatively in a mission driven and family-oriented culture.

Your workday will include:
Overseeing the planning, development and implementation of all marketing and communications, including social media, print and digital content, website, email marketing, public relations, newsletters, collateral and advertising.
Responsibility for agency internal communications and intranet content.
Developing agency-wide messaging, as well as plans and campaigns for particular programs, working closely with program directors as well as agency executives.
Measuring, tracking and analyzing marketing results to inform effective decision-making.
Ensuring that brand identity, messaging and marketing and communications strategy are infused in all organizational efforts.
Overseeing the daily activities of the Marketing Department including budgeting, planning and staff development.
Managing a small staff of 2 communications associates and 1 senior designer; set performance goals and conduct annual performance reviews.
Promoting a culture of entrepreneurship, high performance and continuous improvement, and develop staff using a supportive and collaborative approach.
Developing and overseeing all media relations including acting as agency liaison as needed.
Serving as the organization's lead writer and editor for a range of internal and external communications.
Supporting the Chief Advancement Officer in the development and implementation of departmental and organization strategic goals and objectives.
Maintaining strong relationships with key internal and external partners, including board-level contacts.
Building strong relationships across the organization to stay current on our wide range of programs and to infuse an awareness of marketing and messaging in all of our work.
What can you bring to this position?
A Bachelor's degree is required although a Master's degree/MBA is preferred.
A Minimum of 8 years of experience in managing marketing and communications to advance an organization's mission and goals, including experience in complex organizations with multiple services or products.
Your demonstrated skills, knowledge and experience in the design and execution of marketing and communications activities.
Exceptional writing, editing and story-telling skills.
High competence in Google analytics and other performance measurements.
Excellent collaboration skills'an ability to work proactively and effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.
Experience overseeing the design and production of email and print materials and publications, website management, digital/social media content creation and management, and public relations.
Strong budgeting and cost-management skills'an ability to maximize impact with a limited budget.
Strong listening skills, combined with effective, articulate, and persuasive public speaking.
Experience in building, mentoring, and coaching a team of marketing and communications specialists.
Your excellent judgment and creative problem-solving skills, including negotiation and conflict resolution.
Experience working with media outlets and handling crisis communications.
An ability to work independently and responsibly while managing numerous projects simultaneously.
An interest in and commitment to JF&CS's human service mission!
JF&CS is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All employment decisions including recruitment, hiring, promotions, discipline, terminations or salary are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy, medical condition or disability status. JF&CS is committed to providing employees with an inclusive work environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.

We’re looking for a passionate and people-oriented customer service professional who will partner with their colleagues to develop, implement and deliver high-quality insurance and risk management service to new and existing Commercial Lines clients. As an Account Manager you are in charge of ensuring a smooth client experience by managing day-to-day customer service interactions and maintaining strong and long-lasting relationships with our clients.
We will give you access to mentorship, training, resources, and development to ensure your success but you will need to supply the drive and desire to be a PayneWest Insurance professional. Our ideal candidate is hungry, humble and smart- they don’t stop short of excellence and are driven to do what’s best for their clients, colleagues, and communities.
What you'll be doing:
Work with customers and carriers to handle incoming requests.
Manage new and renewal insurance marketing: including negotiating with carriers, preparing presentation and proposal materials, collecting customer information and ordering insurance policies from carriers.
Analysis: provide customers with insurance coverage analysis and recommendations for improved or additional coverage.
Update customer information:keep accurate, up-to-date records on customers in our agency management system.
Up sell & cross sell: work with your colleagues to find and follow-through on up-sell and cross-sell opportunities.
Customer service: ensure that you and your designated sales and service team provide effective and efficient customer service.
Plus(the fine print): you’ll follow organization policies and procedures, sales and service standards and established workflows. You’ll ensure quality control through proper file documentation and maintenance. You’ll maintain confidentiality and be an all-around awesome member of our team.
Who we're looking for:
You're good with people, even on the tough days. Good customer service is just part of who you are, and you love making people happy.
You’re smart. You understand business and people.
Team oriented. You maintain positive relationships with your colleagues—and you enjoy it.
Leadership skills. You actually walk the walk. You lead by example.
You’re that person everyone can depend on—to pay attention to details, to make deadlines, to be accurate and complete when interacting with clients, colleagues and carriers.
You love to learn. You’re earnest about improving and pursuing professional development.
You can adapt—because our industry changes constantly and so do the needs of our clients. You’re good at staying on your toes.
You’re ready for a meaningful change. No more corporate vanilla structure for you. (Yes, an insurance company really just said that.)
You embrace our core values: accountability, balance, excellence, integrity and respect
The perks of the job:
A competitive compensation package, a potential for profit sharing and a benefits package that includes paid paternity/maternity leave, medical leave and paid time off to volunteer within the community. Also- we’re committed to a diverse workplace and a good work-life balance and offer a great career path with room for growth. We take pride in providing our colleagues with opportunities for career growth across all lines of business and function.
What you can expect:
At PayneWest, we often act as de facto consultants. We are the expert that walks into our client’s life and helps them make positive changes in their business so that they’re more competitive and protected. We take the philosophy that—not only are we there when a client has a claim but—we are there to help minimize their risk in the first place. We guide businesses, develop custom insurance portfolios, and find creative solutions. We expect you to use your business skills—and to be creative and flexible—as you do your job.
About us:
Here at PayneWest insurance is not boring. It’s anything but. We like to work as a team. We’re an employee-owned company, and we’re in it together—for the good of our clients, colleagues and communities. We’re fiercely independent about how we do business—and we’d like to keep it that way.
With 700 employees and 31 offices in Washington, Oregon, Idaho, and Montana, we are one of the top 40 largest independent insurance agencies in the country. We offer all the value-added services of a national firm except we aren’t just about a quote, sale, and a renewal. We advocate for our clients first and foremost. It’s about a relationship, smart business sense, long-term strategies, and being part of the community. Each of our offices has their own distinct personality.
Our work environment:
We think we’ve developed a pretty great work culture. We got to where we are today through collaboration, innovation, and an unwavering commitment to doing what’s right. We strive for continuous improvement and excellence in our industry and our communities. We respect quality of life and nurture a balanced personal and professional environment. We treat our clients, colleagues and communities with fairness, decency and good citizenship.

As an Account Manager at Crescent Electric, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining solid, long-term business relationships with customers and reaching sales and gross margin goals while developing a sustainable sales/profit volume in your assigned territory. This includes prospecting and soliciting orders, identifying customer needs, and proposing solutions and appropriate products and services to meet those needs.

You will know you're a match to this position if you possess interpersonal and organizational skills, are a self-starter, detail oriented, and can work quickly and accurately under time constraints and against deadlines. Previous sales experience, previous knowledge of wholesale electrical distribution industry, and previous experience providing superior customer service preferred.

Primary Duties:
Introduce, demonstrate and sell products and services, offer add-on and up-sell products that may benefit the customer, and suggest alternative products when a customer requested product is not available. Assist customers by pricing bills of material.
Execute sales effort in an ethical and professional manner that will reflect favorably on the reputation of both the salesperson and the company.
Attend sales, product, and other branch/company meetings.
Qualifications:
Valid driver's license and ability to travel often in the assigned territory and occasionally travel to attend company and vendor activities and events. Must meet Crescent Electric Supply Company's requirements to drive company vehicles.
High school diploma or general education degree (GED) and a minimum of two years related sales experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university is preferred.
Family Owned. Culture of Quality. Opportunities to Advance.

Crescent Electric offers a caring and supportive environment where employees are provided with the resources and support of a large company. Quality is a way of life at Crescent. Over the last 100 years, we’ve made every effort to continuously improve and grow as a team. As one of the largest electrical distributors in the United States, Crescent Electric has over 160 locations from coast to coast with a variety of career avenues you could pursue.

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our career overview videos on our YouTube playlist at http://bit.ly/2cVXeXn

Crescent is an Equal Opportunity Employer:
We are committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Candidates are subject to assessments, Motor Vehicle record review, criminal background checks, credit and references check, and a post-offer drug screen.

We think we’ve developed a pretty great work culture. We got to where we are today through collaboration, innovation, and an unwavering commitment to doing what’s right. Golden Eagle Distributing Corporation (GED), part of ECHO, an outdoor power equipment manufacturer, is seeking an Account Manager who will be sales-focused, very engaged with our customers and prospective customers, while working closely with Golden Eagle and Echo to facilitate year-over-year sales growth throughout the territory.

As a sales driven organization, the Account Manager will be sales-focused, very engaged with our customers and prospective customers, while working closely with Golden Eagle Distributing staff, to facilitate year-over-year sales growth, overall and by brand, throughout the territory.

Position Description:
The Account Manager is responsible for managing the sales territory, which includes nurturing strong business relationship with all existing dealers, developing new dealer partners, generating sales to dealers, assisting dealers with the sell through of inventory, conducting product/sales training and post-sale support, setting up retail displays, coordinating and assisting with special sale events, and providing customer service support - which exceed expectations.

Position Responsibilities:
Maintain a“professional” image in all representations of Golden Eagle Distributing.
Manage the sales territory as a“small business entity”.
Manage all accounts: sales, receivables, and personal expenses, in relationship to company goals.
Have a thorough understanding of our sales programs, business practices, and competitive situations, to effectively promote sales of all brands we distribute.
Maintain all dealer files and records, respecting all information in a highly confidential manner.
Secure placement of all brands/products we distribute within all dealer partners.
Generate sales of all brands, including current and new products, to dealers.
Ensure every brand distributed is well represented in every marketplace.
Manage dealer inventories and assist with the sell-through of all brands/products we distribute.
Assist dealers with advertising and promotional efforts.
Assist dealers with displays (e.g.: set up, fulfillment, merchandising, cleaning, and refreshing).
Maintain contact with all dealer partners on a regular basis (face to face, email, and phone).
Perform assessments of dealers ensuring they adequately represent our company/brands, including:
Appealing outdoor facility.
High visibility signage representing our brands.
Clean and organized store with high-impact, well-stocked displays.
Staff that is presentable, knowledgeable, and welcoming.
Be recognized as a primary resource for dealer partners, for all brands represented, including:
Provide sales / sales technique training.
Provide product training.
Coordinate technical / service training.
Provide after-sale / customer service support.
Facilitate sell through of brands represented
Represent Golden Eagle Distributing at sale events, open houses, local fairs, and trade shows, as requested.
Grow sales with existing dealers, add new dealers, and layer dealers according to brand/product target markets.
Maintain all demo equipment, and utilize demonstrators in a manner which will drive greater sales volume.
Communicate with Golden Eagle Distributing management (weekly) to share status updates, challenges, competitive situations, and opportunities.
Maintain a positive attitude which seeks solutions and fosters a mindset of possibilities and success.

The Opportunity


CO-OP Financial Services is bringing digital transformation to the credit union movement. We’re creating innovative technology solutions that help not-for-profit credit unions best serve their members and compete with the big banks. As a result, our world-class team is growing faster than ever! If you’re passionate about technology and want to be part of a purpose-driven organization, this is an exciting opportunity to provide real value and help shape the future of human-centered financial services.

We are seeking a talented Account Manager to be responsible for proactively managing portfolios of Custom Contact Center Credit Union relationships and potentially some other smaller client relationships. Focus will be to retain and grow existing client relationships, add-on sales, maintain high level of client satisfaction, escalate and support timely resolution of problems. This will be an inside position and account management will take place via phone, email, and webinar interactions.

What You Can Look Forward to
Maintain a high level of client satisfaction by serving as the primary point person for client escalation and resolution of issues for assigned portfolio.
Work closely with other areas within the company to resolve client concerns.Initiate contact with clients in the assigned portfolio to ensure they are knowledgeable on the value of CO-OP and have an understanding of the products/services we provide to the credit union market.
Under the direction of the Manager, Client Services Contact Center work to develop add-on sales and retention strategies.
Effectively collaborates with customers and Technical Resources to ensure information templates, telephony configuration and decision engines conform to the customer’s guidelines/preferences.
Collaborates with internal partners regularly to ensure contractual commitments are being met.
Regularly conducts analysis and assessment to facilitate customer conversations; Proposes recommendations and troubleshoot issues.
Thoroughly conducts and prepares documentation for regular Lending Program Reviews, as applicable, for the purpose of maintaining or increasing revenue streams while developing the business partnership.
Thoroughly conducts and prepares documentation for regular Account Reviews, as applicable, for the purpose of discussing service trends and opportunities while developing the business partnership.
Thoroughly conducts and prepares documentation for regular operational conference calls to discuss the current status of service offerings, planned activities/events and impacts while developing the business partnership.
Thoroughly conducts accurate credit union audits to include reconciliation of billing to contracts and work provided, among other potential items to review.
Effectively positions additional products and services to customers. Up-sells and cross sells of existing credit union clients.
Makes recommendations to policy and procedure creation and modifications for Client Services and Operations.
Engage the Client Business Executives as needed.Participate in meetings, conferences, etc. as directed.Understand market changes and legislative issues that may impact client decisions.
Responsible for reporting risks that are identified to the appropriate team and/or management. Additionally, responsible for managing, monitoring and reporting risks within the scope of your work area, to include, but not limited to Information Security risks.
Actively supports our CO-OP culture and embraces our core values of Work as Partners, Communicate Openly and Honestly, Demonstrate Excellence and Champion Change in all interactions.
What You’ll Need to Succeed
Must have a High School diploma but a College degree in business, marketing, finance or related field is preferred.
Must have own car, car insurance, and a valid driver's license.
Strong consumer lending knowledge, working knowledge of lending software products preferred.
Strong PC and software skills, including general Microsoft Office knowledge.
Must be able to take own initiative, work independently with minimum supervision and possess the ability to problem solve.
Strong ability to work well under pressure.
Strong ability to understand business concepts and translations.
Excellent communication (verbal, written and presentation) with all levels of management and clients, organizational and proven leadership skills, good presentation skills and some sales background preferred.
Two years of Financial Institution background in operations, marketing, or member services and preferred 2 years in the EFT Industry.
Two years previous account management experience preferred.
Why Join CO-OP?


CO-OP is committed to fostering a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and connected. We are dedicated to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their value; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives. You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP’s commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. Our vast technological ecosystem facilitates more than 6.5 billion transactions every year and equips credit unions of all sizes to deepen member engagement and prosper in the fast-paced world of fintech.

The Perks
Fun, challenging and, collaborative work environment with passionate colleagues that care deeply about the intersection of technology and human-centered financial services.
Great Work/Life Benefits – Paid Time Off (PTO), Maternity, Parental, Family Care, Adoption Leave Programs, Community Volunteer Time Off, and 10 Paid Holidays.
Health benefits – medical, dental, & vision plus wellness programs and gym reimbursements.
401K with generous company match.
Tuition reimbursement.

At Intersect ENT, we strive to make localized drug delivery the standard of care in the ear, nose, and throat space. In order to meet that goal, we hire people who like to challenge the status quo, collaborate cross-functionally, and pursue excellence.

Do you embody this spirit of innovation? Are you ready to join our team?

PURPOSE OF JOB:

Responsible for providing regulatory leadership for drug/device combination products from development through marketing approval and commercialization for the international market. Responsible for the coordination and preparation of international regulatory submissions for the Notified Body, Competent Authority and other agency reviews and for the development/revision of procedures and practices to ensure compliance with the international regulations (MDR/MDD), guidelines and standards. Responsible for providing regulatory guidance to project teams and review/approval of test protocols/reports, risk management reports, labeling documents, SOP/ WIs, COs etc.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Regulatory representation and leadership to cross-functional products teams, development of international regulatory strategies and support for Intersect ENT's products, marketing applications and post-marketing activities.
Responsible for project timelines and management of international regulatory submissions including technical documentation (EU MDR), Substantial changes and amendments (EU MDD/ MDR), UK submissions related to Brexit and other countries with EU MOA etc. to ensure compliance with the international regulations and guidelines.
Draft and update Regulatory procedures and policies to ensure compliance with the international regulations, guidelines and standards.
Lead regulatory activities including planning and reviewing of chemistry; manufacturing and control; preclinical, clinical, and nonclinical sections of regulatory submissions.
Establish, track and manage regulatory project timelines, status and documents.
Provide EU and OUS regulatory assessments for anticipated design, manufacturing and labeling changes.
Represent RA functional area in the review and approval of Engineering Change Orders (ECO).
Provide regulatory guidance with regard to the preparation, review and approval of labeling and promotional materials.
Provide regulatory assistance and review in clinical operations activities, including review of clinical evaluation, Post-Market clinical follow-up, periodic safety update report etc.
Perform regulatory research and stay abreast of changes in the agency regulations and requirements.
Provide regulatory support for quality assurance and regulatory compliance activities such as audits, as required.
Maintain well-organized, auditable regulatory files.
Write and maintain applicable departmental SOPs.
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum of BS in life sciences, engineering, or equivalent required.
Minimum 5 years’ experience.
OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience in developing, submitting and maintaining design dossiers/ technical files for EU registrations / approvals especially with EU MDR. Experience with Class III products with combination products preferred.
Must be detail-oriented with well-developed organizational and analytical skills.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Adobe Acrobat.
Must enjoy working in a fast-paced environment with proven ability to be flexible and adaptable within a changing dynamic environment.
PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS, VISUAL ACUITY, AND WORKING CONDITIONS:

Physical Activity - Repetitive motions: Making substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. Fingering: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working, primarily with fingers rather than with whole hand or arm as in handling. Talking: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word.

Physical Requirements - Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally and all other sedentary criteria are met.

Visual Acuity - The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection involving small defects, small parts, and/or operation of machines (including inspection); using measurement devices; and/or assembly or fabrication of parts at distances close to the eyes.

Working Conditions - The worker is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions (as in typical office or administrative work).

#XENT

Intersect ENT (NASDAQ: XENT) is a medical technology company dedicated to advancing the treatment of ear, nose, and throat (ENT) conditions through evidence-based innovation. We provide treatments for people with chronic sinusitis, an inflammatory sinus condition that has been shown to substantially reduce quality of life. Sinusitis is one of the most common conditions in the United States.

Intersect ENT is an equal opportunity employer that strives to interview, hire and promote a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, disabilities, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

Headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta ("I bought a...") is a free mobile shopping and payments app that has delivered more than $675 million in cumulative cash rewards to its users for making purchases in-store, on mobile apps, or via websites. Launched in 2012, Ibotta has more than 35 million downloads and has become one of the most frequently used shopping apps in the United States. The Ibotta platform provides cash back on purchases at more than 1,500 leading brands and hundreds of retailer partners. In 2019, Ibotta launched its payments solution, Pay with Ibotta™, enabling shoppers to pay for their entire purchase through the Ibotta app and instantly earn cash back. Ibotta was named to the 2019 Inc. 5000 list of fastest-growing private companies in the U.S., after debuting on the list in 2018. The company recently became the first mobile consumer technology company in Colorado to achieve $1B in valuation.

POSITION SUMMARY

Southland Industries is currently seeking a Proposal Specialist to join our Engineering & Construction (E&C), Southern California Division.

This position will be located in our Garden Grove, CA office. As a member of Southland's E&C team, you will need to be able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where clear and precise communication is critical to the continued growth of the business. You will work in a team environment coordinating construction proposals with a heavy emphasis on word processing, industry research, desktop publishing, formatting and minimal graphic functions. You will support the proposal process by preparing proposal outlines and proposal templates; formatting proposal volumes including resumes and past performance references; developing tables and graphics; formatting and producing presentations and various promotional materials. Our proposal team is not limited to just your local peers, but is a comprised of a national team who collaborates with our corporate marketing teams to ensure the Southland Industries brand is able to standout in our industry. In addition, the successful candidate will support corporate proposal initiatives, prepare material for exhibits and conferences and assist in preparing marketing materials for division events, newsletters and other needs as assigned.

What you’ll do:
You’ll work with internal clients throughout the organization, as well as our Business Development and Proposal Teams to assist with the coordination, development, and production of high-quality proposal responses. This includes prequalification and proposal preparation content development, document layout, proofing, and document quality control.
You’ll help put together supporting documentation as necessary including, but not limited to, scope, personnel resumes, project lists, organizational charts, supporting company statistics, and PowerPoint presentations.
You’ll also work with our Business Teams on all RFQ and Proposal packages to develop deliverable lists, timelines for document preparation, submission requirements and responsibilities, and final package submission.
You’ll use your Adobe Creative Suite and InDesign skills to, prepare and format general introductory packages, handouts, and presentations.
Work closely with members of the Proposal and Corporate Marketing team to make sure external materials are consistent with Southland Industries' standards.
Assist with creating, updating, and maintaining files and documents on the Proposal network.


What you’ll need to be successful:
Intermediate knowledge of proposal development and project management from initial concept to final delivery
You can set deadlines for people and manage them to ensure you get what you need in order to provide a quality product in the required timeline.
Have the ability to prioritize work and self-manage competing deadlines in a fast-paced environment
You must be detail oriented, thorough, self-motivated, enthusiastic, collaborative, and have excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Experience with or willing to learn about trade show logistics and representation
What you bring to the table:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Graphic Design or Engineering required
1-3 years of professional experience in writing, editing, researching, printing, and submitting online technical documentation using Adobe Creative Suite or Adobe InDesign
Newly graduated students are encouraged to apply and internship/course work experience using the Adobe Creative Suite and/or InDesign can be accepted in lieu of professional work experience;
Must be able to demonstrate basic working knowledge of the programs listed above
Recent and direct professional experience with Adobe InDesign is required
Intermediate working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook required
Basic working knowledge of other Microsoft Office 365 applications such as Visio, Publisher and SharePoint required
