WHO IS HUB?

At HUB International, we are a team of entrepreneurs. We believe in empowering our clients and we do so by protecting businesses and individuals in our local communities.

HUB International was born in 1998 with the merger of 11 privately held insurance brokerages and has since grown to one of the largest brokers in the world. We are a network of more than 400 integrated brokerages across North America - all carrying the HUB banner.

Our structure gives us the technology and expertise of a large firm, but still maintains the local flavor of each of our offices, enabling our teams to preserve their own unique regional culture.

HUB Gives! Service is one of our founding values not an abstract concept but a commitment. And we believe that no one deserves that commitment more than our clients and the communities in which we all live and work. Each regional hub has adopted projects in their regions which allow them to give, volunteer, engage, and serve their communities.

You must be self-driven and self-sufficient, be interested in developing your insurance career, and taking on additional responsibilities in the future.

WHAT DOES HUB OFFER YOU?

At HUB, we believe in giving our employees the room and space they need to do their job. We believe in paying a fair wage with bonus opportunities and offering great benefits like a 401k plan where the Company matches 50% of the first 6% you contribute, medical, dental, and vision options, paid vacation, paid holidays, and more! We offer a large selection of benefits that are customizable to fit your personal needs - a portfolio of both comprehensive and affordable choices.

Our work environment encourages critical and independent thinking, problem-solving and project-management. We trust our employees to make good decisions for our clients and we give them the space to do that. Our work atmosphere is comfortable and offers a dress for your day policy as well as a flexible work schedule.

Job Description
Marketing Statement

The Police Communications Specialist position plays a critical role in the success of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority’s (WMATA’s) Metro Transit Police Department. Police Communication Specialists are responsible for answering and dispatching the appropriate Police, Fire, or Emergency Medical Services personnel for calls received by Metro customers and employees. The Police Communications Unit operates 365 days per year to ensure the safety of our riders. Metro is seeking dependable professionals with a background in emergency services dispatching to fill several open positions. This position offers a annual salary range of $52,130 to $78,135. WMATA offers a rich benefit package to include health, dental, group life insurance, paid holidays, annual and sick leave, 457 Deferred Compensation Plan and 401A Retirement Plan as well as tuition reimbursement, flexible spending accounts, and free transportation on Metrobus and rail.

Minimum Qualifications

Education
Graduation from high school or possession of a general equivalency diploma (GED).
Experience
Minimum of one (1) year of public safety dispatching, to include 6 months of call taking experience in a public safety environment,
Or
Minimum of two (2) recent, consecutive years of call taking experience in a public safety environment will be considered.
Certification/Licensure
Must attend training to attain and maintain certifications from Maryland and Washington, DC which allows incumbent access to criminal justice databases, used daily while on duty (WALES and METERS). A passing score on the test(s) issued by each state/jurisdiction is required to obtain the initial certification, as well as bi-annual recertification to remain a valid user of the system.
Other Requirements
Candidate must have never been convicted of a felony or serious misdemeanor.
Candidate must pass an extensive background check.
May be required to work variable shifts as needed, at times during inclement weather and when necessary, work extended tours of duty without notice.
Medical Group:

Satisfactorily complete the medical examination for this position, if required. The incumbent must be able to perform the essential functions of this position either with or without reasonable accommodations.

Mission Essential Designation
In accordance with the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority’s Continuity of Operations Plan (COOP) this job has been identified as critical to mission essential functions. Incumbents in this role may be required to report to or continue to work in the event of authorized office closings or service suspensions due to severe weather, natural disaster, fire, operational emergencies or related events.
Summary

This is full time technical and administrative public safety communications work in an emergency communications call center. Incumbent is responsible for receiving and processing all calls for service to the Metro Transit Police Department, coordinating with jurisdictional police and fire departments, making appropriate notifications, and providing support services to the unit and other Department divisions. Incumbent is responsible for making appropriate decisions during periods of stress and has latitude for independent judgement and action, within established guidelines.

The Communications Division is the primary point of contact for all calls for public safety and operates 24 hours a day, 365 days per year, including special events, holidays and during weather/public safety emergencies.

Essential Functions
Answers emergency and non-emergency calls for service; determines the appropriate police, fire, emergency services or other WMATA department response; queries the caller to ascertain specific and vital details of a situation in a timely manner; maintains contact with the caller or appropriate jurisdictional police agency as needed and relays the information received from the caller.
Operates communications console equipment, computer aided dispatch (CAD) system, telephones, and corporate PC to expedite a variety of emergency, non-emergency and complaint calls from the public for assistance. Incumbent utilizes a variety of communication services, wired, wireless and text, to impart or receive police information.
Conducts police computerized information systems queries, hit confirmations, entries and performs administrative message switching between other agencies utilizing systems such as the Washington Area Law Enforcement System (WALES), the Maryland Electronic Telecommunications Enforcement Resource System (METERS), and the Virginia Criminal Interstate Network (VCIN) and their associated local systems, as well as WMATA in house systems.
Provides callers with customer support and acknowledges WMATA customer complaints, inquiries and recommendations for WMATA during non-business hours, which may or may not be police related.
Researches historical call data or locates information for internal and external customers.
Utilizes the voice, radio and call recording system to review calls and produce recordings for court purposes.
Sends notifications as required, to various WMATA management and external government recipients, reference police or public safety emergencies.
Dispatches police officers, officials and emergency management personnel to calls for service. Monitors, controls and coordinates the response and ensures the safety and accountability of all MTPD personnel in the field, by tracking location and status and frequently checking their welfare. Updates the CAD with pertinent information pertaining to all calls for service until the call is closed and files it for historical purposes.
Determines what type of response by police officers and resources is warranted, based on the call type and information gathered during the interview process of calluses requesting assistance.
Determines the number of police officers that will be needed to handle a particular call for service based on the most current information available.
Evaluates the closest and the safest location to intercept moving trains and buses when an emergency call has been received, and arranges for appropriate police and/or EMS resources to be in place to intercept.
Answers radio requests from officers on patrol for criminal, motor vehicle and civil offenses.
Monitors emergency activations of police radios to identify which officer has activated the emergency button and determine if an emergency exists, and send appropriate assistance when needed.
Reports radio malfunctions to WMATA’s radio maintenance department. Keeps accurate and updated records of malfunctions to include: specific locations, exact problem, and corrective actions being taken by WMATA radio maintenance personnel.
Utilizes available mapping services to assist officers in locating addresses outside of the metro stations for calls for service.
Utilizes bus tracking application to track the movement of buses to determine their location and nearest and safest location to intercept a bus for police and/or fire/medical emergencies.
Utilizes the Rail Operations Computer System (ROCS) live map application to track the movement of trains to determine their location and nearest and safest location to intercept a train for police and/or fire/medical emergencies.
Monitors and communicates with the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) via a dedicated telephone system. The telephone is utilized to notify federal, state and local law enforcement or other first responders of important information regarding the Washington Metropolitan Area infrastructure or severe weather conditions that may affect WMATA operations.
Evaluation Criteria

Consideration will be given to applicants whose resumes demonstrate the required education and experience. Applicants should include all relevant education and work experience.

Evaluation criteria may include one or more of the following:
Skills and/or behavioral assessment
Personal interview
Verification of education and experience (including certifications and licenses)
Criminal Background Check (a criminal conviction is not an automatic bar to employment)
Medical examination including a drug and alcohol screening (for safety sensitive positions)
Review of a current motor vehicle report
Closing

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Develops and implements programs and processes to ensure that company products are safe, legal and meet or exceed customer expectations for compliance with national/regional/global regulations. Prepares document packages for regulatory submissions for new and mature products to ensure alignment and compliance with local and regional registration requirements and company policies. Compiles materials required in submissions, license renewal and annual registrations and maintains updated information about national/regional/global regulatory requirements. Proactively manages the changing regulatory environment for company products, prevents barriers to trade, eliminates duplication of effort and identifies and mitigates areas of risk. Reviews product labeling and marketing materials for accuracy and compliance with regulations. Responds to customers and/or authorities requests/inquiries dealing with regulations and product compliance. Represents company in external bodies dealing with standards and/or product regulations at the national/regional/global level. May assess requirements and identify strategies for earliest possible approvals of clinical trials applications.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Serve as the regulatory representative for new product introduction and new product improvement projects for all product types; participate in team meetings and coordinate quality activities as required
New product development includes design, development and commercialization of assays for pathogen testing on RT-PCR, NGS and Microarray technologies
Assist in FDA EUA submissions, EU Self Certify / IVDR submissions and ROW submissions of products
Assist with the verification and validation experimental design; coordinate with regulatory affairs and R&D to confirm experimental design conforms to appropriate regulatory requirements
Create and update design and process FMEA
Review, create, and update traceability matrices
Conduct detailed reviews of all design history files; coordinate with project management, R&D, and manufacturing as needed ensure the project deliverables are complete, accurate, and in compliance with regulatory requirements
Coordinate efforts associated with the preparation of regulatory documents or submissions in a timely manner to facilitate worldwide product launches
Assess and update design and quality process documentation as required to elevate existing Research Use Only (RUO) products to Class I Clinical Laboratory Instruments, Software, General Purpose Reagents and/or CE-IVD regulations
Identify gaps and update Design History Folders (DHF) and Device Master Records (DMR) for the existing products
Identify gaps in design verification and validation and update them to meet the requirements of Class I and / or II / or EUA medical devices
Create and update technical files
Coordinate with production manufacturing to bring device master record documentation to QSR levels
Bachelors or Master's Degree or equivalent in Biological science or equivalent
4+ years experience in a biological manufacturing environment
Must have prior experience with wet-lab benchwork
Experience writing and executing validation protocols and reports for the medical device industry
Experience writing and submitting regulatory submissions (FDA, EU, or Canada)
Experience in ISO13485 or quality environment supporting clinical markets
Proficient in Microsoft office suite
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with bioinformatics and statistical design
Experience using bioinformatics data analysis software
Prior experience with next-generation sequencing

Job Description:

As a Principal Product Designer you’ll be responsible for designing useful, integrated experiences in collaboration with a group of talented, kind people whose skills

span design, product, tech, and finance.

As a Product Designer on the Integrated Experiences Team, you are ....

A master craftsperson. You pride yourself in confidently driving projects from strategy through execution. You’ve got a whole arsenal of tools and techniques at your disposal that you dispatch appropriately depending on the customer and business needs.

A systems thinker. You think larger than just the work at hand and intuitively think at the ecosystem level. You often think about scalability and adaptability across products and platforms.

Passionate. You are genuinely interested in what you do. You make it your business to know as much as you can about the people you are delivering for and advocate for their needs within the business.

A Customer Advocate. You cultivate a deep empathy for people and anticipate their needs. You help them to focus on what’s essential at the moment and advocate for their best interest.

Collaborative. You’re a team player who puts the interest of the team above your own. You display a positive attitude, are open and enjoy contributing, which contributes to your respected leadership on the team.

A successful juggler. You don’t get overwhelmed or flustered easily. You’re able to keep track of multi-projects at once, manage your time efficiently and appropriately communicate scheduling with the broader team.

A clarifying voice. You add clarity and focus to every conversation you’re in, clearing a path to what really matters and helping others see things in a new, simpler light.

Excited about designing with data. You are comfortable working with data as a raw material. You think carefully about presenting it in a way that helps users focus on what’s important.

Specifically, you will:

Help deliver world-class products that will redefine the very fundamentals of how our client does

business.

● Build empathy and be a customer advocate in our product development process.

● Translate user needs, style guides, and requirements into elegant solutions for complex

problems.

● Leverage analytics tools to measure success, present opportunities, and support

decision-making.

● Participate in workshops to facilitate co-creation, alignment, and understanding.

Here’s what you’ll need to be successful:

You have worked in a product group focusing on web or mobile applications for a few years; in

and around designers, product managers and engineers – and love it. You thrive being the

person responsible for delivering improved experiences.

● Demonstrable prior experience illustrating that you were responsible for product

throughout the full product lifecycle.

● You’ll identify opportunities and uncover untapped needs through customer research

and interaction data.

● You possess the ability to deliver on those insights by partnering with product teams to

drive product vision and experience strategy.

● Working with our engineering teams, the vision you articulate will turn into simple,

intuitive experiences.

● You have a demonstrated record of success inventing, designing, and launching

successful features.

● You are experienced at the end-to-end design process, balancing customer insights and

business goals, from strategy to shipped product as well as post launch monitoring,

enhancements, and iteration.

What You’ll Bring:

A portfolio that highlights strong experience designing for data intensive applications at scale.

● Solid UI/UX experience.

● Ability to work with low fidelity and high-fidelity deliverables in agile teams.

● Experience creating prototypes that showcase design concepts and interaction patterns.

● Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.

● Not intimidated by current design tools, e.g., Adobe CC, Sketch, Invision, etc., or working

with them to develop and complete deliverables.

● Strong storytelling capabilities; an ability to weave key insights into a compelling

narrative.

● Experience creating prototypes at various levels of fidelity to articulate and test user

flows, UI design, and/or UI animation using modern tools (e.g., InVision, Flinto, Pixate,

UXPin,Keynote, etc).

● Excellent problem-solving and relationship management skills.

● Interest in service design with experience using service design methods.

● Ability to clearly communicate your design decisions with partners and influence the

shape of the product using research, user journeys, interactive prototypes, and

high-quality wireframes.

● Ability to advocate the value of Design, and inspire partners and teammates through

elegant presentation and storytelling capabilities.

Client Description:


This client puts its money where its mouth is. As a leading financial services and tech company, they’re constantly pushing the envelope to adapt and stay ahead of trends - whether it’s trends in financial products or in the way they treat their customers. Our client sets the bar in customer experience.

Our Talent are working with “best-in-class” global marketing teams on omni-channel campaigns, leveraging innovative technologies to drive customer engagement. AQUENT Talent work alongside full-time employees presenting ideas to stakeholders and influencing business decisions every day.

Working here:
You’ll be pushed to bring thoughtful creative and marketing ideas to the table
You’ll be collaborating in an Agile environment to deliver purposeful projects
You’ll be working with a global brand - meeting customers where they live by leveraging AI, ML and VR

Requirements:


Basic Qualifications:

● At least 3 years of experience with user experience design, including visual UI design.

● At least 2 years of experience in driving product experience vision and storytelling

Preferred Qualifications:

● 5+ years of experience with user experience design

● 5+ years of experience designing digital products

● 2+ years of experience designing for data-intensive products

● 5+ years’ experience with standard digital design tools (e.g. Figma, Sketch, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Omnigraffle, Balsamiq, Axure, etc.)

● 5+ years of experience with information architecture

● 3+ years of experience creating prototypes at various levels of fidelity

Job Title: Technical Account Manager - Field Post Sales
Job Description:
The Technical Account Manager (TAM) is responsible for actively driving and managing the post sales process with direct and channel customers. The TAM must be able to articulate the company's technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. Must be able to identify all technical and business issues of assigned accounts to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process.

This position is open to candidates based in the Southeast.

Responsibilities
Provide product and technical support for assigned accounts
Identify and develop potential new business opportunities
Convey customer requirements to Product Management, Marketing and Engineering teams
Provide functional and technical support to customers
Respond to customer questions on technical and business related issues
Deliver high-level and detailed sales presentations
Responsible for attending conferences, seminars, etc
Qualifications
Ideal candidate must be self-motivated with strong knowledge in security and compliance space: Vulnerability Management, Policy Compliance , Intrusion Detection Systems IDS, Intrusion Prevention Systems IPS, Network Scanners, PCI, Policy Compliance and Audit Tools, other enterprise security solutions
Knowledge in variety of Federal Regulatory Compliance issues a plus: ISO 27001, HIPAA, GLBA, Sarbanes Oxley SOX, etc
Must possess strong presentation skills and be able to communicate professionally in response to emails, RFPs and when submitting reports
Must be comfortable interacting at all levels within customer organizations, i.e., from C-level to front-line technical staff
Organized and analytical, able to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches
5-7 years relevant experience
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Able to travel throughout sales territory
'Big 4' or similar consulting experience a plus

E-Commerce Marketing Specialist

Primary job duty is to build relationship of trust and respect with clients and help them achieve their e-commerce marketing goals.

Overview:

Our team is seeking to add Paid Search, Product Ads & Amazon Specialists to our growing team.

At EXCLUSIVE, we believe that your work day should be equally challenging as it is fun. We foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and innovation. Our biggest win is our client's success.

We look for talented, spirited, business minded individuals who want to grow with our company.

Consider joining a culture that values individual voices, different points of view and that is constantly testing and adapting new approaches, developing new technologies for capturing and analyzing data and for changing customer behavior-all with the goal of increasing our value to our clients.

NO Mailing it in! Our clients are emotionally engaged in the success of their business and we give them the attention and respect they deserve.

About the E-commerce Marketing Specialist Role:
Responsible for the day-to-day management of paid search marketing initiatives for an array of e-commerce stores.
Communicate regularly with clients on campaign performance and deliverables.
Use statistical analysis to draw conclusions about marketing campaigns and make recommendations accordingly
Implement successful bidding strategies and effective keyword management based on business goals and targets.
Provide bid and ad management/optimization on a regular basis to achieve maximum efficiency
Write ad copy and perform copy testing and keyword analysis- continually monitoring, revising, and optimizing ad text as necessary to drive campaign performance.
Track and report on campaign results and take part in weekly, bi-weekly and/or monthly client status calls.
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong skills in analysis, critical thinking, problem solving
Experience creating and presenting campaign reports including ROI conversion rates
Able to manage multiple tasks and projects under tight deadlines while keeping a professional demeanor
Self-motivated, independent, proactive
Excellent skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Must be an effective negotiator and communicator with internal and external individuals at all levels. This includes spoken, written, electronic, and presentation skills. Communication should be consistently constructive and professional. Must be a good team player.
Preferred hands on experience with search marketing (SEO/PPC); e-mail marketing, Conversion Testing is a plus.

Job Title: Senior Technical Marketing Engineer, Endpoint ICs
Job Description:
It’s an exciting time to be at Impinj! We provide Digital Life for Everyday Items with our market leading RAIN RFID platform. Our platform connects billions of items to enterprise applications providing the identity, location and authenticity of these items. If you’ve purchased apparel from a major retailer, run a race, or checked bags at airports worldwide then you’ve probably interacted with our technology. We have delivered item connectivity for over 30 billion items since our inception and have plenty of opportunity ahead.

We are looking for someone with a passion for technology to join our existing team of Technical Marketing Engineers (TMEs) responsible for enabling our partners’ success with the Impinj IoT platform for RAIN RFID. With a specific focus on our newest generation of Endpoint ICs,(Integrated Circuits) the Impinj M700 Series.

Partners are a critical element of our commercial success and as a TME, you will be responsible for delivering the tools, content, and programs crafted to help our global endpoint partners successfully adopt our newest products. You would not be alone in this! Collaboration between internal teams across the company as well as, at our external partners will enable you to contribute heavily to the success of our clients and Impinj.

What we need from you:
Be the technical domain specialist for our global partners and field sales teams on the Endpoint IC components of the Impinj product portfolio
Provide consultation to our partners on technical issues related to their adoption of the newest generation M700 Series ICs and apply this knowledge to help scale our global ecosystem
Develop technical content crafted to help our partners be successful with our Endpoint IC products, including technical whitepapers, standard methodology tips, e-learning content, and technical demonstrations
Train Impinj and partner technical staff on new product features, capabilities, and applied standard methodologies
Act as an escalation point to back-up our field sales and customer support teams as needed
Represent new customer requirements back to product management and engineering teams
Skills and experience you have:
8+ years of customer facing application/systems engineering experience, preferably in the embedded RF arena
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation abilities, to effectively represent our platform to technical audiences, both internal and external
Relevant understanding of semiconductor technologies, wireless communications infrastructure, and embedded sensor systems
Deep knowledge of silicon wafer manufacturing processes
Proven experience working with customers or partners to understand requirements and respond with technical guidance and solutions to help them succeed
Demonstrated ability to collaborate successfully across multiple teams (sales, marketing, product management and engineering)
Prior RFID experience strongly preferred
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering (BSEE) preferred
Willingness and ability to travel, up to 30%, including some international travel
Why Impinj?

Join a team of exceptionally capable colleagues who work passionately on everything from silicon chip designs to Ember.js web interfaces. Collaboration and teamwork are highly valued, and accomplishments are duly celebrated. We have bi-weekly open Q&A sessions with our executive team. We have an open time-off policy paired with a profound respect for work/life balance. Impinj has a commitment to a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome applications from all backgrounds and walks of life.

#LI-BH1

As Partner Account Manager, you will oversee day to day operations for a significant number of online and offline partners, ensuring that they consistently deliver the highest quality insurance leads and calls, while optimizing to AWL's aggressive performance metrics. To be successful in this role you must be comfortable analyzing and working large amounts of data, have a passion for building and nurturing relationships, and be driven to meet and exceed the goals of both AWL and our partners.
You will optimize and grow both new and existing affiliate partners for a program with extremely aggressive growth goals. You will react to daily and hourly metrics reports to take decisive action in order to optimize and grow the AWL affiliate program. This role is an excellent opportunity to have an immediate impact in a key business segment for a market leader in online lead generation.

What you can expect:
• Create and analyze large sets of real-time and historic data to effectively manage volume, cost, and quality performance metrics.
• Evaluate campaign performance and work with affiliates on a daily basis to capitalize on growth opportunities.
• Manage relationships for a growing program of strong affiliates who use multiple media types display, paid search, organic search, email, television, call center, and more.
• Develop strategic initiatives in order to exceed quarterly goals.
• Collaborate with other Marketing, Sales, and Engineering team members on cross-functional initiatives.
• Conduct market research and competitive analysis in order to identify opportunities for growth.
• React quickly to issues and market shifts as they arise.

To be successful at AWL:
• 1-3 years in a role which has included extensive data analysis, ideally in a digital marketing position.

• Robust analytical skills and ability to work with and analyze a large volume of complex data.
• Ability to efficiently manage multiple projects at once.
• Expertise with Microsoft Excel and other Office software.
• Excellent relationship management skills.
• Extremely self-motivated individual with strong work ethic.
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
• Precise and effective written and verbal communication skills.
• Bachelor's degree required.
• Position is based in Austin, TX - In Office Only

* Must be eligible to work in the United States. Visa sponsorship for employment will not be provided

AWL (All Web Leads, Inc.) is one of the most successful customer acquisition marketing companies in the US. Simply put, we help our customers acquire customers. Today, we do this for the US insurance industry. Our amazing team of over 500 talented and successful professionals uses Internet marketing to turn consumer interest in insurance products into policy sales for the world's largest insurance carriers and more than 30,000 of their agents. We are Austin-born and our growth from a 2-person startup in 2005 to a highly profitable business has been remarkable. We are a tight-knit team with a fast paced, energetic, and entrepreneurial company culture that has been ranked a Best Place to Work in Austin for 2017, 2018 and 2019. We provide competitive pay, outstanding benefits, and a fabulous, fun, collaborative environment that allows our people to be their best.

Excellent communication/negotiating/closing skills with customers/prospects
Flexibility and multi-tasking, ability to undertake several tasks at once and manage them efficiently
Ability to work through a problem and maintain focus with little or no supervision
Positive attitude with an ability to absorb & learn quickly
Team player
Microsoft Office Suite skills: Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint

The individual will be responsible for managing the Chengdu office as the figure head in that area

Job Title: Account Manager - Warehouse and Distribution Centers
Job Description:
Intralox LLC has an opening for
an Account Manager who will be responsible for continued development and growth
of our OEM and System Integrator partners in the North American Warehouse and
Distribution Industry Segment.

Our patented Activated Roller Belt Solutions have been
proven to bring value to Warehouse and Distribution Centers OEMs and System Integrators by reducing overall
system costs and/or adding required functionality beyond the capabilities of
traditional technology. The successful
candidate must possess strong skills in both technical and commercial aspects
of system selling. This includes: qualification of opportunities, funnel
management, account and business development as well as a good knowledge of
alternative systems/solutions, their functionality and their advantages/disadvantages.

Responsibilities
Bring value to customers: Consult with OEM/System Integrator partners on
concepts and Material Handling Equipment layouts to qualify opportunities thoroughly and provide
tailor-made recommendations and solutions tuned to their needs
Clearly articulate Intraloxs value proposition(s) for each solution
offered
Identify and initiate contact with the appropriate buying influences at
OEMs and Integrators
Identify new opportunities for our solutions and work with internal
resources on application development
Continuously increase industry knowledge and effectively apply this
knowledge to strategy
Consistent use of sales tools to maximize selling productivity
Prepare timely, accurate and concise reports on industry and customer
activities and issues
Work closely with a global industry team that leverages best practices
across regions

in Business or Engineering; MBA would be a plus
5+ years of
successful, content based technical sales of equipment and systems
Material Handling Equipment experience in the Warehouse and Distribution Center industry

Self-motivated,

of projects simultaneously

The Graphic Design Specialist is responsible for the conceptualization, design, execution, and delivery of concurrent projects for multiple internal stakeholders. Provides graphic support to the Clinical Affairs Division and other NACHC Divisions as needed to develop internal and external graphics for products that inform, promote, educate, and enhance the sharing and exchange of information between NACHC, national partners, its constituencies, and the general public.

SPECIFIC DUTIES:

Graphic Communications
Develops a graphic communications strategy for NACHC/Clinical Affairs Division.
Creates products funded by HRSA, CDC, and other national partners to professionally display accomplishments, products, and potential partnerships.
Uses design software to create Web and print products including presentations, infographics, brochures, reports, fact sheets, and publications.
Supports Project leads with graphics for promotion and dissemination of information related to programs, projects, training, services, and other issues of importance and interest to NACHC constituencies and the general public.
Assists in maintaining PowerPoint presentations reflecting Clinical Affairs Division strategies, vision, and results.
Supports additional internal creative projects in other Divisions.
Brand/Publishing Standards
Monitors internal adherence to NACHC communications policies, publishing standards and internal/external use of NACHC brand tools (i.e., publications guidelines, logos, templates, etc.) Maintains all related files. Makes recommendations for updates/changes.
Applies NACHC brand guidelines to ensure graphics reflect NACHC's standards and color scheme as well as have a consistent look and feel.
Works on the branding/marketing work group.
Social Media/Website
Under the supervision of the Director of Information, Resources, and Outreach,
assists Clinical Affairs Division staff with graphic design on clinical areas of NACHC’s website.

Interactive Digital Communications
Works in collaboration with NACHC Communications Division on developing interactive digital media including email marketing and social media assets for official NACHC statements, press releases, podcasts, blogs and editorial content as directed.
Other digital media duties as assigned.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Education
Bachelors Degree in related discipline (preferably in graphics, marketing or digital media)
Experience/Ability/Knowledge
At least 4 years work experience in graphic design including designing materials for the federal government, public health organizations or associations.
Experience designing materials for low literacy audiences preferred.
High proficiency in Microsoft Office software.
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator).
Experience working with social networking tools (e.g., Facebook, Twitter), video sharing/hosting sites (e.g., Vimeo, YouTube, Flickr) and video applications (e.g. Dreamweaver, Flash).
Experience with a web content management system a plus.
Must be able to multitask and meet deadlines – attention to detail is essential.
Other
Must work well with others as well as independently.
Strong customer service skills.
Ability to problem solve.
Company Name:
National Association of Community Health Centers, Inc.
3.3

Job Description:
About Us

Acumed is a global leader of innovative orthopaedic and medical solutions developed to improve patient care. With over three decades of experience in the orthopaedic industry, our mission is to aid the afflicted through the ingenuity of our minds, the labor of our hands and the compassion of our hearts. The company is headquartered in Hillsboro, Oregon with a global sales and distribution network supported by offices worldwide.

ASC (Ambulatory Surgery Center) Account Manager

The Ambulatory Surgery Center (ASC) Account Manager, develops new business in national and local Ambulatory Surgery Center (ASC) accounts, drives compliance in facilities with existing Letters of Commitment (LOC) or contracts. Utilizes analytical, interpersonal, and critical thinking skills to develop and maintain strong working relationships with administrative, contracting and clinical leaders at assigned accounts, presenting Acumed as the solution to their problems.

This position works remotely, preferably near a major US Airport.

Duties/Responsibilities
Close new business deals by coordinating requirements, responding to (Requests for Proposal) RFP's, developing and negotiating contracts, and integrating contract requirements with business operations.
Facilitates resolution of customer product issues and concerns.
Act as a content expert on national contract portfolio of ASC accounts, supporting field teams with strategies to optimize existing agreements.
Serve as a key member of the sales team who contributes to strategic direction by developing, making recommendations and implementing account strategy with ASC's.
Assist in the preparation and operation of ASC site visits, trade shows, conventions, and/or clinical meetings.
Routinely update/engage local sales team from rep to manager on business status changes and pending strategies
Maintain routine communication with sales forces to both gather information as input to development of account strategy and share information gathered from account.
Analyze and interpret sales and trend data to develop targeted action plans.
Coordinate activities involving contracting strategies including sales of Acumed products in Ambulatory Surgery Centers
Execute ASC specific strategies by analyzing data for increasing market share within ASC's, coordinating with Sales, Marketing, Contracting, Pricing and new product development
Coordinate specific objectives for ASC's within the National Account strategic plan
Establish relationships with pertinent supply chain personnel, including heads of contracting and value analysis and develop and maintain key decision maker contact list
Close new business opportunities by coordinating requirements, responding to RFP's, developing and negotiating contracts and integrating contract requirements with contracting
Maintain routine communication with the sales force, contracting and the National Account Managers to gather information and coordinate efforts to maintain ASC strategy
Assist in developing training content in coordination with Medical Education for Regional Business Managers, Agents and Sales Representatives
Qualifications
BA/BS in Business or related field highly preferred, equivalency in experience required
3+ years' experience in medical device sales
Solid understanding of US Business Practices and markets management related to medical device sales.
Strong negotiation and sales skills.
Ability to determine which company resources are needed to effectively win ASC contracts and facilitate and coordinate those resources as required.
Strong presentation skills, written and verbal, to both administrative and clinical audiences.
Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills, demonstrated ability to interact with other professionals to gather and disseminate information.
Strong attention to detail, tolerance for time sensitive deadlines and the ability to manage multiple priorities.
Computer literacy is required. Strong working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).Ability to read and speak English sufficiently to understand, and complete all paperwork.
Acumed and ACUTEare equal opportunity employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with a disability.

As an equal opportunity employer, Acumed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying to Acumed and need special assistance or accommodation, please contact us at recruiting@acumed.net.

Job Posted by ApplicantPro

LearnWell is specialized and dedicated to supporting the 49% of all students who may be struggling with an underlying mental health condition—such as depression, anxiety or other mood disorders—which often manifest in self-destructive behavior, substance use, and eating disorders. In partnership with treatment facilities and school districts, we provide an integrated set of academic and mental wellness services for students and their families throughout the continuum of care.

We are hiring an Account Manager to forge administrator-level district relationships and help launch our new mental health counseling services for districts services. This individual will focus heavily on LearnWell’s top 150 customers to deepen our relationship with those districts, cross-sell LearnWell’s academic and tutoring services, while continuing to expand our reach to new customers in each geographic market.

This role is a true hunter-farmer role and will build a book of business and then expand within those key accounts by positioning LearnWell’s unique mental health counseling services. We expect this new service to be a crucial support for school districts and we anticipate high demand.

Key job responsibilities include:
Establish relationships with decision-makers at LearnWell’s top 150 school districts with the goal of introducing and/or cross-selling LearnWell counseling and teaching services
Effectively communicate the purpose, value and use case scenarios for all services offerings
Conduct ongoing outreach to existing district customers to optimize sell-through and usage of services
Manage the annual contracting process, negotiate fixed-fee agreements with districts as necessary
Conduct quarterly customer review meetings to demonstrate program impact and gather feedback
Cultivate reference accounts, customer champions and pursue referrals to new districts
Manage the selling process for all in-bound leads for counseling and academic services outside of LearnWell’s top 150 school districts
Qualifications
At least three years in K-12 sales and account management at the district level, with at least two years of experience generating new business
Excellent client engagement skills: listening, analyzing, speaking, writing, and presenting
Proven success in high-volume, deadline-driven environment
Track record of goal attainment in sales and customer service
Proficient use of computer software, including Salesforce.com and Microsoft Office
Ability to travel up to 25%

From Reading to Interacting!

We're bringing textbooks to life.

We're on a mission to create custom, connected, and engaging learning experiences for private and parochial schools across the United States.

The ideal candidate will be self-driven, detail oriented, able to create, document and follow processes and understands the importance of account development. Account Management experience is helpful but someone with a good work ethic can be just as successful as someone with years of experience. This opportunity involves web based research, creating cost analysis for schools and customer interaction via the phone, email and direct mail to grow our established customer base.

Major Tasks and Responsibilities
Work diligently attaining specific book list analysis, publisher information and school interaction in a timely manner
Manage specific accounts as required
Seek out ongoing education to effectively communicate with customers about products
Interact with customers to resolve customer service related issues
Qualifications We Look For:
High level of personal initiative coupled with good planning and organizational skills
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills
Good analytical and multi-task skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Presents a professional image daily
Experience with computer software necessary
This position is full time and is paid hourly, after probationary period position goes to salary. A competitive benefit package is available.

Join a growing team that has shaped the digital marketing efforts of high-profile clients such as the NFL, U.S. Census Bureau, American Cancer Society, and U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.

Reingold is hiring an early-career (2+ years) paid media specialist to join our social impact communications firm, located in Alexandria, Virginia. This position will help execute integrated marketing campaigns alongside specialists in digital marketing, analytics, user experience, and web design and development.

Responsibilities include the following:
Understand client goals and translate them into paid media strategies.
Perform landscape and competitive analyses, audience research, and other market research.
Develop comprehensive digital media plans and budgets to support campaign goals.
Create and manage paid media campaigns across a variety of channels (search, social, display).
Work with vendors to place, manage, and report on media content.
Analyze and report on paid media campaign data and performance.
Present paid media plans and performance data (internal and external).
Work with the analytics team to define and implement measurement and tracking tools.
This position requires the following qualifications and skills:
At least 2 years of experience setting up, running, and managing paid media campaigns
Proficiency with Google Ads and Analytics, Microsoft Excel, and social media advertising
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (and we mean excellent)
Versatility, intellect, and tact
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
Reingold is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. Women, minorities, veterans, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply. No phone calls, please.

About the role.


The Large Account Underwriting Specialist is a key member of a zonal underwriting team. The Large Account Underwriting Specialist reports directly to the Large Account Underwriting Practice Leader with accountability to the region(s) for which they are aligned. The primary goal of this position is to profitably grow a book of business of $50,000+ accounts in annual premiums by actively partnering with brokers, field sales and marketing, and the underwriting team to generate leads and win accounts. The Specialist will plan and budget for the book of business, develop and maintain strong broker relationships, be accountable for the quality of underwriting decisions and execution, and help identify those capabilities needed to best serve large accounts.

What you’ll do.
Business Management. Work closely with the Regional Executive and Large Account Underwriting Practice Leader on planning and budgeting for the book of business, tracking and reporting performance to plan, and developing a clear view of market conditions and competitive landscape within the Midwest and Gulf Regions.
Underwriting Execution. Responsible for the Regions’ new business underwriting execution, including selecting risks in line with PURE’s strategy and underwriting guidelines, operating within authority and documentation guidelines, following up on large accounts and closing new business. In conjunction with the RUMs, the Large Account Underwriting Specialist will also develop the acumen and build out the capabilities of the underwriting teams. Conduct and report on quarterly self-audit.
Field Sales Partnership. Collaborate with the Sales & Underwriting teams to source large account opportunities, develop terms and engage with COI’s, Brokers & Members. Develop, maintain and manage broker partnerships within the Regions including the development of strategies, goals, and tracking of progress; and positioning PURE within an agency for largest accounts.
Exceptional Service, Empathy & Trusted Advisor: Partner with brokers to craft the best and creative solutions for their largest clients; share knowledge and best practices
What we’re looking for.
5+ years HNW underwriting experience. A Bachelor’s degree is required.
Proven track record of strong broker partnership including extensive field travel and presence.
Ability to demonstrate leadership, integrity, creativity in problem solving, and establish trust and credibility.
Regular Field Travel to Brokers in the assigned territories is required

Location: Bothell, WA

Our client is a premiere Insurance brokerage who specializes in Group Benefits, Commercial & Personal Lines. Well known for being one of the largest worldwide brokers, they have a history of long-term employee retention, and a team structure that provides for growth potential. Managers act like mentors and are invested in your success. There is on-going training, plenty of room for growth and promotions for those hungry to challenge themselves!

In this position you will be responsible for supporting multiple producers, working with two Account Managers and acting as a liaison between the company and their clients.

Job Responsibilities
Manage an existing client book greater than $3 Million
Correspond with clients and maintain strong relations
Communicate with companies / wholesalers
Bind quotations, review, process and invoice policies
Prepare policy schedules and premium breakdowns
Order, review and invoice Endorsements
Cross-Selling / Marketing and Follow-up
Candidates should have:
Active WA Property & Casualty License
Must pass a drug screen and criminal background
Aptitude and attitude to work in a small business environment.
Experience working with MS Excel (pivot tables, charting & V-lookups)
Candidates who meet these qualifications are highly encouraged to apply!

#GlassDoor

Blucora has a bold aspiration: we are committed to giving all people the tools needed to lead healthy financial lives - tools often reserved for the wealthy.

We began our journey by bringing together two industry-leading firms to form a foundation in tax-smart investing that is unreplaceable in the industry. TaxAct is an innovative tax software company that helps more than 4 million Americans prepare their own taxes each year. HD Vest is the first firm in the world to make it possible for tax professionals to support clients’ wealth management needs (now over $45B for more than 300,000 Americans).

We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. Atypical for the financial services industry, we take a contemporary approach to strategy and product development that is founded in user insights, rapid testing and a singular focus on driving end-user value.

Since charting new territory on a daily basis is part of everyone's job at Blucora, we've attracted team members who thrive on the challenge, encourage each other, and are passionately committed to the goal. If you agree that problem- solving is a team sport, and feel energized by a good debate, deep dive research, or a fun night out with colleagues, we might be the right firm for you!

POSITION SUMMARY

TaxAct is looking for a talented Marketing Analyst to join the team to help provide insights and recommendations to marketing leadership and senior management regarding TaxAct’s marketing activities, initiatives and strategy. This role will be focused on identifying targeted marketing strategies that are ROI positive and as well as which media campaigns and techniques - across email, paid search, display, retargeted display, tv, programmatic tv, affiliates and social media - will contribute to unit growth in our TaxAct product. This role will also work with the Brand & Product Marketing team to ensure we’re tracking and reporting out on key segment and consumer life-cycle behavior and KPIs to help inform marketing strategies.

The ideal Marketing Analyst is someone who has a natural customer orientation, a passion for business building is adept at both thinking strategically about difficult business problems and using cutting edge data analytics techniques.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Bring together, explore and analyze large scale datasets to find actionable business insight, with an emphasis on customer segmentation, customer behavior, website usage, and market trend data across a number of channels including: Paid / Organic Search, Paid Social (Facebook, LinkedIn), Display, TV, CTV, Radio, OOH, Email, and Affiliate.

· Support the design and management of digital analytics performance measurement plans; report on successes of digital campaigns and implement improvements in areas of opportunity.

· Create measurement solutions including: measurement frameworks, reporting, dashboards, and campaign attribution models.

· Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Media, Brand & Product Marketing, Creative, Martech, BI and Finance, the Marketing Analyst) to understand the business situation and develop data-driven insights to drive marketing, digital, search, and social strategies to engage with customers.

· Identify and analyze the impact of marketing and product changes on customer behavior, acquisition and retention.

· Utilize analytic techniques to determine customer lifetime value and ultimately to change behavior and drive customer profitability and retention.

· Use insights to recommend changes to marketing investments across the business.

· Create segmentations and forecasting models as part of larger analytic inquiries.

· Communicate analytical findings and recommendations in a clear and concise way to non-technical audiences, both in oral and written presentations.

· Use hypothesis-driven approach to drive setup and analysis of A/B tests, and provide recommendations based on the test performance.

· Automate reporting to be self-serve and improve processes to increase efficiency

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

· Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or analytical discipline (e.g. Business, Finance, Engineering, Economics, statistics).

· 3+ years of working experience data driven marketing environment, analytical roles or consulting.

· Strong organizational, multi-tasking, decision-making, and problem-solving abilities along with an analytical aptitude, inquisitive nature, and a passion to turn data into insights.

· Worked with complex data before using multiple data sources to create insights

COMPETENCIES

SKILLS:

The candidate will need to have an appropriate level of strategic and financial acumen and a proven record of converting data into knowledge and intelligence that drives marketing outcomes. The candidate will have a proven track record of successfully building/managing marketing analytic capabilities across Paid/Owned/Earned channels including, but not limited to:

· Familiarity with digital marketing including (Organic search, paid search, email/CRM, social and display)

· Proven analytical skills with demonstrated experience in data-driven, logical problem-solving skills

· Some experience with Google Analytics, Tableau, Google Campaign Manager, Search Ads 360, Google Data Studios, Adobe Analytics, Proprietary data warehouse or other major digital analytics tools, required

· Some experience developing SQL quires to research, analyze, and create business reports.

· Ability to display data visually, including creating presentations that demonstrate the value of analytic deliverables

· An ability to translate a business question into an analytical framework, generate insights through analysis and effectively communicate recommended actions.

· Help execute the marketing analytics strategy to improve data, build compelling dashboards, and form the tools & processes necessary for a robust, democratized, data-driven marketing machine.

· Meticulous attention to detail and impeccable organization skills

· Strong proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

· Proven verbal and written communication skills

ABILITIES:

· Oral Expression — The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

· Oral Comprehension — The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

· Written Comprehension — The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.

· Deductive Reasoning — The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

· Fluency of Ideas — The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).

Tax Act, Inc is an equal opportunity employer and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Tax Act, Inc considers information gathered in the hiring process, including information on this application, confidential, and only shares it on a need-to know basis or as required by law. Sales Account Manager - Healthcare Division (Cedar Rapids, IA)

Position Summary
Are you driven, goal oriented, growth minded, focused on the people, and eager to build a career as a trusted advisor and industry differentiator?

What you should know about GreatAmerica:

GreatAmerica is a national commercial equipment finance company dedicated to helping our distributers be more successful and achieve the goal of keeping their customers for a lifetime. While GreatAmerica has grown to more than 600 team members, our entrepreneurial spirit remains and endless opportunities lie ahead.

We have experienced unparalleled year over year growth since our founding in 1992. GreatAmerica is structured in cross functional teams which allow individuals to make informed decisions benefiting the company and our customers. There is no doubt in our minds we are building the greatest company of its kind, offering the finest products and services available anywhere. When you are part of the GreatAmerica team, you are part of the future, part of an opportunity to grow professionally and to reach your potential while enjoying your work.

About this position:

Our Account Manager Sales professionals within our Healthcare division are critical to our mission of helping our customers achieve greater success. They have exceptional listening skills and use this ability to tie GreatAmerica solutions to business needs. As an Account Manager, you will have the opportunity to sell creative financing programs to business owners in the Healthcare industry. This will include bring on net new opportunities, but the primary focus is to cultivate and grow existing GreatAmerica relationships to increase their leasing volume. You must be able to successfully use consultative selling methods and you will be accountable for achieving sales volume goals in your territory. You will work collaboratively with a team to drive success in your territory, including individuals from sales, collections, account support, documentation and credit. Specific job duties will involve:
Contribute to stated monthly and yearly funded volume goals for assigned accounts by executing on daily/weekly outbound activity driven by phone calls, emails, webinars, tradeshows, travel to accounts, etc.
Work collaboratively to develop and implement programs that complement the accounts’ strategic initiatives and increase GreatAmerica finance volume, while increasing sales success of the accounts.
Working with key accounts to manage relationships, map account contacts, look for new sales opportunities and secure existing business.
Implement sales rep and sales management training programs to ensure a finance alternative is part of every sales proposal.
Become involved with the accounts’ marketing departments to ensure financing is part of all promotional and communication pieces.
Actively develop industry expertise in order to represent the highest industry standards and unyielding dedication to GreatAmerica’s customers.
Actively develops skills that will enhance the ability to sell GreatAmerica value and overcome objections.
Collaborate with internal departments and leverage leadership to ensure sales goals are met and customer satisfaction levels are high.
Participate in on-site customer visits and off-site customer events as needed.

Position Qualifications
To be successful in this role you’ll have:
Strong business acumen to quickly build trust with business owners.
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with at least 1 year of recent outbound business to business (B2B) sales experience with account management experience preferred.
Proven ability to sell value by helping customers envision how GreatAmerica programs can save them money and/or increase productivity.
Proven ability to build solid working relationships with a variety of businesses, and an interest in learning about ways to add value to an evolving industry.
Excellent communication, account management, relationship management, working autonomously, and time management skills.


We’re growing! Is your sales career? Let’s build something together.

To apply for this position, please follow the online application process at greatamerica.com. Be sure to fully complete the form, including your resume, and complete the Predictive Index assessment.

· Strong organizational, multi-tasking, decision-making, and problem-solving abilities along with an analytical aptitude, inquisitive nature, and a passion to turn data into insights.

· Worked with complex data before using multiple data sources to create insights

COMPETENCIES

SKILLS:

The candidate will need to have an appropriate level of strategic and financial acumen and a proven record of converting data into knowledge and intelligence that drives marketing outcomes. The candidate will have a proven track record of successfully building/managing marketing analytic capabilities across Paid/Owned/Earned channels including, but not limited to:

· Familiarity with digital marketing including (Organic search, paid search, email/CRM, social and display)

· Proven analytical skills with demonstrated experience in data-driven, logical problem-solving skills

· Some experience with Google Analytics, Tableau, Google Campaign Manager, Search Ads 360, Google Data Studios, Adobe Analytics, Proprietary data warehouse or other major digital analytics tools, required

· Some experience developing SQL quires to research, analyze, and create business reports.

· Ability to display data visually, including creating presentations that demonstrate the value of analytic deliverables

· An ability to translate a business question into an analytical framework, generate insights through analysis and effectively communicate recommended actions.

· Help execute the marketing analytics strategy to improve data, build compelling dashboards, and form the tools & processes necessary for a robust, democratized, data-driven marketing machine.

· Meticulous attention to detail and impeccable organization skills

· Strong proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

· Proven verbal and written communication skills

ABILITIES:

· Oral Expression — The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

· Oral Comprehension — The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

· Written Comprehension — The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.

· Deductive Reasoning — The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

· Fluency of Ideas — The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).

Must be able to identify all technical and business issues of assigned accounts to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process. Must be able to establish and maintain strong relationships throughout the sales cycle.

Job Title: Jr. Digital Communications Account Manager (position added 8/11/2020)
Job Description:
Fall 2020 Update from WebFX: We're still actively hiring and conducting interviews via video conferencing

Hi there! We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US. We've been named the Best Place To Work in Pennsylvania 5 times in a row and we'd love to meet you. We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We get super excited about driving business growth for our clients and are looking for people who take pride in their marketing work and enjoy having a little fun at the same time.

What We're Looking For

Desired Education
Bachelor's Degree in marketing, Advertising, Business, Journalism, Communications, Information Systems, or Statistics (GPA above 3.4)

General Knowledge
Solid understanding of the Internet
Solid understanding of basic copywriting
Solid web copywriting skills

Experience
Should have customer service experience in any industry
Part-time/summer job/internship experience is a must
Basic HTML experience (a plus)
Advertising agency experience (a plus)
Any digital marketing experience (a plus)
Leadership/management experience relating to coordinating the work-flow and deadlines of others (a plus)
Experience with Google Analytics (a plus)

Qualities
Stays up to date on new changes to the web and actively reads several blogs
Professional, dependable, solid work ethic
Detail-oriented
Self-motivated
An eye for detail
Dedication to quality and high level of follow through
Approaches problem solving proactively and in a professional manner
Excellent time/project management skills
Solid analytical skills and ability to make decisions based on data
Creative problem solving abilities
Ability to meet deadlines
Outstanding written communication skills

What You'll Do

Responsibilities
- Perform research to establish a strong understanding of client’s business goals and propose solutions and strategies that meet their needs and drive their success on the web
- Generate and provide resources to educate clients on the value of digital marketing strategies, and actions involved to meet their goals
- Identify digital marketing opportunities for clients, and lead testing processes
- Manage ideation, planning, and execution efforts of CRO special projects. I.E. Design specs, freelancer contributions, etc.
- Perform A/B, website usability, and website conversion rate testing
- Interpret web analytics, demographic data, market research, and buyer behaviors as they relate to CRO efforts. Generate and execute strategies as they relate to findings
- Prepare monthly digital marketing campaign reports
- Correct technical issues on the backend of websites
- Champion CRO best practices for clients

Percentage Breakdown
5% analyzing clients’ competitors
5% working in the backend of websites/fixing technical issues
10% managing external resources for CRO projects (i.e. Freelancers)
10% creating reports for client campaigns
15% analyzing data, identifying deliverables
25% client strategy and analytics
30% performing and analyzing A/B testing and other assessments

Training
- Our "Bootcamp" web marketing training program will be provided for new WebFX "family members."
- On-site, state-of-the-art training amenities to facilitate departmental trainings, trend watch reports, and monthly Lunch-and-Learns

What You'll Get

Opportunities for Growth
WebFX grew 250%+ over the past 3 years, and merit-based promotional opportunities are abundant for new family members who meet or exceed position performance metrics.

Potential promotional path for Jr. Digital Communications Account Manager:
Digital Marketing Research Consultant
Director of Digital Marketing
Sr. Digital Marketing Research Consultant

Compensation
$36,500 to $39,500 (potentially higher based on work experience)
GPA 3.8+ : Add up to $3k to high range
Elite college or university and graduation with high honors: Add up to $3.5k to $5k to high range

Candidates interested in the Jr. Digital Communications Account Manager position may also have interest in:
Digital marketing, online marketing, paid advertising, search marketing, inbound marketing, web marketing, content marketing, PPC, SEO, SEM, blogging, customer service, writing, editing, research, communications, entry level, etc.
WebFX Perks & Benefits
Flexible Schedule
Pet Friendly Office
Profit Sharing
Little Amps Coffee & Tea Bar
Yoga
On-site Fitness Center
150% Company Match Of Personal Charity Donations
Supplemental Insurance
IRA With Company Matching
Generous Paid Time Off
Employee Wellness Program
FXLearns Library
Activity Groups
Humanitarian Trips
Health/Vision/Dental Coverage
New Parent Support
Casual Dress Code
Home Buyer Program
Personal Desk Fund
Green Commute Benefits
Pawternity Leave

The Endicia Field Account Manager (FAM) works direct with our large shipping clients to ensure we grow volume and retain existing business. The role is responsible for revenue growth within a specified portfolio of managed accounts, customer satisfaction, and client retention. The FAM is responsible for maintaining and growing external relationships with personnel from the United States Postal Service and other channel partners, as well as, internal cross functional teams. This is a remote position and the optimal locations are Chicago, IL or Minneapolis, MN areas.
Endicia Company Overview:
Stamps.com, Endicia® electronic postage solutions make it easier and more affordable to ship parcels through the U.S. Postal Service®. Our solutions have helped thousands of businesses print more than $14 billion in postage. As a long-time, trusted partner of the U.S. Postal Service, we've built our reputation on our commitment to simplifying, improving, and enhancing the shipping process for our customers. That's what we call “innovation with purpose.”
Stamps.com offers solutions that help businesses run their shipping operations more smoothly and function more successfully under the brand names Stamps.com, Endicia®, ShipStation®, ShippingEasy®, ShipWorks®, and MetaPack®. Stamps.com’s family of brands provides seamless access to mailing and shipping services through integrations with more than 475 unique partner applications.
Company Perks:
Competitive pay, 401k with company match, Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, 3-weeks vacation, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Educational Reimbursement, Commuter benefits, Discount programs, Inventor patent bonuses. Pet Insurance!

Primary Objectives:
Manage an assigned book of business.
Reduce managed account churn.
Build strong internal and external customer relationships.
Be an industry expert and advocate.

Be available for all client needs.
Walk warehouse floors and make recommendations.
Build strong internal and external customer relationships.
Act as the key point of contact (POC) for assigned customer’s day-to-day needs.
Track the development and success of our customers, referencing their business goals and knowing how to accurately align with them.
Effectively negotiate issues that may arise.
Be an industry expert and advocate.
Be a product expert and communicate the value in new products/features to assigned accounts.
Stay abreast of industry news, innovations, trends, best practices, and make recommendations.

Walk short distances.

Speaking and conversing with others.
Lift up to 25lbs without assistance up.
Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Minimum of two (2) years field sales experience required.
Minimum of two (2) years relationship management experience.
Shipping and/or eCommerce industry experience desired.
Skills and Knowledge:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proven negotiation and closing skills.
Strong customer relationship management skills.
Ability to demonstrate critical thinking.

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications.
Salesforce experience a plus.
