Job Title: Personal Lines Account Manager - Property & Casualty
Job Description:
Overview


Shomer Insurance Services, an Alera Group Company is seeking a Personal Lines Account Manager to join our Property & Casualty team.

Are you looking to be part of a company where you have exciting opportunities to learn, grow and make a positive impact?

Join a team where each employee is empowered to listen generously, speak straight, collaborate, and build each other up through mutual accountability and shared success?

If that is what you’re looking for, this is your chance to be part of an amazing organization!

On May 1st, 2019 the Alera Group acquisition of Shomer Insurance opened a new set of opportunities for Shomer and its clients. After this strategic acquisition, Shomer has been able to expand, adding even more value for our clients while still maintaining our identity.

As a Personal Lines Account Manager, you would provide prompt, accurate and courteous service to clients, producers and company personnel in a professional and positive manner. Handle all tasks associated with obtaining, maintaining, expanding and servicing existing accounts in accordance with all agency procedures and carrier guidelines. This includes processing applications, policy changes, account review and renewal remarkets, up-selling existing policies, and cross-selling new policies.

Responsibilities
Process all applications, policies and endorsements for clients, review for accuracy.
Update TAM policy accounts with most current information as received.
Review renewals for significant changes.
Follow up on notices of non-payment per agency procedures.
Prepare and process requests for ID cards, evidence of property, certificates of insurance, and binders.
Process claim reports according to carrier procedures.
Process agency bill renewals & invoicing.
Review monthly Aged Accounts Receivables Report provided by accounting department.
Offer a cross-sell to every client that has only one line of business with the company.
Market renewal business as appropriate,
Qualifications
CA Property & Casualty Licensure required.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum 3 year(s) of work experience in personal lines and customer service.
Proficient in MS Office Suite, knowledge of TAM system very beneficial.
Equal Opportunity Employment


We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

If you're a California resident, please read the California Consumer Privacy Act prior to applying.

APS has a nationwide presence with a local community feel. Our mission is to become the leading facilities management company in the real estate industry by being the eyes and ears to our Clients, being professional managers of information and having a vast network of experienced service providers.
What you will receive:
Full time - 40 hours per week schedule plus overtime when required.
Lunch - 1 Hr. (12 – 1 pm)
Training - We'll teach you everything you need to be great!
Benefits - Medical insurance, 401k & paid time off.
Teamwork - We believe in teamwork and having fun together while we work with frequent contests and recognition events! Celebrate birthdays & spin the wheel for prizes, company t-shirts on Fridays, company outings on special occasions.
Community – Monthly charity sponsored events: food drive, toy drives & more!
Location – Conveniently located to North Georgia Premium Outlet Centers, Walmart, Kroger & Publix shopping centers & Planet Fitness, directly off GA400.
Available Jr. Account Manager Positions and Compensation (experience required):
Landscape Maintenance: $30K-$35K
Parking Lot Maintenance: $30K-$35K
Building Maintenance: $30K-$35K
Snow: $30K-$37K
Procurement: $30K-$37K
Duties and Responsibilities:
Verify and confirm information of our Clients and Service Providers.
Process a variety of documentation associated with clients/service providers within designated timeframes per established procedures
Receive, Review, and distribute documentation throughout departments
Perform routine administrative tasks: phone calls, email messages and initiate the appropriate actions/responses
Build Client and Service Provider loyalty
Communicate high priority issues to the Sr Account Manager in a timely manner
Follow thru to make sure tickets are addressed within 24 – 48 hours
Contact Client/Service Provider and reach out for missing required documents.
Ensure organized storage of all relevant Client and Service Provider documents to the network securely
Follow established processes
Flexibility to adapt to changes in procedures and job assignments
Other duties as assigned
Specialized Knowledge and Skills
Strong, effective communicator capable of navigating challenging conversations
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, presentation, facilitation, and communication skills
Demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards
Ability to adapt to a fast paced, continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities
Strong technical, analytical, and trouble-shooting skills
Excellent follow-through skills, self-motivated and detail-oriented
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects, issues, and priorities effectively and simultaneously, with attention to detail
Excellent phone etiquette is essential.
Proficient in the MS Office Suite to include MS Word, Excel and Outlook

Who we are.
Dendreon is making the battle against cancer personal. Founded on the belief that the immune system holds the key to the future of cancer care, Dendreon is committed to the delivery of treatments that harness the power of the body’s immune system to attack cancer cells.
If you are looking to positively impact the lives of patients, we want you to join our team. Headquartered in Seal Beach, California, and with sizable locations in Union City (Greater Atlanta), Georgia and Seattle, Washington, as well as countrywide Commercial and Medical Science Liaisons teams, we have a diverse offering of exciting opportunities.
What we do.
Vision – Pioneering the future of immunotherapy.
Mission – Making the battle against cancer personal through immunotherapy treatments that extend lives.
How we do it.
The Dendreon Way. We are a purpose-driven, value-based culture. At Dendreon, we…..
Put Patients First. Every day is a new opportunity to improve the lives of patients living with cancer.
Elevate Our People. The strength of our company lies in the success of our team.
Drive Results. Be accountable and execute – we win when everyone performs.
Foster Innovation. Building a culture of creativity, and pushing past boundaries.
Act with Integrity. Be honest, transparent, and committed to doing what’s right in every situation.
Are you ready?
Our high-performing organization challenges, develops, and rewards employees interested in pushing past typical career limitations. If you are passionate about helping patients and looking for a unique career opportunity, view our open positions to apply or refer a friend today.
Dendreon is seeking a Corporate Account Manager (CAM), Michigan that is responsible for the execution within community-based key focus accounts as well as targeted institutional facilities. The CAM approaches each customer with a total account management perspective by leveraging all available and approved resources appropriately. They collaborate with business partners (within and outside the company) to accurately and compliantly articulate the PROVENGE value proposition to their customers. The territory alignment for this role is the state of Michigan, the northern half of Indiana (excluding Indianapolis), the northern half of Ohio (excluding Columbus) and the eastern half of Pennsylvania.
Ideal candidate will be remotely based in Detroit, MI, Cleveland or Toledo, OH.

Educates accounts on appropriate PROVENGE utilization, focusing primarily on targeted high decile users to include Large Urology Group Practice Association (LUGPA) accounts in their defined geography.
Develops Administrative and Operational Champions, while also providing support with Clinical Champion development.
Leads patient identification initiatives within accounts focused on tailoring a process and operationalizing PROVENGE specific to that account/practice.
Drives the execution of the PROVENGE Acquisition Pricing Program (PAPP), working with C-suite executives and administrative champions within key focus accounts to include the seamless collaborating with internal teammates as well as Group Purchasing Organizations (GPO) partners.
Conducts Quarterly Business Reviews with targeted accounts to drive utilization of PROVENGE through PAPP performance Tier management.
Leads and participates in Practice Enhancement Meetings monthly / quarterly. These are attended by Customer Executives and physician partners. Educate offices on navigating change regarding Quality Based Performance pathways.
Develops practices into community Advanced Prostate Cancer Centers of Excellence
The face of Dendreon at sponsored industry events that include GPO meetings, LUGPA, Regional American Urology Association (AUA), American Society Clinical Oncology (ASCO), etc.
Provides market place feedback in a timely manner to corporate leadership on guideline adherence, competitive updates and industry issues and opportunities.
Responsible for the Enrollment to Schedule pull through initiative. Delivers weekly Enrollment not Scheduled Status report internally / externally through 1:1 meetings with navigators and schedulers on pending enrollments. Provides efficiency analysis quarterly on average time to schedule enrollments at account level.
Educates providers on patient assistance programs and other resources. Use discretion and judgment to execute the company's brand strategy and tactics within the assigned customer segment, which may include securing and preserving patient access to PROVENGE in the optimal site of care for the patient and provider.
Updates designated accounts on navigator and provider data with monthly performance reports. Leads the business planning process for field team and participates in all aspects of PROVENGE promotion, including but not limited to PROVENGE access, pull-through, patient identification, and champion development.
Works in conjunction with Sales and Marketing and their internal stakeholders to ensure corporate product objectives are met.
Complies with all OIG/FDA and corporate policies and procedures.

BA or BS degree required. MBA or advanced degree preferred.
Minimum of 5 years' experience in the pharmaceutical/biotech/life-sciences industry is required.
Experience working in the buy and bill arena.
Minimum of 3 years' account management and/or demonstrated success in a sales management, training, or marketing role is preferred.
Experience in oncology/urology specialty or marketplace is preferred.
Experience working with separate class of trade contracts is preferred.
Understanding of trade and other distribution models is preferred.
Experience working with Group Purchasing Organizations (GPO) is preferred.
Knowledge of FDA and PhRMA promotional guidelines.
May require up to 60% overnight travel

The National Account Manager is responsible for delivering sales results within his/her assigned geography, or outside of their geography is registered and approved.. This individual will leverage INAP services to attain his/her assigned Business Unit sales quota including: Cloud (Agile), or Managed Hosting, Colocation, IP Services, and CDN. A successful NAM has exceptional organizational skills; written and verbal communication skills; a demonstrated ability to multi-task; and strong desire to prospect and close New Logo business. He/she is a high-intensity,‘hunter’ with a demonstrated track record of aggressively building a funnel and translating opportunities into orders. Industry related selling experience and/or technical competency are required.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

Include, but are not limited to the following:

• Complete all company required training, but pro-actively seek and obtain the knowledge/capabilities to enable sales success in your market.

• Understand and articulate (orally, written, PowerPoint presentation) the company value proposition into specific customer benefits

• Build the sales funnel:

 “Cold” lead development– telesales, hosted industry events (open-houses, product demos, etc), cold-calling, follow-up marketing lead generated opportunities, etc.

 “Warm” lead development– existing account expansion, RFP response, former account recovery, etc.

• Meet/exceed sales quotas

• Identify and develop partners to accelerate sales (agents, datacenter partners, VARs, resellers, etc)

• Attend training on sales techniques, technology, presentation skills.

• Build business cases internally to ensure complex solutions are profitable

• Develop familiarity with Salesforce.com and utilize as basis for: contact management database, sales opportunity tracking, sales forecast and report generation.

QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE:

• BA/BS degree required or Associates Degree with 7+ years of relevant work and industry experience.

• MBA Desired.

• 7 yrs+ outside sales experience with consistent> 100% quota attainment.

• Preferred outside sales experience in IT, Public or private cloud services, hosting and/or colocation.

• Success translating customer goals into a sales strategy to support revenue achievement

KEY KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

• Knowledge of financial models to ensure opportunity meets INAP goals and targets

• Ability to solve problems quickly and completely.

• Ability to overcome customers’ objections, and qualify opportunities.

• Effective stand up presentation skills

• Effective listening skills.

• Excellent written and electronic communication skills.

• Maintains professional appearance and demeanor.

• Ability to work collaboratively with all departments on sales issues.

• Demonstrates high standards of ethical conduct.

• Self starter with positive, optimistic attitude.

• Ability to develop an effective sales call plan.

Overview


TriSure, an Alera Group Comany is currently seeking a Commercial Lines Account Manager to join their Property and Casualty team.

Are you looking to be part of a company where you have exciting opportunities to learn, grow and make a positive impact?

Join a team where each employee is empowered to listen generously, speak straight, collaborate, and build each other up through mutual accountability and shared success?

The professionals at TriSure make up one of the Triangle’s largest insurance brokerage and consulting firms in Raleigh, NC. We are a diverse group of individuals focused on helping the area’s leading businesses manage their property and casualty insurance risks and provide benefits to their employees. Since our founding in 1999, we’ve been providing the highest level of client service with honesty and financial integrity. For more information, please visit: https://trisure.com/

As an Account Manager your primary responsibility is to assist with clients while maintaining a high level of client and internal team satisfaction. In this role, successful candidates need to be highly organized with experience in a commercial insurance agency, or equivalent related education.

Responsibilities
Coordinate resources (subject matter experts) as needed to facilitate client service delivery that meets client needs with actions that are compliant with federal, state, and local laws and regulations.
Set up accurate and complete client data in client relationship management database (CRM), including documentation and management of action items and client communications according to procedure.
Process policies, endorsements, and requests according to agency procedures and timeframes.
Issue certificates of insurance, insurance applications, identification cards, etc.
Compose letters to clients and insurance carriers.
Contact clients and/or insurance carriers for information or to perform service as needed.
Respond to clients and account executive/producer/Account Manager requests in a timely, effective and professional manner.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum of 2 years prior professional experience in sales, the commercial insurance industry, or equivalent education in Risk Management or a like discipline.

Job Title: Donor Relations Account Manager (Placenta Donation Program)
Job Description:
Donor Relations Account Manager

Location: Jacksonville, Florida

Department: Donor Development

Job Type: Full-Time

Shift: Monday – Friday 9am to 5pm, working outside regular business hours as needed. 70% day travel in the field and 10% overnight based on the assigned territory,

LifeNet Health is searching for talented individuals who will embrace our mission of saving lives, restoring health, and giving hope.

LifeNet Health, headquartered in Virginia Beach, Virginia, is the largest nonprofit organ procurement organization (“OPO”) and tissue processor in the United States, as well as a leading innovator in tissue engineering and regenerative medicine. Our goal is to improve the quality of human life through the provision of organs, tissues and cells for transplantation; to provide innovation in the fields of bio-implants, regenerative medicine and research; and, to serve the community with educational and support services that enhance the donation process. LifeNet Health has over 1200 employees and has a growing global presence.

How you will contribute to LifeNet Health’s success:

The Donor Relations Account Manager promotes, builds, and manages tissue donation and recovery programs throughout a designated territory. In this role, the person will display the highest degree of integrity, honesty, knowledge, and respect for the purpose of tissue donation and transplantation. The Donor Relations Account Manager will possess consultative and new business development skills combined with in-depth knowledge of donation best practices in order to achieve the necessary supply of donated tissue, customer retention objectives, and new business development goals. This individual will be a resource for customers, donations partners, and/or stakeholders such as; hospitals, hospices, funeral homes, medical examiners, law enforcement agencies, donor families, and organ procurement and eye bank organizations.

What you’ll do:
Manages the routine operations for existing LifeNet Health Donation Partners, including events and/or meetings and key marketing and public relations events. Provides training to educate Donation Partners on the donation process, changes in technology, best practices for donation consent, and updated procedures in relation to tissue banking. Manages specific programs and/or initiatives such as, acquiring birth tissue for placenta donation and other specific requests for research tissue that may arise. Conducts rounds with Donation Partners as needed to increase tissue donation and education.
Manages accounts to build and guide key relationships in the hospital system with Executive Leadership Teams (CEO, CNO, CCO, VP etc.), Risk Managers, Quality departments, Nurse Managers (ER, ICU, OR, etc.), Chaplains, and/or other Administrative offices within the assigned or target hospital.
Develops a broad base of support for LifeNet Health’s products and services by maintaining quarterly contact with clinicians, medical examiners, funeral home partners, coroners, and hospital decision makers. Works in conjunction with LifeNet Health Bio-Implant Specialists to tie existing and potential distribution opportunities in target hospitals for conversion and/or maintenance of the existing referral process. Collaborates with donation partners such as Organ Procurement Organizations (OPO) and eye banks.
Supports donor families with LifeNet Health bereavement resources, programs, and events. Supports the Donor Family Advisory Board by providing articles and stories for LifeNet Health Donor Family Newsletters and Commemorative books. Corresponds with donor families by phone, email, and/or letters. Provides information related to donor gifts, grafts, and Thanks to You Letters.
Provides statistical reports for each contracted hospital in order for the hospital to stay within the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) and Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO) compliance standards in relation to tissue donation. Assists hospitals with process improvement through continuous development and refinement of policies and procedures that maximize tissue donation in conjunction with industry standards, federal laws, and state laws. Reviews tissue donation data with key Executive Leadership partners on a yearly basis and/or as established by the referral agency.
Partners with LifeNet Health tissue recovery department to resolve any hospital, funeral home, medical examiner (ME), coroner, hospice or other partnership complaints as well as to provide marketing and professional education. Supports the LifeNet Health Funeral Home Advisory Board to ensure industry best practice feedback and collaboration. Assists in obtaining electronic medical records (EMR) for tissue recovery and quality assurance staff as needed. Establishes communication and procedures for obtaining current and future EMR records for hospitals and other partners in an assigned territory.
Develops effective marketing tools and strategic business plans in order to maximize tissue donation in assigned region. Collaborates with marketing and public relation firms to develop marketing and communication initiatives as they relate to community education and donation awareness. Performs community education through Donate Life programs.
Reports on assigned territory activity, growth opportunities, and competitive analysis to management. Updates data/contacts into LifeNet Health tracking system on key developments, contacts, meetings, and events.
What you’ll bring (Minimum Requirements):
Bachelor’s Degree
Valid State Driver’s License
5 years’ experience in one of the following: healthcare (tissue banking, organ procurement, blood banking, nursing, psychology, medical, EMT, etc.) marketing, sales, public relations, education or business development
Bilingual : Fluent in Spanish preferred
These would be nice too (Knowledge Skills and Abilities):
Ability to communicate professionally with refined presentation skills and public speaking with internal and external customers, partners, donor families, executive leadership, and the general public.
Competent experience in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Complex knowledge of procedures, practices, and policies Ability to work collaboratively with team members
Ability to successfully gather and evaluate pertinent information to draw conclusions and identify potential trends
Ability to anticipate and critically think through problems
Ability to create and revise procedures, technical documents, and other relevant material according to established requirements
Why work at LifeNet Health?

We have a fierce drive for our mission of Saving Lives, Restoring Health, and Giving Hope. You won’t find another company with a culture as strong as ours.
403(b) and Pension Plan
Medical, dental, and vision coverage
Corporate sponsored events (Chili Cook-Off, 5K, Celebration of Life Gala, and many more!)
Work-life balance with generous paid time off
Paid lunches
Tuition reimbursement
Personal career and skill development opportunities
Wellness Program
Food Truck Thursday (at participating locations)
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Dedicated and passionate co-workers
We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer EOE/M/F/Disability/Vet. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. #LI-AF1

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

What You Will Need:

Strong negotiation skills and the ability to communicate professionally with customers

Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Flexibility to work independently and within a team environment

Experience modeling a high standard of commitment to an organization and intellectual curiosity
Respond to inquiries in a timely manner
Exercise a high degree of good judgment to ensure the customer’s needs are met and their expectations are surpassed
Actively engage as a positive team member committed to making a difference

Kleinfelder has been connecting great people to the best work since 1961. We are engineers, scientists, and construction professionals providing solutions that improve our clients’ transportation, water, energy, and other private infrastructure. As a responsive, cross-disciplinary team of bright, curious, and innovative problem-solvers, we are dedicated to doing the right thing, every day, on every project from over 60 offices in the US, Canada and Australia.

Built on a foundation of excellence, Kleinfelder is committed to client-focused solutions. Through our depth of experience and thorough understanding of environmental, regulatory, economic, and civic conditions, we identify and address challenges with innovation and common-sense. Kleinfelder’s integrated, award-winning experts collaborate with clients to meet their objectives - from project inception through design and execution. Connecting great people to the best work is our purpose – together, we deliver.

Kleinfelder’s Baltimore, Maryland office is currently searching for a Business Development professional with a strong background in consultative sales to accelerate business growth in the Baltimore-DC Metro marketplace. The chosen individual will be expected to develop a successful strategy resulting in the identification, pursuit, and capture of new client business and projects within the private sector, with specific focus in commercial real estate development in the local market

The ideal candidate:
Will have a network of existing local and regional potential client relationships
Will have experience in a similar role at a similar firm.
Will have a background in at least one of the following: Construction Materials Testing, Environmental Consulting, Geotechnical Engineering, and/or Commercial Real Estate Development, enabling him/her to have in-depth understanding of the solutions that can be provided and the needs of the target client base.
Will be actively engaged in industry professional groups and/or client networking organizations that will provide qualified project leads to our organization.
This is an excellent opportunity to join a well-known, national engineering consultancy.. Most importantly, this position offers the candidate an opportunity to have a meaningful impact on a local office looking to accelerate growth. Success at this regionally focused position will lead to client account management opportunities at a national and international level.

The responsibilities of the position:
Works with the local Area Manager and leadership team to develop and maintain client relationships, identify new opportunities and execute effective pursuit strategies and outreach.
Identifies opportunities and takes action to build relationships with other Kleinfelder business development professionals to help achieve business goals.
Develops proposal strategies that utilize Company’s strengths and innovative thinking to gain a competitive advantage.
Recognizes problems and responds, systematically gathers information, sorts through complex issues, seeks input from others, addresses root cause of issues, makes timely decisions, can make difficult decisions, uses consensus when possible, and communicates decisions to others
Builds and maintains excellent local and regional partners through involvement within the community and attendance at events, groups and committees.
Develops and fosters collaborative relationships with industry peers to establish partnering opportunities, resolve business issues, and identify best practices
Effectively utilizes Kleinfelder’s marketing systems to build relationships with long term value clients
Accurately maintains a database of client contacts, opportunities and soft backlog within the Kleinfelder CRM
Ability to travel regularly within the Baltimore-DC Metro marketplace.
Experience:
Minimum 5 years of experience working in an engineering or scientific consultancy.
Minimum of 5 years of direct client interaction in private sector, with emphasis on Commercial Real Estate Development
Strong working relationship with the professional community and private industry, including large regional and private client owners and teaming partners
Kleinfelder offers an excellent compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan, and paid holidays.

Position Summary:

Responsible for managing the successful delivery of BIM services throughout all stages of design, preconstruction, construction and transition to facility management. The BIM Manager is charged leading and guiding the efforts of the BIM department and multiple project teams to enable our projects to realize the 3D/4D/5D benefits of Building Information Modeling.

The BIM/VDC Specialist will seek to strategically and operationally leverage BIM technology to expand our client's industry leading business base. He or she will interface with division leadership, BIM staff, project managers, estimating, customers and subcontractors giving the candidate a full bodied and rewarding job experience.

How you will contribute:
Manage the total scope and quality of BIM services.
Accountable for the development, implementation and management of project BIM strategy; coordinate with project or division management.
Assist in the identification of projects which are to utilize BIM services; coordinate with operations managers and other senior management team members.
Coordinate with owners, design teams, operations and estimating personnel to determine overall scope of BIM activities to be performed on assigned projects; ensure that projects are offered comprehensive slate of BIM services, as appropriate.
Ensure that communication is maintained with operations and management personnel in regard to all BIM issues for their particular projects.
Take lead role in the development and delivery of innovative, technically creative presentations and software demonstrations for projects and other BIM marketing opportunities; effectively communicate and present.
Assist with responses to RFP questions and requirements; maintain library of example models and past BIM experience for demonstration of capabilities.
Assume key role in the implementation of BIM on projects utilizing an Integrated Project Delivery approach.
Prepare BIM Action Items List for assigned projects and take action; ensure that scheduled completion of assigned tasks is achieved to meet project requirements; coordinate responsibilities and assignments between field and office personnel.
Establish effective coordination procedures with design teams to ensure that design phase completion levels, level of detail issues, and quality control matches expectations; ensure that questions regarding projects and model information are properly documented and addressed to design team.
Lead the creation, development and ongoing maintenance of BIM models (or conversion of 2D plans or PDF's to 3D models) for projects; create conceptual models based on similar projects and historical cost information.
Guide preconstruction and operations personnel in the utilization of BIM for visualization, coordination, and constructability; prepare models to effectively convey cost management alternatives, when appropriate.
Assist preconstruction personnel with quantity extraction and ensure the preparation of clear, properly formatted material takeoff schedules from the building model.
Any other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education

Four-year college degree in related field (B.S. or B.A. degree in Building Science, Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architecture and/or Associates degree in drafting/design) Preferred

Experience
Demonstrated experience in the implementation and utilization of BIM technologies and/or related design/drafting/graphics software on multiple projects - 3 to 5 years BIM experience
Preconstruction/estimating experience preferred - 2 years.
Field/Operations experience preferred - 2 years.
Healthcare experience, preferred - 2 years
Proficient with blueprint reading, document interpretation for all design disciplines
Proficiency with BIM software.
SpawGlass is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

ABOUT US

Are you ready to transform an industry? At Centro we are building a comprehensive tech platform that radically increases efficiencies and impact across businesses, teams, and campaigns. Our clients can run all their digital business through Basis, with robust business intelligence, workflow automation, search and social integrations, and the number one rated DSP.
We’re taking the digital advertising world by storm and are proud to be headquartered in the rapidly growing tech hub of Chicago, with offices that span across the United States, Canada, Mexico, and London. Join us in our mission to improve the lives of everyone working in the industry!
WHY WORK WITH US?
At Centro, we believe that lasting success is achieved through continual dedication to the growth and well-being of the individual. Our people are the core of what makes Centro unique. Driven by the Centro Manifesto and our guiding principles, we look to hire the best and brightest minds—curious, passionate learners who are driven to create impact.
We are committed to building a culture of highly motivated individuals who create a positive and supportive environment together. When we work hard, stay focused, and act in service to others, we believe that anything is possible. Come grow with us!

We're always interested in connecting with great talent! This is a position we'll be hiring for in the future, but we would love to network with candidates in the meantime. Please feel free to apply and we'll reach out if there's a potential future fit.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Paid Social Specialist is responsible for managing specific social campaigns pre and post launch, as well as ensuring social RFPs and campaign launches are managed in a proactive manner. This role has responsibility for building strategic campaign plans and providing volume estimates for social RFP requests. The Social Specialist is responsible for understanding the media plan objectives and how social can directly affect overall performance of the campaign.

ABOUT THE TEAM

Centro’s national Paid Social team leverages Basis to help plan, execute, streamline, and analyze strategic, paid social media campaigns for agencies and brands. Always positive and eager to try new tools and tactics, their passion lies in finding unique and creative ways to problem-solve for clients. Internal collaboration and communication is critical, as they work closely with the Ad Ops and Analytics teams. These Centrons are committed to thinking outside the box, supporting each other, and pushing themselves to be the best.
WAYS YOU'LL CONTRIBUTE
Build strategic campaign plans and volume estimates for social RFP requests
Launch and analyze paid social campaigns including Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, Linked In, Snapchat and Pinterest
Ensure all accounts pace according to budget and goals
Work with digital media specialists and campaign performance analysts to develop performance stories and highlight the value Centro brings to secure future opportunities
Actively work with internal teams to ensure campaign success based on the KPIs and act as a subject matter expert on the paid social media marketing space
Act in a client facing manner when needed for specific campaigns or client requests and participate in client calls for upcoming plans and regular check-ins in regards to social campaigns
Review client deliverables for quality, ensuring that recommendations and work product are sound and viable
Provide training on social platform tools to clients and account management teams
Assist in the development and documentation of best practices related to social media management for both internal and external documents and assets
Assist in training, mentoring, and developing associate team members
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
2-3 years’ experience in Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Snapchat and Pinterest paid advertising
Knowledge of social media management platforms
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Proficient in Excel
Precise attention to detail
Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, under tight deadlines
Strong analytical skills
Exceptional customer service and communication skills
Adaptable and flexible
A fun, positive attitude that embodies the Centro’s culture
LIFE WITH CENTRO

We take care of our people. Our team has put together a thoughtful benefits package and provides a wide range of perks, including competitive 401k matching, a tax-free health savings account, tuition reimbursement, generous maternity/paternity leave, and more.

Aside from benefits, we’re always finding new ways to invest in the personal and professional growth our employees. We’re proud to support a variety of employee-led communities that enrich our culture of uniqueness, inclusivity, and empowerment. Centro is more than a workplace.

Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and support an inclusive workplace diverse in thought, perspective and culture. We celebrate all team members regardless of gender/identity, sexual orientation, race or cultural background, religion, physical disability and age. We are better together.

LifeWay is one of the world’s largest providers of Christian resources. Voted one of Forbes' Best Midsize Employers in 2019, our headquarters is located in the heart of Nashville, Tennessee. Our headquarters team leads, produces, and delivers biblical solutions to fulfill the mission and vision of LifeWay's ministry.
The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for supporting activities related to executing strategic marketing plans, communicating with media, preparing mailings, and overseeing social media.

As a Marketing Coordinator, you will:
Support marketing activities related to research, events, blogger team, social media, mailings and communications. Coordinate the execution of ongoing strategic marketing plans.
Coordinate public relations activities, distribute communications and organize tasks related to the launch of multiple book and departmental projects. May support similar activities related to trade initiatives, including social media management for B&H's Facebook and Instagram accounts.
Assist LifeWay's B&H Publishing Group marketing manager and strategists with the implementation of marketing plans for specific titles, author brands and leading smaller campaigns.
Provide on-site support for conferences and trade shows. Some travel required when events restart in 2021.

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Advertising, Communications or other related field
One (1) year experience working in a marketing or social media management role, preferred
Experience using social media platforms such as Instagram and Facebook, as well as targeted audience communication
Experience with Google Suite, Canva, Basecamp or Hootsuite, helpful but not required
Demonstrated organizational and professional communication skills
Experience managing or coordinating projects
Member of or attending evangelical Christian church, required
Some travel may be required (5%-10%)
Company Name:
LifeWay Christian Resources of the Southern Baptist Convention
3.9

Job Description:
Bedrock Logistics is an enterprising 3rd party logistics company with a distinguished history, dating back to the late 70’s. We are now looking to add dynamic, fresh faces to our ever-expanding sales force. All four of our offices are currently hiring; Dallas TX, Plano TX, Houston TX, and Orlando FL.

What does a 3rd party logistics company do? In the simplest terms, we are the intermediary for manufacturers and trucking companies. As a logistics account manager, you would spend your day balancing between pursuing new sales prospects and handling your current accounts. On a daily basis, account managers are tasked with negotiating rates, executing sales calls, creating solutions, and providing stellar customer service. No two days are the same and you decide how successful you want to be.

We pride ourselves on the high level of expertise and experience our team possesses. While the foundation of Bedrock is comprised of leading industry professionals, our ideal candidate can be defined only by their strongest character traits and not their job history. We hire the right people, not the right resumes.

You Have:
A tenacious desire to learn and make an immediate impact.
A strong backbone and the ability to troubleshoot effectively.
You are a firm negotiator.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
High energy and enthusiasm, with a relentless commitment to exceeding customer expectations.
An entrepreneurial hunger with a team player attitude.
Competitive spirit that drives you to be the best with little need to be pushed.
Enjoyment for talking to and getting to know people.
We Have:
A support system of experienced peers and management to help you along the way.
A full back office to help make your life easier.
No restrictions on sales regions, commodities or equipment.
Training and ongoing career development to make sure you never stop growing.
PTO
Health, dental and vision coverage.
A 401k.
COMPETITIVE BASE SALARY + UNCAPPED COMMISSION
You show up and we show you the way.

Employment contingent upon background check and drug screening.

Join the technology industry by starting a career at TBI! Our organization is built for growth. Growing partnerships. Growing technology. And most importantly, growing careers. We foster an environment where those new to the industry have access to industry leaders, channel insights and resources for career-pathing.

TBI is the nation's leading third-party technology distributor. Since 1991, it has assisted Systems Integrators, VARs, MSPs, IT consultants, developers, software distributors and more in advising and sourcing the right technology solutions. TBI serves as a partner's advocate, ensuring the proper provisioning of cloud, Internet, data, mobility, voice, and managed services from best-in-class service providers to achieve clients' desired business outcomes.

Through training and marketing programs focused on the benefits of technology to the business, TBI empowers its partners to be the foremost authority to advise and source all of their clients' technology needs. With the largest back-office in the industry, TBI partners are fully supported by pre- and post-sales operations, project managers, and solutions engineers certified in the latest industry-leading technologies.

Position Summary:

The Lead Generation Specialist is responsible for generating and qualifying leads on behalf of some of the nation's largest telecom providers by sourcing quality leads via cold calling, generating proposals, and correspondence to web inquiries. He/she will introduce potential partners to our Channel Management team while remaining part of the sales cycle as support.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Responsible for meeting daily, weekly and monthly sales goals.
Places outbound prospecting calls to potential customers (up to 300 calls per day).
Generates accurate proposals based on customer needs using Excel/Word/PDF.
Collaborates details and information to assigned National Channel Manager
Multi-tasking between various PC programs, carrier tools, and phone calls.
Entering correct customer data into NetSuite/CRM
Generates leads by explaining the benefits of the proposed pricing as well as the value of the telecom carrier.
Sells customers on features and benefits of services.
Provides kind and courteous service to customers.
Applies a professional and positive image and attitude towards all assigned tasks.
Performs with a high level of focus, organization, and competitiveness.
Adheres to all company policies, procedures, and selling practices.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Provides continued support throughout the sales cycle for the assigned National Channel Manager.
Job Requirements:
High School Diploma required
Demonstrated basic computer proficiency including Word and Excel
1-2 years of Sales Experience, preferably lead generation
Excellent oral and written communication skills with a strong attention to detail
Ability to easily adapt to changes
Ideal candidate will demonstrate an energetic and "Can-Do" attitude
Thrives in a competitive environment
What's In It For You: Team TBI Health & Wellness Benefits
Shared-Cost Health Insurance Plans through Blue Cross Blue Shield
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
Medical & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
Company-paid Basic Life Insurance
Company-paid Long-Term Disability Insurance
Short-Term Disability Insurance
Accident & Critical Illness Insurance
Domestic Partner Benefits
TBI Fit Wellness Program
Additional Team TBI Benefits
401(k) savings plan with company match
Extensive growth opportunities
Generous PTO and paid holidays for full time employees
Volunteer time and Maternity & Paternity leave after one year of service
Paid Military leave after one year of service
Extra cash opportunities through company points program
Company social events, onsite lunches, monthly breakfasts and teambuilding events
Candidates for all positions with TBI must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for any positions with TBI.

TBI is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

Company Description

MMIT is growing from the leading drug coverage data business into a comprehensive, integrated market access company serving pharmaceutical manufacturers, health insurers, PBMs and healthcare IT companies. Their suite of applications is designed to manage an ever-changing proprietary set of pharmacy and medical benefit information and to provide a structured view of complex market access information. By embedding their data and SaaS applications across healthcare, they help ensure transparency, consistency and informed prescription decisions across the MMIT Network. They partner with hundreds of payers and pharma manufacturers ensuring that their products continually capture and analyze coverage and restriction criteria for more than 98% covered lives.

Job Description

The Marketing Director will report to the Senior Vice President, Go-to-Market (GTM) and will take on a highly visible role in the development, analysis, and implementation of strategic product-related marketing initiatives. The Director will be responsible for shepherding new solutions to market by designing GTM strategies, developing sales materials and marketing campaigns, facilitating enablement of the sales team, and monitoring performance and ROI. The immediate focus for the role will be to drive high-conversion MQL volume across a diverse and growing set of solutions that span multiple buyer personas. This individual will be a key leader in identifying and supporting the translation of product benefits into a persona-specific, use case-oriented framework for sales and marketing.

The Director will work across functions, serving as a liaison between the marketing, sales, and product teams. Development of new products and solutions is critical to MMIT’s ability to meet its aggressive long-term growth targets. Therefore, this position comes with significant responsibility for helping MMIT enhance its portfolio of solutions to meet both revenue targets and the needs of the market.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

· Develop, drive, and execute comprehensive product specific GTM strategies, including development of sales tools, collateral, promotions, and communication strategies.

· Identify and document the buyer’s journey: including where they get information, and the who, what, when and why behind their buying decisions.

· Collaborate with operations, client service, product and sales teams to ensure that concepts are developed in to functional, market-ready products that are successfully launched.

· Develop product positioning and messaging that resonate with our target buyer personas.

· Support development of marketing materials and promotional cadences by authoring persona-based messages that will fuel ongoing lead flow.

· Collaborate with product and sales to develop sales collateral and other materials to support continued competency and objection handling in the field.

· Conduct customer research and collect competitive and market intelligence; aggregating learnings across internal and external channels to maintain an ongoing knowledge base that influences messaging and GTM strategy.

· Assess the effectiveness of the integrated sales and marketing activities based on established MQL and SQL conversion tracking per product and persona.

Qualifications
8+ years of experience working in a product marketing, or product development capacity with 2+ years of experience in a market-facing role (e.g. delivering/preparing presentations to customers and prospects, conducting competitor and market research).
In depth knowledge of the healthcare industry, preferably with pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and/or payer-related experience in market access.
Demonstrated experience leading product-specific initiatives with creativity, innovative thinking, rigorous analytical ability, and a strong understanding of the market.
Proven ability to gain a deep understanding of potential buyer personas, needs, potential use cases and buying triggers.
Significant experience with business case development, project management, key performance indicator (KPI) measurement, and ROI-tracking and analytics.
Comfortable using CRM, analytics and marketing automation tools such as Salesforce, Hubspot, InsightSquared, and Google Analytics.
Superior organizational, interpersonal communication and management skills.
Ability to lead multiple complex cross-functional initiatives simultaneously in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment.
A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion.
Education:

Bachelor's degree in marketing/business or related discipline. Master’s preferred.

Additional Information

Travel:

Occasional travel to regional MMIT offices. Up to 5%

Location:

Position based in Yardley, PA

About USHA - 48 Awards For Business Excellence in Just 8 Years!
Nowhere else in America will you find a better opportunity to enjoy personal satisfaction and professional achievement... because nowhere else in America will you find a company that is more committed to your success than USHA. As demands for our products continue to increase, you will advise clients on a portfolio of solutions that best fits their individual needs and budget... in one seamless package. Account Manager position is also relevant to job seekers with various work experiences such as: Business Manager Finance Marketing Banking Regional and Territory Sales Office Appointment Setter Tele Teacher Support Customer Service Real Estate and Auto Sales Retail Educators Graduates Agent Financial Services Assistant Leasing Accountant Coordinator Representative Transitioning Military Personnel Business Graduates

Blucora has a bold aspiration: we are committed to giving all people the tools needed to lead healthy financial lives - tools often reserved for the wealthy.

We began our journey by bringing together two industry-leading firms to form a foundation in tax-smart investing that is unreplaceable in the industry. TaxAct is an innovative tax software company that helps more than 4 million Americans prepare their own taxes each year. HD Vest is the first firm in the world to make it possible for tax professionals to support clients’ wealth management needs (now over $45B for more than 300,000 Americans).

We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. Atypical for the financial services industry, we take a contemporary approach to strategy and product development that is founded in user insights, rapid testing and a singular focus on driving end-user value.

Since charting new territory on a daily basis is part of everyone's job at Blucora, we've attracted team members who thrive on the challenge, encourage each other, and are passionately committed to the goal. If you agree that problem- solving is a team sport, and feel energized by a good debate, deep dive research, or a fun night out with colleagues, we might be the right firm for you!

POSITION SUMMARY

TaxAct is looking for a talented Marketing Analyst to join the team to help provide insights and recommendations to marketing leadership and senior management regarding TaxAct’s marketing activities, initiatives and strategy. This role will be focused on identifying targeted marketing strategies that are ROI positive and as well as which media campaigns and techniques - across email, paid search, display, retargeted display, tv, programmatic tv, affiliates and social media - will contribute to unit growth in our TaxAct product. This role will also work with the Brand & Product Marketing team to ensure we’re tracking and reporting out on key segment and consumer life-cycle behavior and KPIs to help inform marketing strategies.

The ideal Marketing Analyst is someone who has a natural customer orientation, a passion for business building is adept at both thinking strategically about difficult business problems and using cutting edge data analytics techniques.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Bring together, explore and analyze large scale datasets to find actionable business insight, with an emphasis on customer segmentation, customer behavior, website usage, and market trend data across a number of channels including: Paid / Organic Search, Paid Social (Facebook, LinkedIn), Display, TV, CTV, Radio, OOH, Email, and Affiliate.

· Support the design and management of digital analytics performance measurement plans; report on successes of digital campaigns and implement improvements in areas of opportunity.

· Create measurement solutions including: measurement frameworks, reporting, dashboards, and campaign attribution models.

· Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Media, Brand & Product Marketing, Creative, Martech, BI and Finance, the Marketing Analyst) to understand the business situation and develop data-driven insights to drive marketing, digital, search, and social strategies to engage with customers.

· Identify and analyze the impact of marketing and product changes on customer behavior, acquisition and retention.

· Utilize analytic techniques to determine customer lifetime value and ultimately to change behavior and drive customer profitability and retention.

· Use insights to recommend changes to marketing investments across the business.

· Create segmentations and forecasting models as part of larger analytic inquiries.

· Communicate analytical findings and recommendations in a clear and concise way to non-technical audiences, both in oral and written presentations.

· Use hypothesis-driven approach to drive setup and analysis of A/B tests, and provide recommendations based on the test performance.

· Automate reporting to be self-serve and improve processes to increase efficiency

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

· Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or analytical discipline (e.g. Business, Finance, Engineering, Economics, statistics).

· 3+ years of working experience data driven marketing environment, analytical roles or consulting.

· Strong organizational, multi-tasking, decision-making, and problem-solving abilities along with an analytical aptitude, inquisitive nature, and a passion to turn data into insights.

· Worked with complex data before using multiple data sources to create insights

COMPETENCIES

SKILLS:

The candidate will need to have an appropriate level of strategic and financial acumen and a proven record of converting data into knowledge and intelligence that drives marketing outcomes. The candidate will have a proven track record of successfully building/managing marketing analytic capabilities across Paid/Owned/Earned channels including, but not limited to:

· Familiarity with digital marketing including (Organic search, paid search, email/CRM, social and display)

· Proven analytical skills with demonstrated experience in data-driven, logical problem-solving skills

· Some experience with Google Analytics, Tableau, Google Campaign Manager, Search Ads 360, Google Data Studios, Adobe Analytics, Proprietary data warehouse or other major digital analytics tools, required

· Some experience developing SQL quires to research, analyze, and create business reports.

· Ability to display data visually, including creating presentations that demonstrate the value of analytic deliverables

· An ability to translate a business question into an analytical framework, generate insights through analysis and effectively communicate recommended actions.

· Help execute the marketing analytics strategy to improve data, build compelling dashboards, and form the tools & processes necessary for a robust, democratized, data-driven marketing machine.

· Meticulous attention to detail and impeccable organization skills

· Strong proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

· Proven verbal and written communication skills

ABILITIES:

· Oral Expression — The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

· Oral Comprehension — The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

· Written Comprehension — The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.

· Deductive Reasoning — The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

· Fluency of Ideas — The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).

The TAM must be able to articulate the company’s technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. Must be able to identify all technical and business issues of assigned accounts to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process. Must be able to establish and maintain strong relationships throughout the sales cycle.

Key responsibilities/accountabilities
Identify and develop potential new business opportunities
Convey customer requirements to Product Management, Marketing and Engineering teams
Respond to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs

Delivery high-level and detailed sales presentations
Responsible for attending conferences, seminars etc
Reporting through Company’s CRM

Organized and analytical, able to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches.
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
5-7 years relevant experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills; must have a perfect command of Dutch & English language
Able to travel throughout sales territory

Fall 2020 Update from WebFX: We're still actively hiring and conducting interviews via video conferencing

Hi there! We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US. We've been named the Best Place To Work in Pennsylvania 5 times in a row and we'd love to meet you. We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. Part-time/summer job/internship experience is a must

Job Title: Personal Lines Account Manager - Property & Casualty
Job Description:
Overview


Shomer Insurance Services, an Alera Group Company is seeking a Personal Lines Account Manager to join our Property & Casualty team.

Are you looking to be part of a company where you have exciting opportunities to learn, grow and make a positive impact?

Join a team where each employee is empowered to listen generously, speak straight, collaborate, and build each other up through mutual accountability and shared success?

If that is what you’re looking for, this is your chance to be part of an amazing organization!

On May 1st, 2019 the Alera Group acquisition of Shomer Insurance opened a new set of opportunities for Shomer and its clients. After this strategic acquisition, Shomer has been able to expand, adding even more value for our clients while still maintaining our identity.

As a Personal Lines Account Manager, you would provide prompt, accurate and courteous service to clients, producers and company personnel in a professional and positive manner. Handle all tasks associated with obtaining, maintaining, expanding and servicing existing accounts in accordance with all agency procedures and carrier guidelines. This includes processing applications, policy changes, account review and renewal remarkets, up-selling existing policies, and cross-selling new policies.

Responsibilities
Process all applications, policies and endorsements for clients, review for accuracy.
Update TAM policy accounts with most current information as received.
Review renewals for significant changes.
Follow up on notices of non-payment per agency procedures.
Prepare and process requests for ID cards, evidence of property, certificates of insurance, and binders.
Process claim reports according to carrier procedures.
Process agency bill renewals & invoicing.
Review monthly Aged Accounts Receivables Report provided by accounting department.
Offer a cross-sell to every client that has only one line of business with the company.
Market renewal business as appropriate,
Qualifications
CA Property & Casualty Licensure required.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum 3 year(s) of work experience in personal lines and customer service.
Proficient in MS Office Suite, knowledge of TAM system very beneficial.
Equal Opportunity Employment


We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

If you're a California resident, please read the California Consumer Privacy Act prior to applying.

APS has a nationwide presence with a local community feel. Our mission is to become the leading facilities management company in the real estate industry by being the eyes and ears to our Clients, being professional managers of information and having a vast network of experienced service providers.
What you will receive:
Full time - 40 hours per week schedule plus overtime when required.
Lunch - 1 Hr. (12 – 1 pm)
Training - We'll teach you everything you need to be great!
Benefits - Medical insurance, 401k & paid time off.
Teamwork - We believe in teamwork and having fun together while we work with frequent contests and recognition events! Celebrate birthdays & spin the wheel for prizes, company t-shirts on Fridays, company outings on special occasions.
Community – Monthly charity sponsored events: food drive, toy drives & more!
Location – Conveniently located to North Georgia Premium Outlet Centers, Walmart, Kroger & Publix shopping centers & Planet Fitness, directly off GA400.
Available Jr. Account Manager Positions and Compensation (experience required):
Landscape Maintenance: $30K-$35K
Parking Lot Maintenance: $30K-$35K
Building Maintenance: $30K-$35K
Snow: $30K-$37K
Procurement: $30K-$37K
Duties and Responsibilities:
Verify and confirm information of our Clients and Service Providers.
Process a variety of documentation associated with clients/service providers within designated timeframes per established procedures
Receive, Review, and distribute documentation throughout departments
Perform routine administrative tasks: phone calls, email messages and initiate the appropriate actions/responses
Build Client and Service Provider loyalty
Communicate high priority issues to the Sr Account Manager in a timely manner
Follow thru to make sure tickets are addressed within 24 – 48 hours
Contact Client/Service Provider and reach out for missing required documents.
Ensure organized storage of all relevant Client and Service Provider documents to the network securely
Follow established processes
Flexibility to adapt to changes in procedures and job assignments
Other duties as assigned
Specialized Knowledge and Skills
Strong, effective communicator capable of navigating challenging conversations
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, presentation, facilitation, and communication skills
Demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards
Ability to adapt to a fast paced, continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities
Strong technical, analytical, and trouble-shooting skills
Excellent follow-through skills, self-motivated and detail-oriented
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects, issues, and priorities effectively and simultaneously, with attention to detail
Excellent phone etiquette is essential.
Proficient in the MS Office Suite to include MS Word, Excel and Outlook

Who we are.
Dendreon is making the battle against cancer personal. Founded on the belief that the immune system holds the key to the future of cancer care, Dendreon is committed to the delivery of treatments that harness the power of the body’s immune system to attack cancer cells.
If you are looking to positively impact the lives of patients, we want you to join our team. Headquartered in Seal Beach, California, and with sizable locations in Union City (Greater Atlanta), Georgia and Seattle, Washington, as well as countrywide Commercial and Medical Science Liaisons teams, we have a diverse offering of exciting opportunities.
What we do.
Vision – Pioneering the future of immunotherapy.
Mission – Making the battle against cancer personal through immunotherapy treatments that extend lives.
How we do it.
The Dendreon Way. We are a purpose-driven, value-based culture. At Dendreon, we…..
Put Patients First. Every day is a new opportunity to improve the lives of patients living with cancer.
Elevate Our People. The strength of our company lies in the success of our team.
Drive Results. Be accountable and execute – we win when everyone performs.
Foster Innovation. Building a culture of creativity, and pushing past boundaries.
Act with Integrity. Be honest, transparent, and committed to doing what’s right in every situation.
Are you ready?
Our high-performing organization challenges, develops, and rewards employees interested in pushing past typical career limitations. If you are passionate about helping patients and looking for a unique career opportunity, view our open positions to apply or refer a friend today.
Dendreon is seeking a Corporate Account Manager (CAM), Michigan that is responsible for the execution within community-based key focus accounts as well as targeted institutional facilities. The CAM approaches each customer with a total account management perspective by leveraging all available and approved resources appropriately. They collaborate with business partners (within and outside the company) to accurately and compliantly articulate the PROVENGE value proposition to their customers. The territory alignment for this role is the state of Michigan, the northern half of Indiana (excluding Indianapolis), the northern half of Ohio (excluding Columbus) and the eastern half of Pennsylvania.
Ideal candidate will be remotely based in Detroit, MI, Cleveland or Toledo, OH.

Educates accounts on appropriate PROVENGE utilization, focusing primarily on targeted high decile users to include Large Urology Group Practice Association (LUGPA) accounts in their defined geography.
Develops Administrative and Operational Champions, while also providing support with Clinical Champion development.
Leads patient identification initiatives within accounts focused on tailoring a process and operationalizing PROVENGE specific to that account/practice.
Drives the execution of the PROVENGE Acquisition Pricing Program (PAPP), working with C-suite executives and administrative champions within key focus accounts to include the seamless collaborating with internal teammates as well as Group Purchasing Organizations (GPO) partners.
Conducts Quarterly Business Reviews with targeted accounts to drive utilization of PROVENGE through PAPP performance Tier management.
Leads and participates in Practice Enhancement Meetings monthly / quarterly. These are attended by Customer Executives and physician partners. Educate offices on navigating change regarding Quality Based Performance pathways.
Develops practices into community Advanced Prostate Cancer Centers of Excellence
The face of Dendreon at sponsored industry events that include GPO meetings, LUGPA, Regional American Urology Association (AUA), American Society Clinical Oncology (ASCO), etc.
Provides market place feedback in a timely manner to corporate leadership on guideline adherence, competitive updates and industry issues and opportunities.
Responsible for the Enrollment to Schedule pull through initiative. Delivers weekly Enrollment not Scheduled Status report internally / externally through 1:1 meetings with navigators and schedulers on pending enrollments. Provides efficiency analysis quarterly on average time to schedule enrollments at account level.
Educates providers on patient assistance programs and other resources. Use discretion and judgment to execute the company's brand strategy and tactics within the assigned customer segment, which may include securing and preserving patient access to PROVENGE in the optimal site of care for the patient and provider.
Updates designated accounts on navigator and provider data with monthly performance reports. Leads the business planning process for field team and participates in all aspects of PROVENGE promotion, including but not limited to PROVENGE access, pull-through, patient identification, and champion development.
Works in conjunction with Sales and Marketing and their internal stakeholders to ensure corporate product objectives are met.
Complies with all OIG/FDA and corporate policies and procedures.

BA or BS degree required. MBA or advanced degree preferred.
Minimum of 5 years' experience in the pharmaceutical/biotech/life-sciences industry is required.
Experience working in the buy and bill arena.
Minimum of 3 years' account management and/or demonstrated success in a sales management, training, or marketing role is preferred.
Experience in oncology/urology specialty or marketplace is preferred.
Experience working with separate class of trade contracts is preferred.
Understanding of trade and other distribution models is preferred.
Experience working with Group Purchasing Organizations (GPO) is preferred.
Knowledge of FDA and PhRMA promotional guidelines.
May require up to 60% overnight travel

The National Account Manager is responsible for delivering sales results within his/her assigned geography, or outside of their geography is registered and approved.. This individual will leverage INAP services to attain his/her assigned Business Unit sales quota including: Cloud (Agile), or Managed Hosting, Colocation, IP Services, and CDN. A successful NAM has exceptional organizational skills; written and verbal communication skills; a demonstrated ability to multi-task; and strong desire to prospect and close New Logo business. He/she is a high-intensity,‘hunter’ with a demonstrated track record of aggressively building a funnel and translating opportunities into orders. Industry related selling experience and/or technical competency are required.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

Include, but are not limited to the following:

• Complete all company required training, but pro-actively seek and obtain the knowledge/capabilities to enable sales success in your market.

• Understand and articulate (orally, written, PowerPoint presentation) the company value proposition into specific customer benefits

• Build the sales funnel:

 “Cold” lead development– telesales, hosted industry events (open-houses, product demos, etc), cold-calling, follow-up marketing lead generated opportunities, etc.

 “Warm” lead development– existing account expansion, RFP response, former account recovery, etc.

• Meet/exceed sales quotas

• Identify and develop partners to accelerate sales (agents, datacenter partners, VARs, resellers, etc)

• Attend training on sales techniques, technology, presentation skills.

• Build business cases internally to ensure complex solutions are profitable

• Develop familiarity with Salesforce.com and utilize as basis for: contact management database, sales opportunity tracking, sales forecast and report generation.

QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE:

• BA/BS degree required or Associates Degree with 7+ years of relevant work and industry experience.

• MBA Desired.

• 7 yrs+ outside sales experience with consistent> 100% quota attainment.

• Preferred outside sales experience in IT, Public or private cloud services, hosting and/or colocation.

• Success translating customer goals into a sales strategy to support revenue achievement

KEY KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

• Knowledge of financial models to ensure opportunity meets INAP goals and targets

• Ability to solve problems quickly and completely.

• Ability to overcome customers’ objections, and qualify opportunities.

• Effective stand up presentation skills

• Effective listening skills.

• Excellent written and electronic communication skills.

• Maintains professional appearance and demeanor.

• Ability to work collaboratively with all departments on sales issues.

• Demonstrates high standards of ethical conduct.

• Self starter with positive, optimistic attitude.

• Ability to develop an effective sales call plan.
